Authors: Hymel, KM; Small, KA; Van Dender, K
Author Full Names: Hymel, Kent M.; Small, Kenneth A.; Van Dender, Kurt
Article Title: Induced demand and rebound effects in road transport
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Vehicle-miles traveled; Congestion; Rebound effect; Induced demand
Keywords Plus: FUEL EFFICIENCY; INDUCED TRAVEL; CONSUMPTION; STANDARDS; INCOME
Abstract: This paper analyzes aggregate personal motor-vehicle travel within a simultaneous model of aggregate vehicle travel, fleet size, fuel efficiency, and congestion formation. We measure the impacts of driving costs on congestion, and two other well-known feedback effects affecting motor-vehicle travel: its responses to aggregate road capacity (induced demand) and to driving costs including those caused by fuel-economy improvements (rebound effect). We measure these effects using cross-sectional time series data at the level of US states for 1966 through 2004. Results show that congestion affects the demand for driving negatively, as expected, and more strongly when incomes are higher. We decompose induced demand into effects from increasing overall accessibility of destinations and those from increasing urban capacity, finding the two elasticities close in magnitude and totaling about 0.16, somewhat smaller than most previous estimates. We confirm previous findings that the magnitude of the rebound effect decreases with income and increases with fuel cost, and find also that it increases with the level of congestion. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Authors: Correia, I; Nickel, S; Saldanha-da-Gama, F
Author Full Names: Correia, Isabel; Nickel, Stefan; Saldanha-da-Gama, Francisco
Article Title: Single-assignment hub location problems with multiple capacity levels
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Hub location; Capacity decisions; MILP formulations
Abstract: In this paper, an extension of the classical capacitated single-allocation hub location problem is studied in which the size of the hubs is part of the decision making process For each potential hub a set of capacities is assumed to be available among which one can be chosen. Several formulations are proposed for the problem, which are compared in terms of the bound provided by the linear programming relaxation Different sets of inequalities are proposed to enhance the models Several preprocessing tests are also presented with the goal of reducing the size of the models for each particular instance. The results of the computational experiments performed using the proposed models are reported (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Article Title: Bayesian inference for network-based models with a linear inverse structure
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Estimation; Markov chain Monte Carlo; Measurement error; Origin-destination matrix; Statistical linear inverse problem; Traffic assignment
Keywords Plus: STOCHASTIC USER EQUILIBRIUM; ORIGIN-DESTINATION MATRICES; PATH FLOW ESTIMATOR; LINK COUNT DATA; TRIP MATRICES; DISTRIBUTIONS
Abstract: Network-based transport models are used for a host of purposes, from estimation of travel demand through to traffic assignment and traffic flow prediction. Before any such model can be applied in practice we must estimate its parameters and also examine its adequacy. A variety of methods have been developed to do this, but they are typically quite specific to the particular model at hand. In this paper we show that it is possible to develop a unified approach by recognizing that a statistical linear inverse structure arises when attempting to perform inference for any network-based model. This common structure provides the building blocks for the development a coherent theory for Bayesian inference for these models, which has a number of advantages of over more ad hoc methods. While calculation of the Bayesian posterior will typically be intractable, our unified framework allows us to design a generic Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithm for sampling from this distribution in practice. We illustrate the operation of this algorithm on a section of the road network in the English city of Leicester. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Lemp, JD; Kockelman, KM; Damien, P
Author Full Names: Lemp, Jason D.; Kockelman, Kara M.; Damien, Paul
Article Title: The continuous cross-nested logit model: Formulation and application for departure time choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Travel behavior modeling; Departure time modeling; Continuous logit; Continuous cross-nested logit; Bayesian estimation
Abstract: Discrete choice models, like the multinomial logit (MNL), have long been recognized for their ability to capture a wide array of transport-related choice phenomena. However, a number of choices are continuous response variables (e.g., location, departure time, activity duration, and vehicle usage). This paper introduces the continuous cross-nested logit (CCNL) model. The CCNL model results from generalizing the discrete cross-nested logit (CNL) model for a continuous response variable, much like the continuous logit model emerges by generalizing the MNL. The model is formulated and shown to come from the generalized extreme value (GEV) class of models. In addition, the structure of utility correlations is presented. The model's parameters are estimated for a work-tour departure time context using Bayesian estimation techniques and San Francisco Bay Area data. Empirical results suggest model predictions that are very similar to the continuous logit, but it out-performs the continuous logit in terms of out-of-sample prediction with these data. The CCNL also allows a more flexible choice behavior to emerge. Finally, a simple welfare example is illustrated and a number of model extensions are presented. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Laporte, G; Mesa, JA; Perea, F
Author Full Names: Laporte, Gilbert; Mesa, Juan A.; Perea, Federico
Article Title: A game theoretic framework for the robust railway transit network design problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Robust network design; Game theory; Saddle points; Nash equilibrium
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; OPTIMIZATION; SYSTEMS; INTERDICTION; UNCERTAINTY; LOCATION
Abstract: This paper proposes a game theoretic framework for the problem of designing an uncapacitated railway transit network in the presence of link failures and a competing mode. It is assumed that when a link fails, another path or another transportation mode is provided to transport passengers between the endpoints of the affected link. The goal is to build a network that optimizes a certain utility function when failures occur. The problem is posed as a non-cooperative two-player zero-sum game with perfect information. The saddle points of the corresponding mixed enlarged game yield robust network designs. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Pricing vs. slot policies when airport profits matter
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Congestion pricing; Slot auction; Slot trading; Airport pricing
Keywords Plus: MARKET POWER; CONGESTION; CAPACITY; INTERNALIZATION; EXPANSION; CARRIERS
Abstract: This paper analyzes pricing and slot-allocation mechanisms to manage airport capacity when profits are important to an airport, owing to budget constraints or profit maximization. We find that congestion pricing and slot trading/slot auctioning do not lead to the same results. Total traffic is higher under slot auctions than under congestion pricing. Furthermore, if airport profits matter just marginally, then slot auctions will outperform congestion pricing in terms of achieving a higher objective-function value. On the other hand, if airport profits matter sufficiently highly, which mechanism is better is then very much dependent on parameter values. In particular, congestion pricing may be strongly preferred over slot auctions for certain parameter values. The impact of congestion-remedy mechanisms on individual carriers is also examined. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chiu, YC; Zhou, L; Song, HB
Author Full Names: Chiu, Yi-Chang; Zhou, Liang; Song, Houbing
Article Title: Development and calibration of the Anisotropic Mesoscopic Simulation model for uninterrupted flow facilities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Mesoscopic; Traffic simulation; Anisotropic; Dynamic traffic assignment; Speed Influencing Region
Abstract: This paper presents the development, analysis, and calibration of the Anisotropic Mesoscopic Simulation (AMS) model for uninterrupted flow facilities, such as freeways. The proposed AMS model is a vehicle-based mesoscopic traffic simulation approach that explicitly considers the anisotropic property of traffic flow into the vehicle state update at each simulation step. The advantage of AMS is its ability to address a variety of uninterrupted flow conditions in a relatively simple, unified and computationally efficient manner. The discussions focus on the key modeling concepts, the analytical properties and numerical analysis, and the calibration process and results. The addressed analytical properties are the overtaking conditions, acceleration and deceleration rate bounds, and shock-waves. The numerical analysis includes both freeway segments as well as merging junctions. Considerable efforts were devoted to employ the Next-Generation Simulation (NGSIM) program datasets to calibrate the AMS model parameters. The high traffic fidelity and satisfactory computational efficiency make AMS a promising simulation approach for large-scale regional dynamic traffic simulation and assignment. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Analysis of Huaibei City Construction Land Dynamic Change Based on Remote Sensing
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Huaibei City; Urban Construction Land; Remote Sensing
Abstract: 1987, 2000 TM image and 2005 Quickbird image were selected as data sources, ENVI 4.5 software was used to carry on the statistical analysis of Huaibei(Xiangshan built-up area) land use / cover changes in 1987-2005, and emphatically analyze Huaibei City's construction land changes in 1987-2000. The results show that: the Huaibei City newly-increasing construction land (non-construction land to construction land) area in 1987-2000 is 7.17 km(2), the newly-increasing construction land mainly distributes in the inner city south-west, north-east direction, and the main body in the new city, The expansion direction is the north-east and south-west; the Huaibei City reduced construction land (construction land to non-construction land) area is 5.37 km(2), the reduced region mainly distributes in the inner city south-east and north-west direction; the net-increased construction land area in Huaibei City is 1.8 km(2).

Book Editors: Li, NJ; Yang, Q; Zhang, H; Xie, W
Article Title: Quality Cost Control of Construction Engineering Based on Value Chain
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Construction engineering; Quality cost control; Value chain
Abstract: Quality cost of construction engineering throughout the whole construction process is large enough to draw our attention; especially the recessive cost such as loss of productivity and customers caused by quality problems will eventually bring incalculable damage to the enterprise. This article identifies the cause of quality cost of construction engineering based on value chain analysis. To protect high productivity and establish a good relationship with customers, suppliers and competitors, the construction enterprise should improve quality cost control system by bringing in the strategy of activity-based cost management, supplier collaboration, customer value and coopetition.

Authors: Teypaz, N; Schrenk, S; Cung, VD
Author Full Names: Teypaz, Nicolas; Schrenk, Susann; Cung, Van-Dat
Article Title: A decomposition scheme for large-scale Service Network Design with asset management
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight transportation; Service Network Design; Asset management
Abstract: In this paper, we address a large-scale freight transportation problem for maximizing the profit of a carrier. We propose two solving algorithms using a decomposition of the problem into three main steps: construction of the network, filling vehicles with commodities and construction of the vehicle plannings. The resolution of these steps involves heuristic schemes, Mixed Integer Programming and Constraint Programming techniques. To evaluate the model and the solution algorithms, we produce instances based on a study of real-life data. The results show that the methods without transhipment provide solutions with a good computation time/quality trade-off. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yang, CC; Marlow, PB; Lu, CS
Author Full Names: Yang, Ching-Chiao; Marlow, Peter B.; Lu, Chin-Shan
Article Title: Knowledge management enablers in liner shipping
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Knowledge management enablers; Organizational performance; Liner shipping
Keywords Plus: COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE; ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE; INNOVATION; RESOURCE; CAPABILITIES; STRATEGY; IMPACT
Abstract: This study empirically identifies crucial knowledge management enablers and examines their impacts on organizational performance using survey data collected from liner shipping firms include shipping companies and agencies. Results indicated that knowledge management enablers such as organizational structure and knowledge management culture are found to have significantly positive effects on the organizational performance aspects of innovativeness, financial performance, and customer service, whereas information technology support is a positive effect on organizational performance aspect of innovativeness. Theoretical and managerial implications of the research findings on knowledge management for liner shipping companies are discussed. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Di Francesco, M; Crainic, TG; Zuddas, P
Author Full Names: Di Francesco, Massimo; Crainic, Teodor Gabriel; Zuddas, Paola
Article Title: The effect of multi-scenario policies on empty container repositioning
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Empty container repositioning; Mathematical modeling; Time-extended optimization models; Multicommodity flow problems; Optimization under uncertainty
Abstract: This paper addresses a container maritime-repositioning problem where several parameters are uncertain and historical data are useless for decision-making processes. To address this problem, we propose a time-extended multi-scenario optimization model in which scenarios can be generated taking into account shipping company opinions. We then show that multi-scenario policies put shipping companies in the position of satisfying empty-container demands for different values that may be taken by uncertain parameters. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Study on the Application of Fuzzy Integral Model in the Performance Evaluation of Public Organization
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: public organizations; performance evaluation; fuzzy integral
Abstract: Enhance the research on performance evaluation of the public organization may reflect the management efficiency effectively and provide foundation for the decision making of upper deck. First this paper point out the advantage that the fuzzy integral model can eliminate the correlation between indexes, which illustrates the feasibility and the advantage when the model is used in the performance evaluation of public organization. Then this paper establishes a comprehensive evaluation model after inventively introducing the fuzzy value to adjust the weights of indexes, which can improve the accuracy of the weights. At last, test the applicability and limitations of the model through application, raising several suggestions for the practical performance evaluation of the public of public organizations.

Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Romanian taxation system; profit tax rate; income tax rate; permanent establishment; tax on nonresidents' income; tax on dividends; tax on royalties; VAT; Romanian IRS
Abstract: During the years, Romania suffered many changes related to its fiscal system. Starting with 2007, since we've joined European Union, Romania committed to respect the EU legislation. In the following article we will try to underline some of the advantages and disadvantages for investors that decide to start a business in Romania. From the fiscal point of view, Romania is the land of many possibilities. Doing business in Romania has definitely advantages but also disadvantages, as we will see.

Article Title: Land price characteristics and its rationality evaluation at the urban fringe in Ningbo,China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: urban fringe; land price; land benefit allocation; urbanization; Ningbo of Zhejiang province in China
Abstract: Urban fringe is between central city zone and rural hinterland. Because of urban expansion, it is also an area with lots of land transactions and development activities. The engendering of land price of urban fringe reflects land use value as well as land supply and demand relationship. In order to ensure healthy central city construction and regional urbanization, it is necessary to realize the characteristics of land price of urban fringe, to handle land price leverage and adjust market demand of urban construction land. Firstly, the urban fringe is designated concretely with abundant inquisitional data of Ningbo. On the analysis of social-economic characteristics of the Urban fringe, the authors divide the area into four land price zones using GIS technology, that are the zone contiguous to the urban place, mixed zone, the zone close to the rural area and rural zone. Furthermore, this paper describes the characteristics of residential land price, commercial land price, industrial land price and farm land price, and evaluates land price from several aspects.

Article Title: Management of project design working based on the thought of activity programming
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: management pattern; Dynamic design management; activity programming
Abstract: In order to improve and strengthen management of project design working, this article proposes project design management pattern based on the thought of activity programming. The article offers a few introductory remarks so that discussions may be stimulated and others may offer their valuable ideas. The activity programming includes design based on demand to control and guide development of project, design work according with the requirements of project management, taking the design management in sequence, Conducting design management according to the principle of emphasizing the near future primarily and considering more at present than in long term, and Dynamic design management and aid decision making.

Article Title: Study on Several Key Issues of E-government
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: e-government; systems engineering; standardization; security
Abstract: With the advancement of network information technology, electronic governance has entered a phase of accelerated development. As a result, many issues have emerged, including such key issues as systemization, unified planning and standards, structural and functional design and security. Since e-government is a complex system project, it is to be constructed according to the principles of systems engineering, which demands for unified planning and standards and careful system analysis and design to determine the framework and functional structure as well as the security issue for the e-government system.

Article Title: Analysis Of Material Flow Of Residential Building
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: MFA; residential building; Ecological Rucksacks; Circular Economy
Abstract: Material Flow Analysis (MFA) is direct and useful tool for study circular economy and sustainable development. At present, the study and practical of MFA have been spreading in some developed countries and just beginning in China. The purpose of this research is to apply MFA approach to analyze the material transformation in the residential building sector, so as to look into the actuality of residential energy consumption, and to provide data support for building energy efficiency work. The material flow model, research framework and evaluation indexes are presented in this paper, especially, the Ecological Rucksacks and its calculation method is introduced. On this base, a complete method of material flow in residential building is worked out to measure the energy consumption of residential building sector. Finally the MFA method above is applied to measure residential energy consumption of Beijing in 2002 by case studies, in order to validate the feasibility of this method.

Article Title: The Evaluation for the Sustainable Development of Real Estate Market in Liaoning Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Liaoning province; Real estate market; Sustainable development; Analytic hierarchy process
Abstract: According to the characteristics of real estate market and from the needs of social economic sustainable development in Liaoning province, selecting 11 indexes which can reflect the social, economic and environment: population density, per capita residential built-up area, per capita daily life water, each myriad people who possess public transit vehicles, per capita GDP, real estate development investment, apartment sales, urban residents disposable income, standard-reaching rate of industrial wastewater discharge, the comprehensive utilization rate of industrial solid waste and construction area green coverage rate. This article adopted the analytic hierarchy process to 14 cities to comprehensively evaluate the sustainable development of real estate market in Liaoning province and carry out the cluster analysis. In conclusion, through the above research, the measures and countermeasures of the sustainable development of real estate market in Liaoning province is proposed. It also provides a scientific basis for the stable sustainable and harmonious development of national economy.

Article Title: A Research on the Conflict Management Strategy and Management Model of the Program Resource
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Program; Conflict Management; Synergy Working Platform; Coordination management
Abstract: Every project of the program was related to each other in the space as well as the structure. Every contract section strived for their own sites and other resources for the interests. In this paper, it had discussed the conflict management of the use of resource. The causes of the conflict would include the inconsistent objectives, the limited resources and also the getting out of control process. In order to implement the resource conflict management, firstly, it suggested making a system analysis for the public resources and identifying the internal and external conflicts of the system. It called for a programming for the conflict management and the options of how to mitigate. Secondly, it demanded the management of the interface related to the resources and the coordination management of the program organization and the reorganization of resources. Thirdly, it asked to establish the internet-based auxiliary decision-making support system for the program public resource conflict management Based on various conflict analysis models, it argued to set up the conflict negotiation decision support system and build collaborative working platform based on internet resources for the program resource conflict management.

Article Title: Economic Analyze the Reform of Chinese Collective Forestry Tenure Regime
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: collective forestry tenure; regime reform; economic analyze
Abstract: Chinese forest tenure regime has been unable to meet the economic development of forestry, We need to establish a system of forestry tenure as the core of forestry investment incentives This article first established the decision-making model of investment in forestry under normal circumstances and the opportunity cost's based on the forest household production function, then we discussed how to decide the term of the forestry tenure combine with the characteristics of forestry investment. Finally we discussed how the compensation of government effect forestry investment

Article Title: Dynamic Analysis of Tax Influence on Housing Price, Supply and Demand
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Tax; System dynamics; Housing price; Supply; Demand
Abstract: To study the relationship between tax policy and housing economic system is very meaningful to promote the reasonable and balanced development of the housing market. In this paper a system dynamics model is established to simulate the housing market. China's housing industry is faced with a great adjustment after the rapid development. Tax policy is one of the most important tools for the government to intervene in economic activities and balance the housing market. It also has a unique function in guiding the rational allocation of real estate resources and fair distribution of social wealth. For those reasons, this paper analyzes the mechanism of urban housing system, explores the root causes of high housing prices, contradictions of housing supply and demand. In the mean while, a system dynamic model is established to measure different effects on housing market supply and demand, housing prices and other factors from different tax policies, which leads to reform direction of the tax policies in housing market.

Article Title: Graphical solution and continuum approximation for the single destination dynamic user equilibrium problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: User optimum; Dynamic traffic assignment; Continuum approximation
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT PROBLEM; VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; ROAD NETWORKS; MODEL
Abstract: This paper studies the user optimum dynamic traffic assignment in a network consisting of a congested freeway section connected to a surface street grid via capacitated off-ramps. It is shown that although the network is simple, it is in general complicated to obtain the optimum solution analytically because (i) it has two different alternating diversion patterns and (ii) it can only be obtained sequentially in time. A simplified graphical solution method is proposed to cope with (i) but the method remains sequential. Finally, a continuum approximation is proposed that enables finding closed-form solutions without the above limitations. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Study on the Program Breakdown Structure System of the South-to-North Water Diversion Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the South-to-North Water Diversion Project; Program Breakdown Structure (PgBS); WBS; PBS
Abstract: The South-to-North Water Diversion Project is a large-scale engineering project which includes three parts named as Eastern Route Project (ERP), Middle Route Project (MRP) and Western Route Project (WRP). The South-to-North Water Diversion Project is a large-scale engineering project which includes many kinds of projects and participants, at the same time, several management models are applied in the South-to-North Water Diversion Project. Given the complexity of the project, the traditional WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) or PBS (Project Breakdown Structure) is not suitable for the decision-making group and the managing departments of the South-to-North Water Diversion Project. Based on the Program Management, the concept of Program Breakdown Structure (PgBS) is proposed in this paper, and the PgBS system of the South-to-North Water Diversion Project is conceived, which will be the important basis of the Program Management of the South-to-North Water Diversion Project.

Article Title: Real Estate Tax and Housing Prices in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate tax; housing price; demand and supply
Abstract: This paper examines the impact of real estate tax on housing prices in China. Based on the data from State Statistics Bureau, the elasticities of demand and supply demonstrate that the supply elasticity is above demand one, and real estate tax is shifted to consumers. The high demand supply ratio of housing market is the fundamental reason of rising housing prices in China. Property tax is proposed to curb rising of house prices. But it it is still uncertain whether property tax can curb housing price. This paper will focus on the question. With the imposition of new property tax, housing market equilibrium will be affected, and the new data give us an opportunity to observe the tax incidence in China's housing market.

Article Title: A Study of Multi-Project Construction Supply Chain Management Model Based on EPC
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Supply Chain Management; EPC; Multi-projects; Management mode
Abstract: The competition of construction market grows more and more fiercely at home and abroad currently. Chinese construction contract market has turned into a part of international engineering market since China joined WTO. This situation intensifies the competition pressure of domestic construction enterprise. A hypothesis is mostly implied in the study of Construction Supply Chain Management model in the past, which the cooperation of supply chain enterprise is just conducted centering on a project. But the fact is that large-scale construction enterprises put EPC in practice, and always carry on many projects at the same time, so that enterprises locate in several project supply chain and become to the core enterprise in the supply chain. How to make the multi-projects core enterprises in the supply chain work more excellently in supply chain management is an issue according with current industry situation. This paper puts forward the multi-project supply chain management mode which aims at EPC construction mode.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Economic Evaluation of Green Building Based On Cost-Benefit Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green Building; economic evaluation; costs; benefits
Abstract: At present, many countries in the world have done a lot of research on green building, the outcomes include green building rating systems, such as LEED of USA, BREEAM of UK, CASBEE of Japan and so on, China had also launched green building assessment criteria (ESGB) by the end of 2006, which is considered as the most comprehensive evaluation tools of green building so far.Green building refers to the quality and characteristics of the actual structure created using the principles and methodologies of sustainable construction. Though green building can generated large benefits, different people have different opinions on whether green building should be built from the point of economic feasibility. Only from the point of project investment, the implementation of green building must be based on the economic analysis. Through using the approach of cost-effective analysis, this paper introduced the whole process of the economic evaluation of Green Building. It not only identify concerning costs and effectiveness of green building, but also may offer a way to evaluate the economic performance of green building to choose program from the point of economy.

Article Title: Research on the Relationship between Regional Tax and Economic Growth: Taking Example of Jilin Province
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: tax; analysis of co-integration; error correction model
Abstract: This paper committed a empirical analysis to the relationship between tax and economic growth of Jilin since reform and opening-up We use the methods of descriptive statistics, co-integration and error correction model, using the data of tax and gross regional product of Jilin from 1978 to 2007 The results show that the tax and economy of Jilin have been growing fast, while economic situation and tax policies arc affected by tax significantly, and that the relationship between tax and economy is balanced in a long term There is a dynamic adjustment mechanism between them in a short term

Authors: Ma, X; Li, HM; Zhang, YL; Hu, X
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ma Xin; Li Huimin; Zhang Yuling; Hu Xin
Article Title: Study on Multi-Life Cycle Dynamic Model of Building Materials Based on Emission of CO2
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Building materials; Emission of CO2; Coefficient of Energy Decline; Multi-life Cycle Sustainable usability
Abstract: In order to select building materials with low energy consumption and low environmental pollution, multi-life cycle dynamic model of building materials is proposed. By introducing the coefficient of energy decline, the emission of CO2 of four stages is analyzed, including raw materials extraction, building materials production, the construction of the implementation, and the recycling of construction materials and then the emission of CO2 of multi-life cycle of building materials is calculated. According to the model and two different types of residence buildings in Xi An, the sustainable use of performance of several important building materials from the multi-life cycle angle is analyzed. Then the results indicate that: (1)Sustainable usability has a greater impact on choosing building materials; (2) Technical level of recycling affects the choosing building materials; (3) The sustainable usability of building material is influenced greatly by production of energy; (4) The coefficient of energy decline greatly influences the choosing building materials.

Authors: Mao, XP; Tang, SH; Lu, HM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Mao, X. P.; Tang, S. H.; Lu, H. M.
Article Title: RE-ENGINEERING CONSTRUCTION PROCESS FOR RADICAL SUSTAINABLE CONSTRUCTION IN CHINA CONTEXT
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: China; Construction Industry; Construction Process Re-engineering; Sustainable Construction; Sustainable Development
Abstract: Persistent boost of economy results in the dramatic improvement of Chinese people's living standard. However, rapid expanding of economy can be shown to be equal to environmental damaging, enormous resources and energy consumption. Sustainable development has become a pillar strategy of China. Corresponding with this strategy, the ideas of sustainable construction should been imbued into the China's construction industry. Compared with the developed countries, the development of China's sustainable construction is at the primary stage. A deeper and wider transformation of the current construction delivery process should be launched to realize the radical sustainable construction in China context. In this paper, the theories of sustainable development and sustainable construction have been introduced. Then, the method of Construction Process Re-engineering has been used to implement the radical sustainable construction. In the meanwhile, a framework has been established to imbue the principles, methods, and techniques of the sustainable construction into the each mission of process at the project level.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Uncertainty Analysis and Risk Assessment of Real Estate Project Planning and Designing
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate enterprises; Niche; Real estate market
Abstract: There is no denying the fact that the designing and planning stage of Real estate projects is extremely vital for the success or failure of a real estate development project. On the domestic background of today's hot real estate development, instead of focusing on the designing and planning quality of the prior period of project, the real estate developers generally pay more attention on shortening the project developing progress and accelerating the recovery of capital, which leading to a large number of problems such as the design change and design wasting. The purpose of this paper is to learn how to solve these problems mentioned above from the perspective of the real estate developers. In this paper, Firstly, finding out the quality problems that may lead to the design of the uncertain factors on the basis of working from all stages of content analysis, secondly, analyzing and ranking these quality problems as well as working out the corresponding methods to deal with by grey correlation degree analysis.

Authors: Naumoski, A; Kocev, D; Atanasova, N; Mitreski, K; Krstic, S; Dzeroski, S
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Naumoski, Andreja; Kocev, Dragi; Atanasova, Natasa; Mitreski, Kosta; Krstic, Svetislav; Dzeroski, Saso
Article Title: Predicting chemical parameters of the water from diatom abudance in lake Prespa and its tributaries
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Lake Prespa; diatoms; physic-chemical status; machine learning
Abstract: In this work, we are modelling the physic-chemical parameters of water using bioindicator data (diatom taxa abundance data). Chemical status of the water (or water quality class) is defined by the values of measured physic-chemical parameters. Traditional approach to model these data is to learn a separate model for each parameter and then derive a global overview with some kind of summarization over the multiple models. Another approach is to learn a single model that describes all parameters (multi target approach). We explore these approaches and apply them on data from Lake Prespa and its tributary rivers. The obtained models revealed interesting connections between the diatom taxa and the water quality (i.e. the values of the chemical parameters).

Article Title: Analysis of Group Management and Control Model on Big Real Estate Enterprise
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Enterprise strategy; Group management and control; Organization structure; Real estate enterprise
Abstract: The conception of management and control has firstly been proposed by Anthony in 1965, who thought that management and control is a process that the supervisors obtain and use the resource efficiently and effectively to achieve the organization objective. The group management and control system must be established and improved when Real estate enterprise developed with large-scale expansion, adjusted enterprise governance and organizational structure, completed enterprise deep-seated competitiveness construction, fully integrated and effectively use all resources, so that the competitive advantage of long-term stability can be constructed. Therefore, based on the conception definition and studies on the domestic status quo of group management and control, this paper detailed discussed the contents and established method of the big real estate enterprise group management and control model, lastly analyzed the New World China Land Limited group management and control model and proposed the related suggestions, aim to provide a reliable reference for real estate enterprise management.

Authors: Sieber, S; Müller, K; Tscherning, K; Helming, K; Pohle, D; Fricke, K; Verweij, P
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Sieber, S.; Mueller, K.; Tscherning, K.; Helming, K.; Pohle, D.; Fricke, K.; Verweij, P.
Article Title: Meta-modelling for cross-sectoral land use policy impact analysis: A model requirements analysis of the SIAT
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Sustainability Impact Assessment; Land Use Policies; meta-model; Sustainability Impact Assessment Tools (SIAT); requirement analysis
Abstract: The Integrated Project SENSOR developed the meta-model Sustainability Impact Assessment Tools (SIAT) to support decision making at the EU level (Sieber et al. 2008). First, this paper illustrates the concept on the functionality and methodology of the meta-model SIAT. Based on the development process and applied methods of software prototyping major model requirements have been elaborated. Four major requirement fields have been revealed. They can be subsumed into the categories of (1) performance, (2) integration, (3) institution and (4) quality (IIPQ), whereas point (1) is classified (a) spatial scales, (b) sectors and (c) indicator variables, (d) dynamic viability over time, (e) flexible system to select the level of implicit and explicit knowledge; point (2) is classified in (a) model response time (b) diversity of visualization results, (c) advanced technologies and system compatibility; point (3) on reliability information is structured in the three fields of (a) quality criteria on results, (b) assumptions and (c) back tracing. The point (4) on institutional embedment links the institutions; either trough stakeholder participation or expert consultations. The SIAT is finally classified according to the given criteria. The paper concludes on further requirements to maintain the model beyond project lifetime. Mainly funding issues, complementary further institutional embedment, flexibility towards new scopes of analysis, quality assurance and scientific publications have been described as major future challenges.

Article Title: Intensification and Perfection of the Legislation of Cyclic Economy under the New Situation
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: cyclic economy; legislation; new situation; key problems
Abstract: Developing cyclic economy is not only consistent with the demand of Scientific Outlook on Development to build a harmonious relationship between economic growth and ecology but also necessary for the adjustment of industry structure and cultivating the new economic growth point to respond to the current domestic and international economic situation. According to the new situation, the paper implies that regional legislation of cyclic economy should be more detailed, more standard, therefore make it more feasible. The paper concludes that regions and functional departments are advised to work out corresponding technical standards and evaluation system to provide institutional guarantee for the development of cyclic economy.

Author Full Names: Tang, C. X.; Wang, M. J.
Article Title: Risk Evaluation on Design Institute's Knowledge Sharing
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Knowledge sharing; Prisoner's dilemma; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; Index system
Abstract: Along with the rapid development of science and technology, means of design industry also put forward higher request. In the times of knowledge-based economy, knowledge management is the sources of sustainable development for design institute. How to make the best of knowledge management between design institutes is a realistic problem before the design institute. Knowledge Management aims to implement knowledge sharing. Based on the expatiation of knowledge's characteristics and prisoner's dilemma for knowledge sharing of design institute, an evaluation index system of risk is setup, and multiple fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method is used to evaluate knowledge sharing's risk. Then, an empirical analysis is carried on the design institutes. The results showed that the index system and evaluation method has a strong feasibility and operability. It will be widely popularized and applied in design institute's knowledge sharing. This not only helps further improvement of the risk evaluation, but also confirms the risk status and role to further improve the design institute's knowledge sharing.

Article Title: Semantically driven meta-modelling: automating model construction in an environmental decision support system for the assessment of ecosystem services flows
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: ARIES (Artificial Intelligence for Ecosystem Services) is a large-scale project aimed to Supporting environmental decision-making by quantifying and spatially mapping the flows of benefits provided by natural systems to humans. Because only ad-hoc models can reflect local conditions with enough detail to support decision making, ARIES needs to specialize its predictive models to a highly diverse set of contexts. This article describes the approach adopted in ARIES to automate the construction of ad-hoc models of variable structure, based on a set of context observations and on rules that encode the expert knowledge that associates model structure to specific environmental, social and economic conditions.

Article Title: Research on the comprehensive development and utilization of waters underground space in the central cities of Yangtze River Delta
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: The central cities of Yangtze River Delta; Waters underground space (WUS); Comprehensive development and utilization
Abstract: The central cities in Yangtze River Delta (YRD) are well developed and have vast water areas. To promote the balance and coordinate development of areas surrounding the waters, research on building convenient traffic network using Waters Underground Space (WUS) has already become the objective demand of the central cities in YRD. In the current economic situation, it is a topic worthy of study to develop and utilize the WUS synthetically, and extend modes by the capital market operation and investment environment in YRD, which could alleviate the conflicts of the land resource reducing increasingly, also create new financing channels for environmental renovation of lakes and rivers, explore new areas for real estate and promote the sustainable development of the society, economic and environment. It firstly analyzes the current status and existing problems of the development and utilization of WUS in YRD, then based on the characteristics of WUS and the theories, puts forward the possible functions and compound modes of WUS, and finally briefly analyzes the main problems of the comprehensive development and utilization of WUS.

Article Title: Impact of the Social Insurance Law on the Labor's Security in the Construction Industry of China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction industry; labor's security; social security
Abstract: The Social Insurance Law is going to be legislated by the Second Session of the Eleventh National People's Congress of China in 2009. With the promulgation of this law, the labor's security of the construction industry is facing a new reform. Based on the overview of the general situation of social security in China, this paper elaborates on the characteristics of the different modes of the labor's security in construction industry, combined with China's policy background and the actual situation of the construction industry. It is suggested that the direction of the development and reform of the labor's security in construction industry is to be merged into the social security system which is regulated by the Social Insurance Law. Finally, obstacles existed in the integration process is analyzed and predicted. Then relevant proposals and solutions are put forward in order to guide the labor's security in construction industry to be brought into line with the social security system.

Article Title: An empirical analysis on the factors Influencing the development of real estate market in Jiangxi Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real Estate Market; Influencing Factor; Empirical Analysis
Abstract: As one of the leading industries of national economic development, real estate industry is very crucial to the macroeconomic development. The history and theory of domestic and foreign economic growth have repeatedly proved that the real estate industry is of high sensitivity and in advance of economic development. The rapid development of real estate is the premise and the major contents of rapid economic growth, at the same time, rapid economic growth also brings the real estate industry forward. Moreover, in view of its push to the development of such as construction, building materials, finance, furniture and other related industries, the real estate industry is an important force for promoting domestic demand and economic growth. This article, at first, put forward the background and significance of the study on the real estate market development in our province, and selected and analyzed the restricted factors of real estate market development, then we made use of statistical methods to carry out the empirical analysis on the factors influencing the development of real estate market, at last, we drew relevant conclusions.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Using SQL Server Data Mining Technology to Construct Housing Price Indexes
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing price indices; Data mining; SQL Server
Abstract: In recent years, the real estate information system in China has improved dramatically, which make it possible to construct high quality price index. However, because up-to-date information technologies are not yet completely introduced to the real estate industry, the process of constructing real estate price index is time-consuming. In particular, some quality-controlled housing price indexes, such as the widely used hedonic price index, require regression models. Without data mining utilities, handling with regression models is the bottleneck of the whole job. This paper introduces a practical method of constructing real estate price indices, using the most common database software Microsoft SQL Server 2005, and gives out a demonstration. The result shows that this method can simplify the constructing process and provide confidential data with better protection. From this paper, it is clear that preparing index with SQL Server has several obvious advantages. First of all, it avoids exporting data outside, so that the security of confidential information will be enhanced. Secondly, by reducing manual operations, it improves the objectiveness of the index. Last but not least, it consumes less time than traditional methods.

Authors: Yu, MX; Yang, KQ; Zhang, L; Zhang, J
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Yu, M. X.; Yang, K. Q.; Zhang, L.; Zhang, J.
Article Title: Study on the standard for economical use of construction land in villages and towns
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction land in villages and towns' area; Economical use; Standard framework
Abstract: The expanding of scale and the extensive use of construction land in villages and towns has been very common in China for a long time due to the lack of unified planning in these areas, which is to hinder the coordinated development of urban and rural areas and the steadily promotion of urbanization in village and town areas. Attention must be paid to the economical use of construction land in these areas for the purposes of protecting arable land and constructing of resource-saving society. Studying on the standard for economical use of construction land and then applying it to urban and rural planning, land use planning and special planning could be an important way to enhance the level of economical use of construction land and to develop villages and towns healthily. In this paper, the standard framework for economical use, based on the analysis of problems existing in the use of construction land in villages and towns, is built from three levels. They are the total scale control level, the structural control level and the classification control level. It's a basis work for the standard framework to classify the construction land. It is found that construction land can be divided into 6 first class categories, 18 second class categories. The value of the standard must be made for all categories. Construction area per capita, the structure of construction land, each area of homestead, land for industry and warehouse, public administration and public service site are core indicators in the standard framework. Three suggestions are pointed out to implement the standard. It's necessary to determine the standard according to the local conditions in different regions. Incentive mechanism must be established and improved in order to enforce the standard. Finally, the standard must be dynamic adjusted to adapt the socio-economic development.

Authors: Zhang, HY; Wang, JQ; Liu, WD; Zhong, LM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang Hengyi; Wang Jiaqi; Liu Weidong; Zhong Liangming
Article Title: A Comprehensive Evaluation Method of Environmental Impact Assessment of Land Use Planning Based on Extenics Theory: A Case Study of Zhoushan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Extenics Theory; Environmental Impact Assessment; Land Use Planning; Evaluation Method; Zhoushan
Abstract: In the first instance, this paper attempts to propose the main aspects of environmental impact assessment (EIA) of land use planning and develops a relevant system of multi-indicators. These indicators were obtained through comparing and analyzing the selected recent literatures which served to illustrate the fundamental theoretical and empirical issues of environmental impact assessment in land use planning. Secondly, an extension engineering model about comprehensive evaluation of EIA of land use planning was set up according to matter-element model, correlation function and extenics theory. This model can transform the multi-criteria decision of EIA into the single-object decision, and provide a quantitative evaluation result by calculating the relation degree with using the correlation functions. The result can directly and soundly show the specific environmental status potentially produced by carrying out the land use planning. Finally, Zhoushan was chosen as a case study. The possible impacts on environment resulted from the land use planning were meticulously identified and predicted under scenarios of a given program subject to land use planning, and then the model and the indicators were applied to evaluate the environmental impact of land use planning. The results apparently and clearly reflect the level of environmental impact of land use planning in Zhoushan. The short-term program, to some extent, imposes a certain negative impact on the environment; therefore this program needs to be adjusted to decrease environmental impact. Nevertheless, the medium-term or long-term program is completely feasible in terms of environmental impact. In conclusion, this paper represents a new approach to evaluate environmental impact of land use planning.

Article Title: The Empirical Analysis of Industrial Parks Development and Industrialization Process for Less Developed Regions

Article Title: The Study on Decision Mechanism of Parents' Migration: The Case of Beijing
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: parents' migration; employed children; motivations; decision-making mechanism
Abstract: According to data of the 1% survey on floating population in Beijing in 2006, the proportion of households with at least one migrant parent has increased significantly than that in the former years. By comparing the immigration time of floating people in Beijing, it can be found that intervals of sequential migration are shortening. The average interval between primary immigrants to their parents is only 8.66 years. Besides, these households are showing typical features of direct-line families, for their years of staying in Beijing is becoming longer; their frequency of migrating again is lower; their settlement tendency is more significant. The tendency that direct-line families are gathering to Beijing indicates that there will be more advanced people will locate at where their children are living. For the purpose of obtaining true opinions of family members on their parents' migration, the essay constructs a conceptual model to reflect motivations and feasibilities, based on the hypothesis of so-called altruism contract. Then, individual characteristics and family characteristics are studied, so as to conclude the motivations and obstacles that determine intergraded behaviors. The research is expected to help migrant families plan parents' migrations rationally and to avoid the risk of their inadaptability.

Article Title: Bounded rationality and irreversible network change
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bounded rationality; User equilibrium; Day-to-day dynamics; Irreversible network change
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC-ASSIGNMENT; DYNAMICAL-SYSTEMS; EQUILIBRIUM; INFORMATION; COMPUTATION; STABILITY
Abstract: A network change is said to be irreversible if the initial network equilibrium cannot be restored by revoking the change. The phenomenon of irreversible network change has been observed in reality. To model this phenomenon, we develop a day-to-day dynamic model whose fixed point is a boundedly rational user equilibrium (BRUE) flow. Our BRUE based approach to modeling irreversible network change has two advantages over other methods based on Wardrop user equilibrium (UE) or stochastic user equilibrium (SUE). First, the existence of multiple network equilibria is necessary for modeling irreversible network change. Unlike UE or SUE, the BRUE multiple equilibria do not rely on non-separable link cost functions, which makes our model applicable to real-world large-scale networks, where well-calibrated non-separable link cost functions are generally not available. Second, travelers' boundedly rational behavior in route choice is explicitly considered in our model. The proposed model is applied to the Twin Cities network to model the flow evolution during the collapse and reopening of the 1-35 W Bridge. The results show that our model can to a reasonable level reproduce the observed phenomenon of irreversible network change. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Du, YQ; Chen, QS; Quan, XW; Long, L; Fung, RYK
Author Full Names: Du, Yuquan; Chen, Qiushuang; Quan, Xiongwen; Long, Lei; Fung, Richard Y. K.
Article Title: Berth allocation considering fuel consumption and vessel emissions
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Berth allocation; Fuel consumption; Emission; Second order cone programming; Port-shipping coordination
Abstract: We propose a more elaborate model on berth allocation considering fuel consumption than before, and overcome the nonlinear complexity by casting it as a mixed integer second order cone programming model. Furthermore, we conduct the vessel emission (in sailing periods) calculation with the widely-used emission factors. Besides, vessel emissions in mooring periods are also analyzed through a post-optimization phase on waiting time. Experimental results demonstrate that the new berth allocation strategy, reflected by the proposed model, is competent to significantly reduce fuel consumption and vessel emissions, while simultaneously retaining the service level of the terminal. Article Title: Fleet deployment, network design and hub location of liner shipping companies
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Hub-and-spoke network design; Liner shipping; Fleet deployment; Elastic demand; Mixed integer programming; Benders decomposition
Abstract: A mixed integer linear programming formulation is proposed for the simultaneous design of network and fleet deployment of a deep-sea liner service provider. The underlying network design problem is based on a 4-index (5-index by considering capacity type) formulation of the hub location problem which are known for their tightness. The demand is elastic in the sense that the service provider can accept any fraction of the origin-destination demand. We then propose a primal decomposition method to solve instances of the problem to optimality. Numerical results confirm superiority of our approach in comparison with a general-purpose mixed integer programming solver. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Yamada, T; Imai, K; Nakamura, T; Taniguchi, E
Author Full Names: Yamada, Tadashi; Imai, Koji; Nakamura, Takamasa; Taniguchi, Eiichi
Article Title: A supply chain-transport supernetwork equilibrium model with the behaviour of freight carriers
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain network modelling; Transport network modelling; Supernetwork; Network equilibrium; Freight carriers' behaviour; Freight transport measures
Abstract: This paper presents a supernetwork equilibrium model integrating supply chain networks with a transport network, namely, a supply chain-transport supernetwork equilibrium model. The model takes into account the behaviour of freight carriers and transport network users to endogenously determine the transport costs generated in the supply chain networks. The interaction between transport network and supply chain networks can also be examined. Results of the numerical tests reveal that the improvement of transport network could enhance the efficiency of supply chain networks. The paper makes contributions to modelling of supply chain networks as well as to that of transport networks. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bell, MGH; Liu, X; Angeloudis, P; Fonzone, A; Hosseinloo, SH
Author Full Names: Bell, Michael G. H.; Liu, Xin; Angeloudis, Panagiotis; Fonzone, Achille; Hosseinloo, Solmaz Haji
Article Title: A frequency-based maritime container assignment model
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Assignment; Logistics; Containers; Linear programming
Keywords Plus: INTERCITY FREIGHT FLOWS; TRANSIT NETWORKS; PREDICTION
Abstract: This paper transfers the classic frequency-based transit assignment method of Spiess and Florian to containers demonstrating its promise as the basis for a global maritime container assignment model. In this model, containers are carried by shipping lines operating strings (or port rotations) with given service frequencies. An origin-destination matrix of full containers is assigned to these strings to minimize sailing time plus container dwell time at the origin port and any intermediate transhipment ports. This necessitated two significant model extensions. The first involves the repositioning of empty containers so that a net outflow of full containers from any port is balanced by a net inflow of empty containers, and vice versa. As with full containers, empty containers are repositioned to minimize the sum of sailing and dwell time, with a facility to discount the dwell time of empty containers in recognition of the absence of inventory. The second involves the inclusion of an upper limit to the maximum number of container moves per unit time at any port. The dual variable for this constraint provides a shadow price, or surcharge, for loading or unloading a container at a congested port. Insight into the interpretation of the dual variables is given by proposition and proof. Model behaviour is illustrated by a simple numerical example. The paper concludes by considering the next steps toward realising a container assignment model that can, amongst other things, support the assessment of supply chain vulnerability to maritime disruptions. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Robust single-track train dispatching model under a dynamic and stochastic environment: A scenario-based rolling horizon solution approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Train dispatching; Disruption handling; Rolling horizon decision making; Stochastic optimization
Keywords Plus: SCHEDULING TRAINS; BOUND ALGORITHM; DURATION; DELAY; PROPAGATION; BREAKDOWNS; OPERATIONS; EARLINESS; FREQUENCY; STRATEGY
Abstract: After a major service disruption on a single-track rail line, dispatchers need to generate a series of train meet-pass plans at different decision times of the rescheduling stage. The task is to recover the impacted train schedule from the current and future disturbances and minimize the expected additional delay under different forecasted operational conditions. Based on a stochastic programming with recourse framework, this paper incorporates different probabilistic scenarios in the rolling horizon decision process to recognize (1) the input data uncertainty associated with predicted segment running times and segment recovery times and (2) the possibilities of rescheduling decisions after receiving status updates. The proposed model periodically optimizes schedules for a relatively long rolling horizon, while selecting and disseminating a robust meet-pass plan for every roll period. A multi-layer branching solution procedure is developed to systematically generate and select meet-pass plans under different stochastic scenarios. Illustrative examples and numerical experiments are used to demonstrate the importance of robust disruption handling under a dynamic and stochastic environment. In terms of expected total train delay time, our experimental results show that the robust solutions are better than the expected value-based solutions by a range of 10-30%. Authors: Luathep, P; Sumalee, A; Lam, WHK; Li, ZC; Lo, HK
Author Full Names: Luathep, Paramet; Sumalee, Agachai; Lam, William H. K.; Li, Zhi-Chun; Lo, Hong K.
Article Title: Global optimization method for mixed transportation network design problem: A mixed-integer linear programming approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Network design problem; Discrete network design; Mixed network design; Mixed-integer linear programming; Global optimization
Abstract: This paper proposes a global optimization algorithm for solving a mixed (continuous/discrete) transportation network design problem (MNDP), which is generally expressed as a mathematical programming with equilibrium constraint (MPEC). The upper level of the MNDP aims to optimize the network performance via both expansion of existing links and addition of new candidate links, whereas the lower level is a traditional Wardrop user equilibrium CUE) problem. In this paper, we first formulate the UE condition as a variational inequality (VI) problem, which is defined from a finite number of extreme points of a link-low feasible region. The MNDP is approximated as a piecewise-linear programming (P-LP) problem, which is then transformed into a mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) problem. A global optimization algorithm based on a cutting constraint method is developed for solving the MILP problem. Numerical examples are given to demonstrate the efficiency of the proposed method and to compare the results with alternative algorithms reported in the literature. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Optimizing the demand captured by a railway system with a regular timetable
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Regular timetable; Modal choice; Discrete-choice model; Branch-and-bound
Abstract: The railway systems in various European countries adopt regular timetables, in which the trains arrive and depart at constant intervals. In fact, their simple structure provides several advantages both to the passengers and to the management of the service. The design of such timetables has recently received a certain attention in the literature, but the standard model aims to optimize the service for a fixed demand. We relax this unrealistic assumption, taking into account the reciprocal influence between the quality of the timetable and the amount of transport demand captured by the railway. This results into a mixed-integer non linear model with a non-convex continuous relaxation. We solve it by a branch-and-bound algorithm based on a piecewise-linear overestimate of the objective function and a heuristic algorithm which iteratively applies the standard fixed-demand model and a demand-estimation model, feeding each one with data based on the solution obtained from the other one at the previous iteration. The computational results presented concern both random instances and a real-world regional network located in Northwestern Italy. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
