Authors: Wu, XK; Liu, HX; Geroliminis, N
Author Full Names: Wu, Xinkai; Liu, Henry X.; Geroliminis, Nikolas
Article Title: An empirical analysis on the arterial fundamental diagram
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Arterial fundamental diagram (AFD); Traffic signal; g/C ratio; Queue-Over-Detector (QOD); Signal coordination
Abstract: For uninterrupted traffic flow, it is well-known that the fundamental diagram (FD) describes the relationship between traffic flow and density under steady state. For interrupted traffic flow on a signalized road, it has been recognized that the arterial fundamental diagram (AFD) is significantly affected by signal operations. But little research up to date has discussed in detail how signal operations impact the AFD. In this paper, based upon empirical observations from high-resolution event-based traffic signal data collected from a major arterial in the Twin Cities area, we study the impacts of g/C ratio, signal coordination, and turning movements on the cycle-based AFD, which describes the relationship between traffic flow and occupancy in a signal cycle. By microscopically investigating individual vehicle trajectories from event-based data, we demonstrate that not only g/C ratio constrains the capacity of a signalized approach, poor signal coordination and turning movements from upstream intersections also have significant impact on the capacity. We show that an arterial link may not be congested even with high occupancy values. Such high values could result from queue build-up during red light that occupies the detector, i.e. the Queue-Over-Detector (QOD) phenomenon discussed in this paper. More importantly, by removing the impact of QOD, a stable form of AFD is revealed, and one can use that to identify three different regimes including under-saturation, saturation, and over-saturation with queue spillovers. We believe the stable form of AFD is of great importance for traffic signal control because of its ability to identify traffic states on a signal link. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Optimal fueling strategies for locomotive fleets in railroad networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Locomotive fleet; Fueling; Location; Schedule; Lagrangian relaxation; Shortest path
Abstract: Railroad companies spend billions of dollars each year to purchase fuel for thousands of locomotives across the railroad network Each fuel station charges a site-dependent fuel price, and the railroad companies must pay an additional flat contracting fee in order to use it This paper presents a linear mixed-integer mathematical model that integrates not only fuel station location decisions but also locomotive fueling schedule decisions The proposed model helps railroads decide which fuel stations to contract, and how each locomotive should purchase fuel along its predetermined shipment path, such that no locomotive runs out of fuel while the summation of fuel purchasing costs. shipment delay costs (due to fueling), and contracting charges is minimized. A Lagrangian relaxation framework is proposed to decompose the problem into fueling schedule and facility location selection sub-problems. A network shortest path formulation of the fueling schedule sub-problem is developed to obtain an exact optimal solution to the fueling schedule sub-problem The proposed framework is applied to a large-scale empirical case and is shown to effectively reduce system costs (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd All rights reserved

Authors: Demirel, E; van Ommeren, J; Rietveld, P
Author Full Names: Demirel, Erhan; van Ommeren, Jos; Rietveld, Piet
Article Title: A matching model for the backhaul problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Backhaul problem; Imperfect information; Matching models; Search costs
Abstract: The 'backhaul problem' is characterized by an imbalance in transport flows between locations. In a perfectly competitive framework with perfect information, the price of transport from low demand locations to high demand locations, the so-called backhaul price, drops to zero when the imbalance is sufficiently large. However, this result is inconsistent with empirical observations for many competitive transport markets (e.g. taxi and inland navigation markets). In this paper, we develop a matching model to show that a deviation from perfect information may address this inconsistency. We argue that carriers' search time to locate customers plays an important role in the determination of prices. We demonstrate that carriers are compensated for a part of the transport cost and for the time they search for customers. This implies positive backhaul prices. The matching model is numerically applied to the inland navigation shipping market in the Rhine river area in Western-Europe. We find that backhaul prices are substantial. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Rawls, Carmen G.; Turnquist, Mark A.
Article Title: Pre-positioning of emergency supplies for disaster response
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Pre-positioning strategies; L-shaped method; Emergency response; Stochastic program; Facility location
Abstract: Pre-positioning of emergency supplies is one mechanism of increasing preparedness for natural disasters. The goal of this research is to develop an emergency response planning tool that determines the location and quantities of various types of emergency supplies to be pre-positioned, under uncertainty about if, or where, a natural disaster will occur. The paper presents a two-stage stochastic mixed integer program (SMIP) that provides an emergency response pre-positioning strategy for hurricanes or other disaster threats. The SMIP is a robust model that considers uncertainty in demand for the stocked supplies as well as uncertainty regarding transportation network availability after an event. Due to the computational complexity of the problem, a heuristic algorithm referred to as the Lagrangian L-shaped method (LLSM) is developed to solve large-scale instances of the problem. A case study focused on hurricane threat in the Gulf Coast area of the US illustrates application of the model. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Boubaker, K; Desaulniers, G; Elhallaoui, I
Author Full Names: Boubaker, Khaled; Desaulniers, Guy; Elhallaoui, Issmail
Article Title: Bidline scheduling with equity by heuristic dynamic constraint aggregation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Bidline scheduling; Air transportation; Dynamic constraint aggregation; Column generation
Abstract: The bidline scheduling problem with equity arises in several North American airlines. It consists of determining anonymous monthly schedules, called bidlines, that will be subsequently assigned to the crew members according to their bids and seniority. These bidlines must satisfy safety and collective agreement rules. Furthermore, to ensure an equity between the employees, each bidline should have as much as possible the same number of days off and the same number of credited (paid) hours. In this paper, we propose an approximate set partitioning type formulation for this problem and two heuristics for solving it. The first one is a standard branch-and-price heuristic that relies on a rounding procedure to derive integer solutions. The second one is obtained by combining this first heuristic with a dynamic constraint aggregation method that was recently proposed in the literature. Computational results show that, for the largest tested instances, the dynamic constraint aggregation heuristic can produce better quality solutions in a fraction of the computational time required by the standard branch-and-p rice heuristic. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhang, RY; Yun, WY; Moon, I
Author Full Names: Zhang, Ruiyou; Yun, Won Young; Moon, Ilkyeong
Article Title: A reactive tabu search algorithm for the multi-depot container truck transportation problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Traveling salesman problem; Time windows; Multiple depots; Container truck transportation; Reactive tabu search; Heuristic
Keywords Plus: TERMINAL OPERATION; DELIVERY; NETWORK; PICKUP; MODEL
Abstract: A container truck transportation problem that involves multiple depots with time windows at both origins and destinations, including the reposition of empty containers, is formulated as a multi-traveling salesman problem with time windows (m-TSPTW) with multiple depots. Since the problem is NP-hard, a cluster method and a reactive tabu search (RTS) algorithm are developed to solve the problem. The two methods are compared with the mixed integer program which can be used to find optimum solutions for small size problems. The computational results show that the developed methods. particularly the RTS algorithm, can be efficiently used to solve the problem. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Techniques for inserting additional trains into existing timetables
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Train scheduling; Job shops; Time windows; Meta-heuristics
Keywords Plus: BUSY COMPLEX STATIONS; TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT; SCHEDULING PROBLEM; TIME; AVAILABILITY; OPTIMIZATION; CONSTRAINTS; TARDINESS; RAILWAYS; NETWORK
Abstract: In this paper techniques for scheduling additional train services (SATS) are considered as is train scheduling involving general time window constraints, fixed operations, maintenance activities and periods of section unavailability. The SATS problem is important because additional services must often be given access to the railway and subsequently integrated into current timetables. The SATS problem therefore considers the competition for railway infrastructure between new services and existing services belonging to the same or different operators. The SATS problem is characterised as a hybrid job shop scheduling problem with time window constraints. To solve this problem constructive algorithm and metaheuristic scheduling techniques that operate upon a disjunctive graph model of train operations are utilised. From numerical investigations the proposed framework and associated techniques are tested and shown to be effective. Crown Copyright (c) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Capacity factors of a mixed speed railway network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Scheduled railways; Capacity analysis; Line planning
Abstract: Fifty-four combinations of track network and speed differential are evaluated within a linear, discrete time network model that maximizes an objective function of train volume, delays, and idle train time. The results contradict accepted dispatching practice by suggesting that when introducing a priority, high-speed train onto a network, maximum network now is attained when the priority train operates at maximum speed. in addition, increasing siding capacity at meeting points may offer a network capacity improvement comparable to partial double track. Authors: Imai, A; Shintani, K; Papadimitriou, S
Author Full Names: Imai, Akio; Shintani, Koichi; Papadimitriou, Stratos
Article Title: Multi-port vs. Hub-and-Spoke port calls by containerships
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Container transportation; Empty container; Network design; Mathematical programming
Abstract: This paper addresses the design of container liner shipping networks taking into consideration container management issues including empty container repositioning. We examine two typical service networks with different ship sizes: multi-port calling by conventional ship size and hub-and-spoke by mega-ship. The entire solution process is performed in two phases: the service network design and container distribution. A wide variety of numerical experiments are conducted for the Asia-Europe and Asia-North America trade lanes. In most scenarios the multi-port calling is superior in terms of total cost, while the hub-and-spoke is more advantageous in the European trade for a costly shipping company. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Pohl, LM; Meller, RD; Gue, KR
Author Full Names: Pohl, Letitia M.; Meller, Russell D.; Gue, Kevin R.
Article Title: An analysis of dual-command operations in common warehouse designs
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Warehouse design; Aisle design; Task interleaving (dual-command); Expected value analysis
Keywords Plus: ORDER-PICKING; RECTANGULAR WAREHOUSE; CROSS AISLES; LAYOUT; POLICIES; SYSTEMS; PICKERS
Abstract: In a warehouse that uses dual-command operations, workers travel loaded from the pickup and deposit (P&D) point first to a location to store a pallet, then to a second location from which they pick a pallet and return to the P&D point. We develop expected travel distance expressions for such operations and use them to analyze three common warehouse designs. Our results indicate that the best of the three is - in our experience - the one least commonly found in practice. We also show that the optimal placement of a middle cross aisle in the most common design is, in fact, not in the middle. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Properties of system optimal traffic assignment with departure time choice and its solution method
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Dynamic system optimum; Departure time choice; Dynamic road pricing; Travel time models; Bottleneck model
Keywords Plus: USER EQUILIBRIUM; LINK MODELS; NETWORK; CONGESTION; BOTTLENECK; ROUTE
Abstract: This paper investigates dynamic system optimal traffic assignment with departure time choice and its solution method. Dynamic system optimal assignment is formulated as a state-dependent optimal control problem. A fixed volume of traffic is assigned to departure times and routes Such that the total system travel cost is minimized. We derive and discuss the necessary conditions on the network inflow for operating the transportation system optimally. We further provide detailed mathematical analysis and discussion of dynamic system optimal assignment when the deterministic queuing model is adopted. Solution algorithm is developed and investigated for solving the traffic assignments. The effect of choosing the underlying traffic model and time discretization on the quality of the corresponding assignment results are also discussed. This paper contributes to the literature on dynamic traffic modelling and management, and to support further analysis and model development in this area. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Park, Y; Choi, JK; Zhang, AM
Author Full Names: Park, Yonghwa; Choi, Jung Kyu; Zhang, Anming
Article Title: Evaluating competitiveness of air cargo express services
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 11th World Congress of the Air-Transport-Research-Society
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc
Author Keywords: Air cargo express services; Integrators; Competitiveness; Service factors; Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP); Importance-performance analysis
Abstract: This paper explores the relative importance of factors that influence the adoption of air express delivery service, and evaluates the competitiveness of air cargo express carriers in the Korean market. Our AHP analysis shows that accuracy and promptness are the two most influential factors to competitiveness, and that DHL is most competitive in the Korean market, followed by FedEx, TNT, EMS, and UPS. We further examine both the factor importance and carriers' competitiveness from the perspective of service users. While accuracy and promptness remain as important factors, price becomes the most important factor. Finally, an importance-performance analysis for each carrier is conduced, and managerial implications are drawn. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Book Editors: Naimzada, AK; Stefani, S; Torriero, A
Article Title: Network Formation with Closeness Incentives
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Abstract: Closeness centrality is an index that has been widely used to assess the strength of an agent's position in a network of relationships. We study the formation of networks in a strategic setting, where every agent tries to optimize his closeness centrality. We investigate how the curvature of the benefit function (decreasing vs. increasing marginal returns) affects the set of stable networks and compare the results to the well-known connections model of Jackson and Wolinsky JET 71, 1996). It turns out that our model can replicate the connections model in the sense that each result is translatable from one model into the other and the sets of stable networks coincide for certain specifications. We conclude that the two models incorporate the same kind of linking behavior and that grouping these closeness-type models means a first step in organizing network formation models by the type of incentives.

Abstract: This paper presents a study of the environmental quality matrix of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in 2005. Article Title: An Analysis of the Operation of the New Rural Cooperative Medical Care System in Xinjiang
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: health investment; rural cooperative medical-care; Xinjiang
Abstract: Improving fanners' health plays an important role in the mitigation of poverty and raising the farmers' income The New Rural Cooperative Medical Care System (NRCMCS) is an important institutional basis to protect the basic capabilities in China's rural areas. The effective operation of the NRCMCS helps the cooperative medical care system to uphold fairness and guarantee basic health care for the rural population including the ethnic minority farmers. Currently there are natural, economic and social constraints in Xinjiang's ethnic minority areas. These system operation constraints arc hindering a smooth and effective operation of the new rural cooperative medical system In this paper, a comprehensive analysis of these system operation constraints is given. The factors such as harsh natural environment, out-dated medical equipments and the slow increase of the income of farmers are described Then several proposals to counter these constraints and improve the implementation of the NRCMCS in Xinjiang are given

Article Title: Fair Risk Allocation in Malaysia's Version of Private Finance Initiative (PFI): A Reality or a Myth?
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Malaysia; Private Finance Initiave (PFI); Risk allocation
Abstract: Private Finance Initiative (PFI) in Malaysia has been promoted in the Ninth Malaysia Plan (2006-2010) as the panacea of the government's belt-tightening budget, abandoned public projects, shoddy workmanship, over-budgeted project procurement and unresolved debts in public project provision. As PFI continues the implementation of the previous privatization which are formerly synonym with poor public accountability, reduction in competition as well as the development of monopolies, the key characteristics of PFI value-for-money delivery, performance assessment based on government's specification and viability enhancement through risk distribution among stakeholders are expected to streamline these privatization projects. Given that Malaysia's version of PFI is claimed as dissimilar from the archetypical PFI as it withdraws some of the PFI key elements of finance fully initiated by the private sector and suitability merely for the provision of social infrastructure projects, it is momentous for this paper to assess the real status of fair risk allocation in the Malaysia's version of PFI implementation. As the risks in construction project encompass macro, meso and micro level risks, this paper provides the literature review of the current and future PFI projects in Malaysia benchmarked against those three levels of construction risk allocation in concluding whether the fair risk allocation in Malaysia's version of PFI is a reality or a myth.

Author Full Names: Lee, H. Y.; Lee, T. W.
Article Title: Using a Hybrid Model to Plan Recreation Area Development Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Land development; Recreation area; Decision support
Abstract: In today's world, a recreation area is a popular place that provides not only relaxation and recreation but also beautiful surroundings, high quality food, even facilities to exercise and do other healthy activities. Different from other real estimates, it requires a large investment of resources to maintain the attractiveness for visitors. Inappropriate strategy as well as incorrect scheduling may cause the failure of any development project. However, planners often subjectively overestimate the project or cater to the preferences of the investors, resulting in an over-developed or imbalanced development. This paper analyzed the characteristics of a recreation area and its facilities, and the relationships between facilities and people. We found that the activities in a recreation area development project are executed based on the resources provided. In the past, the main financial analysis used by planners for a development project was NPV. But this analysis is static and does not consider the resources during the process of development of the recreation area and its operation. We applied the simulation network to present and calculate the dynamic resource flows for the total duration of the project. We also established a decision support system. In addition to the simulation, the system has a dual-loop optimization model. It combines the polyploidy genetic algorithm and the haploid genetic algorithm to search the near-optimal facility development level set with the near-optimal NPV. This paper also evaluated the model using a realistic project and compared it with the planning carried out by human experts. The results showed that the model can propose a better plan faster than the human experts. With regards to the dynamics of resources and activities, the human experts couldn't provide a thorough consideration in their planning, while the model provided a fully integrated proposal. Because the complex calculations are done by the model instead of by the planner, and because the planning advice is proposed by the system, the decision making process has become substantially easier.

Article Title: The Sustainable Development Base on Corporate Life Cycles
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Sustainable development; Corporate life cycles; Core competence
Abstract: Practice has shown that enterprise can win sustainable development only if they are good at adjusting management strategic emphasis according to their evolution life cycles. Consider the exiting literature, many scholarship thought that a enterprise have its own life cycle and present several typical development stages, different stage has different feature, since the development stage classification method is different, this caused the disunity of corporate development stage model. As to how to break through development stage to fulfill sustainable development, what is the factors restrict sustainable development and the method how to fulfill it, nearly all scholarship have different opinions, many of them combine development stage theory with development factors theory together and gained different influence factor system. However, those theories didn't get the support of practice, and many of the key point still need deep research. Therefore, this paper researched enterprise sustainable development aimed at life cycle,argued that core competence, industrial structure, value transfer, enterprise culture and enterprise mechanism are essential to achieving the goal of sustainable development, and points out corporate development prospects.

Article Title: Research on the sustainable housing
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing; Sustainability; Life cycle
Abstract: Sustainable housing takes the form of the eco-housing and efficient use of resources to design, construct, use and re-use, which put the sustainable concepts into the entire process of housing construction. Sustainable house can not only provide people with healthy, comfortable and safe living space, but also in the life cycle to achieve efficient use of resources and energy, and minimally affect the environment. The sustainable housing is of great significance in realizing the sustainable development society, which has the characteristics of durability, resource recycling, energy saving, environmental friendly and structure flexible. Sustainable housing can not be achieved overnight, and only the idea of sustainability is brought into the life cycle of the housing planning and design, construction, use, dismantling and processing, can sustainable housing be realized.

Article Title: How should Supervision Corporation transfer into Risk Management Institution in the construction
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Risk Management Institution; Agent-based insurance model; tripartite contract
Abstract: In recent years, accidents resulting from poor quality projects lead to high damage to the safe of public property and security of human beings occurred frequently.With the Ministry of Construction and the China Insurance Regulatory Commissionthe views of the promotion of the quality insurance in construction projects,the management level of the construction quality and safety should be improved. Risk Management Pilot is used in the city of Shang Hai. The necessaries for establishing the Risk Management Institution (RMI) are talked about, and the differences are presented between Risk Management Institution and Supervision Corporation (SC) department, such as form of the contract, content of the work, distribution of responsibilities and so on. This article tries to make a point of insurance of project quality and how to guarantee the quality of project by the institution of risk management. This paper presents the operation of the Agent-based insurance model, building the mechanism of incentive and the risk assessment qualification. These measures are fit for the integration of two departments.

Article Title: Analysis of the Asymmetric Situation in the Process of Tendering & Bidding and Strategies Choices for The Owner & The Tenderer
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction Bidding; Asymmetric Information; Implied Contract
Abstract: The tendering and bidding process is the key step in forming the co-operative relationship in project construction. As one of the most important process of construction, Bidding is carried on an asymmetric situation. From the view of the Tenderer, the asymmetric information can be considered as implied or unexpressed contract system. However, from the view of the Owner, it is the measurement taken by the Tenderer, corresponding to his bidding documents, but unbeknown to him. This Asymmetric Situation has great effect on the process of construction project, and to treat and adjust the situation reasonably will be a key problem. Here, from different views, we discussed the asymmetric information situation and gave some advice to both. Both the Owner and the Tenderer can take some measures to make up for the asymmetrical information so as to guarantee the smooth undertaking of the business and realize the interest aims of each parties.

Author Full Names: Loeb, Peter D.; Clarke, William A.
Article Title: The cell phone effect on pedestrian fatalities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Pedestrian fatalities; Cell phones; Motor vehicle accidents
Abstract: This paper examines the impact of cell phone usage on pedestrian fatalities in the United States using econometric models and specification error tests. The model makes use of a polynomial specification so as to allow for potential life-saving and life-taking effects of cell phones. The results indicate that when cell phones were first introduced they had an adverse effect on pedestrian safety, but after a critical number of cell phones was reached, the life-saving effect dominated over the life-taking effect. However, as the number of phones continued to increase, the life-taking effect once again dominated over the life-saving- effects. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A dynamic rerouting model for air traffic flow management
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Air traffic management; Stochastic optimization; Scenario tree; Collaborative decision making; Ground holding; Rerouting; Convective weather; Integer programming; Capacity constraints; Aircraft routing; Traffic flow management; Airspace flow program
Abstract: In this paper, we present a stochastic integer programming model for managing air traffic inbound to an airport when both the airport itself and its approach routes are subject to adverse weather. In the model, ground delay decisions are static, while those on rerouting are dynamic. The decision variables in the model are aggregate number of flights planned to arrive at various capacity constrained resources. The model does not directly assign arrival times to individual flights. Therefore, in context of Collaborative Decision Making, which is the governing philosophy of the air traffic management system of the United States, the solutions from the dynamic rerouting model can be directly fed to some resource allocation algorithm that assigns routes and release times to individual flights or to the airlines who operate them. When adverse weather blocks or severely limits capacity of terminal approach routes, rerouting flights onto other approaches yields substantial benefits by alleviating high ground delays. Our experimental results indicate that making rerouting decisions dynamically results in 10-15% delay cost reduction compared to static rerouting, and about 50% less delay cost compared to a pure ground holding strategy (i.e.. no rerouting). In contrast to static rerouting, the dynamic rerouting capability results in making rerouting decisions that are better matched to realized weather conditions. Lower total expected delay cost is achieved by delaying the rerouting decisions for flights until they reach the divergence point between alternative routes, and hence exploiting updated information on weather while making those decisions. In cases where the airport is the main, but not the only, bottleneck, the dynamic rerouting model may assign higher ground delays so that the rerouting decisions can be deferred until more information on en route weather becomes available. Authors: Pan, PC; Zhou, L; Zhao, QX; Wang, MD
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Pan, P. C.; Zhou, L.; Zhao, Q. X.; Wang, M. D.
Article Title: A Study on the Reasons and Countermeasures of Shortage of Design Periods
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: design periods; shortage; reasons; countermeasures
Abstract: the so-called shortage of design periods is such a case that the designers have a very tight schedule to finish the design task. Shortage of design periods has become more and more common in Chinese construction industry, and existence of this phenomenon has some rationality to some extent. It is a crucial problem to be addressed that how to meet the owner's time requirements and at the same time the quality standards were also met. The internal and external factories determining the shortage of design period are analyzed in this paper. Such methods as partial delivery design, closed design, effective communication, etc. can be used in order to speed delivery of drawings according to the author's research. Last, the author think it is not advisable to require more designers take part in a delayed project in order to ensure the completion of drawings in time. The design institutes may find some useful things in this article.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Economic Incentive Policy in Building Energy Efficiency Market
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: building energy efficiency market; positive externality; economic incentive policy; main stakeholders; complete information dynamic game
Abstract: Lacking of Chinese economic incentive policies in the field of building energy efficiency impedes the improvement of building energy efficiency and development of building energy efficiency market. The building energy efficiency positive externality results in an unworkable building energy efficiency market. Only relying on the adjustment of market mechanism, Pareto dominance cannot be realized. Based on game theory, the complete information dynamic game model among three main stakeholders in building energy efficiency market government, developers and consumers, is established. The cost and benefit of the main stakeholders are analyzed by this model. In conclusion, the government should implement economic incentive policies to developers and consumers separately. And such policies should be strengthened in initial building energy efficiency market. Giving them direct economic subsidies to share high-cost of building energy efficiency can aroused the enthusiasm of developers and consumers. In order to effectively supervise the conduct of developers and form energy-saving market, it is essential to apply appropriate administrative penalty to non-energy saving building developers. After building energy efficiency market has gradually grown up, government interference can be reduced and market mechanism continues to regulate the market.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: Environmental Engineering and Facility Management of Berlin's Public Buildings
Source Title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES IN ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Berlin is one of the major European capitals with an extensive network of public services. To provide these services Berlin operates a number of public buildings ranging from small community centers and police stations to court buildings and police training polygons. Overall office space is approx. 20 000 m(2). In 2003 the Berlin Senate founded the Landesbetrieb fur Gebaudebewirtschaftung (LfG) as astate-owned enterprise that is responsible for all facility management activities related to state-owned real estates. In 2005 the UG started a joint research project with the Berlin Institute of Technology (TU Berlin) with the aim of introducing novel information technologies (IT) and environmental engineering applications to better support these activities. This paper presents three aspects of this research project: (i) the overall approach that we used to gather and assess requirements for environmental engineering technologies, (ii) the system architecture that includes a distributed computing environment, mobile clients, and centralized processing systems which integrate ERP applications, and (iii) a description of several environmental engineering application scenarios and how they are supported by the IT infrastructure.

Author Full Names: Tseng, H. S.; Chiou, H. W.
Article Title: Method of Project Scheduling under Fuzzy Estimation of Durations and Precedence Relationships of Activities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project scheduling; Fuzzy estimation; Lag Time of Relationship; Linear programming; Decision-making
Abstract: In general, project scheduling techniques can be classified into two main groups: deterministic and probabilistic. In reality, information or data for scheduling may not be well-defined due to the nature of the construction site. There are many uncertain factors do affect the performance of construction activities such as forecast of weather, prediction of equipment troubles, uncertain preparation of materials, and fuzziness in the procedures to be applied in the activity. Obviously, it is very difficult to interpret these factors properly and to get the data needed for scheduling into precise or probabilistic measures. Thus neither deterministic nor probabilistic technique for many construction works can be used effectively, since imposing deterministic or probabilistic approach to ill generated data or badly defined conditions may produce unrealistic result. So, the interpretation of these data is still much dependent on the uncertain knowledge and experience of the decision-maker. In this paper, fuzzy network as a method for project scheduling is developed in consideration of fuzziness associated with durations and precedence relationships of activities. To measure the possibility of the execution for a specific schedule, two types of membership functions of fuzziness are introduced. The first, time membership function, aims at measuring the possibility that the activity in question will be performed within the estimated duration. The second, precedence relationship membership function, enables the manager to predict the possibility that the lag time of precedence relationship between activities will be carried out within the estimation. Furthermore the different summarized values of those membership functions would provide the decision-maker with different alternative schedules. Finally, the fuzzy network mathematically results in an optimal model of linear programming and the process of calculation is illustrated on a small network.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Emergency Decision at the Construction Site Based on Emergency Plans
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Emergency; Emergency plans; Eermgency decision; construction site
Abstract: The emergencies occurred frequently at the construction site. How to make the right decisions to eliminate emergencies, to prevent the spread of emergencies, and to reduce casualties and property losses to the minimum after the occurrence of emergencies is a problem must be solved urgently in engineering. After the analysis of existing emergency decision research and emergency decision-making characteristics, this study proposes an emergency decision method at the construction site based on emergency plans. This method includes two stages, the first stage is emergency plans decision at the construction site, and the second stage is emergency decision-making after the emergencies. For the first stage, the study analyzes the danger identification and assessment methods at the construction site, the process and requirements of emergency plans' establishment, and the management of emergency plans. For the second stage, the study puts forth three types of decision-making ways which are direct implementation of the emergency plans, the implementation of the revised emergency plans, and developing new plans in accordance with the existing emergency plans. In this paper we also build a model of emergency decision at the construction site based on emergency plans. It is shown that the research can help decision-makers make decisions quickly and take effective emergency response.

Article Title: Research on Lengthening Legal Retirement Age to Reply Intensification of Aging Population
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY

Author Keywords: retirement age; aging populations; pension insurance funds
Abstract: The paper analyzes the contradictions between retirement system and aging population The paper puts forward the conclusion that adjusting the legal retirement age is the effective way to solve the aging population through referencing foreign experience for deal with aging population The paper brings forward some suggestions to solve aging population putting the policy that lengthening retirement age for female employee in time, lengthening retirement age step by step dealing with the relationship between retirement age and employment The paper use data calculates to dynamically simulate lengthening female employee retirement age to add value of pension insurance funds and use a large number of data to explained the effect of lengthening retirement age for aging population

Article Title: The Failure of Government Regulation of Local Coal Mine Production Safety and Optimization
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: safe coal production; failure of government regulation; game
Abstract: Frequent accidents in local coal mine have become the bottleneck during constructing harmonious society and sustainable social and economic progress. The invalidation in government regulation is the deep-seated reason of coal mine safety accidents. Based on public choice economic man hypothesis, the article explores the root causes of government failure in terms of game from the four subjects of interest such as central government, local governments, coal companies and mine workers, and puts forward advices of optimizing government regulations on China's coal mine safety production

Article Title: Day-to-day stationary link flow pattern
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART B-METHODOLOGICAL
Author Keywords: Day-to-day traffic dynamics; Stationary link flow pattern; Deterministic user equilibrium
Keywords Plus: DYNAMIC USER EQUILIBRIUM; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; NETWORK; STABILITY; GAMES; FORMULATION; INFORMATION; EXISTENCE; SYSTEMS; ROUTE
Abstract: Day-to-day traffic dynamics aim at modeling driver's day-to-day learning and behavior adjustment process and providing insight on how the traffic flow pattern evolves over time. A number of continuous-time path flow dynamics have been proposed and studied in the literature whose stationary path flow pattern coincides with user equilibrium. However, the application prospects of these findings are limited by the fact that it might be difficult for transportation management centers to measure and monitor day-to-day dynamic path flow pattern. On the other hand, thanks to the fast development of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), the day-to-day link flow pattern can be more easily monitored and analyzed. Thus, it is not only of theoretical interest but also with implement viability to explore equilibrium in the perspective of link flow dynamics. This paper carries on the study originated by [Zhang, D., Nagurney A., Wu, J., 2001. On the equivalence between stationary link flow patterns and traffic network equilibria. Transportation Research, 35B, 731-748] in investigating the relationship between a stationary link flow (SLF) pattern and traffic equilibrium, and makes significant developments on the subject in the sense that we prove that five existing route choice adjustment processes in the literature are all special cases of a so-called rational behavior adjustment process (RBAP) and thus this RBAP is mild and reasonable and can serve as a general framework of modeling driver's rational behavior. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Evaluating the Eco-community's Sustainability in a Typical Industrial-mining Town, Northeast China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Ecological community; Sustainability assessment; Objective environmental construction; Subjective residential satisfaction; Nanfen community
Abstract: To evaluate eco-community's sustainability, objective environmental construction and subjective residential satisfaction were considered simultaneously. Assessment index system including environment, socio-culture, economy and technology was established for evaluating environmental construction level of community, and then questionnaire was designed according to interview for evaluating residential satisfaction. The index system was divided into three layers: system (A), subsystems (B) and factors (C), and in total of 28 factors was selected. The Nanfen community, affiliated to Nanfen district, Benxi City, Liaoning Province, China was selected as a case study. Results indicated that the community sustainability index related to objective environmental construction was 0.4472 and was classified as class III (moderate); the community sustainability index related to the residential satisfaction was 0.4356, belonging to class III. In conclusion, the sustainability of Nanfen community was moderate and needed to be improved.

Authors: Zuo, JA; Zillante, G; Yu, ZZ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zuo Jian; Zillante, George; Yu, Zhao-Zhen
Article Title: The Power of Project Culture - A Quantitative Study
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project culture; Project performance; Construction industry
Abstract: The culture plays a key role in the management of construction projects. There are few studies on culture at the project level in the construction context; the influence of project culture has not traditionally been on the research radar. This study devotes to develop a theoretical framework to investigate the project culture in construction projects and its impacts on the project outcomes. Questionnaire survey was carried out both in Australia and China to test this framework. The results showed that there is a set of common features of appropriate project culture, which plays an important role in achieving harmonious relationships between project participants and better project outcomes. The situations in two countries are compared and discussed to help the industry practitioners to understand how to work with counterparts to develop and sustain the appropriate project culture in their projects. The objectives of this paper are: 1) to develop and test a theoretical framework to examine the culture at the project level; and 2) to examine and compare the project culture in Australia and China.

Article Title: ERP Training and Evaluation: ERP Life-Cycle Approach to End-Users' Characterization and Competency Building in the Context of an Oil & Gas Company
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: ERP; Training; Competency Building
Abstract: This paper highlights the criticality of the 'End-Users' factor to the success or failure of the ERP venture. This descriptive case highlights the ineffectiveness of the current approaches to ERP end-users' training and competency building, that are commonly applied in ERP implementations. We propose as an alternative, a new structured approach that redefines the traditional role of ERP Training from isolated implementation project activities concerned with introducing end-users to how to use ERP applications to an integral part of a comprehensive knowledge & change management strategy that advocates a holistic life-cycle approach to managing ERP Critical Success Factors (CSF). The investigation benefits from the iceberg competency model, the training management cycle, and Kirk-Patrik's evaluation model as the theoretical basis and context for drawing a comparison of the suitability and effectiveness of training approaches adopted in major ERP implementations in UAE. The proposed approach, which is built around 'end-user characterization' as the main input into 'competency building' is flexible enough to plug into standard ERP methodologies and may be projected throughout the ERP life-cycle. The end-users characterization and competency building approach (EUCCB) is expected to contribute to healthy levels of ERP usage and utilization that leads to positive business gains and return on investment.

Authors: Arman, A; El-Arif, T; Elgazzar, AL
Author Full Names: Arman, Abdallah; El-Arif, Taha; Elgazzar, Abdul-latif
Article Title: Effect of e-learning Approach on Students' Achievement in Biomedical Instrumentation Course at Palestine Polytechnic University
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-learning; Students' Achievement; pre-test; post-test; t-test
Abstract: E-learning is widely used in universities and other organizations all over the world, either to support classroom learning or on its own. The Palestine Polytechnic University (PPU) is no exception. Usually, a special kind of web-based content management system is used for running e-learning courses. These systems hold all the course content and information of the students and also provide the interactive tools to support learning process. While using such systems makes the e- learning experience much easier, it also induces some problems like the heterogeneous previous knowledge of the students. The attitude of students towards e-learning or learning content management systems is also an important factor in e-learning. There have not been any major surveys in the PPU in that regard. With newly developing multimedia technologies, incorporating simultaneous presentations of narration, images, and text, the possibilities for instruction are vast. Yet, how and when should educators use these technologies in the most effective ways to enhance learning? This is the driving question behind this research: What is the effectiveness and usefulness of using multimedia in e-learning approach in teaching the Biomedical Instrumentation course for students of Biomedical Engineering Program in the Palestine Polytechnic University? In this study, an experimental group of (14) students was examined after studying a course using e-learning approach. The instructional design approach was used. I have used the El-Gazzar Instructional Design Model (2002) since it was proved to be simple and efficient. The course was implemented using MOODLE-LMS. The students' achievement was examined before and after the experiment. The research results proved that there is a significant increase in gain in achievement. The e-learning has achieved efficiency greater than (80%) in achievement. Also, the e-learning has achieved efficiency greater than (1.2) measured with respect to Black's Gain Ratio in achievement. Also, the e-learning has achieved efficiency greater than (0.6) measured with respect to McGugian's Gain Ratio in achievement. The e-learning has achieved larger effect size (more than 0. 14) on achievement.

Authors: Arman, A; El-Arif, T; Elgazzar, AL
Author Full Names: Arman, Abdallah; El-Arif, Taha; Elgazzar, Abdul-latif
Article Title: Students' Attitudes Toward e-learning of a Biomedical Instrumentation Course in the Biomedical Engineering Program in PPU
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-learning; Features; Biomedical Instrumentation; Students' Attitudes
Abstract: The increasing availability of high-speed Internet, faster and more powerful personal computers, and wireless Internet provide learners with more opportunities to access, view, and participate in an e-learning environment. More web-based applications are being developed and deployed to meet the expanding demands of the mobile learner. Therefore,e-learning is widely used in universities and other organizations all over the world, either to support classroom learning or on its own. The Palestine Polytechnic University (PPU) is no exception. Usually, a special kind of web-based content management system is used for running e-learning courses. These systems hold all the course content and information of the students and also provide the interactive tools to support learning process. While using such systems makes the e- learning experience much easier, it also induces some problems like the heterogeneous previous knowledge of the students. The attitude of students towards e-learning is an important factor in an e-learning. There have not been any major surveys in the PPU in that regard. This article presents a survey about the usage and the attitudes toward education technology at PPU in Palestine. The survey aims at assessing the experience, skills and computer efficacy of students, measuring their attitudes towards the use of education technology and distinguishing obstacles for the development of an e-learning environment. The results indicate positive attitudes of students toward this new approach of learning. The survey is used for the development of the university e-learning strategy. providing information on how to establish systems and procedures that enable the effective use of an e-learning approach.

Article Title: HOW TO LEARN A BIPED ROBOT TO WALK
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: One of the biggest challenges in robotics is to design and build robots that mimic human behaviour very closely and are physically similar with humans Biped walking is one of the most complex movements of a human body and the main form of animal locomotion on land. It is defined as being the movement of a foot in front of the other with at least one foot on the ground at any time. The challenges of researching methods for implementing bipedal motion is the theme of this paper where we discus about general robot characteristics, components used in this research, the way they where used, the different methods researched, with their advantages and disadvantages, the control of mechanical and electronic parts, all leading to obtaining bipedal walking

Author Keywords: group corporation; financial risk; affiliate transaction
Abstract: At present, most of China's Group corporations haven't established scientific and feasible financial risk management system and many problems appeared under the impact of financial crisis. The paper starts from the introduction of research status in China and abroad. And then by the method of status analysis it expounds the problems existing in financial risk management of China's Group Corporation. After that, it further analysis the financial risk of China's Group Corporation. At last strategy for reasonable establishment of financial risk management system is put forward.

Author Full Names: Danilet, Magdalena; Fotache, Doina; Munteanu, Adrian; Dospinescu, Octavian
Article Title: Transforming Organisational Culture through the impact of Information Integration
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: organizational; culture; integration; productivity
Abstract: Over the last 2-3 decades. investments in the new information technology (NIT) have left a deep impression on the life of organisations, that goes beyond ample differences in each organisation's degree of automatisation. Furthermore, although the generalisation of NIT investment has not produced, on short and medium term, the expected effects on financial and organisational performance, its trend has remained on the increase, and the preoccupation with the development and the implementation of new technologies remains associated with the ice-breaker imagine in almost any field. Research has demonstrated that although technology is one of the most important factors that influence productivity and that, although at least in theory, all countries have equal access to technological innovation, in fact, productivity is influenced by many other factors (acquiring physical and human capital, infrastructure, the structure of the market, demographic evolutions, the degree of competition etc).

Article Title: From Industry Cluster to Technology Brokering-the Innovative Evolutionary Path of SMEs
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovative evolutionary path; industry cluster; network; technology broker; SMEs
Abstract: Small and medium enterprises (SMEs) frequently cannot make very satisfactory service because they can not implement R&D projects due to limited resources. However, when the RD costs can be divided among partners, product development becomes a more feasible concept. SMEs can participate in industry cluster to win through at the beginning, although occasional and out-of-order information exchange can bring about a little product innovation; and then based on the industry cluster, SMEs can establish network and use internet to get it. However, occasional and ordered information exchange can bring about general product innovation; finally, from SMEs network some enterprises are found good at innovation, just like conjunct product design center-technology brokering, can get any kind of innovation. Moreover, inevitable and ordered information exchange can bring about lots of product innovation. The study focuses on analysis the innovative evolutionary path of SMEs, according this path government can promote SMEs' innovation.

Article Title: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN MOTIVATION, ANXIETY, LEARNING STRATEGIES AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNING: A STUDY ON THE CADETS OF THE LAND FORCES ACADEMY OF SIBIU
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Our study examines the relationship between the linguistic level of competence of the cadets of the Land Forces Academy and variables like the general level of academic anxiety, the utilized learning strategies, the motivation for the learning of English and the anxiety caused by it. The following instruments were used Oxford Placement Test 2, Academic Anxiety Test (AAT), R. Oxford's Strategy Inventory for Language Learning (SILL) and Gardner's Attitude / Motivation Test Battery (AMTB) 121 students were included in our study The results indicate that the significant differences between the categories of English proficiency are produced by the different degree of utilization of the cognitive, metacognitive and compensatory strategies by the investigated subjects. Furthermore, we have found that the higher the level of proficiency, the higher the level of anxiety that facilitates the knowledge acquisition The proficient subjects also obtained significantly higher scores in the tests that measure the intensity of motivation and of the desire to learn English

Authors: Hamed, A; Ball, D; Berger, H; Cleary, P
Author Full Names: Hamed, Abdalla; Ball, David; Berger, Hillary; Cleary, Pat
Article Title: Can E-Commerce measure globalization?
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: Globalisation has recently become one of the terms most frequently used in politics, sociology, culture, and especially in economy. The technological basis of the modern globalisation includes the latest accomplishments of the third technological revolution: telecommunication systems, the scientific revolution, new forms of transport, the Internet and E-Commerce, because all of these technical-technological factors have facilitated unhindered communication of knowledge, people, information and capital among the countries worldwide. The question to be asked is how can a country measure its involvement in globalisation. One way is by using E-Commerce drivers and barriers. There are many issues that could count as drivers and barriers to E-Commerce and Globalisation such as cost, payment systems and legislation. By examining the E-Commerce drivers and barriers of a country which will depend upon the level of technological involvement with E-Commerce and its effect on a particular economy could result in Globalisation readiness in the country. For digital classification the level of engagement could be measured by the level of Internet involvement in the economy could measure the level of engagement. This measurement could be used to indicate the extent of globalisation in a country's economy. Globalisation is a result of removing barriers and restrictions to international trade and adopting free economic policy, which are the same drivers for E-Commerce.

Article Title: Research on Attribute Reduction Using Rough Neighborhood Model
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: rough set theory; neighborhood systems; attribute reduction; neighborhood approximation space
Abstract: Rough set theory is an efficient information processing tool used in the discovery of data dependencies. It evaluates the importance of attributes, discovers the patterns of data, reduces all redundant objects and attributes, and seeks the minimum subset of attributes. This paper presents a method for attribute reduction on combination of rough set and neighborhood systems. Neighborhood decision system is investigated by considering relation between two ways and introducing two neighborhood approximation operators. Illustrative results for some databases in UCI repository of machine learning databases provided good results.

Article Title: The Regression and Innovation of Internal Auditing-Explore and Analysis of Internal Auditing in the Post-SOA era
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: regression of internal auditing; innovation of internal auditing; SOA; risk-based internal auditing
Abstract: After the high tide of outsourcing in 1990's, the internal auditing function is returned back to enterprises in recent years. This article firstly introduces the outsourcing phenomenon of internal auditing and its causes. Then it analyzes the background of the regression of the internal auditing and points out 2 key factors influenced the regression, which include SOA and IIA's PPF. After the analysis on the key factors of regression, this article researches on the essence of internal auditing regression and makes a conclusion that regression means innovation. Then it also analyzes what innovations the internal auditing should make in the Financial Crisis today. The conclusion of the article is that based on the innovation, the regression of the internal auditing has broad prospects in the future.

Authors: Liu, YY; Huang, XK; Ding, GL; Yan, S
Author Full Names: Liu Yuyu; Huang Xiaoke; Ding Guolin; Yan Su
Article Title: Research on the Impact of Communication Openness to Organizational Commitment Based On Superior-Subordinate Relationships
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: communication openness; leader-member exchange; Guanxi; organizational commitment; moderating effects
Abstract: This research is established in Chinese settings, and by measuring a sample of 315 employees from Chinese enterprises, it attempts to examine the impacts of communication openness on organizational commitment and the mediating effects of leader-member exchange and Guanxi in this process. Also, we explored the impacts of age,education, position level on these variables. The main findings are showed as follows. Firstly, communication openness is significantly related to LMX, Guanxi and organizational commitment. Secondly, Guanxi fully mediates the relationship between communication openness and organizational commitment. Thirdly, LMX doesn't mediate the relationship between communication openness and organizational commitment directly. This research finds that personal Guanxi between supervisor and subordinate plays an important role in Chinese enterprises, and the suggestions for Chinese enterprises from the result are as follows. Chinese enterprises should build effective formal communication networks to ensure that any information can transmit without obstacle. Supervisors should be more open to subordinates,especially strengthen the initiative of communication. In addition to formal LMX, supervisors need to keep good personal Guanxi with subordinates, and spend time caring them to win subordinates' commitment, thus increase employees' organizational commitment.

Article Title: Study on the Relationship among Learning Orientation, Knowledge Creation and International New Venture's Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: learning orientation; knowledge creation; born global firm; performance
Abstract: International New Venture (INV) is a business organization that, from inception.. seeks to derive significant competitive advantage from the use of resources from and the sale of outputs to multiple countries. This study combines learning orientation and knowledge creation to develop a general model of INV's performance. The paper analyzes this model using 4 structure equation model approach, with 86 INVs in Yangtze River Delta in China selected as the samples of this study. The results indicate that learning orientation positively affects knowledge creation, and knowledge creation has significant effect on INV's performance, but learning orientation does not have direct impact on INV's performance. Furthermore, our results provide evidence that knowledge creation plays a mediating role between learning orientation and INV's performance. The results suggest that significant benefits can be achieved for M's performance by fostering knowledge creation.

Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Abstract: A sustainable and democratic society can not exist if the majority of the citizens have not a minimum level of education. The education of a child has benefits not only for his parents or for the child himself, but for the other members of the society. The education of my child contributes to your well-being by promoting a stable and democratic society. (M. Friedman). Nobody would contest that an individual that invests in his own education could bring benefits not only to his family, but to the others. However, there are a lot of other good things for the human co-operation or to a society, but it does not result that they should be produced by the state and financed by taxes and fees. Additionally, the investment in one's training/education can finally be retrieved, when the individual comes to the labor market.

Abstract: During the last years the highly scientific training have been heavily stressed in the project management field. The constant emerge of new markets and the strong development of delivery and running capacity became obvious in the internal combustion engine department - seen as an essential part in the energy and transport industry. The present paper deals with several aspects regarding the need to improve the students specialized theoretic training and skills in the internal combustion engine field. This concerns design and construction of fully equipped modem beds for engines testing and research. The paper's primary goal consists in stressing the importance of training experts - in internal combustion engine, as source of energy recovery and/or ecological combustion drive - highly skilled in research and marketing project design and management.

Abstract: In a competitive environment, information about clients is a key element for the development strategy of an institution. The paper presents the research methodology used by the Department of Economic Engineering from Herman Oberth Faculty of Engineering in Sibiu in the 2008 Faculty Applicant Survey. The study was conducted in order to find out more information about the applicants' decision-making process when selecting an area of study or a faculty of interest. The information is useful for faculties' recruiters in order to set up the recruitment strategy. The results of the study are presented in the paper Who are they and what do our candidates want? - part II.

Article Title: Empirical Study on Industrial Structure Readjustment of International Trade in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial structure readjustment; term of trade; relative output; VAR
Abstract: Based on micro-foundation model, this paper theoretically analyzes the industrial structure readjustment of international trade in China, and deduces the dynamical equation, on which VAR model is adopted to test it. The result proves that: the industrial structure readjustment of international trade has some perfect improvement mechanism on tern of trade in short term, but has threshold effect in long term; at the meantime, the readjustment impulsion shows immediate deterioration on the output. Gradualism is supported on the way of industrial structure readjustment of international trade in China.

Article Title: CSR, Externality and Profits Allocation of Supply Chain
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: corporate social responsibility(CSR); externality; profits allocation; supply chain
Abstract: This paper considers one of the hot topics in the current society-food quality and safety problem. We analyze the new features of CSR under supply chain management and then analyze its short, medium and long-term effects on the profits allocation;in supply chain management under the perspective of externality. Based on the analysis, the CSR has different effects on the profits distribution in short, medium and long-term ways. The externalities produced by CSR are not an easy way but a step-by-step process. In the short term, it has no obvious effects on manufacturers, retailers and society, the profits of the short term. can not compensate for costs. In the medium term, there are three situations which depended on the specific circumstances. While in the long term, it will improve the Pareto Optimal of society, bring about positive external effects. We can use the J Curve to manifest the relationship among short, medium and long-term. Finally, we conclude strategic choices for the supply chain under CSR.
