Article Title: Design of Supermarket Intelligent Information Management System Based on RFID and ZigBee Technology
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: RFID technology; Zigbee technology; supermarket; intelligent information management
Abstract: Aiming at scheduling problems of large supermarket, designing an intelligent information management system which combines RFID technology and Zigbee wireless sensor networks technology. This article introduces basic theory of RFID and Zigbee WSNs technology and also finishes design of intelligent information management system based on RFID and Zigbee technology. This system includes electronic tags, reader, Zigbee wireless sensor network nodes and central management computers, which archive functions of supermarket goods transportation management, storage management, products display management and selling management. System is designed with concept of modularization. It applies the principles of easy expanding and maintenance. According to applied experiment results, this system is good for solving two primal problems in supermarkets: out of stock and loss of goods, at the same times it improves shopping environment and enterprises' competitive power. Generally this system has definite application value.

Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1

Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: The Third Party Reverse Logistics; Automobile Logistics; 'Push-Pull' Mode; Strategic Partner
Abstract: As the improvement of environmental consciousness of society, the economic value of automobiles' reverse logistics comes out prominently. Strengthening the research on automobile reverse logistics plays an important role in the development of national economy and the competition of enterprises. By breaking through the third party reverse logistics (3PRL), working activities and system networks of 3PRL on automobile enterprises are analyzed here. Then the strategic advantages of 3PRL mode and a new kind of push pull operation mode are proposed. Just because 3PRL enterprises take a significant effect on the automobile's recovering, the selection standards of 3PRL Enterprises. Finally, by means of using excel software in actual example, AHP is introduced to select the cooperative partner of automobile enterprise in detail which is not only valuable for the automobile enterprises but also meaningful for other enterprises' evaluation criterion and computing technology.

Author Keywords: enterprise; core value; value-assisted management; cost-sharing rate; construction; evaluation
Abstract: By analyzing the core value system of the corporation according to the systematic viewpoints, the paper puts forward the value-assisted system which has close ties with the core value system, particularly analyses the features and the content of the value-assisted system and the positive impact which the construction of value-assisted management system of the enterprise has on the enterprise as well; further combining with the realization flow of the core value of the enterprise, the paper puts forward the steps and the methods to build the value-assisted systems on the basis of the core value system, so that the construction of the value-assisted management system can be operational and practical for the enterprise; finally establishes the evaluation model of the value-assisted management system based on cost analysis of the core value and the support value, which can help the enterprise evaluate own self logically in the process of the value-assisted management in order to reform and realize the core value of the enterprise.

Article Title: Optimal Portfolio Selection Using Tangent Utility Function
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: utility function; indifference curves; portfolio selection
Abstract: The problem of portfolio optimization involves selecting appropriate stocks for investment by maximizing the returns from the portfolio at a certain level of risk. The current approaches center around Markowitz's mean variance optimization method that suffers from several limitations like instability of beta, and are either computation extensive or lead to sub-optimal solutions. The present work puts forward a new method to solve this problem. We provide a hyperbolic tangent utility function and covert it into indifference curves. Finally, we supply an instance to find the optimal portfolio using the hyperbolic tangent utility function.

Article Title: Supply Structure Optimization from the Perspective of Supply Risk: Model and Simulation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: supply risk; total purchase cost; structure optimization; optimal supplier quantity
Abstract: Essentially, the optimization of supply structure can be perceived as how to determine the optimal supplier quantity. Accordingly, in this paper, on the basis of the quantitative analysis of the relationship between the supplier quantity and the supply risk as well as the total purchase cost, the total purchase cost is subdivided into price cost, transaction cost and risk cost, and an optimization model of supply structure from the perspective of supply risk under the principle of minimal total purchase cost is established, and how the related factors affect the optimal supplier quantity is analyzed through resolving and simulating the model, and then a method of determining the optimal supplier quantity is obtained.

Authors: Druica, E; Cornescu, V; Munteanu, I
Author Full Names: Druica, Elena; Cornescu, Viorel; Munteanu, Irena
Article Title: (1+1)-EA for Econometric Models. The Comassability of the Matrix of States
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Evolutionary Algorithm; time to get the optimum; commasability
Abstract: Many topics related to stability of equilibrium, equilibrium selection, transitional dynamics, the long-run evolutionary dynamics of economic processes or other microeconomic or macroeconomic concepts are of the most importance in economic studies and often involve a set of optimization techniques able to provide the best solution under specific conditions. One of the main issues that should be studied as an optimization algorithm is applied is the total time required for that process to get the optimum. Even in this era of the New Technologies, as computers are designed to work faster and faster, it is welcomed to know to which extent a specific function is welcomed to be optimized by using a specific algorithm, or to which extent the time required by that algorithm to get the optimum is a polynomial or an exponential one. Among the classical methods that we can use to drastically reduce the dimension of the transition matrix P of the Markov chain attached to (1+1)-EA, the comassability of the states is a very important one. For some fitness functions this comassability is possible, but for other it is not. This paper aims at making an exact description of certain unimodal functions which lead to a transition matrix P comassable in relation with a partition of the states space.

Abstract: In electronic commercial activity, to strengthen the information distributive ability of the business to the customer can increase customers' knowledge of goods and relevant information. One of the strategies for weakening the negative effect of the information asymmetry is the effective information distribution from businesses to customers. In this paper, we analyzed the theoretical foundation on which the information distribution in the electronic commerce, the thesis analyzes and summarizes all kinds of media forms and network information organizing ways in the electronic commerce' activity, and from the perspective of real-time flow analyzes the network transmission model of information distribution.

Article Title: First-line and Middle Manager IT Usage Intention: A Test of TAM
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: first-line and middle managers; usage intention; TAM; attitude; perceived usefulness; perceived ease of use
Abstract: Information system offers the potential for substantially improving enterprise performance, but enterprise performance gains are often obstructed by users' unwillingness to accept and use available systems. In this paper, whether TAM can explain the first-line and middle managers' IT usage intention is firstly tested by using the regression analysis method with the sample size of 156. The results show that attitude is the key effect factor of IT usage intention, perceived usefulness has no direct effect on the IT usage intention, attitude is the mediator between the perceived usefulness and the IT usage intention, perceived ease of use has no direct effect on the attitude, perceived usefulness is the mediator between the perceived ease of use and attitude, which is not completely followed to the TAM. The core perception variables in TAM do not predict use in this study. The paper discusses the implications of these findings and suggests directions for future research.

Article Title: A Psychometrically Sound: Multidimensional Tool to Measure Internet Privacy and Security
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Multidimensional; Scale development; Internet privacy and security
Abstract: Internet Privacy and security concerns are reported to be widely prevalent with over 80% of customers reporting these concerns in Canada and the United States. In the literature privacy and security concerns are measured using as unidimensional single question. Given that Internet privacy and security concerns are complex issues; these constructs should be examined from a multidimensional perspective. Multidimensional scale development was conducted in two phases. The first phase involved the generation of items from the Internet literature and potential web users and content validation by a panel of experts. The second phase involved the establishment of factor structure, and reliability of the developed tool through administration of a self-report potential customers' survey. A psychometrically sound tool with a five-factor structure with acceptable levels of reliability was developed. Future studies should examine the relationship between the Internet privacy and security with online shopping behavior.

Authors: Lin, M; Li, Q; Yin, H
Author Full Names: Lin Mingchi; Li Qiang; Yin Hong
Article Title: Research on Warship Maintenance Cost Forecasting Algorithm Based on Chaos Optimization LSSVM
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: LSSVM; chaos optimization algorithm; warship maintenance cost; forecasting
Abstract: Warship maintenance cost is impacted by many factors, which have complex function mechanism and result in fluctuation and instability of cost distribution. Then, the least squares support vector machine (LSSVM) model is introduced in this paper. Against the problems of parameter optimization, training and testing speed existed in LSSVM model, combining chaos optimization arithmetic, warship maintenance cost forecasting, which is based on chaos optimization LSSVM, is established. The practical emulation result shows that in warship maintenance cost forecasting, the model is more accurate, more feasible and more effective than traditional model.

Author Full Names: Paul, Vimala Balakrishnan; Yeow, H. P.
Article Title: Text Entry Factors and Texting Satisfaction: An Analysis among Malaysian Users
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Text entry factors; texting satisfaction; age; interviews
Abstract: This paper investigates the effect of respondents' age in relation to the experience of using mobile phone for sending text messages. The text entry factors considered in the study were speed, special character selections, case conversions, simplicity, learnability, menu traversals and audio feedback. One hundred and ten Malaysians aged between 17 39 years old were interviewed. Special character selections, learnability and simplicity were found to be the three most important predictors for users' taxiing satisfaction. Effects of age were significant for satisfaction towards learnability, speed and special character selections, with the younger respondents being more satisfied than the older respondents. Similarly, the younger respondents were also found to be more satisfied with their texting satisfaction than the older respondents. Results can be used by mobile phone designers and manufacturers to further improve mobile phone designs by focusing on important text entry factors. This may increase their customers' texting satisfaction.

Author Full Names: Popa, Constantin; Lazaroiu, Gheorghe; Oleg, Susan; Chisacof, Alexandru; Panaitescu, Valeriu
Article Title: THE USE OF FDS FIRE MODELLING SOFTWARE FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: fire modelling; fire curtain; backdraft; fire officers education
Abstract: The article gives for the specialists in fire safety education, two methods to use a computer software designed for fire modelling, in educational purpose, to theoretically train the fire officers that attend building fires. The two modelled situations by using Fire Dynamic Simulator computer software, are: protection of the enclosures by descending a virtual fire curtain and the implementation of backdraft, a very destructive phenomena that manifests in fire situations. The presence of the two elements together in the same structure with the intention to use the resulted information in educational purposes, is a major advantage because both are state of the art elements in CFD fire modelling but mostly because the two cases can be interdependent in fire situations, both influencing the number of casualties and the level of material damage.

Article Title: Pros and Cons of the Enterprises' Industrial Diversification: Theoretical Analysis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Enterprises' Industrial Diversification; Positive Effects; Negative Effects; Related Diversification; Unrelated Diversification; Theoretical Analysis
Abstract: The paper theoretically analyzes the pros and cons of the enterprises' industrial diversification and compares the differences between the two kinds of industrial diversification (related and unrelated diversification) at the aspects of the pros and cons above analyzed. The industrial diversification of enterprises may produce the following positive effects: dispersing the nonsystematic risk of industries; gaining the economies of scope and synthesis; saving the transaction costs; strengthening the market power; being a way of the enterprises' growing up; obtaining the information advantages and tax advantages, etc. And the negative effects produced by industrial diversification may be causing the agency problem; reducing the efficiency of operation; increasing the management costs and the difficulties in management, diffusing the resources and capabilities of the enterprise; causing the inefficiency of the internal capital market; bringing new risks, etc. There are certain differences between related diversification and unrelated diversification in the above-mentioned aspects of positive and negative effects of the enterprises' industrial diversification.

Article Title: Network Resource and Capability: Effects on Product Innovation Performance of Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: network resource; network capability; product innovation performance
Abstract: Product innovation as an important source of core competitiveness of enterprises, has been fully concerned by the theorist and industrialist. With increasing study on product innovation theory and practice, more focuses are on effect factors of innovation performance and how they affect. With the emerging and growing trends of network and network theory, we try to delineate the effects of network resource and capability on innovation performance. Accordingly this study reviews the extant relevant literatures to summarize the factors that impact on product innovation performance and analyzes the internal mechanism systematically on resource-based and capability-based view and puts forward the conceptual model and hypothesis.

Article Title: Open Notebook Science: An Exploratory Study on Motivations and Perceived Challenges
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: open notebook science; knowledge creation; biomedicine; chemistry
Keywords Plus: OPEN SOURCE SOFTWARE; COMMUNITY; ASSISTANCE; INNOVATION; PROJECTS; MODEL
Abstract: The article explores the motivations of and the challenges faced by practitioners of open notebook science (ONS) through an on-line survey and a qualitative analysis. Motivations range from voluntary participation to the need to take part in ONS. The challenges are rooted mainly in the clash of ONS with the incumbent scientific culture. The implications for science are: identification of more suitable disciplines to adopt ONS and the design of new policies and adoption of new practices to overcome cultural barriers that impede the full exploitation of ONS by scientists.

Authors: Wang, Y; Wang, G; Zhao, P; Li, H
Author Full Names: Wang, Yan; Wang, Gao; Zhao, Pin; Li, Hao
Article Title: Asymmetric Competition Analysis Based on Consumer Choice Set: Case of Chinese Automobile Industry
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Asymmetric Competition; Competitive Market Structure; Consumer Choice Set; Brand Cannibalization; Automobile Industry
Abstract: From the viewpoint of demand-side, this paper proposes a method that how to analyze the competitive market structure and asymmetric competition according to consumer choice set. According to survey data from 4,918 Chinese automobile potential buyer's choice set, this paper constructs brand switching probability matrix then analyze the completion from three levels: brand, firm and country. The result shows that asymmetric competition and cannibalization all exist on brand, firm and country levels. This paper also gives a picture of competition circumstances in Chinese automobile market.

Author Full Names: Wei Wenqing; Nian Jun; Zhou Xing
Article Title: Research on the Short-term Precision Forecasting Model for Production and Sales
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: clues; sales funnel; short-term sales forecasts
Abstract: The sales forecasting is the starting point of production and marketing activities, but the traditional sales forecasting analyzes the historical sales data and the influencing factors. With the idea of Lean-accurate Supply Chain, based on the actual of China's automobile production and sales as well as the characteristics of vehicle purchasing behavior, this paper puts out the short-term forecasting precision model for production and sales with the use of sales clues, and through analysis of the examples of Dongfeng Citroen brand in Shen Long Automobile Co., Ltd., testing the feasibility and accuracy of the methods and models, which will provide a scientific frame of reference for the decision-makers on production and marketing plan to provide.

Authors: Xu, J; Wang, YL; Li, QM; Liu, FY
Author Full Names: Xu Jia; Wang Yong-li; Li Qian-mu; Liu Feng-yu
Article Title: A stability module of path compression techniques for on-demand ad-hoc routing protocols
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: communication technology; Ad Hoc; path compression; SMPC; dynamic model
Abstract: Path compression techniques are efficient on-demand routing optimizing techniques for mobile Ad Hoc networks. But the existing path compression techniques have some shortages such as blindfold compression and unstable path. It is necessary to achieve the effective tradeoff of compression efficiency and path stability. This paper calculated the dynamic, real-time stable compression period probabilistically based on a dynamic path compression model and proposed a Stability Module of Path Compression technique (SMPC), which can restrain the blindness; of path compression efficiently and improve the stability of routes. SMPC introduces GPS based SMPC-ES and compression coverage based SMPC-MS to lessens the ephemeral short-cuts and multiple short-cuts. The simulation results show that SMPC based path compression algorithms have good performance in merits of original RREQ, end-to-end delay and delivery rate compared to AODV and PCA. It is a generic and efficient stability module of path compression technique for on-demand Ad-hoc routing protocols.

Authors: Xu, SY; Ouyang, K; Fang, D
Author Full Names: Xu, Shiyong; Ouyang, Kan; Fang, Dong
Article Title: Organizational Justice as a Mediator between Paternalistic Leadership and Organizational Retaliation Behavior
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: paternalistic leadership; organizational justice; organizational retaliatory behavior
Abstract: While paternalistic leadership is expected to have impact on employee's performance, its impact on organizational retaliatory behavior has not been explored. Based on a survey of 265 employees in four provinces in China, & present paper found that (a) authoritarian leadership had positive impact on organizational retaliation behavior whereas both benevolent leadership and moral leadership had negative impact on organizational retaliation behavior; (b) interpersonal justice fully mediated the relationship between benevolence leadership and organizational retaliatory behavior and partly mediated the relationship between authoritarian leadership and organizational retaliation behavior; (c) procedural justice fully mediated the relationship between benevolence leadership and organizational retaliation behavior and partly mediated the relationship between authoritarian leadership and organizational retaliatory behavior.

Article Title: IPO Pricing Efficiency Analysis of High-tech SMEs from Messaging Perspective
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: High-tech SMEs; IPO; pricing efficiency
Abstract: Over the years, the inefficiency of the ITO(Initial Public Offer)pricing in China has greatly affected the interests of investors and financing function of securities market. The transmission of information is the key to the efficiency of IPO pricing, this paper builds an analysis framework of the efficiency of IPO pricing from the perspective of messaging. A sample of the High-tech enterprises of SME board in Shenzhen is used to study the level of IPO pricing and the influencing factors. The research provides empirical basis for the improvement of IPO pricing of High-tech SMEs (Small and Medium Sized Enterprises).

Authors: Yan, YZ; Wang, ZS; Yuan, D
Author Full Names: Yan Yezhou; Wang Zushan; Yuan Di
Article Title: Empirical Studies on Collusion between Major Shareholders & Company Managers and Supervision Efficiency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: collusion; manager opportunism; supervision efficiency
Abstract: There are different views in theoretical studies about whether major shareholders' supervision over managers will be strengthened or weakened when major shareolders and managers collude together to infringe the interests of minority shareholders. This paper studies the issue by utilizing the data of listed companies in China from 2003 to 2005. Study shows that the opportunism conducts of managers of listed company are closely correlated with major shareholders occupation on the fund of listed company; the higher extent that major shareholders occupy listed company's funds, the severer opportunism conducts managers have, which means that collusion between major shareholders and managers will weaken major shareholders' supervision efficiency over company managers.

Authors: Yang, XC; Zhang, XH; Zuo, F
Author Full Names: Yang, Xuecheng; Zhang, Xiaohang; Zuo, Feng
Article Title: Who Talk More? The Impact of Relational Attributes on Mobile Phone Users' Communication Behavior
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Customer Relationship Management; Relational Attributes; Social Network Analysis; Communication Behavior; Telecommunication Industry
Abstract: Predicting customers' behavior precisely is a major task for Customer Relationship Management (CRM). although the current CRM analysis already considered many customer attributes such as demography information, consumption characteristics, the customers' interaction, and in particular relational attributes have not been examined deeply, even it is well known that customers are consciously or unconsciously connected to each other. This paper focuses on the impact of relational attributes on mobile phone users' communication behavior. Instead of considering the market as a set of independent entities, market in this paper's prospect is a social network in which the customers are linked with each other via mobile communication applications such as voice calling, SMS, MMS, blue-tooth, etc. The presumption in our empirical study is that customers' relational attributes can significantly affect their communication behavior (i.e. voice calling). The result of our study is fully supported this presumption, and approves that relational attributes are the powerful predictors of customers' voice calling behaviour, and furthermore, higher calling level and lower calling level users show different relationships with those network attributes.

Authors: Zeng, P; Cai, X; Ning, HL
Author Full Names: Zeng Ping; Cai Xiang; Ning Honglong
Article Title: Learning, Innovation and Dynamic Capability: An Empirical Research About South China Enterprises
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Organizational Learning; Knowledge Innovation; Dynamic Capability; Integrative Coordination Capability; Transformative Reconfiguration Capability
Keywords Plus: ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE; ABSORPTIVE-CAPACITY; MARKET ORIENTATION; FIRM; MANAGEMENT; RESOURCES; EVOLUTION
Abstract: Learning and innovation are important ways for enterprises to develop dynamic capabilities, and dynamic capabilities are a key factor for enterprise to acquire and maintain competitive advantage in dynamic environment. It studies the relationships among organizational learning, knowledge innovation and dynamic capability. The sample of this study includes 271 enterprises in South China. The result indicated that knowledge innovation has a positive direct impact on dynamic capability, but organizational learning impacts dynamic capability indirectly by knowledge innovation. That is to say, if we want to strengthen the dynamic capability and competition advantage of enterprise from organizational learning process, we need the pilot process of knowledge innovation. The main research achievements will be beneficial to Chinese enterprise to promote knowledge innovation by organizational learning, and improve the dynamic capabilities.

Article Title: Study on the Mechanism of the Formation and Evolution of Business Strategic Alliances in Technological Innovation Based on the Super-cycle Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: super-cycle; strategic alliance in technological innovation; formation; evolution
Abstract: As a new innovation model which is taking shape business strategic alliances in technological innovation can be seen as the formation of a new life. The beneficial enlightenment may be obtained from the formation and the origin of life. In this paper, the super-cycle theory is applied to study the mechanism of the forming and evolution of business strategic alliance in technological innovation. The strategic alliances' genes and replicase which control the genes' copy are looked into It is concluded that it is the super-cycle that contributes to the forming and evolution of business strategic alliances in technological innovation as it does to the origin and evolution of the life. The forming and evolutionary process of business strategic alliances in technological innovation is characterized as self-organization, self-promotion, mutual promotion and co-evolution. A theoretical basis for analysis is provided to do a good job in the management of the strategic alliances, to promote a virtuous circle of the strategic alliances and to enhance the core competitiveness of the strategic alliances.

Authors: Zhang, XC; Liu, SY; Huang, M
Author Full Names: Zhang Xinchen; Liu Shouyin; Huang Mei
Article Title: Wireless Video Access for Talent Market Multimedia Information System
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: video transcoding; wireless video transmission; video gateway; multimedia information system
Abstract: One of the most important tasks of constructing talent market information system is how to effectively solve the problems that exist in the process of applying for a job and inviting applications for a job. In order to satisfy the requirements of the useful multimedia information anytime, anywhere, the paper proposes a new service scheme, which integrated by using SMS, wireless video transcoding, wireless video transmission, multimedia database, and data mining. To handle the heterogeneous mobile devices and the smallness capability of the handheld devices, a video transcoding gateway system is introduced. To gain the high wireless video quality, an efficient video transcoding structure based on close-loop model is implemented on PCs. The main functions of this transcoding system include frame size down-scaling, frame rate conversion, bit rate adaptation, error resilient conversion, etc. Based on this, the experimental system can supply this new application in talent market multimedia information system (TMMIS).

Article Title: Study on Remanufacturing Reverse Logistics Network Model Design of Household Appliances
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: household appliances; remanufacturing reverse logistics; network model; design
Abstract: For the confusion and gaps in logistics management of waste household appliances, combining with the actual situation in our country, this paper introduces the main types and function of reverse logistics networks of waste household appliances, put forward the model focus on remanufacturing reverse logistics network and use the methods of mixed integer linear programming, so that make the entire reverse logistics network cost to be the minimum. At the same time, this paper verifies the reverse logistics network model with actual data, and ultimately makes the best program. This study will contribute to China's development of reverse logistics industry and have far-reaching significance to the sustainable development of the national economy.

Authors: Zhu, H; Wu, XH; Gu, YG
Author Full Names: Zhu, Han; Wu, Xiaohong; Gu, Yonggen
Article Title: Probabilistic Applied Pi Calculus and Zero Knowledge
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Probabilistic Applied Pi; Zero Knowledge Proof; Hamiltonian Cycle
Abstract: As Zero-Knowledge proof plays a more and more important role in modern cryptography, the need for formal analysis becomes more urgent. In this paper, we make use of formal methods to establish a Zero-Knowledge result. The formal model is Probabilistic Applied Pi and the Zero-Knowledge proof is Hamiltonian cycle. By this example, our preliminary work shows how Zero-Knowledge can be modeled in formal models such as process calculi and how to establish a Zero-Knowledge proof by checking equivalence in the model.

Article Title: The Application of WA- Delphi and DEA to the Enterprises' Operation Efficiency Evaluation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: WA-Delphi; DEA; evaluation of operation efficiency; improve path selection
Abstract: The paper applies two methods-quantitative analysis and qualitative analysis for evaluating enterprise management efficiency. And by combining the two methods; corresponding evaluation indexes are established. Finally based on the performance evaluation methods available and by adopting weighted allocation Delphi (WA-Delphi) and data envelopment analysis (DEA), a new evaluation model has been developed. Furthermore the empirical research demonstrates that this model is effective and credible.

Article Title: Integrated Platform for R&D Information Systems: A Canadian Experience
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: R&D process; Information System; Integrated platform
Abstract: The knowledge Economy is the objective that many countries around the world are targeting in their strategic planning, it is meant to enable social and economical development. For many economists, it is also the sophisticated economy that balances out the dependency on basic commodities as natural resources. Research is the key to creating a Knowledge Economy; more and more public and private money goes into funding research around the world. On the other hand, governments and industries are more and more eager to put their hands on practical research results to be applied to solve the ever growing complexity of society issues and needs. This makes Researchers and Research Administrators more accountable. Our target in this paper is to explain how we see the Research Administration Process evolving, and how the Information Technology solutions can help streamlining and standardizing this process.

Article Title: Firm Location Choice with Technological Diffusion
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: cournot duopoly model; location choice; spillovers; complementarities; subgame perfect Nash equilibrium
Abstract: This paper formulates a three-stage cournot duopoly model on a circular city to investigate firm location choice and firm R&D strategic interaction. Both firms choose locations, make R&D decisions and compete a la cournot. In the presence of spillovers and complementarities of technology innovation, this paper derives two subgame perfect Nash equilibria: a strictly dispersed equilibrium without firm R&D activities and a strictly agglomerated equilibrium with R&D activities by both firms.

Article Title: How Travel Agency Survive in e-Business World?
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Intermediation; Disintermediation; Reintermediation; Electronic Commerce; Travel Industry
Abstract: This paper provides certain degree of analysis on the benefits that leverage from the use of new technologies in the Travel Industry. Besides the concerns about what technology can do for travelers, we also address the pressures for changes, the potential impacts on different category of travel agencies and also the implications on leisure and corporate market segments. The paper also explains the three phases- intermediation, disintermediation and reintermediation that travel agencies may be facing when serving as the middleman between the product providers and the customers. In response to the electronic business impulse, travel agencies may react differently; the paper also elaborates on how the industry players reengineer their business in order to maintain the competitive position or at least to survive.

Article Title: UNESCO POLICY, STATEGIC GOALS OF EUROPEAN UNION CONCERNING EDUCATION AND NATIONAL CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT IN EDUCATIONAL PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Compared to other socio-economic sectors, educational development involves more difficult and multidimensional problems. Faced with financial constraints, governments in many countries are not able to meet the broad social demands without adopting restrictive measures within the education sector, while rationalising the use of allocated resources. In the dynamics of educational management of student flows, as well as that of public finance, they have to make difficult decisions to regulate the utilisation of resources, without leading to serious disruptions and dysfunctions. Because there are too many actors, variables and the interrelations between these, it is necessary to have not only a reliable information system but also many other technical tools to facilitate policy consultations and policy-making. The aim of this article is to resume the strategic goals of UNESCO and European Union concerning education, to asses information systems and technical tools to facilitate policy consultations and policy-making, and study the impact on Romanian Higher Education planning and management; on policy formulation and capacity development of Romanian universities Through this paper we wish to contribute to the debate on decentralization policies in education in the context of the Education for All (EFA), while seeing how they can be taken into account in the preparation and implementation of national plans of action in the case of military.

Author Full Names: Elkilani, W. S.; Abdul-Kader, H. M.
Article Title: Performance of Encryption Techniques for Real Time Video Streaming
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Multimedia Security; Video Streaming; AES
Abstract: Recently, multimedia security is becoming more important with the continuous increase of digital communications on the internet. Moreover, special and reliable security is needed in many digital applications (such as video conferencing and medical imaging systems). The classical techniques for data security are not appropriate for the current multimedia usage. As a result, we need to develop new security protocols or adapt the available security protocols to be applicable for securing the multimedia applications. In this paper, three different symmetric encryption techniques are studied namely: AES, RC4 and XOR. The performance of these algorithms was evaluated for three data types (text, audio and video). Simulations were performed to indicate the performance of the selected encryption algorithms for the different data type given. The results showed the effectiveness of the AES encryption technique in such application.

Article Title: The Evolution of the ICT Sector in Egypt-Partnership4Development
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: ICT and socioeconomic development; ICT strategy formulation; ICT transfer and deployment in developing and emerging nations
Abstract: Emerging information and communication technology (ICT) is setting the pace for a changing, competitive and dynamic global marketplace and representing an enabling platform for business and socioeconomic development in the 21(st) century. In that respect, developing nations are urged to keep pace regularly with the developments taking place in the developed world through the design and implementation of plans for universal access in terms of ICT literacy and its effective utilization for developmental purposes. It is important to note that building the ICT infrastructure will not realize quantum leaps in the development process unless it is coupled with concrete projects and activities that engage the community at large with its different stakeholders irrespective of their locations whether urban or remote, gender or background. This paper describes the evolution of the ICT sector in Egypt over the last decade as an integral element of the nation's overall development process within the context of a an emerging economy and the various growing potentials ICT offers for its socioeconomic development

Article Title: The Analysis on Industrial Independent Innovation System and Its Component Elements
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial innovation; independent innovation; innovation system; industrial independent innovation system
Abstract: Independent innovation is put forward in China, and many researches focus on how to improve it. Constructing industrial independent innovation system is important way to promote independent innovation capability. This paper analyzes the connotation of the industrial independent innovation system, and establishes the structure model of the industrial independent innovation system. And then, detailedly analyzes four elements of the industrial independent innovation system: innovative principal parts, innovative mode, innovative content and innovative environment.

Article Title: DEA Comprehensive Evaluation on Enterprise's Technology Innovation Capacity
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: enterprise; technology innovation; evaluation; DEA (Data Envelopment Analysis)
Abstract: As evaluation factors of enterprise technology innovation capacity are very complicated, evaluation methods commonly used do not consider interrelationships between every capacity element, which results in subjectivity of evaluation results. Because non-parametric methods can be used to deal with evaluation problems with many input and output, this thesis proposes DEA evaluation idea and establish DEA evaluation module. Through practical case study, optimum value analysis of sample enterprise, returns to scale analysis and projection analysis, relatively efficient enterprises are identified and adjustment proposals are put forth for inefficient enterprises. Case study shows that: DEA evaluation method is an efficient method to evaluate enterprise technology innovation capacity.

Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV

Article Title: EDUCATIONAL SPREADSHEETS FOR MASTER STUDENTS IN MANAGEMENT AND BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: At present, teaching computers for adult users, specialists in different fields of activity, is one of the most provocative pedagogical works because of the variety of the necessities and the lack of tradition in this kind of training. The paper aims at pointing on some of the most important aspects of teaching computers for the students, graduates and master students of economy faculties. A short overview of the decision making applications is presented. As part of the master course curricula, the paper presents the theoretical and practical issues of solving typical management problems by using the advanced functions of a spreadsheet software. The two examples - educational case studies with spreadsheet implementation, prove the utility of studying and applying the advanced facilities of general purpose spreadsheet programs for assisting the decision making process in business administration.

Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV

Article Title: MODERN METHODS OF STUDY AND RESEARCH IN MECHANICAL ENGINEERING APPLIED TO MEDICINE
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: This paper aims to present modem interdisciplinary study and research in engineering and medicine For this the authors have focused on assessing the quality of restorative oral treatments, which ensures the success of restoring and maintaining health system stomatognathic tissue. The goal of this paper is to review the modem methods of reverse engineering applied to dental restorations, namely scanning 3D in vitro tissue dental scanned using CAD-CAM systems of the same tissue and reconstruct 3D models as images obtained from CT. Authors makes a comparison of these methods and analysis using finite element models obtained in order to identify the behavior of these tissues. An understanding of the fundamental principles of biological, physical, mechanical, is important in learning and training of students in both fields.

Article Title: TECHNOLOGY CLUSTERS: CHINA, INDIA AND THE NEW WORLD OF ENGINEERING COLLABORATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: It is helpful to think of the engineering process according to the aspects of CDIO. However, although this formulation presumes that most engineering work is shared and collaborative it does not specify the particular features and problems associated with collaboration. These days much highly technical collaboration is done at a great distance and across disparate cultures. This phenomenon is increasingly the case with the growing influence of China and India. The rise of China and India in the global technological economy has demonstrated the effectiveness of technology clusters as highly flexible venues for innovation and entrepreneurship. flow do such clusters foster engineering collaboration in China and India? What impact will these Asian technology clusters have on engineering practice across the rest of the world? Given the power of instantaneous electronic networks to share even the most complex sets of data and to support collaboration on large, elaborate and proprietary endeavors, does the geographic location or cultural setting make any significant difference?

Author Keywords: indicator system; enterprise tacit knowledge management
Abstract: The most common problem in appraising the knowledge management of enterprises is that it is hard to figure out its value accurately. Obviously, these are very important for the enterprises but they are difficult to be figured out. There are some deficiencies in the existed appraisal methods for the knowledge management. New research contents and appraisal method are also explored in this dissertation. The key principles that have effect on enterprises tacit knowledge management are analyzed and the indicator system of knowledge management evaluation is designed.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: low-rent housing financing; low-rent housing investment trusts fund; float mode; operating process
Abstract: The low-rent housing system is used to solve the lowest-income families' accommodation in cities. As a part of housing safeguard systems, this system has played a vital role in the entire housing supply system. But the biggest difficulty it meets is the fund shortage since it has implemented from 1998. This article innovatively from the angle of floating the Low-rent Housing Investment Trust fund, transforming the traditional government direct finance to the indirect finance mainly depend on folk capital, designing the float mode and operating process, carrying out demonstration study on the repayment and risk, finding an effective and innovative financing mode of low-rent housing construction.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Abstract: The paper focused on technological innovation of the Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) in Jilin province, by using DEMATEL method, various Influence factors on technological innovation of SMEs in Jilin province are employed for quantitative analysis, the exogenous innovative feature of SMEs in Jilin province are shown, the main reason influenced on technological innovation of SMEs is the weak technological acquisitiveness caused by unsatisfactory technological environment. Article Title: Innovative Applications of Bamboo in Product Design
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: bamboo; product design; innovation
Abstract: Bamboo is a kind of material that grows the fastest. It is recyclable and degradable that meets the requirement of environment protection. Its great advantages in bending resistance, hardness and water resistance make it more popular than such materials as plastic and metal in product design nowadays. Bamboo still has some weaknesses, like uneven material properties, rough texture and modeling difficulty. However, as deeper understanding of the material properties and-the development of processing technic, these weaknesses can be avoided, and it can be used in different areas of product design according to its properties. In the situation that the resources are running out and the environment is getting worse, bamboo will surely become an important material in innovative product design.

Article Title: On Competition plus Cooperation Relationship among Enterprises within an Industrial Cluster and its Coordination
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Industrial Cluster; Inter-Enterprises; Competition plus Cooperation
Abstract: Competition and cooperation among enterprises within a cluster is a type of dynamic competition and cooperation. Enterprises' reliance on competitive advantage of the integral whole of the cluster and pressure for seeking self-development keep clustering enterprises positioned in incessant gaming of competition and cooperation to form a new relationship of competition and cooperation. This new relationship of competition and cooperation, in essence, is a model seeking coordination-cooperation gaming balance, which, through multiple repeated gaming, will finally reach Nash balance point and realize internal coordination among clustering enterprises. Coordination mechanisms on competition+cooperation among clustering enterprises include trust mechanism, reputation mechanism, intermediate organizations and governmental support.

Article Title: Research on Trusting Relationship Between Virtual Enterprises and Its Impact on Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: virtual enterprise; trusting relationship; enterprise performance
Abstract: With the development of network economy, Virtual Enterprise is becoming a trend for forms of enterprising constitution. However, the practice of Virtual Enterprise is not satisfactory, in which trusting relationship is one of the key elements impacting the operation. Therefore, it is of theoretical and practical significance to explore trusting relationship between Virtual Enterprises. Based on the definition of trusting relationship, this paper explores the generation and connotation of trusting relationship between Virtual Enterprises, and puts forward the factors of trusting relationship by literature and normative analysis. The overall model of trusting relationship between Virtual Enterprises and its impact on performance is established, which is to provide a theoretical framework for study of trusting relationship and performance in Virtual Enterprise.

Article Title: Study on the Relationship between Outsourcing and Enterprises' Innovative Capability Based on Organizational Learning
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: resource-based view; outsourcing; organizational learning; innovative capability
Abstract: Based on the Resource-Based View (RBV), this paper analyzes the strategic advantages of outsourcing and its impact on enterprises' innovative capability. Through the optimization of resource allocation, the limited resources are utilized for developing core activities and meanwhile the peripheral activities are outsourced to suppliers, thus making use of the resources of outside enterprises and form complementary advantages with the enterprise's own resources. During cooperation, the organizational learning is enhanced to strengthen the absorption and application of external knowledge and improve the efficiency of learning and absorbing knowledge. Therefore, the enterprise's innovative capability is bettered. Based on this, the theoretical model is built for the relationship between outsourcing and enterprises' innovative capability, so as to propose a relevant hypothesis, holding that outsourcing has positive effects on enterprises' innovative capability.

Article Title: Fuzzy Knowledge Base System for Fault Tracing of Marine Diesel Engine
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Diesel engine; Fuzzy knowledge base systems; Fault tracing systems
Abstract: Marine diesel engine provides the prime mover for the majority of ship propulsion systems and as such plays a fundamental role in ship operational and economy. Ship owners and operators focuses to the development of improved method of analysis, operation, fault condition diagnosis, performance monitoring, performance optimization, and recently emission analysis and control. Information technology can be used to raise the technological level of diesel engine automation and control to enable a new generation of engines with high level of safety and friendly use for the operators. Fuzzy knowledge base systems are practically suitable for these problems and will inevitably become an essential element in marine technology. The main objective of this paper is designing a prototype fuzzy knowledge base system (FKBS) to improve the capabilities of fault tracing for a ship diesel engine. Such system can be used by non-experts to improve their problem solving skills. Also it can be used as a training tool for new staff For implementing the Knowledge base system, a special software package has been proposed. This software package has been designed for building the prototype knowledge base system shell. The developed system has a friendly user interface and does not require any special programming skills to encourage all operators to use it.

Article Title: The Research of Remote Monitoring Systems of University Building Heating Network
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: University Building Heating; Configuration; Monitoring; Energy saving
Abstract: This topic is based on the remote monitoring systems of university building heating network. The universities in north are large heat consumers, and have special consumption types. In this paper, a remote monitoring system for university heating network is given by the use of configuration software ForceControl 6.0 through GPRS and PLC communications. The system can realize the monitoring and regulating of heating network. In monitoring center the scene real-time data display, historical memory, real-time trends and historical trend analysis, historical statements of the enquiry, Web site publishes, and other functions are accomplished by using the configuration software. According to the characteristics of college, by using some energy-saving measures, energy saving can be realized. The research has much economic effects and social effects.

Authors: Cao, L; Zhang, ZG; Chen, ZL
Author Full Names: Cao Lei; Zhang Zigang; Chen Zilin
Article Title: Research on Free-Riding Behavior of a Dual-channel Supply Chain in E-commerce
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: e-commerce; dual-channel; free riding; free-riding factor; channel conflict
Abstract: With the rapid development of e-commerce, many companies began to use a manufacture-retail supply chain consisting of a mix of a traditional retail channel and an electronic channel. Free riding in a dual-channel supply chain occurs when one traditional channel engages in the customer service activities necessary to sell a product, while another electronic channel benefits from those activities by making the final sale. This paper quantitatively studies the free-riding behavior of a dual-channel supply chain in E-commerce and the dual-channel models are established. Besides the electronic channel's best-response function and optimal profit, relationship between the free-riding factor and the electronic channel's profit is found. Due to the existence of free riding, the electronic channel's profit is an increasing function of the free-riding factor when the free-riding behavior has positive effect. This is mainly because the electronic channel as a free rider can benefit from the traditional channel's high level of service. This paper also studies the free-riding effects in channel conflict, and presents several response measures.

Article Title: Contribution Evaluation of Port to Urban Economic Development Based on AHP and DEA Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: AHP model; DEA model; port; urban economy; contribution evaluation
Abstract: The port is an essential condition for development of the urban industry, financial industry and other service industries, and plays a leading role in the urban modernization. This paper adopts the AHP and DEA model, takes seven port-cities such as Hong Kong, Qingdao, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Shanghai, Dalian and Tianjin as the Decision-making units (DMUs), constructs the evaluating indicator system of contribution of port to urban economic development, and establishes evaluation model of contribution of port to urban economic development to make comprehensive analysis and evaluation on it. The model is solved by matlab software.

Article Title: Conduction Mechanism Research of the World Financial Crisis Caused by Subordinated Debt
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: subordinated debt; conduction; risk; financial crisis
Abstract: In this paper, we define the risk transmission of financial crises on the bases of summarizing the risks and the financial crisis risk, then analysis the transmission paths of financial crisis risk. Furthermore, we present that the carrier is the bridge and efficient realize form of risk elements, interaction in risk transferring in the financial crises conduction chain and conduction network. In addition, the carrier has the function of bearing and conducting the risks, at the same time, it has magnifying glass effect in the financial crisis conduction chain duo to the coupling effect forming by the interaction of the risk source, the driving force and carrier. At last, we discuss how to prevent and control the world financial crisis from the perspective of financial crisis risk transmission.

Article Title: DETERMINANTS OF KNOWLEDGE AND TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER ACTIVITIES BETWEEN FIRMS AND UNIVERSITIES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to investigate mechanisms of knowledge transfer between firms and universities that involve knowledge spillovers, the extent of use of these mechanisms, and the determinants of their use. Universities have become increasingly involved in technology transfer by establishing offices of technology transfer, business incubators, and technology parks. Results point to differences between technology transfer and knowledge transfer. Our findings suggest that either investment in university research do not generate acceptable returns, or indicators used to measure returns on investments such as patents, licenses, and spin-offs do not capture a large part of the returns generated by investments in university research The future research will be focused on the organizational dimensions of university research.

Article Title: Corporate diversification discounts: Incentives Diminishing and Investment Misallocation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Internal capital markets; Incentives diminishing; Investment misallocation
Abstract: By building a model of internal capital markets, we draw conclusion that allocation resources in divisions of diversified firms depends not only on output efficiency of division but also on stimulation level of division managers. Therefore diversified firms suboptimally invest by subsidizing poor performing business segments with resources from profitable business segments, which bring resources misallocation and harm corporate value. We take a closer and more critical look at diversification discount by this theoretical research.

Authors: Harris, MSG; Chisholm, CU; Allan, M
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Harris, Margaret S. G.; Chisholm, Colin U.; Allan, Malcolm
Article Title: DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION OF ALTERNATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS FOR PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF FUTURE GRADUATES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The value of traditional on-campus learning is reviewed, analysed and discussed in relation to the recognition of evolving learning environments such as workplace learning, home-based learning, community-based learning and other such lifeplace learning environments. Detailed consideration is given to the impact of the learning environment if the learner is in a paid or unpaid work role It is reported that the main focus over the last decade has been on the operation of workplace learning where learners are in paid employment. It is concluded that both the traditional on-campus and the paid work environments deprive learners of a negotiated approach to learning and thus do not provide the base of knowledge upon which learners can arrive at their own decisions It is shown that if learners do not develop an ability to take responsibility for their decisions they make, then they fail to develop critical competence in exercising independent judgment. This competence is considered essential and core to professional development. It is further proposed that essential to the successful use of alternative learning environments, is the need for the personal and professional autonomy of the individual to be core to the learning model. Environments such as the non-aid workplace, the home and the community are considered in relation to effectiveness for the development of personal and professional autonomy We describe here, a model based on using off-campus life places combined with negotiated learning to enable informal and non-formal learning to be recognised through assessment and the award of credit where appropriate The model has at its core, development of competence in independent judgment. It is concluded that this approach to learning is the essential way forward to achieve effective learning results for the future and should be recognised alongside traditional on-campus learning

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: Kansei engineering; product design; method; NPD
Abstract: The Kansei engineering is an important method for the process of the product design, and in the field of technology, it has been applied on new product development (NPD). It is very important for a company to know how to make their products comfortable and acceptable for users. For new product development, the designer should master the method of how to design to meet the requirement of the market. The paper presented our research on the developing new product based on the Kansei engineering, from the method; it can obtain the design elements importance for the development system. For one case study, one mathematics model is built during the process of new product design, using the method, a handoperated generator chargers was created on the form design.

Article Title: Model of Distributed Innovation Determinants on Firm Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: firm performance; integrated innovation model; determinants of innovativeness
Abstract: Based on literature review, concerning distributed innovation determinants, innovativeness and firm performance, this paper, from an in-firm perspective, analyzes these factors and their relationships that could contribute to firm distributed innovation performance. At the end, the paper presents comprehensive and integrated model of distributed innovation, and gives an empirical analyses for explaining firm performance. The integrated innovation model can be regard as a guideline to create an environment in organizations for supporting and encouraging better firm performance based on improving the in-firm innovation determinants.

Article Title: An Orthogonal Method for Evaluating Security Levels, Measures and Deficiencies
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: Information security breaches take many forms including identity theft, financial fraud, laptop theft, and a variety of other attacks. Security breaches can carry destructive effects on economy and national security. Security related losses cost the US economy more than $ 60 Billion a year. Therefore, it is of utmost importance to provide security measures and implement them at various levels of the organization. Such measures are designed to protect information availability, confidentiality and integrity (ACI) of the organizational assets. In the last four decades, researchers have addressed all types of security measures and made available a variety of techniques which help organizations achieve their desired goals of security. Such measures include anti-virus programs, firewalls, encryption, coding techniques, port sniffing, reliable messaging, and many others. This paper presents a security assessment method which is designed to enable the organization or a third party auditor to evaluate the various levels of security required by the given organization, the current security measures used by the organization and the security gaps which need be taken care of.

Article Title: THE MANAGEMENT AND EXCHANGE OF KNOWLEDGE AND INNOVATION IN ENVIRONMENTS OF COLLABORATING SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED ENTERPRISES
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
