Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Quality engineering; quality management; TQM; metrology; small and medium sized enterprise SME; information technology; artificial intelligence
Abstract: The importance of small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) is today far beyond any discussion in countries all over the world - in European countries as well as in Asia and in USA, in Africa as well as in Latin America. To meet market demands in present and future global industrial world, manufacturing enterprises of any kind and any size must be flexible and agile enough to respond quickly to product demand changes. With support of artificial intelligence and modern information technology it is possible to realise modern cost-effective customer-driven design and manufacturing taking into account the importance and basic role of quality management and metrology. This will be especially possible on the basis of the innovative concept and model for modern enterprises the so-called Multi-Functions Integrated Factory - MFIF that makes possible an agile and optimal industrial production in any kind of industry and especially in up-to-date SMEs.

Article Title: THE STIMULATION OF THE SUCCESSFUL INTELLIGENCE FOR ENGINEERING EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: To teach for a successful intelligence require from the teacher to use a set of techniques that encourage the students to engage both in a learning that stimulates the reproductive thinking, and especially in an analytical, creative and practical learning. Purpose to capture the specific learning and thinking styles of students from technique academic specializations depend on the preference of the learning environment. Objectives: to identify the preferences of the students from technique specializations for certain learning situations (analytical, creative and practical); to identify the learning and dispositional thinking styles preferred by students from technique specializations. Sample. 120 students from Polytechnic University of Timisoara. The instruments used-Learning style inventory (Honey and Mumford, 1986); Rational-experiential Inventory (Pacini and Epstein, 1999); Questionnaire for identifying preferred learning situations from a successful intelligence perspective (Palos and Maricutoiu, 2008); Questionnaire for identifying preferred learning environment (Palos, 2009). Pragmatic value: designing educational materials, choosing efficient teaching methods.

Article Title: Adaptive Dynamic Scheduling in Agent Based Manufacturing Environment: A Budget Approach
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Agile Manufacturing Systems; Multi Agent Systems; Simulation; Fuzzy Logic
Abstract: The competition environment is characterized by significant market shifting, rapid development and introduction new technologies and global competition with the focus towards customer need. In order to play in such an environment, enterprises need to build reactive and agile manufacturing systems capable of adapting to the variable conditions (internal or external) of the manufacturing systems. Agent based manufacturing systems have demonstrated their ability to be very agile and reactive. The focus of this paper is on the decision-making strategies in order to keep an adequate level of system performance. This paper proposes an innovative decision making strategy for autonomous agents in a cellular manufacturing environment by a budget assigned to each part in order to purchase a manufacturing cell services. The budget manages as a market like approach among agents to coordination the multi agent system.

Article Title: How to Improve Brand Identification through Virtual Community: The Role of Participation and Perceived Usefulness
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: virtual brand identification experience; perceived usefulness; participation in community; brand identification
Abstract: The present study focuses on the paths to improve brand identification through virtual community and emphasize the role of perceived usefulness and the participation. The rational is to provide tactics for practitioners to enhance their abilities to manage the virtual brand community. Results show differential effects among these relationships. Virtual brand community experience has a significant positive effect on perceived usefulness. Perceived usefulness not only exerts direct influence on brand identification but also affects indirectly through participation in community. Managerial implications are discussed and suggestions are made for future research directions.

Article Title: Research and Design of Papermaking Industry Heat Treatment Furnace Groups Wireless Monitor System
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: wireless communication; heat treatment furance; temperature monitor and control; single chip microprocessor; nRF401
Abstract: In papermaking industry heat treatment furnace temperature monitor and control system, we usually adopt artificial style or conventional instrument technology to realize monitoring and controlling of heating furnace temperature. But due to fluctuation amplitude of furnace temperature is larger, which usually lead to poor production quality appearance. Aiming to this problem, we design a heat treatment furnace group's temperature intelligent monitor and control system based on single chip microprocessor and wireless communication technology. Each field controller connects with work central station by wireless communication chip nRF401. And work central station connects with upper PC through serial interface MAX232, which realizes heat treatment furnace groups' temperature on-tine monitor and management system design efficiently. Through papermaking industry heat treatment furnace experiment monitor, system can accurately control heat furnace according to technique requirement in real-time, temperature monitor error is less than +/- 1.5 degrees C, steady-state error absolution is less than 1 degrees C, and can realize alarming notice under setting limit temperature +/- 1 degrees C, as well as communication well with upper PC.

Article Title: Supply Chain Management and Clusters-A Case Study on Guangdong Automobile Clusters
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: supply chain management (SCM); industrial clusters; automobile clusters; cluster supply chain
Abstract: Supply chain and industrial cluster are the results of competition economy. The distinguish and relation of them were discussed in order to put forward that supply chain and industrial cluster could be introjected. This paper illustrates the clusters theory, supply chain management theory and the linkages between supply chain management and Porter's clusters theory. Clusters' characteristics enable more efficient supply chain management practices, and supply chain management improves clusters competitive advantage. Taking Guangdong automobile clusters for example, analyzing the present situation of Guangzhou automobile industrial cluster, the paper considers that the establishment of the cluster should take the improvement to fits supply chain as the base and the key factors that determine the development of Guangzhou automobile industrial supply chain and the industrial cluster are enterprise core competitiveness, maturity structure of automobile industrial supply chain, clusters and automobile industrial clusters system based on supply chain management. This is the theory base for application of the supply chain management methods in the industrial cluster construction and obtaining the competition advantage of industrial cluster based on global supply chains.

Article Title: Cue Diagnosticity and Product Evaluation: Effect of Brand Name, Store Brands Knowledge and Store Loyalty on Store Brands Perceived Quality
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: store brand; perceived quality; brand name; store brand knowledge; store loyalty
Abstract: Based on cue diagnosticity, this article classifies cues into accumulative cues and intuitive cues according to whether consumers need high level knowledge of the cues when the cues play important roles. And then develop a multi-cues model which is at different levels of accumulative cues, intuitive cues have different diagnosis. By the experimental design of 3 (brand name) x2 (store loyalty)x 2 (store brands knowledge) x 3 (price cue), this article explains why store brands use store name as store brand name, consumers with higher brand knowledge or high store loyalty all have higher store brands purchase intent. This article finds that using store name as store brand name, consumers with higher brand knowledge or high store loyalty, the level of accumulative cues is high, the intuitive cues, e. g. price or package, have high diagnosis. This article thinks the reason why those consumers with high store brands purchase intent is that those consumers achieve higher store brands perceived quality.

Abstract: In this paper, a data extraction model to support the traffic safety integrated information database is presented, which is conformed to the requirements of the public security traffic management departments. And the relative data that were stored in the diverse media and computer systems can be extracted efficiently, and transformation of different kinds of data constructions and dynamic updating of the great many extracted data can be both realized based on the proposed model. Article Title: A Dynamic Immunity-Based Real-time Network Risk Evaluation Method
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: antibody density; pathogen attack intensity; real-time; network risk evaluation; immune response
Abstract: According to the relationship between the antibody density and the pathogen attack intensity, a dynamic immunity-based real-time network risk evaluation method (DIRNR) is presented. In DIRNR, the concepts and formal definitions of self, nonself, antibody, antigen and immune detector in network risk evaluation domain are given. Then, depending on a series of immune responses to antigen, such as self evolution, self tolerance and immune detector lifecycle, the mathematical models for describing the change of network risk are established. Building upon the above models, a real-time network risk calculation model based on antibody density is presented. By using DIRNR, the types and intensity of network attacks can be calculated in real-time. In DIRNR, the concept of the antibody density in a biological immune system has been abstracted and extended, and a new method based on antibody density for network risk evaluation has been presented. The theoretical analysis and the experimental results show that the proposed method is a good solution to real-time evaluation for the network risk.

Article Title: Research on Software Requirement Analysis Based on Agile Modeling
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: requirement analysis; agile modeling; iterative; requirement changes
Abstract: This paper has a deep research on the process of the traditional software requirements analysis and proposes a method of agile modeling. Comparing with traditional modeling, the practice of agile modeling can well solve the problems that traditional requirement analysis process can't deal with such as difficult to capture the requirement and requirement change is difficult to control. In order to better address these issues, this paper build a requirement analysis model based on agile method and come to a conclusion that requirement elicitation should be client-centered, adopt iterative analysis methods and Comply with the control flow of Requirement Changes.

Authors: Zhang, WW; Zhu, LB; Yan, DS
Author Full Names: Zhang Weiwan; Zhu Linbin; Yan Dongsheng
Article Title: Legal Solution to Online Behavioral Targeting Advertising
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: behavioral targeting; online advertising; e-privacy
Abstract: Behavioral targeting(BT) technology, is an advertising method arising from the development of online advertising technology. In China, CCmedia started to provide behavioral targeting service in 2008 and pushed online advertising into a new era. The impacts of behavioral targeting will certainly affect Chinese netizens in the near future; thus, striking the balance between the suspicion of e-privacy infringement and potential of daily convenience seems to be the top priority task for China's presiding authorities. By observing this new technique, this article presents some legal concerns of behavioral targeting technique as well as the controversy between business agility and privacy protection. The existing law system in China remains scant of e-privacy, but doesn't reduce the importance of the issue. Legal problems shall never be ignored when it comes to management. This article suggests that China's presiding authorities shall initiate the legislative procedure to regulate online business and to accomplish her own legal system as possible as they can.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: SMEs; innovation; corporate social responsibility
Abstract: This paper concentrates on the relationship between innovation and corporate social responsibility (CSR) in Chinese small-to-medium enterprises (SMEs). Based on the analysis of both the nature of innovation activities and CSR related practice, the link between them is interpreted. And after having a brief review on the challenges of innovation faced by SMEs and on the evolution of CSR in China, the paper explores the implication of CSR on the innovation of Chinese SMEs, and concludes that CSR can lead to the successful innovation in SMEs.

Abstract: Within the Project 2(nd) Tech-Cycle a team of six chairs of the University of Erlangen-Nuremberg in cooperation with T-Mobile and RIM surveys the market possibility for Second-Product-Lifecycle Strategies exemplified through mobile high-tech devices. Built-on three key concepts, such as hardware transfer, knowledge transfer and generation of product- and process-innovations, the first research focuses on the knowledge transfer, as an online-survey identified the missing knowledge for key barrier for small and medium organizations from the use of the mobile high-tech devices. This work in progress paper is the first step for building up a cross-organizational communication transfer in the context of 2(nd) Product-Lifecycle-Strategies.

Abstract: With the rapid development of the logistics industry, the postal logistics services are faced with unprecedented challenges because of the fierce competition in the logistics service market. Authors: Carutasu, V; Cristea, S; Carutasu, D
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Carutasu, Vasile; Cristea, Sorin; Carutasu, Daniela
Article Title: OPTIMAL IMPLEMENTATION OF A TECHNOLOGICAL PROCESS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The sequence of operations performed within a technological process can be modelled with the help of a directed graph. It is obvious that all the operations have to be performed for the technological process to be completed and the final product to be accomplished. This condition is equivalent to determining the Hamiltonian paths from the attached graph We first have to build the adjacency or Boolean matrix attached to the graph which represents the links between operations, and then the terminal adjacency matrix or path matrix which represents a sequence of links between any two operations. This matrix helps us to analyse whether the technological process is complete or whether corrections have to be made. Moreover, in case the technological process goes through all the operations (the graph admits Hamiltonian paths) it is from the analysis of the same matrix that we can find out whether the attached graph is cyclic or acyclic and thus establish the algorithm determining the Hamiltonian paths and the sequence of operations within the technological process referred to The present article introduces a computer application for the analysis, correction and determination of Hamiltonian paths in a graph, useful for the optimization and projection of complex technological processes.

Abstract: Industrial competitiveness, which is reflected by industrial capability of independent innovation, is the core of national competitiveness. Key industries play a leading role in the entire national economy. In this paper, the frame theory of independent innovation platform of national key industries is come up with. The structure of independent innovation platform of key industries can be summarized as: a lead agency, four main parts of the platform, three levels of the platform, three contents of the platform, five support systems and four operational mechanisms.

Article Title: Study on Innovation of SME Financing Channels in Industrial Clusters
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: industrial clusters; SME; financing channels; innovation
Abstract: As a new organization form of industrial space, industrial clusters have strong competitive edge and economic vitality. SME in the industrial clusters has financing advantages compared to those outside the industrial clusters, but there still exist problems such as single financing channels, financial services of the financial institutions not matching the financing needs of the SME and the inadequate credit guarantee system. This paper studied the problem of innovation of SME financing channels in industrial clusters on the base of the theory of industrial clusters and the theory of corporate financing, the conclusion is that SME can finance through relationship financing, mutual guarantee loan, listing on the Growth Enterprise Market and issuing collection of bonds.

Abstract: The magnetic heads with LTO2 format used in data storage in server are anisotropic magnetoresistive (AMR) heads. Key parameters are optimized in the design of the LTO2 magnetic heads, such as coil design, the thickness of NiFe and SAL(CoZrMo), the ratio of NiFe/SAL Gap between shields and the ratio of Ga1/Gap2. Article Title: RESEARCH AND EDUCATION IN ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS WITH SPECIAL CONSIDERATION ON GEOMETRICAL PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS AND VERIFICATION - GPS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The prescription and consumption of material and energy to achieve the necessary and required workpiece accuracy in series manufacturing depends to a great extent from the workpiece (geometrical) tolerances of any kind (roughness, form, positional, dimensional) which are prescribed for the production and the fulfilment of these tolerances and therefore for the function of the produced workpieces and their fitness for practical application and none the less of the economy of production altogether. This requirement is of great importance at the time being which is characterized by shortage of energy and raw material. Adequate knowledge in this area is an important presupposition to achieve waste free production and low costs of manufacturing with high as possible quality and accuracy at the same time. This is of extreme importance in present time of worldwide international competition in industry and production

Authors: Dusmanescu, D; Enachescu, D; Matei, M
Author Full Names: Dusmanescu, Dorel; Enachescu, Daniela; Matei, Mirela
Article Title: Optimal investment level for increase the capacity of an transportation network
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: transport network; arc; node; flux; capacity
Abstract: In this paper we presents an algorithm for minimizing the investments for increase the capacity of a transportation network. A transportation network is a graph that simulates a real network like roads network of a country, pipes network for fluid transportation etc. In this paper we consider the case when we need to increase the transportation capacity of the network with a specified quantity from the substance transported. The problem was previously treated in [1] for the case of a simple transportation network. In real life we work with complex network, with many inputs and many outputs (i.e. transportation network for water or gas distributions etc.). When we need to increase the capacity of the network we have two solutions: increase the capacity of one or many existing arcs or installing a new arc between two nodes. This problem involves a total cost of the operations that depend on the selected solution. The aim of this work is to refine the algorithm from [1] for increasing the capacity of a transportation network with a determined value including the internal requests and restriction of the network.

Author Keywords: management; humanity assumption; organizational structure; organizational goal
Abstract: By means of documentary and deductive method, this paper analyzes the management theory development trends of the humanity assumption, organizational structure and organizational goal, then puts forward the possible relative theoretical innovation, such as network humanity assumption. It holds that with the evolution of society, the theoretical innovation of humanity assumption, organizational structure and organizational goals will continue to arise in the 20 century, and draws a conclusion that humanity assumption will evolve into knowledge human, network human and virtual human, organizational structure will evolve from the traditional rigid bureaucratic structure into a semi-flexible network structure or a flexible ecological structure, organizational goals will be developed from the goal of profit maximization into goals diversification.

Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference

Abstract: This paper explores current model and practice regarding the dynamics of financial flows along global supply networks. Based on data collected from technology and service providers that focus on such issues along global supply networks, the paper identifies and discusses requirements for improved solutions to supply chain finance challenges. This research has particular relevance in the light of the disruptions that the global credit crunch has brought to global financial systems, and the changes that are likely as responses to these disruptions.

Article Title: Research on Purchasing Supply Chain Coordination Mechanism for Multiple Suppliers with Incomplete Information
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: purchasing supply chain; incomplete information; buyer; suppliers; coordination
Abstract: The growing of market competition and increasing of social division has been enabling the dependency of modern enterprises on advanced supply chain management. In complex purchasing supply chain, the incomplete information causes a variety of contradictions during the cooperation among multiple suppliers and buyer, which holds back the development of buyer collaborative partnership, decreases the operational efficiency, and corrupts the whole benefits of the supply chain. Therefore, the importance of purchasing coordination management has become increasingly prominent. The state-of-art research on the purchasing supply chain coordination mechanism is very few. Accordingly, the paper proposes a novel purchasing supply chain coordination mechanism for multiple suppliers with incomplete information. The two game processes of the buyer with the upstream suppliers and the downstream customers are investigated. The coordination mechanism with upstream and downstream counterparts are designed and verified with numerical analysis. The proposed mechanism contributes to purchasing supply chain coordination mechanism, improves the purchasing management theory and is of great value for the enterprises.

Article Title: Factors influencing consumer intention to cope with technological products innovativeness
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation diffusion; adaptation to product changes; consumer coping strategies
Abstract: Although technological products are inescapable in contemporary life, and they harbour distinctive paradoxes reflective of wider trends in post modernity, studies focusing on then in the consumer behavior field have been few and narrow in the foreign literature reflecting the need to carry out more quantitative approaches to investigate the issue and find out its marketing implications. Previous research work on technology acceptance and adoption models have dissuaded from undertaking more quantitative analyses to examine consumer and brand characteristics influence on the decision to adapt to frequent changes related to the consumption of technological products and their relation to emotional reactions and behavioral coping strategies of consumers after technology have been acquired. This paper attempts to discuss the findings in terms of implications for theories of technology acceptance, innovation diffusion, and human coping strategies in consumer research area and is also relevant to an era where consumer co-creation of value is of increasing interest.

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge worker; stressors; stress management
Abstract: Knowledge worker as the core of enterprise technology innovation is strategic resources to maintain and enhance the competitive advantage. The stress management about them has grave implications for the staff physical and mental health and enterprise performance: This paper studied the pressure sources, established the theoretical model of stress management in view of the characteristics of knowledge worker. The aims of enterprise implementation of stress management for knowledge worker are to cause employees feel that they are real owner of businesses, and a community of interests which have common vision, common participation, common development and sharing with the enterprise.

Article Title: Research on Coupling Degree of Product R&D Alliance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product R&D alliance; coupling degree; enterprise relationship
Abstract: With the arrival of the knowledge economy age, it is inevitable for many enterprises to carry out organizational learning and look for the cooperation outside in order to exist and develop under such fast changing environment. The product R&D alliance becomes a popular way to develop products by cooperating with external organizations in the face of severe global competition. The enterprises can improve core competence and reduce environmental uncertainty through R&D alliances. Consequently, how to organize and operate product R&D alliances effectively and successfully is the key competence of enterprise to win in the future. In order to increase the success rate of product R&D alliance, based on the points of-synergistic theory and the concept of capacitive coupling and factors model of physics, the coupling degree model of product R&D alliance has been put forward. The index system of relations of product R&D alliance is also built according to the model. The status of relations of product R&D alliance is analyzed, and some quantitive suggestions have been put forward.

Authors: Hunaiti, Z; Masa'deh, R; Mansour, M; Al-Nawafleh, A
Author Full Names: Hunaiti, Ziad; Masa'deh, Ra'ed (Moh'd Taisir); Mansour, Mohammed; Al-Nawafleh, Ahmad
Article Title: Electronic Commerce Adoption Barriers in Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SMEs) in Developing Countries: The Case of Libya
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: SMEs; E-commerce; Developing Countries; Libya
Abstract: Today e-commerce has become crucial element to transform some of the world countries into an information society. However, several calls have been made to meet the association between the perceptions of e-commerce adoption barriers in developing countries. This paper focuses on the main challenges facing the growth of e-commerce in SMEs in Libya. Further, a deep investigation concerning e-commerce growth and development in Libya was carried out by discussing several issues such as: postal system suitability, banking system services, internet safety and customer's culture upon the growth of e-commerce. In order to accomplish the objectives of the study, questionnaire surveys have been distributed to forty business managers to concerning e-commerce situation in Libya. The study showed many challenges facing Libyans' e-commerce like the expensiveness of internet pricing; the unsuitability of online shopping services and Libyan postal system; and the Libyans' culture and their limited trust in the online trading systems.

Article Title: CLOUD COMPUTING: A NEW CHALLENGE FOR ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paradigm of Cloud Computing offers a growing variety of services available on the World Wide Web and represents an innovative and rapidly developing technology market space. In this paper we discuss new approaches in open education and collaborative learning facilitated by the rise of Web 2.0. Questions to be answered are connected to the relationship between the innovative educational services and the expected outcomes, the ways students approach and use information, how well do such environments currently support and promote collaborative work, at what extend they encourage creativity among users, if they offer services and features that students do not already have in campus halls and labs A critical understanding of cloud computing is essential to leverage the opportunities and benefits this new computing paradigm offers.

Author Full Names: Khelalfa, N. K.; Belhardj, Samira; Mahrouk, A.; Dendah, S.; Benabdellah, T.; Boudraa, S. E.
Article Title: Use of ICT to design a teaching tool in heat conduction field
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: ICT; e-Learning; Heat transfer by conduction; Simulation
Abstract: This work aims to achieve a teaching tool using ICT to help engineering students in their learning of heat transfer by conduction mode A numerical simulation based on the finite volume method was necessary, followed by the achievement of an interface which aims to achieve a session of practical work in heat transfer. This will allow students to be able to compare their experimental results with those obtained by simulation and/or theoretical level due to the lack of test bed and practical work equipment, which is a crucial problem in African universities.

Authors: Li, WJ; Guo, LJ; Xie, G
Author Full Names: Li Wenjian; Guo Longjian; Xie Gang
Article Title: Analysis on Synergy Development System of the Firms R&D, Marketing and Intellectual Property
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: synergy development system; model; order parameter
Abstract: This paper thinks the synergy development of firms R&D, marketing and intellectual property activity construct a self-organization system. Synergetics, grey relation and system science theory are employed to analyze the relations of system parts and to build a model to explore the evolution of the firms R&D, marketing and intellectual property synergy development system. The research result shows that there are clear linkage and interacting relations among firms R&D, marketing and intellectual property activity. Patent product revenue ration in sales revenue is order parameter which determinates the regular state of synergetic development system evolution. Therefore, organizational change facilitating intellectual property together with business strategy will help the better practices of the Total Innovation Management (TIM).

Authors: Meng, LK; Li, JY; Tao, L; Chen, ZD; Chen, DQ
Author Full Names: Meng, Lingkui; Li, Jiyuan; Tao, Liang; Chen, Zidan; Chen, Deqing
Article Title: Research on Automatic Composite of MODIS Data Based on Grid
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Grid; MODIS; composite; automation; scheduling
Abstract: Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectror adiometer (MODIS) remote sensing data is one of the new generation satellite remote sensing information sources. Composition of MODIS data is involved in a large number of complex calculations. In this paper, we present a plan of automatic composition of MODIS data based on Grid. First of all, the framework is given which is designed for automatic composite of MODIS data based on Grid. It achieves the high efficiency of automatic process through task division, task scheduling, distribute strategies and data communication mode. On the basis of business characteristics of MODIS composition, we divide the tasks and rebuild sub-tasks properly, then take different scheduling and distribute strategies to the grid tasks according to different flows and jobs. Meanwhile, we compare three communication modes, and then realize it in the efficient way. Finally, the paper gives evaluation of the grid and looks forward to the future work.

Article Title: HUMANISING ENGINEERING EDUCATION: TOWARDS PROMOTING WOMEN IN SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to assess the role and position of women in the area of science and technology in Romania, starting from engineering education and further on analysing their employability in their field of specialisation. The underlying hypothesis of this study is that the role of women in contemporary society needs to be reassessed in order to best utilise the national 'human capital' since the advancement of women is an important economic, business and societal issue with a significant impact on the growth of nations (Hausmann, Tyson, & Zahidi, 2007, p. vii). We will first present statistical data provided by the European Commission and analyse the data supplied by the survey The Contribution of Higher Education to Regional Development - Centre Region no. 7, as well as investigate the particular situation of engineering education at 1 Decembrie 1918 University of Alba Iulia

Authors: Scarlat, C; Alexe, CG; Alexe, CM
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Scarlat, Cezar; Alexe, Catalin George; Alexe, Catalina Monica
Article Title: ASSESSING THE FIRM'S INNOVATION CAPABILITY
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: Innovation; Innovation capability; Innovation capability assessment; European Innovation Scoreboard (EIS); Engineering education
Abstract: Like individuals, organisations have a certain potential of innovation and creativity The way to achieve the excellence in innovation has three main stages: analysing the current level of the innovation capability, implementing a set of measures to improve it up to the target level; assessing the final level of the innovation capability and measuring the progress made. This paper deals with the third stage. Based on the European Innovation Scoreboard Report (2008-2010) - which evaluates the macroeconomic effectiveness of the innovation systems - the authors have developed a complex set of indicators aiming at assessing the firm's innovation capability. The authors had to overcome the obstacles raised by the frequent changes of the European legislation. The work is supported by an original research on the current status of innovation in Romanian small businesses. The proposed methodology is a useful tool for both engineering & business educators and practitioners to assess the firm's innovation capability

Abstract: In this paper, the use of ecological compensation theory, and through the DPSIR model to study the ecological environment in China's rural areas the issue of innovation management, that the establishment of ecological compensation system, and promote the rural ecological environment is the management and protection of ecological environment in rural areas to address today's issue of the rational choice. Article Title: Research on the Equipment Competitiveness Procurement Pricing Model Based on Multiattribute Auction Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: equipment competitiveness procurement; multiattribute auction; optimal auction mechanism; pricing model
Abstract: Under the circumstance of army's vigorously promotion of equipment competitiveness procurement, the traditional method of equipment procurement pricing hasn't been able to meet the requirement of market economy development and equipment procurement system reformation. So it is of great significance to research the competitiveness procurement pricing method according to equipment characteristics. Based on the theory of multiattribute procurement auction, the traditional one-dimensional equipment procurement auction is evolved into the two-dimensional form. The two-dimensional attribute optimal auction mechanism model is built up and then the corresponding implementation mechanism and theory are both presented. Finally, the effectiveness of mechanism is shown by an example and the rational equipment competitiveness procurement price is fixed under the conditions at equipment procurement expected utility maximization and equipment quality optimization. Multiattribute auction theory offers a new idea of equipment competitiveness procurement pricing.

Authors: Tang, HW; Yang, ZF; Zhang, PZ; Yan, HL
Author Full Names: Tang, Hewen; Yang, Zengfang; Zhang, Pingzhen; Yan, Honglin
Article Title: Using Data Mining to Accelerate Cross-Selling
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: data mining; association rule; CRM; marketing; cross-selling
Abstract: Data mining is often used to discover hidden knowledge of large datasets, which is widely used in bussiness. Cross-setting is very important in marketing and which is the practice of suggesting related products or services to a customer who is considering buying something. Data mining can accelerate cross-selling through finding the related products or services. In this paper, we mainly propose a method of data mining in Excel with an add-in of XLMiner to accelerate cross-selling. It does not need much speciality knowledge of data mining but only some parameter setting. Additionally, almost everyone can use Excel skilled. Therefore, the proposed method, which is based on Excel, can be mastered by general selling people easily. This paper also present an example through mining association rules.

Authors: Tian, GJ; Zhang, WJ; Yang, JJ; Shen, J
Author Full Names: Tian Guanjun; Zhang Wenjuan; Yang Jianjiang; Shen Jia
Article Title: SWOT Analysis of the Development of Chinese Small E-commerce Companies-Taking ECF as an Example
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: SWOT; e-commerce; small e-commerce companies; case
Abstract: This paper analyzes SWOT model in a Chinese small business company by means of case study from three dimensions, which respectively are the internal environment, the macro environment and competitive environment. According to the analysis result, this paper analyzes those strategic influencing factors, divides and constructs four kinds of combinations, and also investigates strategic decisions of companies under each kind of combination. The results illustrate that SWOT analysis can make the small business companies more rational in introducing approriate strategic decision-making. At last, we also puts forward some solutions and suggestions based on the limitation of SWOT' anlysis.

Article Title: The Study on the Composing of Enterprise Internal Environment Based on Technological Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technological innovation; internal environment; forming mechanism
Abstract: This paper suggests that technological innovation should be studied from internal environment, which exceeds the old way only from simple internal factor. Referencing many scholars' viewpoint, the paper firstly brings forward that the enterprise internal environment is consists of entrepreneurship, enterprise material base, enterprise structure and enterprise culture, which are interrelated and interact on each other; And then the paper analyses and defines the four factors from the view of technological innovation; At last, the forming mechanism of enterprise internal environment is put forward.

Authors: Yan, H; Xin, C; Jun, L
Author Full Names: Yan, Han; Xin, Cui; Jun, Liu
Article Title: Psychological Contract and Innovative Behavior: the Moderating Role of Perceived Supervisor Support
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovative behavior; psychological contract; perceived supervisor support
Abstract: From the psychological perspective, the study develops and tests a theoretical model of employee innovative behavior. Psychological contract and employee perceived supervisor support are modeled to influence employee innovative behavior. The relational and transactional components of psychological contract are examined. Results of analyzing 116 employee-supervisor dyads show that: (1) the employee with relational but not transactional obligations relate positively to innovative behavior; (2) employee having perceived supervisor support relates positively to innovative behavior; (3) supervisor support moderates the relationship between transactional obligations and innovative behavior so that the relationship is positive when employees perceive high level of supervisor support, while the relationship turns negative when employees perceive a low level of supervisor support. Implications of the findings are discussed.

Authors: Yang, W; Chang, GR; Ying, W; Zhu, ZL
Author Full Names: Yang, Wei; Chang, Gui-ran; Ying, Wei; Zhu, Zhi-liang
Article Title: Research on Dynamic Model of File Diffusion in P2P File-Sharing Networks
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Dynamic Model of File Diffusion; P2P; Modelof SEIR; Model of IEDL; the behavior of peers
Abstract: In this paper we propose an IEDL dynamic model for analyzing file diffusion in a peer-to-peer (P2P) file-sharing network According to the principle of the P2P file diffusion system, each peer not only shares the downloaded parts of the file, but also downloads the needed parts of the file. This behavior is similar to the spreading of epidemic diseases. We apply the well-known medical model SEIR to analogy of P2P system. There exits four types of peer which are peers in the state of idles, peers in the state of exposed peers in the state of downloading and peers in the state of being a lecher. Model of IEDL is used to simulate the dynamic behavior of the P2P network. Model of IEDL is proved to have the ability to simulate the behavior of the peers in P2P. Considering the network topology structure of the P2P system is our future work needed.

Article Title: FACTORS FORMING COLLABORATION WITHIN THE KNOWLEDGE TRIANGLE OF EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: A proper combination of education, research and innovation is provided by varied cooperative networks. However, the success of collaboration within a multicultural environment requires that the key factors enabling synergy between education, research and innovation have to be considered. Aim of the following paper is to identify and to analyze these key factors within the knowledge triangle of education, research and innovation The meaning of the key concepts of education, research and innovation is studied within the search for factors forming collaboration. The results of the paper reveal the factors forming successful collaboration to become more mobile, to learn from the experiences of others and to work in a qualitative way.

Article Title: THE FUTURE EUROPEAN CO-OPERATION IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Since the 2008 Spring Council underlined the necessity to attract more adults into education and training, there has been a slow progress towards meeting the established benchmark of 12,5% participation in adult learning (achievable in 2017). The goal of this paper is the presentation of the potential education and training five European benchmarks for 2020 and the Romanian comparable results. That means the adult participation in lifelong learning, low achievers in foundation skills, language learning, investment in higher education, promoting equity and citizenship These benchmark areas are relevant in European and national education policy and, the elaboration of the National Qualification Framework is very close related to them. Starting from the table of the participation in lifelong learning trends in Member States and comparing with the results in Romania, in the paper will be done an analyse of the internal causes of the huge difference and they will be identified some solution.

Article Title: Research on the International Competitiveness of China's Culture Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: cultural industry; international competitiveness; countermeasures
Abstract: In the context of economic globalization, a country's cultural industry development has become an important part of overall national strength. The international competitiveness of China's culture industry has long been in a relatively backward state. In this paper, we try to use the gray correlation analysis method to build a comprehensive evaluation system of international competitiveness of the cultural industry, and measure and compare China and the world's major cultural industry countries. On this basis, we analyze the reasons why China's international competitiveness of culture industry lags behind in the input and output elements. Finally, suggestions are given on relevant policy recommendations.

Authors: Druica, E; Cornescu, V; David, O
Author Full Names: Druica, Elena; Cornescu, Viorel; David, Oana
Article Title: New Technologies and the Relationship between Economic Development and Environment: the Romanian Society Case
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: environment damages; new consumerism; sustainable development; new technologies
Abstract: The over consumption society is a widely discussed subject in economic literature and the specialists who have contributed in studying this phenomenon belong to various interdisciplinary fields. Analyzing the effects of the new consumerism, specialists delimitate a number of results that have been recorded once consumers' practices tend to change. As a natural consequence of the shifts in consumers' attitudes, the health of the environment is of great interest in both theory and practice. The main goal of this paper is to discuss the ecological problems that Romania's environment has faced since December 1989, when the post communist economy was born and the consequences of these problems on the economic growth in this country. The analysis aims to include aspects related to the impact of using new technologies in several fields of Romanian economy, on the pollution level and energy consumption especially in big cities.

Author Full Names: ElKordy, Manal M.; Yacout, Omneya M.
Article Title: IT Enabled CRM Process, Drivers, and Impact: Empirical Investigation in Egypt
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: CRM; Critical success factors; Process; Model
Keywords Plus: CUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT; CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS; INFORMATION
Abstract: A growing number of organizations have been developing CRM systems to maximize customer value and organizations' profitability. However the literature reports on high failure rates of such endeavors. This could be attributed to ignoring the organizational, human, and process facets of CRM. The objectives of this study are to develop a comprehensive model of CRM and to use the model to assess the current state of IT enabled CRM in Egypt. The research model is developed based on extensive review of perspective and empirical literature related to CRM process, CRM/ES CSFs, and CRM technology. This model will be tested against empirical data from a sample of medium to large Egyptian firms. The study results are expected to further the understanding of the CRM process and its underlying causes of success and failure. It will also narrow a gap that exists in the empirical studies literature regarding the Arab region, particularly Egypt.

Article Title: Study on Innovations of Beijing Daming Optical Based on Organizational Routine
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: organizational routine; Beijing daming optical; innovation
Abstract: The rising of evolutionary economics was one of the main events in the international academic circle at the end of the 20th century. Organizational routine is the core concept of evolutionary economics, and it is also the analysis unit on organization innovation. Beijing Darning Optical is a famous time-honored enterprise, occupying the leading position of glasses retail industry in Beijing market. Nowadays, the market competition is becoming increasingly fierce, and Darning Optical is facing with the enormous impact. Innovation has become the key to survival and development. This article explains the connotation and main characteristics of organizational routines. In the framework of organizational routine, this paper researches into the routines of Darning Optica, studies the external environment of innovations, makes a thorough analysis on the characteristics innovations in Darning Optical, and gives the corresponding strategies.

Article Title: REALITIES AND AIMS REGARDING THE QUALITY MANAGEMENT PROCESSES FROM TECHNICAL HIGHER EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paper presents a synthesis of the made researches in case of die priority project with title of Study regarding the higher education scientific management with technical profile, conferred to requirements of the market economy, the general objective is, to identify ways and appliance for an efficient management regarding the research and education activities in technical higher education institution, according to the national strategy directions and international tendencies The paper is structured in five parts The first part deals with a general presentation and guideline of management quality processes of higher education institutes In the second pail after the principles and aims enouncement, there are presented the hierarchy systems and the mode of structure of regulations viewing the university management and quality processes. In the third part are described the aspects regarding the Romanian universities management and the quality processes. The next part studies the evaluation of technical higher education conformity in Romania, with requirements of beneficiaries The last part of the study describes as conclusions the management and the curriculum's characteristics from analyzed European and American universities.

Article Title: Quality and Standards for E-learning: An Emerging Leitmotif
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: E-learning; quality; standards; lifelong learning; knowledge society
Abstract: For building a knowledge society, it is critically important to thoroughly understand quality and standards in e-learning. Business requirements are changing so rapidly and powerfully that is hard for teach professionals to keep up. The paper try to explore a range of topics such as: the wide difference between the promised and actual uses of e-learning in industry and academe, the struggle to implement standards, the necessity of quality instructional design models for e-learning, and the limitations of current methods for researching and evaluating e-learning.

Authors: Kablan, W; Hegazy, AF; EIZeweidy, MAT
Author Full Names: Kablan, Waleed; Hegazy, Abdel Fatah; EIZeweidy, Mohamed Aly Taha
Article Title: A Novel Approach for Stock Market Prediction Using Automated Neural Network: Egyptian Stock Market Case Study
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Neural network; Stock Market; Machine Learning Prediction
Abstract: Detecting the future value of a company stock or any financial instruments traded over market exchange is a complex task. Mostly successful prediction of this future value can leads to significant profit. However, the possibility of predicting stock market is still questionable by some theories such as the random walk hypothesis [1]. In contrast, several studies [2, 3] indicate that the market is predictable to some point. Recent studies [4, 5, 6] show that neural network is one of the most promising prediction techniques for stock market. This back to the special characteristics exist in neural network which are very suitable to stock market nature. In this paper we aim to propose a new approach for stock market prediction and provide an answer for two interesting issues. First, is the market predictable and what factors are actually affecting the accuracy of this prediction. The second issue is what is the correct neural network structure that will provide the most accurate prediction, and how this network handles the market movement over short. The neural network approach proposed during this research can automatically adjust to minimize the error rate and to improve the prediction accuracy. To test our approach we use real stock market data collected from the Egyptian stock market and we apply several testing phases.

Article Title: A Framework for Investigating the Impact of IT Infrastructure and E-Commerce Capability on Firm Performance
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: firm perfermance; IT business value; IT infrastructure; e-commerce capability; resourec-based view
Keywords Plus: SUSTAINED COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE; INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY; DYNAMIC CAPABILITIES; BUSINESS VALUE; RESOURCES; MODEL; WEB
Abstract: In recent rapidly changing competitve environment, electric commerce plays an important role on value chain. Many firms invest IT to ensure their success on e-commerce. In the strategic management field, many scholars considered that firms should have the new ability to reconfigure IT resource and create new e-commerce capability to face the new environment However, how affect the firm performance when using information technology in supporting organizational e-commerce activities is still a question. The purpose of the research is to assess the business value of e-commerce capability and IT infrastructure in the context of electronic business at the firm level. Grounded in the resource-based theory of the firm, we develop a research framework to analyse the relationship among IT infrastructure, e-commerce capability and firm performance. Within this theoretical framework, we propose several propositions and define three key constructs to facilitate the development of the theory. At last, the paper points out some research suggestions for the future study related to the e-commerce capability and business value research.

Authors: Mihail, T; Constantin, O; Daniel, G; Cristina, T
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Mihail, Titu; Constantin, Oprean; Daniel, Grecu; Cristina, Tanasescu
Article Title: STUDIES AND RESEARCH ON CUSTOMER COMPLAINT MANAGEMENT IN THE ACTIVITIES OF POST SALE SERVICES WITHIN THE KNOWLEDGE-BASED ORGANIZATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The scientific paper approaches the problem of the management of the client's complaints within the activities of services which are specific to knowledge-based organizations. Taking into account the specific nature of the activity of repairing vehicles, the care for the CUSTOMER should be the top priority within the policies of such organizations. Empathy is the key word, which should be in the way of thinking of all the company's employees, no matter if they carry their activity in a workshop, in the department of exchange component supplies or in the management area. The paper presents a complex study within a real organization and underlines the idea that all protests, the clients' complaints, have to be treated with maximum attention because they are real sources of improving the organization's activity. The study emphasizes the fact that the analysis of the evolution of protests, of the complaints within a knowledge-based organization, is carried each trimester and the entire correspondence and documentation which were the basis of the final complaint are kept as a record regarding the quality of that respective service of the product, for at least 3 years. The study is presented in the university courses on Industrial Engineering and in the MA university courses at the Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu

Author Full Names: Moga, Liliana Mihaela; Ionita, Ion; Buhociu, Florin Marian; Antohi, Valentin; Virlanuta, Florina Oana
Article Title: Introducing Technical Oriented Fast Diagrams in the Projecting of the Informatics Systems for the Management of Small and Medium Size Enterprises
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: informational system; value; technical oriented FAST diagram; informatics system; function
Abstract: If the Value Engineering is currently applied mainly for the projection/reprojection of the products, the researches made in the last twenty years allowed to elaborate new methodologies in order to extend the application area of the method to the technological processes of fabrication and to the investment objectives. This article is meant to present a new methodology, able to be applied in the projection/reprojection of the enterprises' informatics systems. The use of the Value Engineering instruments whose purpose is to project the informatics systems, which represent an essential part of the informational system, help to reconsider the managerial system's mode of action with all its subsystems so as to bring increased benefits to the enterprise. The projection methodology of the informatics systems, by using the Value Engineering concepts, completed with the Technical Oriented FAST diagrams that is proposed by this article could constitute the basis of the reconsideration of the value concept in the process of the informatics systems projection.

Article Title: IMPLEMENTATION OF HACCP SYSTEM IN THE PROCESS OF OBTAINING SMOKED COOKED SALAMI
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The HACCP is a management system used in the food industry to avoid putting in danger the safety of food during the whole technological process HACCP concept is related to ensuring food safety by physical-chemical and microbiological point of view. This paper aims to present a theoretical example for implementing HACCP system on the flow of obtaining cooked and smoked salame, in order to familiarize future specialists for food industry with the methodology of application of this system and to provide a clear vision on contribution and its benefits.

Authors: Peng, HF; Wang, CJ; Cai, J
Author Full Names: Peng Hongfeng; Wang Chunjing; Cai Jie
Article Title: An empirical investigation on the adoption of online shopping of university students in China
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: online shopping; perceived usefulness; perceived ease of use; reputation; functional and after service; Internet knowledge; perceived risk
Abstract: Structural equation model is used to analyze factors which have influence on the adoption of online shopping of university students in Mainland China. Those factors include perceived usefulness, perceived ease of use, Internet knowledge, functional service & after service of online shopping, perceived risk, reputation, and the use willingness of online shopping. As the empirical results suggest, perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use have influence on the use willingness directly and significantly. Internet knowledge and functional service & after service of online shopping affect the purchase intention indirectly through the influence on perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use, respectively. All results above are consistent with our assumptions and statistically significant However, there are still several assumptions which are not supported by the empirical results,such as the relation between Internet knowledge and perceived risk, the relation between the reputation discussed and perceived risk. Reasons are given to explain these results.

Article Title: INNOVATION, TECHNOLOGICAL CHANGE AND LABOUR SAVING IN THE AFTERMATH OF THE GLOBAL CRISIS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: innovation; technology; crisis; DTC (directed technological change)
Abstract: The correlation between the technological progress and the scarcity of labor (Habakkuk, 1962, Beaundry, 2002, Acemoglu, 2002, Alesina, Zeira, 2006) suggested a faster adoption of new technologies. The aim is to analyze the links between innovation, technological change and labor saving in a DTC (directed technological change) framework. We use a version of Acemoglu' s model (2007) to analyze the effects of supplies of factors on the changing of bias of technology with focus on the implications of labor scarcity on innovational cycle. Based on these results, we find new mechanisms capable to encourage the technological change based on innovation and new strategies for a robust recovery of the high-tech industry after the global crisis.

Article Title: Development of the electronic banking services in Romania
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: electronic banking services; security banking risks; Internet Banking
Abstract: Launching in Romania the banking products and services with long-distance access was based on image motives for the Romanian banks, domestic institutions or foreign banks branches. In this way, banks wanted 10 be innovative and they didn't address necessarily to their clients needs. Once the long-distance payment instruments diversified and once the clients became aware of the benefits of such services, the electronic banking services corroborated with the new technologies seduces the clients with their expected benefits: comfort, promptness and accessible costs. As an alternative to the classic payment system, the fees attached to the virtual access are regularly smaller than the fees of the classic services. Strong development of the Internet and mobile telecommunications is fortunately also met in Romania, so some of the industries can benefit of the major advantages offered by the new technologies. So, banking industry lunched on the market in the last years the electronic banking services as a viable alternative for classic banking services which assume the client's presence at the banking desk. In the last years, Internet became a popular distribution platform for electronic banking. Consumers of the electronic banking had easier access to their accounts in every moment. Still with this comfort, the e-banking adopting rates were very low in many countries. In Romania, of 39 banks that operate in the Romanian market, 21 offer their clients 28 long-distance payment instruments of which 14 are Internet Banking solutions, 12 are Home Banking solutions and 2 are Mobile Banking solutions. This paper aims to present the types of the electronic banking services in Romania comparative to other countries, their development in the recent years, their benefits for banks and customers, their costs and risks and their risk management.

Article Title: E-Procurement in Catalogue Based E-Marketplace by Multi Agent Approach
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: E-marketplaces; Multi Agent Systems; Production Planning; Discrete Event Simulation
Abstract: The research presented in this paper proposes an innovative agent-based approach for planning and no-negotiation approach in catalogue based e-marketplace. In e-marketplace, production planning tools allow creating a link between commercialization and production activities providing a better service for the customer and for the supplier. On the other hand, negotiation tools allow making transactions able to take into account buyer's and seller's identities and goals, providing a better global satisfaction. The paper proposed an approach based on a single round among customer and suppliers to reach an agreement. The purposes of this approach are to reduce the time to reach an agreement and to reduce the behavior information to set for the agents. A discrete event simulation environment has been developed in order to test the proposed approach. The performance of the proposed approach are compared with a negotiation approach as a benchmark. The simulation results show that the proposed approach outperforms the negotiation approach.

Article Title: On Strategic Transformation of Defense STILP
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: defense science & technology innovation (DSTI); combine military efforts with civilian support; defense discipline labs (DDL); independent innovation; national key labs(NKL)
Abstract: In new period, the aim of restructuring Defense Science & Technology system is to build the defense S&T innovation system in the mode of military-civilian integration and combine military efforts with civilian support. The article puts forward an idea that defense Science & Technology Innovation Laboratories Platform (STILP) of China should be transformed in the pattern of combine military efforts with civilian support strategically. Then it discusses the strategic significance of the transformation in defense STILP; in the following the article analyses the existing conditions of restructuring; at last, we offer the countermeasures of strategic transformation. The article provides theoretic foundation for building defense foundation research base.
