Author Full Names: Sabir, Raja Irfan; Sabir, Raja Moazzam
Article Title: Exploring the Concept of Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Economic growth; Innovation; National Innovation System; Sustainability
Abstract: One of the most important strategies that have evolved during the past two decades is to use innovation to boost and stabilize a nation's economy. Innovation has long been considered as the source of creating value for business enterprises, but recently it has been recognised that if used strategically and systematically, it can benefit a whole nation as well as the world. The concept of innovation system has become the source of success and sustainability for enterprises and industries, and has gained tremendous acknowledgement around the globe, especially in the emerging economies. Describing the importance and role of innovation in the economic growth and stability of a country, the 21(st) Century Innovation Working Group has stated that, Innovation transforms insight and technology into novel products, processes and services that create new value for stakeholders, drive economic growth and improve standards.of living([1]). And Lundvall has pointed out that, The growth of a nation depends upon its capacity to produce innovative and high-tech goods to be offered within and outside its territories([2]). Keeping in view the increasing importance of innovation, this paper attempts to describe the concept of innovation and related aspects at the enterprise and the national levels through a brief literature review.

Authors: Schmid, B; Schroth, C; Miche, M; Janner, T
Author Full Names: Schmid, Beat; Schroth, Christoph; Miche, Markus; Janner, Till
Article Title: Valuating Modular Architectures for Cross-Company Electronic Interaction
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Modular architecture framework; option value; electronic markets; information technology valuation
Abstract: The persistent improvements in the cost-performance ratio of information technology today facilitate the provision and consumption of electronic business services across corporate boundaries. However, existing technical solutions and organizational approaches are not adequate to support the efficient management of loosely coupled, highly agile business networks which incorporate heterogeneous requirements. To address this challenge, we propose a modular architecture framework for cross-company electronic interaction which covers both organizational and technical aspects. We show its applicability in the field of Swiss public administration and investigate its economic potential based on a novel architecture valuation model which is particularly adequate to capture the value of agility.

Article Title: On Evaluation System for College Hospitality Program Websites
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: evaluation system; hospitality program; website
Abstract: A benchmark study was conducted of 126 usable hospitality program websites examining content features as well as technological design features. The results were used to frame an evaluation instrument to measure the student-centeredness of college program websites. One of the practical implications of the study is a move toward the use of standardized website evaluation attributes among hospitality program website developers. Programs will be better able to gauge how effectively they are using web technology to move them toward advanced levels of student-centeredness in compliance with regional accreditation goals.

Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Slatineanu, Laurentiu; Coteata, Margareta; Chirila, Alina; Cretu, Gheorghe
Article Title: TRADITIONAL AND MODERN IN TACKLING THE TECHNICAL PROBLEMS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Tradition can be defined as a set of conceptions, habits and beliefs which are historically established within some social or national groups and which are orally transmitted from one generation to another, defining specific features for each group. The paper aims to analyze some traditional expressions and idioms and the correspondence of their significances with the actual technical or technological context and the actual development requirements. The increased exigencies concerning the insurance of the products high quality, high productivity and generally high efficiency show that new interpretations or significances could be given to some traditional expressions or even the applying of such traditional expressions could be disadvantageous in the modem context. The paper conclusions emphasize the necessity to adequate interpretation or adaptation of the traditional expressions in the actual stage of technological development.

Authors: Wu, W; Deng, Q; Yu, B
Author Full Names: Wu Weiwei; Deng Qiang; Yu Bo
Article Title: Study on the Impact of Technology Management Capability on New Product Development Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technology management capability; new product development performance; DEA
Abstract: This paper contends that technology management capability is of significance to the performance of new product development. The objective of this paper is to explore and explicate the impact of technology management capability on new product development performance, and to provide beneficial suggestions for China's enterprises to promote the performance of new product development. This paper analyzes the mechanism of technology management capability impacting on new product development performance, and establishes the evaluation model integrating effective technology management capability and effective technological capability A survey of 56 companies in China is conducted, and according to the data, the impact of technology management capability and the impact of technological capability are compared. The results show that technology management capability exerts more impacts on new product development performance than technological capability significantly. The paper culminates with a discussion of implications.

Abstract: This paper begins to interpret the connotation and character of the Ecological Technology Innovation (ETI) Then it constructs the assessment indexes and establishes a measurement model for assessing Ecological Technological Innovation Efficiency of China's Industrial Sectors based on a super-efficient DEA mode, which allows for a ranking of efficient units. On this basis, the deep reasons on the uneconomical scale for the Ecological Technological Innovation of Chinese Industrial Sectors are revealed, and the relative improvement measures are put forward. The conclusion affords a useful guidance of the decision-making for constituting the strategies of the Ecological Technological Innovation and carrying out the innovation activity.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: reverse logistics; definition; measures; flow
Abstract: The paper first introduces the recognition of reverse logistics. Reverse logistics is gaining increasing levels of attention because of environmental factors as well as economic reasons. After that the definition of reverse logistics is discussed. Then the paper focuses on some measures to reduce the reverse logistics flow, including product life cycle management, perfect information systems, improved gatekeeping technology, electronic data interchange, radio frequency identification, two-dimensional bar coding, design for reverse logistics and partial refunds.

Article Title: A Study of Enterprise Crisis Based on Business Ethics
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: crisis management; business ethics; structure variable; ethics cost
Abstract: Business ethics has always been an important issue concerned by scholars. With the development of modem business system, the enterprise crisis which caused by business ethics is getting more and more frequent. According to the two sections theory on enterprise crisis, this article unifies business ethics and enterprise crisis to construct a model for crisis management on the basis of business ethics. Two questions are discussed: finding out the agent that induced enterprise crisis from the view of business ethics; discussing how enterprise may carry on crisis management based on business ethics. Suggestions are put forward for the enterprise crisis in the light of business ethics construction.

Authors: Zhang, HJ; Yue, PX; Zhu, J
Author Full Names: Zhang Haijun; Yue Puxiu; Zhu Jie
Article Title: A Realization of Optimal Order-Picking for Irregular Multi-Layered Warehouse
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Irregular Multi-layered Warehouse; Warehouse layout diagram; Hybrid Genetic Algorithm; Order-Picking
Abstract: This paper proposed a method to realize irregular stereoscopic warehouse layout diagram and presented an algorithm to calculate the minimum distance between every two storage points. In this method, the components of the warehouse were defined as passage, shelf, storage point and node. Passage is a roadway by which the operator can access goods stored on shelf. Node is the intersection of a vertical passage and a horizontal passage. To retrieve the goods stored at storage point, the operator must pass by passage an no e. As we know, the number of nodes is much smaller than the number of storage points, so, we can simplify the computing of the shortest route between every two goods items in an order by computing and storing the shortest route between every two nodes. Based on this idea, this paper presented an algorithm to initialize the warehouse layout diagram and to find the adjacency relationship between the elements and to compute the shortest route between every two storage points. On this foundation, a hybrid genetic algorithm was given to solve the optimizing order-picking problem of irregular multi-layered warehouse. After then, an order-picking system based on C/S structure was given to guide the operator's work.

Article Title: Case of the Mobile Telecommunication Service Innovation in Madagascar
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; service; mobile telecommunication; price
Abstract: This paper analyses the rote played by innovation in mobile telecommunication market in Madagascar. Telecom sector has seen a significant acceleration from 2005 until now, namely through strong growth of basic services subscribers and network geographical expansion. This is due to a more favorable investment climate, to some key regulatory decisions and also to new innovations on tariff plan from Operators which have allowed prices to go down. The arrival in the mobile internet however did not fail to give a blow of inch to the growth of mobile market. A good health, also boosted by the arrival of a new operator in the market of the mobile: Telma Mobile, in the beginning of 2007. In Madagascar island, during the last five years, the mobile telecommunication sector is one of the major contributors in terms of revenues and infrastructure development.

Article Title: Empirical Study of the Financial Risk Management Based on Multivariate Statistical Techniques
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: listed companies; financial crisis early warning; Logistic regression model; financial index; audit opinion
Abstract: Financial crisis early warning analysis is important for enterprises, commercial banks and various investors. The aim of my study was to determine if the Logistic multi-regression model enhances the efficiency veracity of financial crisis early warning. In this thesis, the author choose 63 A stock companies, which are marked ST companies because of abnormal financial standing in Shanghai and Shenzhen in 2006, form the financial crisis sample, and choose some similar sized listed companies in same industry as matching sample, Finding index of remarkably distinct the financial crisis company and the non-financial crisis company through analyzing financial indexes of the listed companies. Taking the index of property liabilities ratio, audit opinion, finance lever ratio, gross property net profit ratio, sales revenue growth ratio and cash flux to current liability ratio as the final variants, set up the Logistic multi-regression model, conduct the case analysis of financial crisis early warning. The empirical results show that Logistic regression model help to improve the efficiency of financial crisis early warning.

Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: industrialization; solar cells; key technology
Abstract: The key technology is found before the solar cell industrialization, which technical experts will be able to evaluate the degree of difficulty to solve the key technology and clear its technical obstacles. In this paper, the bibliometric analysis is used to study the key technology problems in the process of the solar cell industrialization. First of all, the use of the word frequency analysis of the literature keywords determine new technology library in the process of the solar cell industrialization. Secondly, the co-word analysis of key words is used to build the technology network of solar cell industrialization. Finally, the centrality index of technology network is used to obtain key technologies in the process of solar cell industrialization.

Article Title: The Impact of America' SPS Measures on China's Horticultural Exports to America
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: SPS measures; horticultural products; China; America
Abstract: This paper aims to study the impact of America's application of SPS measures on China's horticultural export to America. Using the Gravity Model, the study selects the quarterly data of China's horticultural export in recent years to analyze the impact. The result shows that other variables remaining unchanged, with an influential lag length of one quarter, every 1%'s increase of SPS notification in previous quarter will result in 8%'s decrease of Chinese horticultural export to America. As an important non-tariff trade barrier, current SPS measures has a negative influence on exporting China's horticultural products to American, which deserves special attention.

Author Full Names: Liu Xiaoxia; Cai Gangyi; Cui Jingwei
Article Title: Research on Scheduling of Dual-Resource Constrained Job Shop
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: job shop scheduling; dual resources; hybrid genetic algorithm
Abstract: In this paper, a dual-resource constrained job shop scheduling problem was studied by designing a scheduling method based on Genetic Algorithm (GA) and Simulated Annealing (SA). The combination of GA and SA has higher degree of convergence precision by utilizing GA excellent global search ability and SA efficient to avoid getting into part minimum. The operation-based encoding and an active schedule decoding method were employed, and several kinds of crossover operations were adopted in order to promote solution diversity. This hybrid genetic algorithm reasonably assigns the resources of machines and workers to jobs and achieves optimum on some performance. Compared with the solutions suggested by other researchers, the developed algorithm can search better solution on make-span and mean flow time, and can receive higher machine utilization and worker utilization. In conclusion, the algorithm proposed in this paper is available and efficient.

Article Title: Evolutionary paths of R&D Internationalization: The Case of Taiwanese Transnational Corporations
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Developing country; Path; R&D internationalization; Technology strategy
Keywords Plus: FOREIGN DIRECT-INVESTMENT; HOME COUNTRY ADVANTAGES; MULTINATIONAL-ENTERPRISES; DEVELOPMENT ABROAD; JAPANESE FIRMS; TECHNOLOGY; LOCATION; MANAGEMENT; DETERMINANTS; ORGANIZATION
Abstract: Based on data from 75 of the top 1000 Taiwanese manufacturers, we examine how these films establish their overseas R&D centers and connect with global innovation networks over time by conducting both data searching and in-depth interviews. We categorize four paths of internationalizing R&D for Taiwanese firms and explore three types of technology strategies through in-depth interviews with top management. The three technology strategies are 'technology driven strategy', 'cost driven strategy', and 'keeping flexible strategy'. By comparing three financial indexes, we find that firms adopting a keeping flexible strategy gained the highest average performance, and those firms focusing on cost performed the worst. The results provide valuable insights to the top management of firms in developing countries.

Article Title: Study on Method of Fault Diagnose for New Roller Overrunning Clutch
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: clutch; frequency; fault diagnose
Abstract: Fault diagnose of the roller overrunning clutch is a headache problem in engineering at home and abroad. This paper introduces a new method to solve the problem by using the wavelet transform to separate fault signal and further analyzing the impact frequency. The signal local singularities under the wavelet transform are studied. According to the propagation features of modulus maximums of the fault signal and the noise under the wavelet transform different on the scales, and by use of the signal wavelet decomposition reconstruction algorithm, the clutch shell vibration acceleration signal is decomposed, denoised, and reconstructed. The signal-to-noise of the monitored signal improved greatly. The fault characteristic signal on time domain is positioned. The fault characteristic frequency is picked up. Experiment shows that it is quite effective.

Article Title: Research of Evaluation Model on Enterprise's Green Degree of GrSCM
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: green supply chain management (GrSCM); green degree; fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; research; model
Abstract: With the rapid development of manufacturing, it has brought about numerous material welfare to human society as well as many problems of resources and environment. Under the background of trying for the harmonious development of economics and environment, Green Supply Chain Management (GrSCM) emerged as the time required, which was considered as a mode of sustainable development of the enterprises. Firstly, the necessity and significance of the implementation of GrSCM in the Chinese enterprises are expatiated. On the basis of GSCM theory,the enterprise' green degree evaluation index system on GrSCM is designed. Besides, the evaluation model is structured by ABF-Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method. In the end, a case study is given which demonstrates that the above-mentioned evaluation index system and the evaluation model is doable.

Article Title: Mobile Technologies in Tourism Destination Marketing
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: M-commerce; Wireless Technology; SMEs
Abstract: This paper forms part of a larger PhD study (work in progress) at the University of Wales Institute, Cardiff (UWIC). The purpose of the larger study is to investigate the potential of mobile technologies for small, medium and large-sized tourism enterprises (SMEs), destination development and marketing, through a consideration of issues relating to the exploitation of new technologies by small tourism businesses. To achieve this aim, an initial framework for mobile information technology provision for the tourism sector was proposed, which is based on the literature review. The initial outcomes from this framework identify that the implementation of a system for tow-ism mobile marketing using mobile commerce in any destination would comprise three key aspects: destination level leadership/coordination; participation of small, medium and large-sized tourism enterprises; third party technology solutions.

Article Title: A NEW UNIVERSITY COURSE IN ROMANIA - KNOWLEDGE BASED ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Transition to the knowledge based economy or the new economy is the main revolutionary mutation of last decades. Unfortunately in the universities in general and - in Romanian universities in special - there is not enough preoccupation on this topic. In our paper we present the objectives, topics, methods and other major elements regarding the new university course recently implemented in Economic University of Bucharest (ASE) at MBA level. We emphasise the necessity and the multiples roles and functions of the course, in a contextual approach, taking into consideration the national and international evolutions, especially the Lisbon Strategy

Article Title: EVOLUTIONARY DESIGNS IN ELEARNING VIRTUAL ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: With its hopeful benefits, eLearning has now enjoyed prevailing adoption not only in higher education but also in corporate training. eLearning has grown from its infancy of merely being a way to access online learning text material into a mature, dynamic, and personalized learning experience provided through powerful and blended tools This paper is not intended to be a forecast of the future of eLearning, nor did an intensive review of all newly design eLearning tools and functions offered by widely used eLearning platforms However, this study aims to create a conceptual guideline for future design and development of eLearning tools and methodologies based on some early indications. Moreover, some widely used eLearning platforms are selected by the authors in order to compare their tools and functions

Article Title: E-Consumer Redress Mechanism for Negligence in Malaysia: A Survey Analysis
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Negligence; liability; e-consumer; ISP; redress
Abstract: The law of contract cannot provide any remedies as parties concerned in most cases had no contractual relationship. A negligence tort is simply an accident that occurs when someone fails to pay attention and therefore, harms another person or thing. This research paper analyses the availability and the applicability of the negligence through survey. The issues like manufacturer's and service provider's liability and the difficulty of proving their liability will be analysed using the data collected through the survey. The finding shows that law of negligence in Malaysia has undergone very little development. The position of the e-consumers in Malaysia seems not satisfactory on the account of the fact that any contract term or notice purporting to exclude or restrict liability for the death and personal injury resulting from negligence may be effective and enforceable.

Article Title: Construction of Innovation-oriented Small & Medium Business
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Core competitiveness; Innovation; Innovation-oriented enterprise; Small & Medium Business; China
Abstract: Facing with the deteriorating environment for the survival and the fierce market competitiveness, the SMB (Small & Medium Business) must rely on the core competitiveness in order to survival and develop. Therefore, the SMB has entered the times of the core competitiveness, and its survival and development only rely on the core competitiveness. It is discussed that the innovation is the source of the core competitiveness of enterprises. It is pointed out that the innovation-oriented SMB has an innovative gene and establishes the innovative system, innovate all-round and continuously by everyone, and has rich achievements of the innovation. In a word, the significant feature of innovation-oriented SMB is innovation. Therefore, building innovation-oriented SMIB is an effective way to improve the core competitiveness of Chinese SMB. Meanwhile, it is put forward that we should note some issues in the process of the innovation-oriented SMB construction, such as: establish the innovation-oriented culture of the business, strengthen the management of innovation, and give some advices to establish innovation-oriented SMB.

Article Title: Regional Difference of Attracting Employment Capacity under the Frame of Industrial Structure in China-A Positive Research Based on SSA Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: human resource; employment; regional difference; shift-share analysis (SSA) model; industrial structure
Abstract: Based on the employment data during a seven year period from 2001 to 2007 in 31 provinces, autonomous regions, and metropolis in China, a research method is given by the aid of SSA (Shift-Share Analysis) Model. This paper compares the capability of creating job position in six Chinese regions (Northern China, Northeastern China, Eastern China, Central South China, Southwestern China, Northwestern China) and analyzes the potential reasons causing the difference. The result shows that under the frame of industrial structure, the effect of industrial structure and regional factors on employment and accession rate is quite different. Three different strategies are presented for improving industrial structure and increasing employment rate.

Article Title: The Route Choice of Trade Liberalization
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: free trade; welfare; bilateral free trade agreement
Abstract: Tariff can prevent oversea companies from entering domestic market so as to protect domestic companies and enhance social welfares, While the cancelling of tariff between countries can improve production and enhance social welfare further. However because of extrution effect, countries out of the free trade agreement will suffer social welfare lose from the free trade agreement between other countries. At this time, it is hard for countries out of the agreement to enter the agreemnt. To achieve trade liberalization, countries out of agreement can come to bilateral free trade agreement with countries within the agreement seperately.

Article Title: The Research of Multiple Sensors of Data Fusion Arithmetic and Realization of DSP
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: multiple sensors; data fusion; DSP
Abstract: Data fusion is a new concept; it is a method for acquiring information. Data fusion has different forms in different fields. Two kinds of arithmetic of data fusion are introduced, which are weighted fusion method and gray-scale modulation method. The principle is to have pictures fused together after adjustments based on bow much information each picture has in order to have more detail information reflected visually. Gray-scale modulation is an effective image fusion method which is proved useful in fusing visible light and infrared and it is yet to be proved in fusing multi-frequency infrared images. Based on DSP6701 hardware frame and software flow, finally the pictures of final trial proves this arithmetic can obtain satisfactory result.

Article Title: An Empirical Study on the Interactive Development between Producer Services and Manufacturing Industry in China
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: producer services; manufacturing industry; interactive development; cointegration test; granger causality tests
Abstract: Producer services gradually become the dominant force of the increasing economy and play a very important role in the development of manufacturing industry. Interactive development between producer services and manufacturing industry in China has been empirically analyzed based on the relative data of them collected from 1990 to 2007. The results show that there is a long-term balanced relationship between producer services and manufacturing industry in China. From the internal structure of producer services, transportation, storage, post and telecommunications, scientific research and polytechnic services are positively related to manufacturing industry, but, finance and insurance is negatively related. Policy recommendation for improving interactive development of producer services and manufacturing industry in China has been described.

Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: Chinese automobile; marketing competence; appraisal indices; AHP
Abstract: The marketing competence is an important symbol of the corporate core competences. Based on the development situation of the Chinese automobile marketing this paper analyzed the actual state of the Chinese automobile marketing competence,and determined the Chinese automobile marketing competence with four primary indices, which were marketing concept, marketing strategy, marketing organization, and marketing performance and 16 secondary indices pertained to the peculiarity of the automobile industry and automobile marketing. Utilizing AHP, this paper put forward the appraisal indices and appraised the marketing competence in combination with an actual example.

Author Full Names: Zeng Zhongping; Chen Tao; Zhang Yi
Article Title: E-Government information security in the web environment based on Role Based Access Control technology
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: E-government; information security; role based access control
Abstract: Information communication technology (ICT) has penetrated the government sector due to their increased functionality, low cost, high reliability and easy-to-use nature. However, in such E-government applications the privacy and security of the transmitted information must be preserved. Also different civil servant involved in the government must have different access privileges to the government information. Today, with the development of E-government projects, more and more government information is stored in government website, office automation system based on the database technology. Meanwhile, E-government projects are engaging in aggregating numerous types of information by interacting with Web services technology. It is necessary to utilize access control technology to improve E-government security. In this paper, we present a framework of role based access control model on the base of E-government construction situation analysis. The framework will provide helpful advice and information for E-government information security plan.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Integrated Business Process Management; efficiency; innovation; cooperation
Abstract: Studies of the relationship between Business Process Management and organizational performance have not consisted to each other yet. In this paper, the Integrated Business Process Management model is introduced, and it has been proved that the IBPM can positively impact organization outcomes through three ways: (1) the IBPM can enhance the level of organizational efficiency and innovation simultaneously; (2) the IBPM can positively impact intra and inter-organizational cooperation; (3) the IBPM contributes to organizational outcomes through improving effectiveness, adaptability, individual satisfaction, and financial performance.

Article Title: Brand Equity Increment of Chinese Time-honored Enterprises: A Case Analysis of Combination of Innovation and Nostalgia
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; nostalgia; brand equity; time-honored brand; Wanglaoji case
Abstract: Brand revitalization is urgent and necessary at present because most Chinese time-honored brands declined and even stagnated, and brand equities drained ceaselessly. This research focuses on the strategy of time-honored brand equity increment based on theory of innovation and consumer nostalgia using the method of case research. The case reveals Wanglaoji realize the increment of brand equity by brand repositioning, channel innovation, communication method on the basis of inheriting unique brand culture and history by nostalgia. The case implies time-honored enterprises may choose and decide specific elements of innovation and nostalgia according to market and its condition, and strive to retain history and start innovation.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: high-tech enterprises; corporate social capital; human capital; performance
Abstract: This study took high-tech enterprises in Shaanxi Province as samples, and made a comprehensive and systematic analysis about the relationship between corporate social capital and performance. In addition, it introduced corporate human capital and ultimately came to the conclusion as follows: First, corporate social capital played a positive role in promoting performance. Second, corporate social capital and human capital are two key factors impacting the performance, however, in certain economic conditions, the impact of corporate social capital on performance will be greater than human capital.

Article Title: Secure E-Voting Scheme through Polling Stations
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: E-Voting; E-Token; E-Government; PKI; Hashing; Blind Signature
Abstract: Over the last few years, computer networks have been widely spreading, as they became part of our daily lives. The rapid development of Internet infrastructure showed up a variety of activities that can be done over the Internet saving the two most important factors in life, time and money. Also, one of today's most shining research areas is migrating election to the online platform. The term 'Online' now has it's own glance, and adapting the life to the online way is where people are looking to go. Recent election problems such as the increasing number of voters, vote buying, double voting, the joke of dead people voting and time taken for results, have sparked a great interest in computerizing the election process by developing electronic voting systems to face these problems. In this paper, the proposed scheme uses modern cryptographic techniques to maintain the electronic vulnerabilities that can threaten the fairness of the election, and gain the trust of government, candidates, and citizens. In the proposed scheme, digital signature, mutual authentication, hashing, PKI, and blind signature are used to maintain authentication, privacy, accuracy, non-duplication, verifiability, vote buying/selling prevention, mobility, robustness, and completeness.

Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: In this paper the author has tried to exhibit that the copyright protection of computer programmes which has though reached to the maturity stage but many question are yet to be answered. Thus a general overview of copyright protects followed by examination of the infringing act of copying with regards to computer programmes, the technological protection measures used to access control,examining situations after Digital Millennium Copyright Act and the EU Directive The legal backing for the technical measures, concludes that the technological measures used to access control mechanism may be appropriate answer in the light of piracy menace but whether it is on the cost of doctrine of fair use or rights of user, if so then precautions have to be taken to balance the both rights.

Article Title: Enterprise search solutions: the new edge for information systems
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Enterprise Search engines; information systems; Enterprise Social Search
Abstract: Search Engines are a gateway for information contained on the Web but also in the Enterprise. Members of organizations need to perform various types of searches just to get their routine work done: looking up addresses and references in a directory, finding a specific data or an image for a presentation etc. Search tools have become essential for an organization in order to exploit information stored. However, the solutions are very heterogeneous and vary from the simple open source application to search tool included in the infrastructure. This article aims at analysing the landscape of the search engine business solutions market in terms of structure, actors, products, and segmentation. We try to analyse how the dynamics of the market are evolving, how the solutions in relation to the strategy of the sellers are modified and what are the trends emerging.

Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paper presents the results of a scientific research conducted over a period exceeding 3 years, having the following objectives analysis of efficiency, effectiveness and importance of communication in training engineers at the H. Oberth Engineering Faculty, L Blaga University of Sibiu. Using 3 tests and 4 questionnaires there were collected information from students. The results after processing the collected data clearly show that after attending the Business Communication course students have acquire theoretical and practical-applicative knowledge, of great importance to their career, allowing them to capitalize on their professional knowledge through the transmission of clear, accurate and consistent messages (verbal, nonverbal and written). Business communication is useful for searching, exercising, or keeping a job, and facilitates hierarchical promotion This is why the business communication discipline should be included not only the curricula of all engineering faculties but also in those of other faculties.

Authors: Malkawi, M; Khasawneh, M; Al-Jarrah, O; Barakat, L
Author Full Names: Malkawi, Mohammad; Khasawneh, Mohammed; Al-Jarrah, Omar; Barakat, Laith
Article Title: Modeling and Simulation of a Robust e-Voting System
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-voting; modeling and simulation; performance evaluation
Abstract: In this paper we present a simulation model for a multifaceted online e-Voting system. The proposed model is capable of handling electronic ballots with multiple scopes at the same time, e.g., presidential, municipal, and parliamentary, amongst others. The model caters for integrity of an election process in terms of the functional and non-functional requirements. The functional requirements embedded in the design of the proposed system warrant well-secured identification and authentication processes for the voter through the use of combined simple biometrics. Of utmost importance are the requirements for correctness, robustness, coherence, consistency, and security. To verify the robustness and reliability of the proposed system, intensive computer simulations were run under varying voting environments, viz, voter density, voter inter-arrival times, introduced acts of malice, etc. Results of the simulations show the impact of several parameters on the performance of the system. These results provide the proper grounds that would guide the decision maker in customizing an e-voting system.

Article Title: STUDY OF DYNAMIC SYSTEMS USING VIRTUAL INSTRUMENTATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Programs created in LabVIEW environment, called virtual instruments, offers multiple possibilities for building user interfaces or HMI that can be used for many applications including dynamic systems analysis. In this paper we present a virtual instrument used in the process of studying the dynamics of systems through modelling and simulation. Based on the functional structure of D.C. motor and the laws of physics and electricity under which this motor works is build the mathematical model for it. Using the mathematical model, build it in Matlab environment and included in virtual instrument like a Matlab script, in a series of simulation experiments in LabVIEW, it can notice the behaviour of the motor dynamics like angular displacement, velocity and acceleration. Same virtual instrument, through a data system acquisition, allow compare, on the front panel, the results obtained by simulation with actual measured values of these quantities.

Article Title: Web Based Application for SMEs Economic and Financial Diagnose
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Financial diagnose; Web application; Expert systems; Intelligent systems in Economy; Economic and financial analysis
Abstract: Effectiveness, efficiency and profitability are examples of major aspects that must be highly considered by any Small and Medium-sized Enterprise (SME) interested in obtaining better economic results. Therefore, in order to achieve better fulfillment of SMEs economic and financial objectives, using a computerized instrument for performing the economic and financial diagnose of its activity is a high priority. The specialized market offers quite a diversity of information technologies that can be used in order to design such an instrument as that depicted above. Among those, we decided to combine the web technologies with expert systems and spreadsheets. This paper is a continuation of a former idea where we stated as a future direction the implementation of such a tool, in the web environment, making it available worldwide to those interested in performing a computerized financial diagnose. Also, we have made several improvements regarding the methods used to fulfill the economic and financial diagnose. One of the papers' major aims is to illustrate a manner of computerizing the field of economic and financial diagnoses for the case of a Romanian small and medium-sized enterprise. Thus, we will conduct the current study by implementing into a real application the theory (from the specialized literature) and expertise (collected from experts) related to the field of financial diagnose and apply, for exemplification purposes, the financial ratios that are used in the process of a financial diagnose. In author's opinion, the innovative feature of this system is its development by combining three technologies: web, spreadsheet and expert systems and also the methods used for performing the economic and financial diagnose. Thus, the computer based model is accessed throughout a webpage (hosted on an Apache virtual server), is developed using Exsys Corvid and obtains variable's values from a spreadsheet files. The web application can be accessed at the following address: http://feaa-c-24.feaa.uaic.r0/diagnose/index.html.

Article Title: THE EFFECT OF KNOWLEDGE ECONOMY ON ORGANIZATIONAL ENVIRONMENTS: Do the Governance Mechanisms Differ According to Institutional and Technical Environments?
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: governance mechanisms; institutional environment; technical environment; knowledge; ICTs
Keywords Plus: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY; TRANSACTION COST; NETWORKS; FIRM
Abstract: Technological developments result in important changes for organizations and their environment. The most remarkable change in the organizational field is the widespread usage of Internet, a new information and communication technology (ICT). The changes depending on Internet, affect organizational structures, since they are designed compatible to the communication needs dependent on the technology. In some cases, however, the communication technologies can be developed in consistence with the organizational structure. This indicates that, when ICTs are taken into consideration, it occurs that there is no clear distinction between technical and institutional organizational environments. The ICTs dependent on Internet is both a legitimacy source for the organizations and an efficiency tool. Accordingly, in this study it is considered that the technical and institutional environments are interpenetrated and different types of governance mechanisms result due to the varying effects of the environmental pressures. Testable propositions are developed for different types of environments.

Abstract: The casted benchmarks as rotors of aviation turbocompressors are made using special methods of precise casting, such as for example massive monolithic ceramic forms with ethyl silicate - namely patent / license Shaw. in the current industrial practices, production companies in this field use permanent metallic models, difficult to execute and at high-costs, for complex parts such as those mentioned and at a small production capacity or unique parts (prototypes). The paper presents the research made in achieving the model armature by stereo lithography techniques (CAD applications = Computer Aided Design) and technological solutions projected by IT & C data procession means (CAE = Computer Aided Engineering).

Article Title: Principle of Partition of Fixed Asset Investment Based on Multi-player Cooperative Games
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: fixed asset; cost and investment partition; government and non-government funds; multi-player cooperative model
Abstract: The importance of non-government funds' engagement in fixed asset investment is illuminated in this paper, and the defects of classical methodologies of cost and investment partition for fixed asset investment among funds of various nature is elucidated. On analyzing the nature of partition, a model based on multi-player cooperative game is promoted for the solution, and further suggestions have been donated on specific application of the proposed approach.

Authors: Wang, YX; Xi, XY; Wang, ZH
Author Full Names: Wang Yunxia; Xi Xiaoyan; Wang Zhihong
Article Title: Meta-analysis of Risk Factors of Stroke among the Youth in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: China; youth; stroke; risk factors; Meta Analysis
Abstract: This study applied Meta- analysis to make a comprehensive quantitative analysis about the results of risk factors of stroke incidence among the youth in China. Software RevMan4.2 was used to make a heterogeneity test and calculate the pooled OR and 95% confidence interval. The results showed that the pooled OR-values of the relationship between hypertension, hyperlipidemia, smoking and stroke incidence were respectively 6.10 (4.11 similar to 9.05), 5.55 (3.26 similar to 9.44) and 2.39 (1.79 similar to 3.20), and the combined results were stable; OR-values of drinking and obesity were 2.03 (0.84 similar to 1.36) and 1.53 (1.02 similar to 2.30), but the combined results were not stable. The limited evidence suggested that hypertension, hyperlipidemia, smoking were risk factors of stroke in the young people in China.

Article Title: Research on Reverse Logistics Repurchase Pricing Mechanism of Waste Battery
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: waste battery; reverse logistics; repurchase pricing; government intervention; recovery rate; closed-loop supply chain
Abstract: As a great country of battery producing, China also consumes a large quantity of batteries as well. However, the recovery rate of waste battery in China is far lower than that in developed countries. It's not only polluting our environment and doing harm to our health to discard so many used batteries at will, but also wasting so many precious resources. Firstly, this paper introduces the situation of waste battery both at home and abroad, and its harm to the environment and human beings. Then the purpose and the significance of the waste battery's reverse logistics are illustrated. Finally, the mathematical model is established to analyze quantitatively how to enhance the management of reserve logistics by using repurchase pricing mechanisms.

Abstract: With the development of the national economy and society, expressways constructed in 1980s and 1990s are faced with the expansion question. This paper proposes four expressway expansion modes; combines the AHP method with grey evaluation method to establish selection model of expressway expansion mode based on analysis of advantages and disadvantages of various expansion modes and validates the effectiveness and maneuverability of the Grey model through application in the Shanghai-Nanjing expressway expansion project.

Article Title: Quantum-Inspired Immune Evolutionary Algorithm
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: evolutionary algorithm; quantum-inspired immune evolutionary algorithm; clone; knapsack problem; Application
Abstract: The quantum-inspired evolutionary algorithm (QEA) is a probabilistic algorithm based on the quantum computing, which combines some principles such as concepts of qubits and superposition of states. QEAs can improve the traditional evolutionary algorithm effectively. However, they are easy to be trapped into the local deceptive peak, and the operations in QEA lack the capability of meeting an actual situation, so that some torpidity often appears when solving problems. In this paper, a new improved quantum-inspired immune evolutionary algorithm (QIEA) is proposed to overcome the shortcoming of the conventional QEAs. The new QIEA combines the main mechanisms of immune theory and every individual of each chromosome will make its own dynamic clone to build its new sub-swarm; then every new chromosome will be mutation in its low bit; at last, the QIEA will update the whole swarm by using random strategy. Experiments on the knapsack problem are compared with other evolutionary algorithms. The result indicates that the performance of new algorithm is superior to the others.

Article Title: Multiplier-Accelerator Effect of Brand Extension
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: brand extension; brand association; spillover effect; multiplier-accelerator model
Abstract: Today, Brand Extension has become the first choice of marketing strategy for the majority of companies. The association between the parent brand and the sub-brand is the basis of the brand extension. The spillover effect of the brand extension drives and accelerates the brand extension. On the basis of the previous achievements, this paper applies the nonlinear system dynamics to the brand extension, brings forth the multiplier-accelerator effect of the brand extension, considers the brand association as the multiplier effect. And it considers the spillover effect of the brand extension as the accelerator effect, constrcuts the multiplier-accelerator model of the brand extension, calculates its equilibrium and analyzes the stability of the model.

Article Title: An Empirical Study of City's Innovation Capability Based on the Establishment of an Evaluation Index System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: city innovation capability; evaluation index system; principal component analysis
Abstract: A city usually serves as the main carrier of a country's innovation capability. The paper designs a six-dimensional evaluation index system, which includes innovation capability in knowledge, technology, industry,management, service and environment. An empirical study is conducted by using principal component analysis to study the innovation capacity of six major cities in China. Results show that Beijing enjoys the highest level of overall innovation capability followed by Shanghai, Tianjin, Wuhan and Chongqing respectively.

Article Title: Consumer Segmentation and Marketing Strategies in the Financial-Banking Branch of the New Economy
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: globalization; management; marketing; banking system
Abstract: Globalization keeps influencing the financial market. Because of the easier ways to access information, the consumers' features given by their affiliation to a certain category based on nationality, age, education and income are no longer valid. Consumers start to create their own values according to their own needs and aspirations and they become even more different than the other people around them. Thus the issue of consumer segmentation according to different criteria and the need to adjust marketing strategies according to each new category appear. Considering that globalization cannot alter the basic human psychological features, consumer segmentation according to the psychological profile is an alternative.

Article Title: BRINGING THE EDGE OF COMPETITIVENESS INTO ENGINEERING DESIGN EDUCATION: THE UTC-N EXPERIENCE
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Modem technical products have to fulfil complex sets of requirements. They have to meet higher and higher technical performance standards, satisfying in the same time cost-effective objectives and tight environmental issues. In this context, a paradigm shift occurs in engineering design Engineering design education has to reflect this orientation into university curricula, too. Thus, the challenge for university educators is to formulate and implement reliable methods that make students feeling the value added of approaching engineering design from the competitiveness perspective. The experience of the Technical University of Cluj-Napoca (UTC-N) in bringing competitive engineering design in the study programs of several specializations is revealed in this paper The UTC-N educational methodology in competitive engineering design under the scheme of semester projects is also introduced. A case study highlights the UTC-N methodology. The paper ends with some discussions around this experience, as it is seen from the students' perspective.

Article Title: Digestion-Based Software Formal Transformation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: software requirement; formal transformation; software reliability
Abstract: Software reliability is becoming increasingly important in today's information era. Many techniques have been proposed to improve software reliability with varying degrees of success. One important technique in this regard is the so-called formal methods which include formal verification, formal specification, formal analysis, and formal modeling. While these formal methods cover many phases of the software development process, the transformation of software requirement into formal representation is still done by manual labor, which we believe to be a weak link. This paper presents a digestion-based software formal transformation model that eliminates the weak link existing in today's software formal method approach, and automatically transform natural language-based requirement into formal representation.

Article Title: Total Innovation Management Competence: A Case Study of Fotile
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: total innovation management; total innovation management competence; independent innovation; small and medium-sized private firm
Abstract: It is vital for firms to develop total innovation management in order to survive and thrive in ever increasing competitive market. This paper examines the total innovation management competence by theoretical research and in-depth,case analysis in a Chinese private firm Fotile, so as to establish theory frame of total innovation management competence. Our findings and results show that this firm has four key aspects of total innovation management competence (strategy management competence, culture innovation management competence, technology innovation management competence, and market innovation management competence). It has practical meaning for building independent innovation of Chinese small medium-sized private firms and constructing total innovation management competence. This paper also proposes the direction of further research.

Article Title: An Analysis on Financial Effect of Accounting Methods for Business Combination
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: business combination; pooling of interest method; purchase method
Abstract: This paper, based on reviewing the relevant documents, studies the financial effects of purchase method and pooling of interest method via analyzing and comparing the two methods with correlated cases. It comes to the conclusion that the reason for the disparate financial effects lies in the inconsistent valuation basis for assets and liabilities. Aiming at the special financing and regulatory environment in our nation, this paper points out that it's crucial to handle the restrictions on the employment of pooling of interest method and to consider the recognition criteria of purchasers in using purchase method. Finally the paper puts forward a prospect for the new subject law in the application of the business combination in our nation.

Article Title: Environmental Decision Support System Development for Soil Salinization in the Arid Area Oasis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: EDSS; GIS; mathematical compute soft; Oasis
Abstract: Soil salinization is a mayor problem for agriculture and soil conservation, which often bring the environmental problems and economic loss, especially in and and semi-arid areas, such as in the southeast margin of Tarim Basin in Xinjiang, China. The results of study indicated that the increase of water table was the main cause resulting the increase of soil salinity. Utilization of water resources and control of groundwater play a key role to resolve the problem. This paper provides an overview of the development and implementation of an integrated environmental decision support system (EDSS) designed to help policy makers and other stakeholders have a clearer understanding of the key factors The EDSS is developed based on the mathematical compute soft which solve the muti-object models and geographic information system (GIS) which support Spatial management It provides visual simulation environment and scenario water recourse management and analysis capabilities. Some lessons drawn from development of the system are useful for other in and and semi-arid areas for management of water resource.

Article Title: Influences and Measures to Technological Innovation of R&D Investment in China by Transnational Corporations
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: transnational corporations; R&D; cultural innovation
Abstract: As more and more transnational corporations (TNC) set up R&D institutions in China, scholars begin to study influences on and measures to our technological innovation of R&D investment in China. This paper analyzes positive influences on our technological innovation of R&D investment in China by transnational corporations. TNC's R&D investment will help to form cultural innovation in China, promote China's regional innovation system, improve technical innovation ability of Chinese enterprises, and train and attract large numbers of talents for china. The negative impacts on China's enterprises is not conducive to independent innovation, intensifying competition of talent's market in China, and widening the innovative capability gap of China's advanced and back-ward areas. On this basis, the paper proposes corresponding suggestions and measures.

Authors: Liu, JB; Ren, H; Xie, JH
Author Full Names: Liu Jian-Bing; Ren Hong; Xie Ji-Hai
Article Title: Critical Chain Project Management Based Heuristic Algorithm for Multiple Resources-Constrained Project
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: theory of constraint; critical chain management; buffer size; project schedule management; heuristic algorithm
Abstract: The traditional methods of project schedule management still have had a lot of problem, which are bad to the stability of the project plan and easy to the overthrow of the project plan and so on. Critical chain is a new kind of method of project management brought forward by Dr El GOLDRATT IN 1997, which based on the theory of constraint. After the theory and the application of Critical Chain Project Management(It's abbreviation is CCPM) are introduced, a new kind of method of byffer' size calculazed is designed. which can built the project buffer management mechanism that carries out the project duration dynamic management. The critical chain project management technology optimized bp heuristic algorithm based on the prior rule is applied to scheme the best optimal duration of Multiple Resources Constrained Project Schedule Problem (Its abbreviation is MRCPSP), which solves the problems of the stability and the whole optimization of the project schedule.

Authors: Liu, YS; Ji, L; Ma, CL
Author Full Names: Liu Yongsheng; Ji Li; Ma Chunlei
Article Title: Early Warning Mechanism of Enterprise Logistics Risk Based on Supply Chain Management
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: supply chain management; enterprise logistics risk; risk early warning mechanism
Abstract: With the rapid development of enterprise logistics business, risk of enterprise logistics is also increasing. To address this problem, effective enterprise logistics risk (ELR) management is encountering increasing interest in both the academic and practitioner communities. The focus of ELR management is early warning and prevention in advance, rather than control afterwards. The paper begins with a discussion of the concept of early warning of ELF, and then explores the sources and symptoms of ELR. Base on these, the early warning mechanism of ELR based on supply chain management (SCM) is thoroughly explained from three aspects: (1) relationship between SCM and early warning mechanism of ELR; (2) characteristics of early warning mechanism of ELR; (3) construction of early warning mechanism of ELR.

Article Title: Melting Knowledge Management across the Supply Chains in the Consulting Industry: Knowledge Sharing in Construction Supply Chains
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: supply chain; supply chain management; knowledge management
Abstract: Supply chain management and knowledge management have emerged as two distinct business philosophies in the last decade. Both are making rapid inroads into the consulting industry. The premise of this paper is that knowledge management would make it possible for all the trading partners in a supply chain to reap benefits. Current research in knowledge management in the consulting industry is generally targeting those big organizations that are main contractors. This has restricted the scope of knowledge management, and limits the benefits to a few, rather than the whole industry. If the consulting industry as a whole is to prosper and improve its productivity, strategies for knowledge management at the industry level must be established. This paper argues the case for melting the scope of knowledge management across the full extent of the supply chain, and attempts to identify the benefits that may arise out of sharing knowledge across the supply chain.

Article Title: WAYS TO FURTHER IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF EDUCATION BY APPLYING THE METHODOLOGY SIX SIGMA
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The aim of this work is to present a case study for the ongoing quality improvement training through practical implementation of the six sigma method to reduce or eliminate the inappropriate results in practical training of students. It is a test methodology for the implementation of six sigma to continuous improving mainly used in industry in a segment rarely used the services of education, with customization in the field of military training. The study complies with methodology stages of the six sigma presented in the reference work in the field and the conclusions presents the performances of students who increased significantly, succeeding fewer qualifications of unsatisfactory from 18 to 1. and the number of very well grades increased by 59.3%.

Abstract: Traditional learning is changing and evolving from day to day, especially now in the Internet era. The main purpose of this paper is to offer a modem learning tool for students in the milling cutting area An online software application was created, together with an e-learning platform meant to teach students the basic theoretical notions before using the software application. The paper ends with a survey, in order to find user's reaction to the software, and to improve the quality of the e-learning platform.
