Article Title: Study on Cultural Integration Process of Merger & Acquisition based on the Theory of Organizational Change by Lewin
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: M & A; cultural integration; process; executive ability
Abstract: Recent years with the increasing tendency of M&A, the issue of M&A became more important than ever, but the consequence of it is not satisfying, such as the unsuccessful M&A cases of Chinese flagship companies, Lenovo and TCL. The underperformance of M&A lies in the lack of execution ability and the disability to relieve the cultural conflict. Through case study and theoretical reasoning this paper wants to establish a process with executive ability of cultural integration from pre-M&A to post-M&A, based on pre-M&A to post-M&A, and the Lewin's organizational change of unfreezing-changing-refreezing.

Article Title: Factors Affecting on the Organizational form of Public Technological Platforms in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: public technological platform; organizational form; joint venture; non-equity alliance
Abstract: A series of Public Technological Platforms (PTPs) has emerged in China over the recent years, and has been regarded as a key institutional reform for promoting industrial innovation. Yet, the development of PTPs has been on experimental stage, and some key issues remain ambiguous. One of them is how to select an appropriate organizational form which is vital for PTPs. This paper discusses two organizational forms including of joint venture and non-equity alliance. It analyses six factors affecting the organizational forms selection for PTPs. On the basis of this, this paper presents a conceptual model of organizational form selection for PTPs.

Author Keywords: blue ocean strategy; value innovation; sustainable competitive advantage; Jinjiang Inn Co., Ltd.
Abstract: This paper is based on the theory of value innovation to explain the significance of the implementation of Blue Ocean Strategy in the enterprise. It analyses the practice of the implementation of Blue Ocean Strategy to achieve value innovation and build sustainable competitive advantage based on the theory of value innovation in Jinjiang Inn Co., Ltd. And then this paper comes to the conclusion that carrying on consumer demand-oriented value innovation is able to create a bigger market space and provide protection for corporate profits growth and sustainable development.

Author Keywords: EMS; business process re-engineering; information technology
Abstract: Through the analysis of the main business processes of China Post EMS, we draw the main problems in logistics and information flows. Addressing these issues, this paper argues that through the use of modem information technology for process optimization, we can solve these problems. So that we build the entire network information system to in order to ensure smooth and coordinate operation of the process the entire EMS system. Finally, in this paper, we briefly analyze the impact on logistics and information flow of EMS after process reengineering.

Article Title: Fleet Assignment Problem in Hub-and-Spoke Network
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: hub-and-spoke network; fleet assignment; operating cost; spill cost; recapture revenue
Abstract: The fleet assignment is a key factor affecting the operating costs of an airline. In this paper, we address the fleet assignment problem (FAP) in which the flight route is taken into account. On the basis of the analysis of the airline's cost structure and the space and time method, a more comprehensive mathematical model with regard to the hub-and-spoke network is provided. In the model, not only the classic cost construct of airline but also the spill cost and the recapture revenue are considered. Besides the new model for FAY, the corresponding program is also introduced and the computation results are reported in the end.

Article Title: Research on Coordination in Closed -loop Supply Chain Based on Evolutionary Game Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: closed -loop supply chain; coordination; evolutionary game theory
Abstract: With the people's awareness of environmental protection strengthens and constraints of regulations and laws to environmental protection increasing closed -loop supply chain is being taken by more and more enterprises. But in the closed-loop supply chain, each member of the business is independent economic entities, which has its own strategic objective. With this objective, the enterprises make decision of how to use resources, and how to coordinate the external environment, as well as to take what action to achieve this objective. So, with the focus on long-term, this article tried to study closed-loop supply chain nodes in the corresponding business combination of different parameters to take different modes of cooperation. And got the conclusion that the different parameters of closed-loop supply chain decide the different model in which may have different coordinate act on key parameters.

Authors: Zheng, WF; Ma, YY; Lyytinen, K
Author Full Names: Zheng Wenfu; Ma Yuanyuan; Lyytinen, Kalle
Article Title: From Manufacturer-driven to Carrier-driven: Towards China's TD-SCDMA Commercialization Strategies
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: technology innovation; service innovation; mobile telecommunications; TD-SCDMA; industry chain
Abstract: The paper aims to discuss TD-SCDMA technology commercialization strategy and proposes a conceptual framework for mobile telecommunications technology commercialization process. In the framework, the mobile telecommunications technology commercialization process consists of three stages: (1) idea generation and invention, driven by customers, (2) technology innovation, driven by manufacturers and (3) service innovation, driven by carriers. The paper argues that the TD-SCDMA technology commercialization process is now in the service innovation stage, which began in April of 2008, when the commercial test was launched. The paper also discusses the strategies in the service innovation stage of the TD-SCDMA commercialization process from such perspectives as belief embracing, brand building, application development, Investment Strategy and the roles of government, etc..

Article Title: A Bibliometric Study of Agent-Based Modeling Literature on the SSCI Database
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Bibliometrics; Agent-Based Modeling; Social Sciences Citation Index (SSCI); Bradford's Law; Lotka's Law
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to investigate the characteristics of the international literature using Agent-Based Modeling (ABM) in SSCI during 1997-2009. The results of this study reveal the fact that the growth of international literature using ABM is still well perceived. Most of the literature is from various institutions in the USA. According to Bradford's Law, eight core journals in ABM are identified and analyzed. Moreover, the frequency distributions of the author productivity match the generalized Lotka's Law. Applications of ABM are mainly found in the fields of social science/interdisciplinary studies, economics, and environmental studies.

Article Title: Predicting Herding Trend by Fuzzy Logic
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Fuzzy logic; herding behavior; predicting
Abstract: In this article we focus on the predicting of herding behavior towards the Toronto Stock exchange index (TSX60) using a fuzzy logic. We use monthly data from January 2000 to December 2006. Our observations are divided into two subsets: the first is used for estimation and the second for the forecasting. Despite the estimated model produced an inexact answer, with a probabilistic output, it is possible to implement an investment strategy, using the herding index as a proxy for investors, which outperforms a buy-and-hold one.

Article Title: HIGH LEVEL MINING EDUCATION: FROM UNPROMISING EXPECTATIONS TOWARDS REAL DEVELOPMENT CAPABILITIES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The major changes occurred in worldwide mining education system are inducing specific consequences both at graduate and postgraduate courses level The need of change is coming from several directions, which are going to be discussed in the paper. Mining education is evolving nowadays, as it struggles to meet the demands of an overheated industry, on a number of developing fronts. On the other hand, industry is beginning to recognize the importance of career improvement, in the form of corporate training programs or accredited professional development. Based on a brief analysis of the Romanian mining high level education present state, the paper synthesizes the trends concerning the interconnection in networks of the universities and high mining schools, the operational collaboration with mining industry, the extension of the distance education programs and emphasises the perspectives and the possible development ways.

Article Title: Technological Innovation and Technology-Intensive Manufacturer: A Case Study of CSR
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Technological Innovation; Technology-Intensive Enterprise; Case Study
Abstract: To improve its technological level, China South Locomotive & Rolling Stock Corporation Limited (CSR), a technology-intensive enterprise, desires to set up a complete technological innovation system and execute flexible innovation strategies. The pattern of technological innovation in developing countries and a thorough review of technological development history of Chinese rail transportation equipment manufacturers are examined. The technological innovation system of CSR is analyzed through the paradigm of innovation portfolio. Two major areas for improvement are identified based on the study results. Suggestions are discussed for the innovation system of CSR including combining, technological innovation and organizational innovation, integrating technology strategy with business strategy, strengthening the cooperation with universities and research institutes, and setting up strategic technology alliances with technology-advanced companies. Suggestions for the innovation strategies of CSR are promoting more technology innovation on manufacturing key vehicle parts and accessories and improving the capability of system integration.

Authors: El-Kasheir, D; Ashour, AS; Yacout, OM
Author Full Names: El-Kasheir, Dalia; Ashour, Ahmed S.; Yacout, Omneya M.
Article Title: Factors Affecting Continued Usage of Internet Banking Among Egyptian Customers
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Technology acceptance model; Diffusion of innovations; Self service technology; Internet banking
Keywords Plus: TECHNOLOGY ACCEPTANCE MODEL; INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY; PERCEIVED USEFULNESS; PLANNED BEHAVIOR; USER ACCEPTANCE; REASONED ACTION; ADOPTION; INTENTIONS; SERVICE; INNOVATIONS
Abstract: This research aims to understand and explain customers continued intention to use internet banking in Egypt. The research starts with reviewing well-known theories of behavioural intentions such as the theory of reasoned action, the theory of planned behaviour, the theory of decomposed planned behaviour, the technology acceptance model,and the diffusion of innovations theory as well as the use of these theories in self service technologies such as internet banking. By using a sample of users of internet banking services, perceived ease-of-use was found to be the strongest predictor of intentions to continued usage of internet banking services. Demographic variables had no significant effect on continued usage of internet banking services. Finally, perceived risk had no relationship with customer continued intention to use the service. The research concludes with study limitations and suggestions for future research.

Authors: Enachescu, D; Matei, M; Dusmanescu, D
Author Full Names: Enachescu, Daniela; Matei, Mirela; Dusmanescu, Dorel
Article Title: Analyses of foreign portfolio investment at Bucharest Stock Exchange in Global Financial Crisis
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: financial crisis; BSE; foreign portfolio investment
Abstract: The globalisation of financial markets, facilitated by new technology, under which a shock in one region is rapidly transmitted to other centres all over the globe, had ensured that, in less than a year, the USA financial crisis has spread across the continents, including countries that are not so very linked regarding financial markets. The capital market in Romania is a market of shares, bonds market being in a process of development, a phenomenon specific to the countries of Central and Eastern Europe. Unfortunately, the weak integration of our stock exchange on international and European financial market and a poor transparency of the transaction at BSE established a masive turmoil of the BSE activity. In this paper the authors will try to analyse the impact of the USA financial crisis in Romanian Stock Exchange markets, especially the foreign portfolio investment in BSE.

Article Title: A Dual Loop Model for Managing Information Resource
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: With the rapid development of information and communication technology, modem business activities become increasingly dependent on Information Resource Management (IRM). To manage implemented information resources successfully in practice, one great challenge facing time management team is how to deal with various mismatches between information provider and information user. In this paper, the substance of IRM challenges on mismatches is clarified, and a dual loop model is designed to deal with the issue on mismatches. The contribution of this paper will be twofold: one is to set up a sound management mechanism for promoting information resources management, the other one is to create adaptable information resources in practice.

Authors: Karadsheh, L; Mansour, E; Alhawari, S; Azar, G; El-Bathy, N
Author Full Names: Karadsheh, Louay; Mansour, Ebrahim; Alhawari, Samer; Azar, Ghassan; El-Bathy, Naser
Article Title: A Theoretical Framework for Knowledge Management Process: Towards Improving Knowledge Performance
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: KM; Knowledge Performance; Knowledge Infrastructure; Knowledge Application
Abstract: Evidently, there is a strong competition among organizations and rapid changes in business surroundings. Therefore, the organizations start thinking of developing their performance and processes. In this regard, Knowledge Management (KM) processes have turned out nowadays to become an organization strategic resource to the extent in which KM is viewed as a base of success or failure. The aim of this paper is presenting a conceptual KM process framework. It mainly emphasizes on developing phases such as knowledge infrastructure, knowledge combination, knowledge filtering, knowledge repository, knowledge sharing, knowledge application, and,finally, knowledge performance across the KM process. The paper describes a more valid process to Improving Knowledge Performance.

Article Title: Study on the Development Paths of American Biotechnology Pharmaceutical Enterprises and Its Revelation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: modem biotechnology; development paths; reason; revelation
Abstract: Under the background of biotechnology pharmaceutical industries, the paper choosing four American biotechnology pharmaceutical enterprises as the research subjects: Amgen, Genentech, Biogen and Genzeme. Through analyzing the development course of these enterprises, three typical development paths zre concluded: self-development by means of traditional large-scale enterprises, self-integrated development and tie-core incremental development. Meanwhile, the reasons why different enterprises choose different paths are analyzed. At last, revelations for China biotechnology enterprises development path are put forward based on above study and such suggestions aim at different enterprise type.

Article Title: Internationalization Motivations of Emerging Market Enterprises:. Institution-based View
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: emerging market enterprises; internationalization motivations; institution-based view; regular pillar; normative pillar; cognitive pillar
Abstract: Traditional multinational enterprises theories claim that the internationalization of firms should be carried on after possession of the domestic market, which means the monopolistic advantages are the precondition. However, recent experiences reveal that, at least in emerging economies, it is not the case. The firms from emerging markets expand overseas without overwhelming advantages. So how is it happened? For filling this gap, this paper investigates the internationalization motivations of emerging market enterprises and develops an integrated framework to explain the question basing on institution-based view. From the three different pillars, we convince that the compound strengths including internal and external forces impel these emerging market enterprises venturing overseas. Overall, the paper not only probes into the unique motivations that steer them toward internationalization comparing to the multinational enterprises from developed countries, but also sheds light on institution view, which is significant especially in emerging economies.

Article Title: Financial, Organizational and Macroeconomic Determinants of the Profitability of Tunisian banks
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Performance; banks; determinants; board of directors
Abstract: Tunisia is one of the countries where the banking sector forms the core of the financial system. However, despite the weight of bank intermediation for financing Tunisian economy, assets of banks relative to GDP are very low. In addition, Tunisian banks have a high credit risk associated with low levels of profitability, liquidity and capitalization. The presence of these signs of fragility in the Tunisian banking system motivated us to study the determinants of this low profitability of banks. The contribution of this study is that it examines the impact of organizational variables, in addition to macroeconomic and financial variables, focusing primarily on the role played by the Board of Directors. The interest to this internal governance mechanism stems from the particularities of banks corporate governance. The empirical results of this study, contrary to expectations, show that the board of directors, despite its great importance, it granted only a limited place in Tunisian banks and it has several shortcomings in relation to its mission.

Article Title: CHALLENGES AND SUCCESS FACTORS IN DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF AN E-LEARNING COURSE FOR LARGE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The interactive e-learning course Essentials of Personnel Management was realized for managers and teachers of secondary and primary schools This course was developed by teachers of the Slovak University of Technology in cooperation with their colleagues of the Constantine the Philosopher University in Nitra in the learning environment Moodie and supported by the European Social Fund. This e-learning course is a part of National Project of Further Education of Pedagogical Employees in the field of communication skills, school management and marketing. Nearly 2,000 participants took part in ten course runs starting in October 2007 and ending in September 2008. The authors summarized and analyzed experiences gained by the course developers, providers and participants in the form of challenges in the development and implementation phases of this course and factors contributing to their successful completion.

Article Title: ADLIB NETWORK AND WEB FEED POWERED E-LEARNING SYSTEMS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: This paper explores the use of online social networking systems such as Hi5, MySpace or Facebook integrated with feed aggregators as adlib alternative educational platforms. The main goal of this article is to define ways in which the structure and dynamics of social networks powered by the data flow of web feeds can be used to semi-automatically create adlib educational platforms using data freely available on the Web. Such systems may prove to be efficient in providing general and specific information on a wide range of topics as well as interaction with teachers and specialists in the respective educational fields The main advantage of combining the network interaction paradigm with the automated information flow of web feeds is using existing platforms in order to create new digital frameworks to support lifelong learning but also conventional education. The paper will conclude by outlining specific functions such a system could perform, the advantages of building a learning community on top of popular social networking systems and the use of customized web feeds (e.g. via Yahoo Pipes) as means of retrieving data and managing the information flow.

Article Title: MULTIMEDIA AND WEB 2.0: NEW CHALLENGES OF VET
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The number of Virtual Learning Environments (VLEs), based on multimedia and web 2.0 concepts, is increasing and they have been advertised as being a solution for the remote and cross-border vocational educational training (VET). Hence, VET institutions are increasingly turning to VLEs in order to: save the time of teaching staff, facilitate the integration of distance and self-based learning during the period without face-to-face meeting teacher / students and provide a service for students, increasingly looking for the new technologies as a more exciting medium for finding information. The aim of this paper is to underline the penetration of new multimedia and internet technologies in the VET field, to underline the advantages (and weak points) of traditional, in-classroom activities versus taking those activities online and to analyse the results based on these technologies obtained in transnational projects in the framework of the Leonardo da Vinci European Programme (Romanian case study Romanian contractors).

Article Title: THE OPTIMISM AND THE CREATIVE MANAGERIAL THINKING - SUCCESS FACTORS IN THE KNOWLEDGE BASED ECONOMY
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In knowledge based economy, teaching should put the accent on creative thinking of the instructed ones. To keep up with The actual dynamic environment, where every organization plays its role, the faculties' graduates must own creativity and a high degree of optimism, too. A first step in making clear the importance of those two factors in die knowledge based management and economy is represented by the research done by authors, using a questionnaire which was distributed to Romanian managers from different activity domains. The results of this research, presented in the paper, guide us to interesting conclusions about the possibilities to improve the Romanian educational area. We consider that the present explorer research opens a large field for the study of the roles which optimism and creative thinking play in the Romanian management and entrepreneurship.

Article Title: INNOVATIVE NEW METHODS FOR BUSINESS EDUCATION - PROBLEM-BASED LEARNING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In the knowledge-based society, business education in educational institutions is experiencing increased competitive pressures. One way to differentiate is by using innovative new methods in business education. This paper presents the advantages of Problem-based learning method that can be applied with distinctive benefits in all educational fields and specifically in business education. This method can present solutions to simple or complex changeling problems that are at the centre of human living experience. Problem Based Learning develops specific skills like the ability to recognize and respond to problems by creative thinking and promotes individual and team work interaction to respond to certain objectives.

Article Title: CONSIDERATIONS ABOUT THE TRANSDICIPLINARY KNOWLEDGE SEARCH WINDOW IN MECHATRONICAL EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: transdisciplinarity; knowledge search window; top-down and bottom-up perspective; teaching/learning process; mechatronics; lifelong learning
Abstract: The knowledge search window as a methodological concept in order to explain the bottom-up/ top-down mechanism of the teaching-learning process in mechatronical educational paradigm from a transdisciplinary perspective is introduced. The teacher is presented acting from a top-down perspective, while the apprentice from a bottom-up one, the communicators, teacher and apprentices, being alternatively in a symmetrical and complementary interaction states, depending of the context in the negotiation process of the solutions in a creative-innovative way. The mechatronical curricula studies strive to develop in each student a balance between these top-down and the bottom-up perspectives on mechatronical approach of knowledge, studying in depth the key areas of technology on which successful mechatronical design is based and thus lays the foundation for the students to become such true mechatronician, a new synergistic job profiles created as a mix of mechanical, electrical and IT knowledge Mechatronics as a transdisciplinary technology education holds the potential for teaching all the people involved in the VETS as lifelong learning apprentices getting the skills of problem solving.

Article Title: Study of Design and Analysis System about Ring-plate-type Pin-cycloid Planetary Drive on Product Data Management
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: design and analysis system; pin-cycloid planetary drive; data management; Ring-plate-type; data model
Abstract: Management and share on engineering data have become key contents in engineering design. Large-scale phases data with different formats and complex relationships are produced in scientific computing and analyzing in complex product design process, because of its tentativeness and iteration. It has become a bottleneck of product design. In order to organize and manage those data efficiently, main product digital models are discussed in this paper. Product information, product structure-relation and design document three main data model are proposed. An engineering design-analysis system of ring-plate-type pin-cycloid planetary drive is developed as an example of engineering data management which has system management, product information management, drawing management and design analysis four models. The system has functions of browsing, loading, modification, deleting product information, document management, product structure management, parameter design, meshing stiffness computation and analysis, and system maintain. A synthetical design-analysis-management platform is proposed for study of ring-plate-type pin-cycloid planetary drive.

Article Title: Technology-based Relationship between Innovation and Growth
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: innovation; patent; regional economic; time series analysis; western China
Abstract: The economic effect of innovation, as one of the research focus in international innovation policy studies, are more and more frequently targeted on developing countries. This paper focuses on the innovation promotion impact to regional economic growth. The empirical study takes Guangxi district for an example to test the promotion impact by time serial analysis. All data covers the period of 1988-2005. Using patents application and GDP as proxy of innovation and regional economy, the empirical estimates reveal that increase in patenting leads to increase in economic growth for Guangxi district. The result shows that companies in the backward areas are inefficient patent application strategy and low patent transfer rates, and the innovation promotion impact to economic growth is more effective in short term than in long run. Western district in China should strengthen the degree of intellectual property rights (IPRs) protection, in order to create a legal environment that can stimulate more innovations.

Article Title: Distinctions between the Chinese and Western Organizational Pattern: The Role of Culture
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: distinction; organizational pattern; culture
Abstract: In the current global market in which enterprises, countries, and individuals are only as good as their last viable idea, we cannot disregard the value of proper organizational pattern. Nonetheless, Chinese domestic business organizations are frequently committing serious blunders in their desire to quickly catch up the development path of western organizations. Chinese enterprises are merely copying advanced development patterns from progressive western nations without regard for the differences of context in which they operate, which would in turn harm the further development of Chinese enterprises. This paper, on the basis of distinguishing the role of different cultures, proposes the distinctions between the Chinese and western organizational pattern, hoping which could promote the overall recognition of Chinese enterprises.

Authors: Sun, XH; Hua, FJ; Lu, WY
Author Full Names: Sun Xiaohua; Hua Fengjuan; Lu Wuyan
Article Title: Research on How Human Capital and Social Capital Impact Self-Employment Motivation-Case Study from Laid-off Unemployed Workers in Xi'an City
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: laid-off unemployed workers; human capital; social capital; innovative undertaking; performance
Abstract: The laid-off unemployed workers' re-employment problem is one of the major problems for government and social concerns. Under the national policy, a growing number of laid-off workers are looking forward to their own businesses independently. This article takes the laid-off workers' human capital as a basic point, introducing the social capital theory, and utilizing the path analysis method. We found human capital and social capital are interacted, but the social capital is more important than human capital; their combined action has an salience influence on the founders' performance.

Abstract: According to the problem which China's furniture manufacturing industry is facing, the paper mainly analyses the management ways and strategies At the same time, in order to realize furniture industry development at higher level, higher quality, the paper proposes that making full use of inherent simplicity of the system can achieve breakthroughs in the shortest possible time with a minimum of resources. For furniture manufacturing industry, making efforts to increase throughput, reducing inventory, shortening production cycle and strengthening the quality management are the direction of the future.

Abstract: This paper introduces the present research situation in terms of risk evaluation methods of high technology projects, and tries to make an exact risk evaluation on high technology projects by employing the dynamic level analysis method with the factor of time integrated into it. The method can enhance the dynamic quality of risk evaluation in the process. of risk investment management and consequently guarantee the success of investment projects for starting a career.

Authors: Wan, KY; Zhao, ZJ; Yu, SJ
Author Full Names: Wan Kunyang; Zhao Zhijiang; Yu Shujuan
Article Title: Spatial Econometric Analysis of Venture Capital Spillovers and Regional Innovation Cluster
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge spillovers; venture capital; Knowledge Production Function (KPF); Spatial Lag Model (SLM); Spatial Error Model (SEM)
Abstract: On the basis of the current literature review, the paper puts forward the view that the attribution of venture capital investment should be considered when researching the effect of knowledge spillovers. After the testing of the zone innovation spatial correlation via the Moran's I index, this paper get a conclusion that zone innovation has the feature of spatial correlation with a phenomenon of obvious zone innovation cluster. Drawn on the experience of Griliches' Knowledge Production Function (KPF), the paper constructs the updated KPF model with the consideration of the venture capital investment influence to the zone innovation. Under the frame of the updated KPF model and according to,the spatial econometrics theory, it makes an empirical analysis for the effect of knowledge spillovers (venture capital, R&D expenditure, etc.) through the Spatial Lag Model (SLM). As a result, venture capital and R&D expenditure have an obvious positive spatial diffusion (spillover) effect on the zone innovation. Thus, the R&D investment should be increased successively, and we should focus the development of the VC on establishing the zone venture capital center in four areas (Beijing, Shanghai, Hubei and Guangdong), instead of blossom everywhere which we used to in the past.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: strategic marketing; medium and small; automobile enterprises; current trends
Abstract: This paper is based on a study of the Chinese automobile market and industry and aims at proposing marketing strategy for Chinese medium and small automobile enterprises. Objectives being building up market share and customer base, increasing vehicle sales volumes and achieving strategic edge over its competitors, the paper approaches the problem by putting the customer at the central focal point of all marketing operations. Current global automobile industries trends are analyzed firstly, then the strategic marketing framework for medium and small automobile enterprise are put forward, and implementation plan for medium and small automobile enterprises are given too. To look for agile opportunities in the Chinese automobile industry and identify customers' needs and expectations in the current and future markets are also very important for enterprise to satisfy customers' needs.

Abstract: Based on analyzing the past and current development trends of the strategic alliances of the enterprises, this paper suggests to establish the strategic alliances of learning-orientation should be mainstream, and puts forth that to construct an effective learning strategic alliances, the enterprises should take measures from mechanisms of knowledge sharing and alliances object choice based on absorptive capacity. Finally, the paper also suggests the ways of promoting learning effect of enterprises' strategic alliances.

Article Title: An Analysis of Forecasting Model of Crude Oil Demand Based on Cointegration and Vector Error Correction Model (VEC)
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: crude oil demand; influence factors; forecast; cointegration; vector error correction model
Abstract: This paper establishes a cointegration and vector error correction model to forecast the crude oil demand in China after analyzing main factors affecting crude oil demand. The model proves that GDP, population, the share of industrial sector in GDP and the oil price are the main factors influencing crude oil demand. Especially population and the share of industrial sector make significance influences on crude oil demand, since the large-scale population, ever-increasing living standard and fast industrialization in China in the past thirty years. After implementing ex post forecast which implies that the cointegration and vector error correction model that established before fits the demand trend very well, the paper forecasts China's crude oil demand from 2008-2020 using the model. The forecast indicates that the demand will be as great as 0.599 billion tons in 2020, which means that China will encounter more and more serious energy problems, for which some suggestions are proposed to policy-makers.

Author Keywords: equity incentive; listed shipping company; performance; interrelationship
Abstract: Based on American shipping data of listed companies, the article makes positive research on effect degrees by equity incentive to financial performance. It establishes regression model and makes analysis of mixed section, reveals that equity incentive has continuous, stable and positive effect on business performance and shows distinct influence in the perspective of horizontal and vertical ways. Listed shipping companies with good performance trend to utilize equity incentive system to decrease business risk and promote profit level as well.

Article Title: Study on Institutional Innovation of China's Urban Tourism
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: China; urban tourism; institutional innovation
Abstract: With the emergence and development of urban tourism in nations around the world, urban tourism has gradually become an important form of tourism, accounting for a rising percentage of tourists and tourism revenues. Despite its short history, urban tourism has surged in China in recent years. The author of this paper uses a combination of empirical and normative methods in the research, examines the development of domestic and overseas urban tourism, and argues that China's city development process suffers from some institutional hindrances, which have seriously constrained the healthy development of urban tourism. Through analyses, the author finds that at present institutional hindrances constraining the development of China's urban tourism are largely manifested in the following facts: first, legislation on urban tourism has lagged behind; second, city leisure space layout has yet to be incorporated into urban planning; third, the existing urban tourism investment management system suffers from various deficiencies; and fourth, notions of leisure and leisure tourism commercialism remain outdated. On the basis of the above research findings, the author draws the conclusion that as an integral party of urban economic development and the turning point and area of growth for the urban economy, the urban tourism industry is set to significantly boost the development of China's urban socio-economic development; given China's vast resources in urban tourism, its development prospects are brilliant; and that to meet the demand of domestic and overseas tourists for urban tourism, institutional supply must be innovated. Thus, the author proposes the following measures: (1) to administrate tourism according to the law; (2) to improve the planning of urban tourism; (3) to improve the operating management system of the urban tourism industry; and (4) to reform mentality and build a leisure education system. The innovation of this paper lies in its comprehensive examination of the problems with the institutional supply of China's urban tourism, and its proposal of highly operational measures.

Authors: Zhang, J; Chang, Z; Liu, B; Xiu, ZY
Author Full Names: Zhang, Jie; Chang, Zhi; Liu, Bo; Xiu, Zhenyu
Article Title: L-Fuzzy Co-Alexandrov Topological Spaces
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: L-fuzzy partial order; L-fuzzy poset; L-fuzzy upper set; L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topology; L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topological space
Abstract: Firstly, we present some characterizations of L-fuzzy poset and their corresponding proofs. Then, we give the definition of L-fuzzy upper set and prove its related properties. Next, we define the concept of L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topological space on an L-fuzzy poset (X, e). We further study the properties of L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topological space and equivalent characterizations, which are generalizations of the Alexandrov topological space on a poset (X, E:) in the classical topological space theory. Finally, we establish the relationships of L-fuzzy poset, L-fuzzy upper set and L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topological space. These relationships make clear that we can use L-fuzzy poset, L-fuzzy upper set to construct the L-fuzzy Co-Alexandrov topogical space. All the theories we proposed to provide a general theoretical framework for the study of the fuzzy data types, fuzzy relations and fuzzy approximation operators in information systems and database technology

Article Title: Research on Enterprise Performance Evaluation System Based on BSC and EVA
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: enterprise performance; performance evaluation; BSC; EVA
Abstract: At present, the majority of foreign enterprise have already got rid of the pattern taking the pure financial criterion as the weight performance, they use the BSC (Balanced Scorecard-BSC) system primarily. While, the EVA (Economic Value Added) is taking as one kind of evaluating indicator system to be able to obtain the shareholder value as well as the enterprise increase in value performance, it has reflected the enterprise strategy operation objectives directly. This article introduces performance evaluation systems-the BSC and the EVA, proposes one new performance evaluating indicator system unifying the BSC and EVA based on the relationship between the two systems, and explains the setup procedure of this set of system's targets taking ABC Corporation as the example.

Authors: Zhu, L; Yu, S; Zhang, X
Author Full Names: Zhu, Lu; Yu, Sheng; Zhang, Xing
Article Title: Improvement Upon Mutual Password Authentication Scheme
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: authentication; password; hash function; secure; attack; trusted computing
Abstract: Many password authentication schemes have been proposed for electronic commerce environment; however, none of them is secure enough. Hwang and Yeh proposed an improvement on the Peyravian-Zunic password authentication scheme including protected password transmission and password change. We demonstrate that the Hwang-Yeh scheme is also vulnerable to several kinds of attacks though the scheme has repaired some security problems of the Peyravianis-Zunic scheme. Furthermore, we propose an improved scheme to enhance security of their scheme in the paper. Based on collision-resistant hash function, the proposal employs techniques of salting, time stamp and trusted computing to be free from worries of possible common attacks, such as replay attack, guessing attack, stolen-verifier attack, denial of service attack, impersonation attack, and server spoofing attack. According to security analysis over insecure networks, the proposed scheme is the most secure scheme among the Peyravian-Zunic scheme, the Hwang-Yeh scheme, the Peyravian-Jeffries scheme, and the Wang-Zhang scheme.

Article Title: Discussion on the Cultural Environment of Scientific System and its Value to the Development of Science
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: scientific system; cultural environment; science; value
Abstract: The cultural environment system for science and technology development is composed of the interrelationships and interactions during humanities' development status, national cultural tradition, social values and the humanities equipment of scientific workers. They interrelate, interact and constitute a whole entity, namely the cultural environment system for the development of science and technology. Its value to scientific development is embodied in three aspects such as the basic role of material culture, the carrier role of organizational culture and the directional role of mental culture.

Article Title: Necessity of a Framework for the Implementation of the IT Innovation Strategy
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: IT control objects; IT innovation; IT innovation strategy
Abstract: IT is the driving force for many innovations. Consequently, it has to focus more strongly on its ability to innovate and thus contribute to the company's future success. Hence, the innovation aspect is already part of many IT management models. But oftentimes these models provide only less or none informationen about the control objects which are important for the implementation of the IT innovation strategy. Furthermore they normally don't contain any advice how these control objects should ideally be designed to encourage the generation of innovations. Therefore, this research paper reveals the necessity of a framework for the implementation of the IT innovation strategy which should contain the essential information.

Article Title: Study on Model about Competitive Intelligence System of Enterprise based on Data Mining under Electronic Commerce Environment
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: electronic commerce; data mining; data warehouse; competitive intelligence system; model
Abstract: Electronic Commerce (e-commerce or e-business) is the mainstream business model in the 21st century. The development of enterprises will face the brand-new choices and opportunities. Using data warehouse technology realizes subject-oriented data integration, and using data mining technology for competitive intelligence analysis can effectively resolve analysis, evaluation and forecast questions of competitors in the competitive intelligence system of enterprise, then help enterprises win the competitive advantage. Based on the analysis of the features of enterprise competitive intelligence under electronic commerce environment, this paper introduces competitive intelligence system and data mining technology, focused on the specific application of data mining technology in competitive intelligence system, presents a model about competitive intelligence system of enterprise based on data mining under electronic commerce environment. Due to the study of this paper, it will provide a reference for the construction and implementation of competitive intelligence system of enterprise based on data mining under electronic commerce environment.

Article Title: Application of Entropy Weight and Fuzzy AHP to Priority Decision-making of Mechanical Product Projects
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: mechanical product; project priority; entropy weight; fuzzy analytic hierarchy process
Abstract: Machinery makers are limited with resources or productivity while contacting several projects. In resource conflicts, they should make priority orders for the projects. The priority ones should enjoy resources first. This paper combines fuzzy mathematics with analytic hierarchy process and entropy weight, in line with characteristics of mechanical products, based on consideration of various factors of mechanical product project priority. The model combines the subjective judgment with objective calculation, reducing notably errors made by the subjective judgment in analytic hierarchy process. The case of priority assessment of three collateral mechanical product projects justified feasibility and practicability of the model, providing a scientific theoretical quantitative proof for decision makers of mechanical companies.

Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Constantin, Oprean; Mihail, Titu; Daniel, Grecu; Cristina, Tanasescu
Article Title: STUDY REGARDING THE IMPORTANCE OF THE ACTIVITY OF TRAINING IN QUALITY MANAGEMENT WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT OF POST-SALE SERVICES IN THE KNOWLEDGE-BASED ORGANIZATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The scientific paper presents a laborious and well-documented study regarding the importance of the activities of training in the field of quality management, within a department of post-sale services, in a real knowledge-based organization The study which is carried in the scientific paper emphasizes the importance of the activity of training and it is based on the idea that, nowadays, the client notices in detail the way and the duration in which the personnel approach each intervention It emphasizes the principles of quality management, the fact that the client continually evaluates the services he receives. With the purpose of obtaining a maximum level of motivation of the personnel, the study emphasizes the knowledge acquired by each employee after having followed a few training activities, specific to the approach field. The study is presented in the university courses on Industrial Engineering and in the MA university courses at the Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu.

Article Title: STUDIES AND RESEARCHES ON THE INTERPRETATION OF VISUAL IMAGES IN EDUCATIONAL MANAGEMENT
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Multimedia transforms the inter-action between man and computer and permits the creation of a new products family that can be considered a catalyser to launch the second informational revolution. This new product generation permits both placement of the multimedia elements inside the existing environment and a new approach concerning the process of work. There is the problem of a new management of multimedia data base for educational processes. Image data base is a more important source for developing and more rapid learning of knowledge and in this way it contributes to the development of educational system Through the present paper the authors find a new possibility of visual searching and finding of the information but also a statistical determination of the main methods of working with the pictures from the data base This kind of data base may be used in all educational development's phases of a human being, starting with individual forming. The major conclusion remains the necessity of a new and more rapid learning and adequate educational approach for the academic environment, based on this new multimedia management process (using image date bases). [HCI (HUMAN COMPUTER INTERFACES) APPLICATIONS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES]

Article Title: NEW OPPORTUNITIES AND THREATS CHALLENGING THE SYSTEM OF ENGINEERING EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The globally changing higher education environment is under real pressure to interact with surrounding society where success is increasingly based on knowledge, skills and ability to learn. It is the responsibility of engineering education to build both the necessary structures for renewing engineering curriculum and course structures, and to implement alternative teaching methods and assessment of their effectiveness, raising the status of teaching in society and in institutional hiring and reward policies. The engineering education is facing the challenge of encouraging the co-operation with external stakeholders and of creating common understanding of the target future, by remaking the quality of education so as to facilitate social responsibility and innovation. The aim of our paper is to analyze and improve the Romanian system of engineering education taking into account the global challenges in the Learning Society (new knowledge economy).

Article Title: Business Intelligence - A Helping Hand for the Strategic Management
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: business intelligence; Chief Information Officers; information technologies; strategic management
Abstract: The Information Age has shaped the business world and has obliged the companies to adapt and design their strategies accordingly. In order to develop and execute a strategy, the company's management must make clear decisions on the activities that it will prioritize in allocating resources. This paper focuses on the main phases of strategic management and how these have been changed by the information technology boom that started at the end of the last century. The authors have also looked into the role that the Chief Information Officers have today, analyzing the job concept since its appearance. The final part of this research focuses on the way the business intelligence could be implemented in the strategic management process while the conclusions summarize main findings on the impact that the information technology has had upon business processes in general and strategic management in particular.

Article Title: Research on the Supply and Demand Status of High-Tech Industry Talent
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: high-tech industry; talent supply and demand; DSR
Abstract: This paper introduces the supply and demand status of High-Tech Industry Talent (HTIT) in China. We use the Demand/Supply Ratio (DSR), the ratio of number of demanded people to number of jot seekers. as a measurable indicator of the supply-demand imbalance in HTIT market, analyze this DSR and its trend with X12 seasonal adjustment and HP filtering method, and apply OLS to forecast this trend. Study results show that there is an imbalance between supply and demand of HTIT, furthermore this imbalance will continue. Finally, we can find the reasons for this imbalance and put forward some policies and recommendations to solve this issue.

Article Title: An Empirical Research on the Relationship between Debts Structural Arrangement of Listed Company and Company Value Based on Growth Characteristics
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: debt structural arrangement; listed company value; growth
Abstract: According to whether the information is disclosed or not, enterprise financing process is divided into public debt financing and non-public debt financing. Normally, the component proportion relationship between public debt and non-public debt is called debt structural arrangement. It is generally believed through existing research that debt structural arrangement has great impact on company value. Through using correlation analysis method and the analysis on the relationship between debt structural arrangement and enterprise value of China's non-financial industry listed companies from 2001 to 2008 which have balance of bonds payable and different growth characteristics, this article reaches a conclusion that debt structural arrangement doesn't have positive influences on the value China's listed companies. According to state-owned property right grouping inspection of listed companies, bank-major non-public debt financing has soft constraint on state-holding listed companies.

Article Title: An Empirical Investigation of Chinese Stock Markets with Feed-back Models
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Efficient Capital Market Hypothesis; The expectational model; The geometric lag
Abstract: Feed-back models in the stock markets research imply an adjustment process toward investors' expectation for current information and past experiences. The Efficient Capital Market Hypothesis, which had ignored the effect of the accumulation of information, can not explain some anomalies such as bubbles and partial predictability in the stock markets. Researchers find out that the feed-back mechanism developed by some cognitive psychologists is effective to explain some anomalies to a certain extent. In order to investigate the feed-back mechanism and to determine an effective model, we use daily data of the stock index of two Chinese stock markets. Shanghai Stock Exchange and Shenzhen Stock Exchange, from January 2007 to June 2008 with the expectational model, which is one kind of geometric lag models. Our result clearly shows the common coefficient of expectations and fourth-order autoregressive disturbance exist in the two Chinese stock markets. Furthermore, we find the scone coefficient of expectations has an autoregressive effect on disturbances in the two Chinese stock markets. Therefore the presence of such feed-back is also supported in Chinese stock markets.

Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to identify attitudes, knowledge and behaviour of young people, students of a technical university towards science and technology. Methodology: The survey was conducted on a population of 124 students from different faculties of a technical university. The questionnaire used followed: the degree of interest and information for science and technology, used source of information, loisir scientific practices as well as scientific knowledge and technical skills. The results obtained show the strong points and vulnerabilities in terms of scientific and technical culture of the current students, future specialists in science and technology

Article Title: THE INVOLVEMENT OF THE ROMANIAN ENTREPRENEURS IN ACHIEVING THE ORGANIZATIONAL OBJECTIVES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The first purpose of this paper is the evaluation of three dominant factors in determining the degree of involvement of the Romanian entrepreneurs in achieving the objectives of the organization they belong to: the wish of professional achievement, the degree of involvement in the organizational life - even at the risk of limiting the private life - and the degree of entrepreneurs' initiative in the firm. To achieve this objective, a research was made, based on a questionnaire. The second essential objective of the paper is to issue some suggestions, based on the results of the research, for new development directions of the managerial disciplines, in order to raise the degree of involvement of the faculties' graduates in achieving the organizational objectives. The originality of the paper consists of the research made, the results obtained and the recommendations made.

Article Title: A THEORETICAL MODEL OF INVESTMENT IN EDUCATION. FROM JOB-LOCK TO PROMOTION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Many individuals and firms make choices of investing in education and training based on rational benefits and costs. The Nobel laureate, Gary Becker, introduced the distinction between general and specific education in order to explain the individual's incentives to invest in human capital and their influence on job-lock and promotion. The aim of this paper is to offer a theoretical analysis of investment in human capital, and to explain why different rate of returns are associated with different kind of education.

Article Title: Distributed Java Mobile Information System
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: Technology is now everywhere; integrated into our everyday objects and activities. Mobile computers and devices are now widely affordable and powerful enough. Because of that, developments of mobile applications become a phenomenon today. Mobile applications could be used both to connect people with each other, and to link them with crucial data from almost anywhere in mobile manner. Since mobile devices come in a variety of purposes and properties and in different communication mechanisms, a portable software platform and a flexible and extensible networking supports need to be considered. Java, specifically Java Micro Edition (JME), is particularly an attractive development environment that suits the purpose. This paper discusses a research project of a Java-based smart mobile application. The application, a client/server based application, is designed using JME. It allows the built application to be deployed on any client devices and access to a large variety of network services on the server side. The open source database.

Article Title: Green Design Technology of Chinese Automobile Industry during Independence Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: automobile industry; independent innovation; green design technology
Abstract: With rapid development of automobile industry, it leads to increasingly serious pollution problem. Therefore, green design technology has become a hot research in recent years. Focusing on the issue, this paper discusses the current situation of Chinese automobile industry, analyzes the gained achievement on green design technology and compared with other developed countries in auto industry. The results show that there is a great gap compared with those countries. Based on this situation, Chinese enterprises should use resource integration approaches to attract external resources and thereby form their own core competence, strengthen green design R&D, only through which we can develop our own national auto industry and realize independent innovation model.

Article Title: Has Undergraduate Students' Method of Access to Knowledge Changed Because of the Presence of Online Sources of Knowledge?
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Online Sources of Knowledge; Blog; Wikipedia; Yahoo! Knowledge
Keywords Plus: INTERNET; SATISFACTION; GRATIFICATIONS; LOYALTY; MEDIA; BLOG
Abstract: This study investigates how undergraduate students in Taiwan are using different sources of knowledge to augment and complement their study efforts because of the presence of online sources of knowledge. The three online sources of knowledge investigated are professional blogs, Wikipedia and Yahoo! Knowledge+ while the two traditional sources are books as well as newspaper & magazine. The factors considered include three motivational items (information richness, convenience and social networking), credibility, reliance and satisfaction. Book emerges. as the best source of knowledge in term of information richness and credibility. Online sources perform best in convenience and social networking. Undergraduate students rely heavily on Yahoo! Knowledge+, follows by book and professional blog. Professional blog combines the desired features of traditional and online sources of knowledge, hence making it a promising online source of knowledge. This research suggests instructors can set up professional blog to improve their effort to assist undergraduate students.

Article Title: Study on Technological Innovation Modes of IT Enterprises Based on the Technological Convergence
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: IT enterprises; innovation mode; technological convergence
Abstract: As the industrial boundary getting fuzzy, the phenomenon of technological convergence gets universal unprecedented. The new trend of competition in technological convergence compels enterprises to think over their strategies of product innovation. Based on redefining the concept of technological convergence, we set up two stage game models to analyze the three main innovation modes of technological convergence in IT enterprise, which are core technology sharing consortium, technology merger and acquisition, technology licensing. We also discuss how complementarities coefficient of technology, absorption coefficient of enterprise, spillover coefficient and innovation coefficient influence equilibrium investment of technology, investment of R&D, output and profit. And we also compare the equilibrium investment of technology, equilibrium cost of R&D, equilibrium output and equilibriums profit in the three innovative ways.

Article Title: Optimal Return Policy in Direct Selling Supply Chain
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: direct selling; competition; pricing; return policy; optimal model
Abstract: Nowadays, various merchandises can be bought via Internet and mailing. Direct selling has become an important supply chain mode. Although it generates profit for manufacturers and provides convenience for customers, the difficulty of physically inspecting the product exists. Therefore, return policy is a key factor to influence a customer's purchasing decision. There is a trade-off between cost due to more returned products and benefit due to more attractive refund policy. This paper develops a profit-maximization model and discusses e-tailer's optimal pricing and return policies with respect to certain market reaction parameters in a competitive e-business scenario. Furthermore, the impact of competing degree on e-tailer's profit is illustrated with a numerical example. It is also explained that how to influence the responsive sensitivity of company's return policy in a way of using marketing and operational strategies so as-to maximizing the e-tailer's profit. Finally, several future research directions are pointed out in the paper.
