Article Title: Study on the Problems and Countermeasures of Chinese Sports Industry's Operation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: sports industry; operation; concentration; countermeasures
Abstract: The operation of sports industry in China faces' many problems, such as unclear principal status, weak consciousness of operation of sports enterprises, shortage of sports agents, and low market concentration of sports industry, which is unfavorable. for scale operation. To solve these problems, the country should change the status of sports enterprises, cultivate qualified principal parts in sports industry, implement unbalance development strategy, enhance scale and concentration of sports industry, implement brand strategy, and promote sustainable development of the industry.

Article Title: Study on the Knowledge-based Parts Library Management System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: parts library; STEP; ISO13584; CAD; knowledge base
Abstract: Adopting information technology and modular design methods, this paper focuses on these problems in the process of using CAD systems under networked manufacturing environment in manufacturing enterprises, such as repeating design of parts, low reusing parts, low sharing resources of parts library, and information asymmetry. The design ideas are proposed, which are based on PLIB standards, STEP neutral files, knowledge base of design standards and design specifications. The knowledge-based parts library management system is developed, which comes to meet the requirements of centralized management of part information, introduces the knowledge base into parts library to improve the level of standardization, and meets the needs of sharing and reusing resources of parts library for enterprises under networked manufacturing environment. Besides, the system has laid a solid foundation for multi-collaboration.

Article Title: Quantitative Analysis on Contribution Rate of Technological Progress to China's Automobile Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technological progress; automobile industry; the contribution rate; quantitative analysis
Abstract: This paper analyzes the contribution rate of the technological progress to China's automobile industry and importance of technological progress to the development of China's automobile industry, applying Cobb- Douglas production function with cutting to sample of the original value in total production value, fixed assets and workers number of China's automobile industry in 1990-2007. This paper draw a conclusion that the contribution rate of technological progress to China's automobile industry is low but gradually growing.

Article Title: Adjustment in the Financial Strategy for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises against Financial Crisis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: small and medium-sized enterprises(SMEs); financial crisis; financial strategy; strategic adjustment
Abstract: This paper analyzes the current financial situation of SMEs and the impact of the international financial crisis on the financial strategy of SMEs, proposes the specific measures of financial strategic adjustment against financial crisis, including adjustment of the investment strategy, the financing strategy, the profit distribution strategy and the internal adjustment for the implementation of the financial strategy and so on, comes to the conclusion of countermeasures in the financial strategy of SMEs against the international financial crisis. Finally it points out that SMEs are not only related to the enterprises themselves but the development of the whole society, and call on widely social concern and support on this problem.

Article Title: Research on Electric Power Enterprise Development Based on the Financial Index Analysis of Electric Listed Companies
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: electric listed company; financial target; influencing factors; development proposal
Abstract: China is the second largest electricity consumer in the world. In China, the electric power is not only basic industry, but also public utilities. This paper uses several important financial indexes to carry out a deep analysis of the solvency, profit ability, growth ability and the cost structure of the five major power generation groups' subsidiaries, explains the factors influencing the electric power enterprises' development; then we come to some conclusions that the electric listed companies have high asset-liability ratio and some over-expansion phenomenon, etc. Finally, in response to these problems, we put forward some corresponding countermeasures for the future development of electric listed companies.

Article Title: Using an Arabic ontology to improve the Q/A task
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Question/Answering; Query Expansion; Ontology; Arabic WordNet; Semantics; Morphology
Abstract: Users in an open environment such as the Web need advanced tools which make easier the access to the information. Question/Answering systems are new types of Information Retrieval (IR) systems. They reduce the effort to be done by users when searching for a precise answer to a question instead of a set of documents. In this paper, we describe our project of improving the Arabic Q/A task by using ontologies in the semantic Query Expansion (QE) approach that we propose. We present the steps that we followed in the preparation of our semantic resource and the experiments related to the evaluation stage as well.

Authors: Cao, CX; Ma, HY; Li, WC
Author Full Names: Cao Changxing; Ma Haiyan; Li Wenchuan
Article Title: Marketing Environment, Entrepreneurship and Rapid Internationalization of the Born Global
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: marketing environment; entrepreneurship; born global; rapid internationalization
Abstract: The Born Global (BG) is a business organization that, from inception, seeks to derive significant competitive advantage from the use of resources from and the sale of outputs to multiple countries. This study combines marketing environment and entrepreneurship to develop a general model of BG's rapid internationalization. The paper analyzes this model using a structure equation model approach, with 105 BGs in Pearl River Delta and Yangtze River Delta in China selected as the samples of this study. The results indicate that marketing environment positively affects entrepreneurship, and entrepreneurship has significant effect on BG's rapid internationalization, but marketing environment does not have direct impact on BG's rapid internationalization. Furthermore, our results provide evidence that entrepreneurship plays a mediating role between marketing environment and BG's rapid internationalization.

Authors: Chen, J; Huang, ZH; Liang, J
Author Full Names: Chen Jin; Huang Zu-hui; Liang Jing
Article Title: Innovation of Finance: the Application of Reverse Mortgage in China
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Reverse Mortgage; Senior Citizens; Aging Problem; The elderly homeowners; Pension via Mortgaged House; Financial Innovation
Abstract: China is now confronting the drastically emerging aging problem, which will greatly influence not only China to keep a healthful steady and sustainable development but also stability of the society. Among all of the ways of dealing with this problem, reverse mortgage won the greatest reputation, which is designed to cater the need of elder civilians. Reverse mortgage is a financial product which is intended for the elderly homeowners to improve the quality of their lives. Without the interruption to the operation of house consumption, the estate will be transferred into money to improve the quality of the elders' life. In this paper, we first present the fundamental definition of reverse mortgage, and then make systematic illustration of issues like the market demand of reverse mortgage, personal demand and characteristics of consumers, etc. Based on these, there comes the discussion about the adaptability, meaning, and condition, and how to run it with the hope to illuminate theoretical support and practical strategy for China.

Article Title: Influence Mechanism of Corporate Governance on High-Tech Companies' R&D Expenditure-Empirical Evidence from China
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Corporate governance; R&D expenditure; influence mechanism; High-Tech companies; policy
Abstract: The paper investigates the relationship between corporate governance and investment in R&D of High-Tech companies in China. It also analyzes the influence mechanisms of corporate governance on R&D expenditure, which include insider pattern and outside pattern. On the basis of the former research in the field of corporate governance and R&D expenditure, the paper explains three aspects about corporate governance and financing of investments in R&D: the nature of the principle, the extent of ownership and control, and characteristic of the board with their impact on R&D expenditure on the firm level. Based on the theoretical analysis above, we propose relative hypotheses and analyze the possible path that corporate governance works on R&D investment. In order to test the hypotheses above, we use the firm-level data and set up the statistical model to do the empirical analysis and get related results. And we conclude some useful implications for future corporation's performance and policy.

Article Title: Innovative Start-ups & Technology Transfer challenges in the context of Business Internationalization
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Start-up; Spin-off; Technology transfer; Business; Internationalization
Abstract: The paper work emphasizes the real contribution of innovative start-ups and technology transfer at the business/economy level and the importance of this process for the internationalization phenomenon. Also it is very important here the creation of a link between educational systems (universities spin-off) and economy as a beneficiary of innovation (new products and services) in all the sectors and especially in the technological one. The main point of this paper work consists in the study of the entrepreneurial process multiple dimensions, with accent on challenges that have to face the new technology- driven enterprises in the new knowledge economy international context.

Authors: Ilie, AG; Dumitriu, D; Sarbu, R; Colibasanu, OA
Author Full Names: Ilie, Anca Gabriela; Dumitriu, Dan; Sarbu, Roxana; Colibasanu, Oana Antonia
Article Title: From Resource Planning Technologies to Business Intelligence: Case Study of Implementing Business Intelligence Solutions in Romania
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Business Intelligence; Resource Planning Technologies; Information Technology; Enterprise Resource Planning
Abstract: The global business world has created incentives for information technology to develop and serve complicated tasks that companies' management sets. The paper focuses first on the evolution of the information technologies up to contemporary world of business intelligence (BI) applications, providing a clear background of the main steps in BI history. The research then looks upon the challenges of implementing BI technologies in companies and analyzes Romania's situation. Conclusions refer to the way BI helps the business community in general, in the world today with an emphasis of the main trends of BI sector in Romania. Main trends of economic developments of the Romanian industries are also considered when forecasting the dynamics of BI sector.

Article Title: Analysis on Incentive Distortion and Feedback Incentive of Salespersons
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Salesperson; Incentive Distortion; Feedback Incentive
Abstract: Incentive of salespersons is an important part of corporate incentive mechanism. This Article conducted analysis on incentive mechanism of salespersons based on systems thinking, and revealed that the causes of incentive distortion of salespersons lies in feedback function between various sub-systems of salespersons' incentive mechanism operating system, and proposed to effectively devise incentive measures and control salespersons' incentive distortion by feedback incentive method.

Authors: Jin, Y; Zhang, Y; Xie, BZ
Author Full Names: Jin Yao; Zhang Yu; Xie Baozhu
Article Title: A New Fabric-weave Design Method Based on Algebraic Operation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: fabric weave; algebraic operation; group; permutation; superposition
Abstract: This paper introduces the mathematical concept of 'group' into fabric weave and presents a new fabric weave design method by algebraic operation principle. Firstly, on the basis of set theory and mapping relationship between the set of weft float serial numbers and the set of warp float serial numbers, it utilizes 'permutation' method to define fabric weave, and builds its mathematical model by group theory. Then, it defines multiplication operation and superposition operation between weaves, and investigates a method for design new weaves by these two algebraic operators. Finally, it discusses the method with some examples of application. The method explores a new digital way to represent and design fabric weave.

Author Full Names: Lai, Cora Sio Kuan; Pires, Guilherme
Article Title: Towards a Model of Macao's E-Government Portal Adoption
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-government portal; adoption; satisfaction
Abstract: Electronic government is an information system (IS) that uses information and communication technology to improve public administration efficiency and policy effectiveness, to increase the convenience, performance and accessibility of government services to internal and external users. This research tests an integrated model of e-Government satisfaction that incorporates constructs from the technology acceptance model (TAM) and end-user satisfaction (EUS). The model explains a large proportion of the variance in citizen's intention-to-reuse Macao's e-Government portal. Empirical results support the hypothesis that satisfaction with the e-Government portal partially mediates the relationship between success factors and intention-to-reuse the portal. Information quality, system quality and social influence (but not perceived effectiveness) were confirmed as determinants of the adoption of, and satisfaction with Macao's e-Government portal.

Article Title: Management Synergy Research On Customer Demand-Oriented Supply Chain
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: management synergy; supply chain; customer demand; advantage
Abstract: Management synergy is aimed at the realization of the whole function effect of the system. To the organization of supply chain, management synergy of supply chain means the effective use and integration of the overall supply chain resources, enhancing competitiveness and achieving the maximization of common interest. So it becomes the most realistic model of the supply chain management. This paper introduces the basic principles of supply chain synergy, summarizes the main advantages, analyzes the impact of customer demand on supply chain synergy, builds the supply chain synergic model, explores the method of implement of management synergy on customer-oriented supply chain and draws a conclusion that supply chain synergy is an effective way to win market and improve the competitiveness of enterprises.

Article Title: A Study on the Integration of Product Innovation and Service Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product innovation; service innovation; innovation integration; innovation management maturity
Abstract: In this paper, we discuss how companies make the transition to integrate products and services. There are four stages of service management maturity. Each stage adds higher levels of service, provides more sophisticated solutions, and generates more attractive margins. To match these higher stages of service maturity requires expanding your value proposition beyond existing products to provide customers with solutions that include integrated products and services. You also need to fuse technology and business model innovation by organizing and allocating the appropriate resources. Finally, you need to develop robust partnerships to support the enhanced customer value proposition.

Article Title: Analysis of Corporate Environmental Reports using Statistical Techniques and Data Mining
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Environmental Report; GRI; statistical analysis; data mining and quantitative analysis
Abstract: Measuring the effectiveness of corporate environmental reports, it being highly qualitative and less regulated, is often considered as a daunting task. The task becomes more complex if comparisons are to be performed. This study is undertaken to overcome the physical verification problems by implementing data mining technique. It further explores on the effectiveness by performing exploratory analysis and structural equation model to bring out the significant linkages between the selected 10 variables. Samples of 539 reports across various countries are used from an international directory to perform the statistical analysis like - One way ANOVA (Analysis of Variance), MDA (Multivariate Discriminant Analysis) and SEM (Structural Equation Modeling). The results indicate the significant differences among the various types of industries in their environmental reporting, and the exploratory factors like stakeholder, organization strategy and industrial oriented factors, proved significant. The major accomplishment is that the findings correlate with the conceptual frame work of GRI.

Article Title: THE ERGONOMICS OF THE EDUCATIONAL VIRTUAL SPACE USED IN ENGINEERING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In an educational virtual space/environment, different people cooperate in order to achieve the objectives of an elearning programme. The educational virtual space is a substitute of the traditional class, involving a real teacher and instructional materials used in the teaming process, The teaming process is a mental and complex process, which is still being deliberated. Ergonomics is the science that studies the impact of the environment over humans. In the virtual spaces designed for the teaming process, there take place complex, difficult to control activities. So, ergonomics plays a major role in the rated capacity of the elearning process. In this paper, the authors debate the problem of the educational virtual spaces' ergonomics, especially in the field of the engineering sciences. Considering the ergonomic rules of working on the Internet, the authors discuss the aspects of the ergonomic criteria for designing educational sites, as well as the benefits of the ergonomic interfaces. They also present a prototype site developed to teach the discipline Computer Graphics.

Article Title: Research on Humanized Design and Personalized Design in Product Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; humanized design; personalized design
Abstract: With the development of diversified Information era, product innovation has been applied to humanized design and personalized design. Designers are seeking design elements that will represent the grade and using characteristic product to express their care of people themselves. This paper researches on the development and position of humanized design in product innovation, it is illustrated that innovative design is not only the process of in which designers develop imaginations and techniques, but also the process of communication between designers and customers. Designers should give full consideration of the consumer's. aesthetic demand and psychological factors, to satisfy the user's material and spiritual needs as much as possible, and under this premise, the personality and style must be integrated into the product design, they play a guiding role in product innovation, improve the product attractiveness and the core competitiveness of enterprises, and change the way of people life, promote the sound development of society.

Authors: Sun, M; Zhang, QS; Sharina, L
Author Full Names: Sun Min; Zhang Qiusheng; Sharina, Liu
Article Title: China Railway Restructuring: the Definition of the Stakeholder
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: China railway; restructuring; stakeholders
Abstract: The management system of China railway is still under the combined control of government and enterprise, even though the worldwide reformation and restructuring of railways have been carrying on for decades, and the reorganization of other domestic transport, i.e. roads and aviation, have been completed. It is worthwhile to make a thorough investigation on the factors that cause difficulties in the market-oriented process of China railway industry. This paper investigates on the restructuring of the management system of China railway from a new perspective, with the expectation of providing valuable ideas to China railway restructuring. Analyzing from the viewpoint of stakeholders, and researching with specialized questionnaire, this paper concludes that the key factor of China railway restructuring is not the mode itself, but the benefit balance among stakeholders. This benefit balance should be recognized reasonably among different types of stakeholders, instead of being allocated equally by all entities.

Article Title: Environmental Protection Domain Modelling
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: environmental ontology; Protege; object oriented method; UML
Abstract: In this paper the authors propose two methods for environmental protection domain modelling. First method, the ontology, belongs to the artificial intelligence field and the second, Unified Modeling language, is taken from the object oriented modelling methods domain. Initially, the authors present, briefly, the ontology and the model concepts and, then define de Unified Modeling Language. Forwards, they are comparatively analyzed the Prot g Environment used at the ontology design and the Unified Modeling Language. Finally, they are presented the two solutions for interest domain modelling.

Article Title: Business Process Modeling Based On Norm Analysis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: business process; norm; norm analysis; UML; business rule
Abstract: Though diligent efforts made by the software engineering community, the failure of software projects keeps increasing at an alarming rate. After two decades of this problem reoccurring, one of the leading causes for the high failure rate is still poor process modeling and requirements' specification. Therefore both researchers and practitioners recognize the importance of business process modeling in understanding and designing accurate information systems. However, it lacks a clear ontology of the business model. This paper aims at discussing business process modeling and improvement as an essential work to create a successful and competitive enterprise. To achieve this goal, we use a methodology called norm analysis linking with UML to capture the business process. And a case is used to demonstrate that the method provides an effective way to model business process rigorously and the exceptions also can be controlled and handled flexibility. Finally, we conclude its merits and challenge in the future.

Article Title: A Three Phase Idea Selection Approach for Team Creation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Creative problem solving; team creation; idea selection; idea generation; Support Vector Machine
Abstract: Team creation is a process of continually solving creative problems. Idea generation and idea evaluation are the most important phases in team creation. Now a great deal of research focuses on idea generation, while little research is about idea selection which is a daunting task to team members. We propose an approach to select the most appropriate idea stage by stage. Our approach is separated into three phases, in each phase different kinds of experts are involved and the most appropriate idea is selected until the last phase. In the first phase, ideas are classified into three classes which are ideas of low quality, misappropriate ideas and appropriate ideas. In this phase appropriate ideas are selected. In the second phase appropriate ideas are comprehensively evaluated according to team task, some ideas are selected according to all criteria or some specific criteria. In the third phase experts discuss about ideas selected in the second phase, and make the final decision.

Article Title: Research on the Sustainable Development of the Collective Economy during the Reconstruction of Urban Villages
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: reconstruction of urban villages; collective economy; sustainable development
Abstract: In the process of urbanization, the contradiction between the expansion of collective economy of urban villages and the process of urbanization is becoming increasingly acute in China, which is gradually changing into restraining factors in the development of urbanization. Based on the analysis of the dilemma in the development of collective economy of urban villages, this paper stresses the importance of sustainable development of collective economy and puts forward four strategies aiming at improving urban villages.

Article Title: A Study of Constructing Defected Product Recall Early Warning System for Enterprise
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: defected product; defected product recall management (DPRM); early warning system; constructing methods
Abstract: Defected product incidents happened in these years not only disturbed the market order, but also negatively influenced the life and property of consumers, worse still, it brought about great damage to the development of harmonious society. Weakly-constructed early warning system is a common problem faced with domestic enterprises today when implementing Defected Product Recall Management (DPRM). In order to solve this problem, we puts forward Defected Product Recall (DPR) early warning process framework, analyzes the major components of DPR early warning system, and indicates the key points in constructing this system in this paper. The construction methods proposed here will help domestic enterprises to prevent and identify defected products in the first time, reduce recall costs on a large scale, and make reasonable recall decision.

Article Title: On the Construction and Practice of Regional Enterprise Innovation Network
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: enterprise; high technology; innovation network; industry
Abstract: In recent years, with the science and technology progress and the rapid development of economic globalization, the world economy has started the industry structure adjustment with large range, deep degree and fast speed and the research and development globalization has provided opportunities for the enterprises in the developing countries to make use of external resources and take part in the technical cooperation and innovation. However, the enterprises in the developing countries face increasingly complex technology development due to their own weakness in the aspects such as fund, scale and policies and need more and more broad cooperation in the face of the global competition. The relevant research results of enterprise innovation network in recent years are summarized in this dissertation and the construction of regional enterprise innovation network is brought forward based on the innovation network operation mode and frame to drive the enterprises to learn and communicate externally, understand knowledge and technology as well as grasp the method of judging market and technology changes and finally improve the use efficiency of enterprise innovation factors and enhance the enterprise innovation efficiency and capability. With the FDI-driven high-tech enterprise innovation network in Pudong of Shanghai of China as an example, the experiences of regional enterprise innovation network in the developing countries are also analyzed in this dissertation to enrich the innovation network theory with Chinese characteristics and improve the regional innovation capability of developing countries.

Article Title: Short Time Correction to Mean Variance Analysis in an Optimized Two-Stock Portfolio
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Mean variance analysis; Conservative strategy; Portfolio management; Short term correction
Abstract: The effect of short time correlation in stock prices on a two-stock portfolio under the framework of Mean Variance Analysis is investigated. The theory of Markowitz on portfolio management, based on a long time scale analysis of return and variance, is first optimized over a selection of pair of stocks from the Hang Seng Index and then corrected by the return of short time scales of the stocks. Several choices of short time returns, from 1 to 5 days in the past, are studied. The cumulative return is highest when the returns of the two-stock portfolio in the past 2 days are included in the correction to the modified Sharpe ratio. The testing data cover the period between Jan 10, 2007 and July 21, 2009 for 24 blue chip stocks from the Hang Seng Index. The strategy is compared to the average return of these 24 stocks as well as to the Hang Seng Index in the same period. We conclude that our strategy has a positive return over most of the days of the testing period, including a very stable positive performance in the period of market crash. The variation of the cumulative return of our strategy is less than both the average returns of the chosen stocks or the Hang Seng Index, thereby providing a portfolio with a smaller risk but still attractive return. This strategy of time dependent mean variance analysis to include both the long and short time scale data appears to be a good investment scheme for conservative investors who prefer stable return even during market downturn.

Article Title: Analysis Study of Culture's Impact on E-Readiness Assessments in Developing Countries
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Culture; E-Readiness; Information and Communication Ttechnology (ICT)
Abstract: Nowadays the world is witnessing huge and rapid developments in Information and Communication Technology [ICT] systems which can affect all aspects of our daily lives. Therefore, no country in the world can live in an environment isolated from the rest of the world. This paper aims to review some of the existing cultural factors, to identify their impact on the e-readiness process in the Developing Countries, and to discuss to what extent they can really fulfill their intention in acting and helping to build blocks of an e-readiness assessment framework as guiding tools in the successful introduction and implementation of eReadiness. Based on this discussion, the paper presents these blocks - categorized into eight factors which cover some important cultural issues that should he addressed when setting an appraisal framework of eReadiness success in Saudi Arabia as developing County. These factors ware designed to seek information related to the influence of Saudi culture on the adoption of ICT systems. Eight questions sought information related to business language, communication language, culture and ICT R&D, support of the Saudi Arabia government of production development, consistency of Internet with local culture, openness of the culture of the country to foreign influence, the impact of employees' culture on their work, ICT and the protection of Saudi culture. Researchers are conducting survey and 30 interviews to collect data for this study. Descriptive statistical methods are used to find the means, percentages to find the differences between the public and private sectors.

Article Title: IT Project Portfolio Management as Critical Success Factor for IT Innovations
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: IT Innovations; IT Project Portfolio Management
Abstract: Nowadays companies are in worldwide competition for innovations which are essential to ensure their competitiveness and consequently their business success. Information Technology (IT) plays an important role in this context. IT organisations have to generate own innovations and thus contribute to fulfill the confronted challenges. The alignment of an IT organisation according to these requirements can be influenced by several control objects. One decisive control object is the IT project portfolio. By an efficient management of this portfolio, IT organisations can help establish a more innovative company. Therefore, this research paper points out the significance of the IT project portfolio management for the generation of IT innovations.

Article Title: Analysis of Credit Investigation Products Based on Transaction Cost Theory

Author Keywords: credit investigation product; transaction costs; economic utility; function analysis
Abstract: Credit investigation product is an important product to reduce transaction costs. This paper study it based on transaction cost theory. In this paper, the mathematical reasoning method is used to build the benefits function model of credit investigation products. It believe that under the three different credit investigation states, the effectiveness of banking and community brought by credit investigation products is different. It concludes that the appearance of credit investigation products not only reduces transaction costs, but also increases economic benefits of banks and community.

Article Title: REFORMING THE ENGINEERING AND DESIGN COURSE FOR THE FIRST YEAR ENGINEERING STUDENTS: WITH OR WITHOUT CAD
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Rapid growth of electronic information technology has a major impact on the content, delivery, and role of engineering graphics. Changes in engineering education are inevitable, and require the incorporation of innovative activities This paper presents an experiment of applying computer graphics, virtual reality, and Internet resources in the teaching of technical graphics in engineering and design courses at the University of Windsor, Canada, and Lucian Blaga University, Romania Our motivation was the fact that most of the students have a lack of previous knowledge on the basis of drawings, resulting in difficulties in both understanding and visualizing technical drawings As an experimental method, we have introduced software for enhancing visualisation, solid modelling, and design-build projects, in addition to regular pencil-and-paper drawings. To better support learning, we also provided a website with animations and virtual reality resources. This experiment is intended to improve the learning in a way that motivates the students. Classes and the course website were designed to take advantage of computers' interactivity, and animated resources.

Abstract: There is an important transition from analytical paradigm to systematic paradigm in the method of research on enterprise innovation management which adopts a wholly thought on technological innovation. As a new trend of system theory, self-organization theory focuses on the study of the mechanism, condition and law of system evolving from disorderly to orderly and low to high stages This paper thinks that enterprise technological innovation competence system is a self-organizing system,. The innovative points of the paper is that based on the definition of material innovation competence, product innovation competence, craft innovation competence, method innovation competence and management innovation, the enterprise technological innovation competence 5strength dimension structural model has been discussed to establish the self-organizing mechanism of enterprise technological innovation competence system.

Article Title: The Research of Value Chain Operation Model in E-Commerce
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: E-commerce; Value chain; reconstruction; Operation model; competitive ability
Abstract: With the rapid development of computer network technology and information technology, E-commerce emerged as the times require and it has gradually become the main operation model of the world economy. In the new business model, the external and internal condition of enterprises have happened fundamental change, this has had a profound impact on value chain model of traditional business, and it has given a challenge for enterprises' competitive ability. In order to survive and develop in the fierce market competition, enterprises must reconstruct their value chain to adapt the new business model. Base on Porter's value chain, this paper analyzes the defects of traditional enterprises' value chain and the impacts on enterprises' value chain by E-commerce, then put forward a new value chain operation model in E-commerce environment, which can meet enterprises development needs in the new era and enhance their competitive advantages, finally puts forward some suggestions for the transform of value chain into E-commerce value chain.

Article Title: Research on the Relationship between Tacit Knowledge Management and Dynamic Core Capacity: Theoretical Model and Explanation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: tacit knowledge; dynamic capacity; knowledge management
Abstract: This paper deepens the definition of tacit knowledge and dynamic core capacity through literature research, analyzes the connotations and characteristics between tacit knowledge and enterprises' dynamic core capacity, clarifies their relationship, and points out that tacit knowledge is the ultimate source of dynamic core capacity. The article sets up a theoretical model of dynamic core capacity, and uses the model to analyze how dynamic core capacity comes into being. A case study of Qirui Automobile Company proves that dynamic core capacity to great extent depends on tacit knowledge and its utilization of the company.

Article Title: Analysis on Issue between Energy Security and Future Economy
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: energy consumption; economic growth; energy security
Abstract: Because of the energy shortage, especially the petroleum shortage, energy policy became an important part of the political, economic and diplomatic policies in every country. Energy drives economy, and constrains scale and speed of economy. Energy security is critical to future economy. Establishing the energy strategy, taking the effective measures and decreasing the restriction from energy shortage may lead to the persistent economic growth. To improve the environment of energy, to create multichannel for importing petroleum, to distinguishingly restrict industry development that consumes excessive quantities of energy and resources and to promote the development of new energy economics should be our current acceptable strategic countermeasures.

Article Title: The Mode Change of Chinese Mobile Marketing
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: mobile marketing; marketing change; wireless marketing; mobile commerce; site redirection; dual-mode site; Chinese marketing; marketing model
Abstract: This article critically reviews development process in Chinese marketing, and evaluates the characteristics in each marketing stage, argues that every marketing ways increasingly rely on the advancement of technology. The requirement of enterprise mobile marketing, developments of marketing platform, architectures of mobile marketing platform, and other hot issues are also discussed. Specifically, we look at the principle and method of website redirection technology and dual-mode e-commerce websites to promote the efficiency of mobile marketing systems, and solve the problem of building dual domain names and content for traditional marketing and mobile marketing. Statistical investigation showed that the development of mobile systems and wireless marketing systems was very quickly in China, so that the breakthrough of new mobile marketing model in the Chinese marketing field will become an important change of marketing, and is an innovation in the marketing field. Research results also showed that the mode change of Chinese mobile marketing may experience three stages. The first is the changes in the form of marketing. The second is the transformation of the enterprises' growth mode. The third is the breakthrough of entire value chain. Then the core competitiveness of Chinese enterprises will be enhanced.

Authors: Lascu, AE; Negulescu, S; Cioca, M; Zerbes, M
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV

Article Title: INTERFACE AGENTS AS VIRTUAL TUTORS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: Interface Agents; Computer Persuasiveness; Digital Ethics; Virtual Tutor; Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
Abstract: Interface agents are parts of Computer programs that, in general, offer dedicated assistance to users with their computer-based tasks but they can be also used for teaching as presented in this paper. Most interface agents are designed to customize themselves by learning from the interaction with the user and by creating the user profile. In this paper we present an experimental model of an interface agent intended as a virtual tutor. After a brief introduction of the approached topics, the history and related work are presented in section 2. The rational and approach section describes the way in which such interface agents can be implemented by taking into account also the digital ethics and captology (computer/agent persuasiveness) aspects. Subsequently the next section presents a possible (still experimental) model for a virtual tutor. Conclusions and future work are closing the paper. On short, this paper aims at showing how a virtual tutor can help students in the process of learning and the benefits from this human-computer interaction.

Article Title: Institution Innovation for Land Acquisition in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: project-affected persons(PAPs); land acquisition; non-monetary compensation
Abstract: This paper analyzes the various factors affecting the satisfaction level of project-affected persons during the process of land requisition. The results demonstrate that, besides the monetary compensation, non-monetary compensation such as opportunities of business, agricultural development, living conditions after demolition and environment of resettlement are all important factors. In a word, as a non-market compensation country, in order not to reduce the satisfaction level of PAPs, both monetary and non-monetary compensation should be attached great importance.

Article Title: COLLABORATIVE DIMENSIONS OF TEACHER EDUCATION FOR SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Pivotal to every political discourse on development, the idea that investments in knowledgeable human resources go hand in hand with economic performance and competitiveness places the education of teachers at the core of any attempt to reform and develop educational systems and explains the emphasis on the importance that a highly trained, theoretically informed and pedagogically agentic teaching working force is invested with In this paper the focus is on exploring the implications of collaboration as both learning strategy (pedagogical tool) and ethos for teacher education within distinct systems of activity located in two programs of pre-service teacher education aiming at training teachers for science and engineering, both set up as inter-institutional partnerships between university and school but located in different socio-cultural settings. one in Romania the other in England The paper presents the results of a comparative analysis between the two systems of activity pursued with the analytical tools provided by the cultural historical activity theory (CHAT).

Author Full Names: Magutu, Peterson Obara; Ongeri, Richard Nyaanga; Mwangi, Haron
Article Title: Modeling the Effects of E-Commerce Adoption On Business Process Management: Case Study of Commercial Banks in Kenya
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-Business; Business Process Management and Commercial Banks
Abstract: The general objective of this study was to model the effects of e-commerce adoption on business process management. This was a census study on modeling the effects of e-commerce adoption on business process management in commercial banks in Kenya. Out of the sixty (60) respondents to whom the questionnaires were administered, only forty-one (41) responded. This gave a response rate of 68.33% percent. It was found that the commercial banks in Kenya have Formalized Policy on E-Commerce and Internal Business Process Management. Also to a great extent the banks have focused their e-business activities on collaborating with business partners using ICT; provision of other on-line and e-services, including e-marketing and advertising; supply chain management using intranet; and on-line buying (interne). Lastly, e-commerce is the complete set of processes that support commercial business activities on a network. The major effects of e-commerce on banks business process management are it has improved the image of the bank; besides profit making the bank have actively engaging themselves for the good of the effective business process management.

Article Title: Research on Investment Decision of Enterprise's On-the-Job Training Based on Cost-benefit Analysis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: on-job training; cost; income; decision
Abstract: In this paper, on-the-job training is considered as a kind of enterprise investment. The cost and income of enterprise's on-the-job training has been recognized and measured with the method of cost-benefit analysis, and then the internal benefits rate of on-the-job training can be got. On this basis, the investment decision model is built and investment decision is analyzed. It is concluded that the economic boundary of enterprise's on-the-job training is that the total present value is no less than the actual costs.

Article Title: Does Organizational Culture Influence Technological Innovation with Organizational Commitment as An Intermediary?
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: transformational leadership; organizational commitment; technological innovation
Abstract: Organizational culture plays an important role in technological innovation. The culture of effective organization has four components, namely involvement, consistency, adaptability and mission. This paper applies the structural equation model to examine the link between the four components of organizational culture and organizational commitment and technological innovation for firms operating in China. The results are as follows: (1) the involvement component of organizational culture had a significant and positive effect on organizational commitment, and indirectly influenced technological innovation with organizational commitment as an partial intermediary; (2) the consistency component of organizational culture had a significant and positive effect on organizational commitment, and indirectly had a significant and positive effect on technological innovation with organizational commitment as a complete intermediary; (3) the adaptability component of organizational culture had a significant and positive effect on organizational commitment, and indirectly influenced technological innovation with organizational commitment as an partial intermediary; (4) the mission component of organizational culture directly had a positive but not significant effect on organizational commitment, and indirectly did not influence technological innovation with organizational commitment as an intermediary.

Authors: Oprean, C; Kifor, CV; Negulescu, SC; Barbat, BE
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Oprean, Constantin; Kifor, Claudiu V.; Negulescu, Sorin C.; Barbat, Boldur E.
Article Title: INNOVATING ENGINEERING EDUCATION, TO FACE THE KNOWLEDGE SOCIETY
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paper develops its title, explaining it in reverse order. Since the onset of the Knowledge Society is inescapable, whereas its details are yet fuzzy, the approach is pragmatic: the starting point is based on the general framework of the Lisbon objectives filtered through the contextual expectations of a Romanian university. On this groundwork, the paper core elaborates on diverse meanings of to face in an almost chronological order: admit, be in front of, cope with. Then, a contentious issue is dealt with - as less biased as possible: Engineering Education is regarded as the area where a paradigm shift is both more influential and more urgent. Hence, Innovating is considered not just a means, it becomes a must. Among the conclusions: a) Universities should start a critical - but not hasty - revolution towards Life-Long Learning. (Because this problem involves moving the focus from managerial-strategic aspects to academic-tactical ones, the authors tackle the topic in a related paper.) b) To be affordable here and now, such a vital shift is beyond the reach of both traditional solutions and local approaches. Thus, the paper ends with specific proposals to boost regional cooperation aiming at the very words in its title.

Article Title: A Study of Interaction between Design Innovation and Intellectual Property
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: intellectual property; design innovation; lead; policy
Abstract: This paper starts from both Chinese basic condition and analyze on Chinese present industry. The result is that the design ability should be valued if China intends to become a real world factory. Meanwhile, when we emphasize on the improvement of design ability, industry producing shouldn't be ignored. To achieve the goal of improving design ability, the respect of intellectual property from both companies and individuals should be brought up. For example, shorten the application time and reduce financial cost on applying for patent; improve the maintain fee; provide government allowance on patent expense in developing regions. After this adjustment has been achieved, the attitude of companies and individuals on intellectual property will change from being forced to self-conscious and the well-interaction can form in this way. By this means, a world factory with high quality and quantity could be founded which will devote to world economy development,

Article Title: Information Technologies in the Calm Technologies Era
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: Information and communication technologies met a culminant evolution even since they appeared, with major achievements that became established in various fields of activity. Currently, one can notice an increased tendency to upgrade from classic computers to other types of equipment, much smaller in size, able to perform similar functions, such as FDA's or mobile phones. Also, the expansion of wireless communication technologies allows the access to Internet and to users' permanent interconnection. Therefore, a normal desire of human beings is developed, that of using miniaturized equipment, with no less performance, capable to ensure access to various information sources and to support communication. This tendency will result in the transition towards a new evolution stage of the IT&C, known as the calm technologies era. This study is intended to seize the main stages, characteristics and conditions that the technological evolution should pursuit and fulfil in order to ensure the success of calm technologies and, at the same time, to optimize users' economic and social life.

Author Full Names: Tugui, Alexandru; Georgescu, Iuliana; Georgescu, Mircea-Radu; Genete, Laura-Diana
Article Title: Digital Accounting Implications to Improve the Quality Information Accounting
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Digital economy; Digital accounting; Accounting; Knowledge; TQM; TQA
Abstract: The specialty literature ([3], [2]) speaks much about a so-called digital revolution, which will sweep away the tangible limits imposed to industrial economy. As any other revolution, the digital one radically influences all the aspects of our daily life, both at the micro- and macro-economic level. In any society, accounting plays an extremely important social role, as it allows the quantification of some economic processes and phenomena and it provides information to interested users. Therefore, as an information system with an extremely important social role, accounting must adapt to parameters specific to digital economy where it will be active. The specialty literature ([4], [10]) defines for the digital economy the so-called digital accounting, which, in our opinion, will lead to an improved quality of the accounting information, as a result of the wide acceptance of the information technologies, which will improve the procedures used by accounting in fulfilling its function. The purpose of this study is to emphasize the qualitative leap regarding the quality of accounting information in the future digital economy.

Abstract: this paper provided a new method to evaluate the priorities on location selection of the dry port. The factors that affect the facilities of the dry port were systematically analyzed and an evaluation model was built when considering the feed back and the relations between those factors. With the analytic Network Process, the dry port location is selected based on the index system in view of the factors. At the last the evaluated result is the same as the scheduling location selection of Tianjin Port's decision as before.

Article Title: Studies on Technology Innovation Model Selection of China Automobile Brands
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: automobile; own brand; technology innovation; model
Abstract: World automobile industry is facing fierce competition currently. In order to build up independent distinctions and advantages, China's auto brands are suggested to conduct technology innovation and to select a proper model conducive to enhance independent R&D capabilities, build own brands independently, have own voices in the technical area and boast leadership advantages in innovation. Thereafter China's auto brands can win the initiative to participate competition in the international market. This essay introduces technology innovation model of China's own car brands in three stages, and analyzes the key issues of car brands in technology innovation. The author furthermore illustrates four models for automobile technology innovation. Automakers can choose their own mode of technology innovation referring to their financial and scientific research competence.

Article Title: On Logical Framework for Trust Operation of Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: trust operation; logical framework; operating trust; trust culture
Abstract: Historically, China is not a nation lacking credibility. However, there is a serious honesty crisis nowadays disturbing the order of market economy. Trust is now one of the scarcest resources in China. If a kind of resources is scarce but very useful, those who own it and can make sound management of it will become successful. Based on previous studies, this article attempts to construct in a breakthrough way the multidimensional logical framework diagram for trust operation of enterprises, analyzes the relations between trust operation, corporate culture and operating trust, and probes into the law of developing trust operation from a unique perspective with innovative thinking by combining the experience of innovation and planning in medium and large sized enterprises these years. There is significant theoretical meaning and practical orientation values currently with fierce competition to understand these laws, guide the enterprise operators to study and master the trust operation approaches, and improve the awareness of trust operation among the personnel in the business world.

Article Title: Study on the Relativity between Technology Innovation Capability and Regional Industrial Structure
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technology innovation capability; industrial structure; relativity; empirical study
Abstract: Applying Pearson mathematical model, we carry out comparative study on the correlation between China's technology innovation capability and regional industrial structure. Empirical results show that the improvement of technology innovation capability of the eastern region is conducive to the development of the tertiary industry; the relativity between technology innovation capability and the secondary & tertiary industry in the central region is the most significant; in the western region, the relativity between technology innovation capability and the three industries is also significant; the optimization of the industrial structure of the northeastern region plays a strong role to promote regional technology innovation capability. The research conclusion shows that the promotion of regional technology innovation capability can promote the development of the tertiary industry, in turn, the optimization of the tertiary industry structure will improve the whole regional technology innovation capability.

Article Title: Comprehensive Analysis of Information Transmission Among Agents: Similarity and Heterogeneity of Collective Behavior
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Bipartite graph; Degree centrality; Shannon entropies; Kullback-Leibler divergence; Jensen-Shannon divergence; Foreign exchange market
Abstract: Recent development of Information and Communication Technology enables us to collect and store data on human activities both circumstantially and comprehensively. In such circumstances it is necessary to consider trade-off between personal privacy and public utility. In the present article I discuss methods to quantify comprehensive states of human activities without private information and propose a measure to characterize global states of societies from a holistic point of view based on an information-theoretic methodology. By means of the proposed method I investigate participants' states of the foreign exchange market during the period of the recent financial crisis which started around the middle of 2008. The results show that drastic changes of market states frequently occurred at the foreign exchange market during the period of global financial crisis starting from 2008.

Article Title: Learning Backward Induction: A Neural Network Agent Approach
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Agent based computational economics; Backward induction; Learning models; Behavioral game theory; Simulations; Complex adaptive systems; Artificial intelligence; Neural networks
Abstract: This paper addresses the question of whether neural networks (NNs), a realistic cognitive model of human information processing, can learn to backward induce in a two-stage game with a unique subgame-perfect Nash equilibrium. The NNs were found to predict the Nash equilibrium approximately 70% of the time in new games. Similarly to humans, the neural network agents are also found to suffer from subgame and truncation inconsistency, supporting the contention that they are appropriate models of general learning in humans. The agents were found to behave in a bounded rational manner as a result of the endogenous emergence of decision heuristics.

Article Title: IMPLEMENTING INNOVATION IN THE ENGINEERING TERTIARY EDUCATION - ON FOREIGN LANGUAGE LEARNING AND USING STRATEGIES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The educational context we are moving in is characterized by features that have lately emerged, thus inaugurating a necessary era of change. As educational actors, teachers should adopt an attitude of reflectivity and incessant search for answers, providing support to learners in understanding the contemporary period's dynamism. At both institutional and personal level, we must all become adepts at learning, in order to reshape the current structures and processes, thus generating an educational framework able to flexibly give birth to its recurrent modifications. It is therefore imperative to follow the direction of learning about teaming throughout all societal constituents. The paper presents the empirical research of the author in the area of foreign language learning and using strategies. All the facets of the innovative component - that of creating and introducing a strategy awareness raising set of activities in an originally designed English for Computer Science module - are presented in some detail, including the tasks types, their rationale and a discussion of results

Article Title: Research on Identification of Industrial Customers' Demand Types Based on Fuzzy Clustering Method
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial customers; demand management; fuzzy clustering method
Abstract: In the industrial market, as a result of cryptic requirement of industrial customer and the complexity of the purchase process, it is difficult for the sellers to forecast and grasp accurately the customers' purchasing psychology and behaviors. In this paper, drawing on the basis of theoretical research results of the domestic and international scholars on customer's demands identification, it uses Fuzzy Clustering to analyze data of industrial customer's requirements and transforms the information into the matching suppliers' attributes category. As the basis above, the industrial customers' demands are divided into five basic types, and emphasis and differences of industrial customers of different types are explored.

Author Keywords: sustainable technological innovation; capability; institution structure; evaluation
Abstract: The enterprises that introduce new technical innovation projects continually can enhance the core competitive capability, and the innovation capability is the key factor to realize enterprise's sustainable technological innovation, so we need to study how to measure and evaluate enterprise's sustainable technological innovation capability. According to this, the paper design the model of enterprise's sustainable technological innovation capability, and take Yunnan Baiyao Group Ltd, Lenovo Group Ltd and Huawei Co Ltd as cases to analyze, finally arrive at the conclusion that institutional structure factors, especially entrepreneurs' management institution, technological innovation management institution and institutional environment play an important role in enhancing enterprise's sustainable technological innovation capability.

Visualizing the phenomena that take place at the molecular level brings forth a superior understanding and depth for the study. For visual arts students and not only, this is an efficient way of presenting the information. In this manner, the paper presents the 3D simulation of the reactions that occur in the tinctorial processes on fabric support - acid dyes.
