Article Title: The Strategic Concept of Spatial Development - Romanian Particularities
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: spatial development; territorial development; territorial amenities; synergic indexes
Abstract: The vision of the territorial development of Romania promote an aggregate of values and ideas of the urban and rural communities, aiming to facilitate exchange and understood among different social, cultural and economic groups and to attract new inhabitants, visitors and businesses. The objectives of the spatial strategy guide partnerships between public and private actors in developing investments for territorial amenities by ensuring equal access to infrastructure and knowledge, and for prudent management of the natural and cultural patrimony. Conditions for the strategy implementation are evaluated by the proposed synergic indexes, from the point of view of the funding sources, proposed for projects for capital and social investments, being structured according to the funding instruments of the European Union.

Article Title: Research on the Niche Construction and Evolutionary Dynamics Model of the E-Commerce Enterprise in the Cyber-society
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: NicheConstruction; Evolutionary Dynamics; E-Commerce Enterprise; Suitability; Momentum
Abstract: It is a new research to apply the thoughts, theories and methods of ecology to the research of enterprise management as the development of Bionics, and it hasn't developed a comprehensive theory system about the enterprise niche at home and abroad. According to the theory and method of the Evolutionary Dynamics and take the E-Commerce enterprise as the core, this paper studies the mechanism and mode of the niche construction systematically. It discloses the coordination evolution relationship between the E-Commerce enterprise and the environmental resource by constructing the space model of the niche construction dynamics model, the suitability model and the evolutionary momentum model of the niche construction and calculating relevant parameters. It also provides a new and effective quantitative method to research the reasonable evaluation and evolvement forecast of the E-Commerce enterprise in the cyber-society in order to develop correct development strategies and improve the enterprise competitive ability.

Article Title: The Strategy of Abandon in Design Management for New Media Game Industrial Production
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: design management; strategy of abandon; new media game
Abstract: Normally, people think that design is focusing on new ideas and new productions. The aim of our study was to determine that the strategy of abandon also enhances efficiency for accurate and effective design for new media game design and industrial production. Two groups participated in the study. One group only focused on creating new designs and other group cared about abandon a few parts of new design. Results suggest that design should be based on people's needs, even include human's nature weakness. Designers, business development and sales must meet the needs above. Once design is fitting to the corporate of the local needs, the design management will gain more profit from the balanced good design. The strategy of abandon is a kind of design management philosophy.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: High-tech zones; independent innovative capability; factor analysis; regression analysis
Abstract: This paper establishes a comprehensive evaluation index system of independent innovative capability of high-tech zones. By using factor analysis methods, independent innovative capability of 13 high-tech zones city of Jiangsu Province is anylyzed. A comparative study is carried out among the different high-tech zones to find out the reasons of the uneven development there by using regression analysis method and through testing of links between independent innovative capability and economic development. Finally, recommendations are given on how to develop high-tech zones.

Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: accounting standard; harmonization of accounting; China; France; Togoleselese
Abstract: France's financial accounting and reporting system has evolved over the last three hundred years in Togoleselese. In France or Togoleselese the Accounting standard could face different procedures while USA and UK accountants have to be found fraudulent to face the same transaction. Harmonization of accounting standards is challenge for Togoleselese. Based on innovation on Accounting Standard of France and Togoleselese has been analyzed and summarized under harmonization of IFRS. Furthermore, with the introduction of Accounting Standards for Business Enterprises (ASBEs) as the harmonization of accounting standards around the world in China, such as fair value is put forward.

Article Title: Electronic System of Remote Access to Medical Records Anytime Anywhere
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Electronic Health Records (EHRs) Systems; Wireless Networks
Abstract: The outcome of a study carried out to establish a system of storing and accessing a patient's medical record is presented. The system is designed to fulfil the need for General Practitioners (GPs) and hospitals to store and retrieve medical-record data electronically. A patient's medical history can be accessed at anytime anywhere via various communication technologies. This makes medical records available for viewing at different locations, so that a patient's record can go wherever medical treatment is offered (different hospital or different GP). The system provides both a better medical service for patients and convenience for medical staff. One of the major highlights of the system is its ability to allow communication through various means of information networks thereby facilitating global coverage, anywhere, anytime. The user will be able to access the electronic medical records and choose which telecommunication system offers greater reliability for a given time and place.

Abstract: Generically, media notion includes all public information sources, either are written (press - newspapers, periodicals; books like dictionaries for instance etc), audio (radio), audio-video (cinemas, television). In this context, the Internet (the NET), is as well a global means of communication, but at the same time represents a multitude of medias, meaning Multimedia The Internet represents a giant warehouse of information. The most important Internet service is the Web (www = World Wide Web); Web pages (hypertexts) and the connection between then as browser, offer possibilities, most difficult to quantify, of Multimedia in all domains, including business engineering and education. This paper presents the main structural elements of the www architecture, certain services and applications dedicated to business engineering and education

Article Title: COMMITMENT FOR EXCELLENCE APPROACH
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: While many organisations implement and certify their quality management systems accordingly to ISO 9001 requirements, the commitment for excellence (C2E) approach, followed by recognised for excellence and subsequently excellence award, has appeared as a sustainable and more deeply sound management system promoting continuous improvement and learning. The paper presents the self assessment approach as referenced to the excellence model criteria (in number of 32) of the European Foundation of Quality Management (EFQM) and explains how to progress from a classical ISO 9001 implementation phase to the first C2E step. The RADAR concept is explained and, based on a case study from the administration field, the improvement projects launching is detailed and main lessons learnt from their implementation presented.

Author Keywords: human resources; quality; evaluation; factor analysis
Abstract: In the process of the talent quality evaluation, a number of indicators are usually applied for analysis. But the indicators normally have certain relevance. How to use fewer indicators to reflect the fundamental of all the original information is the main point. This paper begins with the basic principles and models of the talent quality evaluation, and proposes the idea of using the factor analysis method in the corporate human resources evaluation to reduce of the negative impact from the related indicators.

Article Title: The Positive Research of the Relativities between Earnings Management and Board Characteristics-Evidence from Listed Companies of Hubei
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: earnings management; board of director of characteristics; listed companies
Abstract: Board of directors is a core of corporate governance. Resent researches have revealed the relation between characteristics of board of directors and earnings management. This paper examines four characteristics of board of directors' effectiveness by the method of logistic regression, such as size of board of directors, the proportion of directors' ownership and independent directors and annual meeting. The results show that size of board of the directors is positively associated with earnings management, and the proportion of the directors' ownership is negatively associated with it based on the data of listed firms in Hubei province. And annual meeting is negatively related to earnings management, while more independent directors in a firm can't limit earnings management.

Article Title: An Automated Mechanism for Negotiations in E-Commerce Systems
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: E-commerce; Autonomous Negotiations Agents; Negotiation Models
Abstract: Research in the domain of autonomous negotiation agents gains more and more attention due to the industry hype and momentum regarding e-commerce and e-markets. Negotiations have been identified as an advantageous coordination mechanism for the interaction of buyers and sellers in e-market that transcend the selling of commodities or uniform goods. Therefore, support for autonomous negotiations may become a critical success factor for e-commerce systems. This paper presents the taxonomy for autonomous negotiation agents in e-commerce systems. The taxonomy allows not only for the exact characterization and comparison of a broad variety of autonomous negotiation agents designs and systems, ranging from bilateral negotiation and multilateral negotiation, but could also lead towards a more structured approach for the design of autonomous negotiations.

Article Title: Project Marketing Implementation and Its Link with Project Management and Project Portfolio Management
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: This paper intends to propose a research attempting to contribute new knowledge to the field of project marketing and find a home in the realm of enterprise level management. We will discuss different worldviews adopted toward the field of project marketing. The first perspective corresponds to the approach taken by the group of project marketers and the second is that of the project managers. This paper will illustrate these differences as the recent developments in project management suggest a new way of thinking. This new approach recommends considering project management as a process instead of only a set of managerial actions. We will describe the nature of the purpose of both the worldviews and how they influence the definition of project and project marketing. Furthermore, the paper proposes a methodology to improve the understanding of project marketing and to contribute to the existing body of knowledge concerning the intersection and/or the interaction between marketing and project management.

Article Title: The Choice of Enterprise's Technological Innovation Strategy (TIS) Based on Knowledge Management Tactic
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge economy; knowledge management tactic; competitive strategy; technological innovation strategy
Abstract: This paper introduces the knowledge management (KM) tactic and its applied knowledge tools, discusses the competitive advantage corresponding to knowledge management tactic from the perspective of knowledge usage cost and knowledge differentiation. Furthermore, we analyze how to choice the enterprise's technological innovation strategy (TIS) based on knowledge management tactic from the technology innovation strategy corresponding to competitive strategies. And then we analyze the basis for choosing technological innovation strategies corresponding to different knowledge management tactics by applying knowledge tools. Enterprises should choose suitable TIS according to the development stages of knowledge management.

Article Title: BHR-GOMS Behavior Model's Innovative Study of Automobile Human-machine Interface
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: man-machine interface; behavior model; GOMS model
Abstract: The innovative studying of Behavior Model is the basis of analyzing operational behavior of products' users. Through analyzing the limitation and advantages of GOMS and its derived behavior models, this paper puts forward a behavior model which can be applied by human-machine interface designed products using cross study of psychology and research of users. It used task decomposition, gradually detailing and quantitative calculation methods to design and evaluate the man-machine interface. This paper also used the model to evaluate the performance of open and lock modes of the car door in different operations, and proved the accuracy of the model by case study of users and experiments.

Article Title: Study on the Risk Evaluation of Logistics Service Delivery System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: logistics service delivery system; risk; evaluation
Abstract: Logistics service delivery system is a medium to connect suppliers and consumers, as well as create value for them. However, some uncertain factors may weaken the value creation, and bring out risks. Based on the structure of logistics service delivery system, this paper establishes evaluation index system of logistics service delivery system which is constituted by 5 dimensions: dynamical subsystem risk, network subsystem risk, operation subsystem risk, service recovery subsystem risk and innovation subsystem risk. The method of integration of Fuzzy synthetic evaluation and AHP is adopted.

Author Full Names: Liu Xiaojun; Zhang Mi-er; Tian Dan
Article Title: Industrial Design Embedding Product Innovation and the Impact Analysis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial design; product innovation; technology integration; technological evolution
Abstract: As a tool of product differentiation, industrial design plays an important role in product innovation. Based on the empirical research of mobile phone patents, the development trend of the role of industrial design in technological evolution is analyzed. The study shows that the impact of industrial design on product innovation is not unconditional, but depends on technology evolution. Until the core technology is leveled-out, industrial design dominants product innovation. The established core technology is the key factor to make the industrial design play its role. Based technology integration, industrial design effectively incorporates with core technology. Industrial design has the advantage to fulfill the demand of segmented market. It is the differential product based on industrial design which supports enterprises to obtain competitive advantage.

Article Title: Mapping Rules Based Data Mining for Effective Decision Support Application
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: mapping rules; information granules; Fuzzy ART; decision support
Abstract: Due to the learning problem on skewed distribution of data sets, such as data sets of credit card fraud detection, which tend to produce poor predictive accuracy over the minority class by traditional machine learning algorithms, mapping rules based data mining approach (MRDMA) is proposed in this paper to make effective classification decision support on the minority class. NRDMA constructs suitable information granules (IGs) by fuzzy ART, and then hierarchical clustering analysis is employed to produce mapping rules from IGs to final classes. When new inputted data clustered to the IGs by continue on-line learning of fuzzy ART, the final class can soon be decided by the mapping rules. The experimental results show that MRDMA has better classification performance on skewed data sets than SVM and C4.5.

Article Title: Human Capital, Technology Change and the Development strategies of Agricultural Products Processing Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: human capital; technology advancement; agriculture products processing industry; development strategy
Abstract: The academic circle has paid much attention to the technology advancement of agricultural products processing industry (Referred to as agro-industry), whereas little effort has been made on the research of the human capital of agricultural products processing industry. This paper, with theories about human capital and technology advancement as its theoretical basis, analyzes the present conditions of technology advancement and human capital in the agricultural products processing industry. Secondly, based on expounding the complementary relation between human capital and technology advancement, both long-term and short-term development strategies have been put forward in the paper. Finally, the paper draws its conclusion: only when technology advancement is combined with high human capital can it turn to be a necessary and sufficient element for the development of China's agricultural products processing industry.

Article Title: HACCP STUDY AND VALIDATION BY QMSFSM FOR BREWING PROCESS - APPLICATION FOR TRAINING OF STUDENTS FROM FOOD TECHNOLOGIES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The Government of Romania by decision no. 924 of I I August 2005 concerning the approval of the general rules for food hygiene, published in the Official Gazette no. 804 of 5 September 2005, requires the implementation of the management system of food safety - HACCP (Hazard Analysis of Critical Control Points) for any organization in the food chain To achieve the HACCP Study the top management of the firm called by decision a team of food safety (TFS) The TFS must have a combination of multidisciplinary knowledge and experience in the development and implementation of food safety management (FSM). The TFS for the HACCP Study documents and implements a system procedure that meets the requirements 7.4, 7.6 and 7.7 included in the reference standard SR EN ISO 22 000.2005. This article will present, with the aim of training complex of students from Brewery technology discipline, an example of procedure for the HACCP study and QMSFSM (Quality Management System and Food Safety Management) validation for the brewing process, which should contain information on the list of flow diagrams, analysis and assessment of hazards, decision tree, HACCP plan, location plan, protocol validation of QMSFSM.

Article Title: Grey Correlation Analysis and Prediction of Leisure Consumption and Income
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Author Keywords: grey correlation analysis; grey prediction; income; leisure consumption
Abstract: This paper places emphasizes on the relation between leisure consumption and income from the view-of consumption structure. First, this research selects eight indexes concerned with consumption structure and studies relation between leisure consumption and income with the information of statistical data, by adopting grey correlation analysis. Second, on the basis of grey prediction, this paper builds prediction model, forecasting data of income and consumption from 2009 to 2013 and analyzes future trend of relation between leisure consumption and income.

Article Title: Research on Scientific and Technological Innovation Ability of University
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: S&T innovation ability; Data Envelope Analysis; efficiency; university
Abstract: Scientific and technological(S&T) innovation ability of university means the university turns input into output through S&T innovation activity. This study firstly established the input and output index system of university's S&T innovation, then carries on quantitative description and evaluation of input and output relation of university's S&T innovation ability by DEA, Based on cross sector and panel data, concludes that efficiency index of university's S&T innovation of each province and cities in China. The analysis based on panel data is rational because it can compare both parallel and longitudinal, and it reveals that university's S&T innovation efficiency of most of provinces and cities are insufficient in China. Finally, brings forward advices which can improve university's S&T innovation.

Article Title: Appropriate Marketing Strategies for Romanian SME for the Crisis Period
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: small and medium enterprises (SME); crisis period; entrepreneurial attitude; marketing strategy
Abstract: This paper presents new points of view of the marketing strategies for the Romanian small and medium enterprises (SME). Thus, our endeavor has focused over aspects such as: funding, investment opportunities, organizational culture. Support to SME has become a key priority for the Romanian government, they being important contributors to growth, competition and innovation and thus employment and the productivity of the Romanian economy as a whole. A SWOT analysis of the Romanian business medium in this crisis period is presented, representing a start-up of the proposed marketing strategies. Not the financial crisis, but a wrong marketing approach is the main risk for the Romanian SME.

Article Title: USING THE COST-EFFECTIVENESS ANALYSIS IN THE OPTIMAL SELECTION OF PRODUCTS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: This type of analysis is performed when the most convenient offer has to be selected out of a wide range of products having the same utility The model offered by decision trees is a useful tool for the accomplishment of the cost-effectiveness analysis. The most important stage of this approach is the one establishing criteria. sub-criteria and their weights in order to identify, analyze and describe the qualities this type of product has to present. Once this stage has been accomplished, we have to consider the cost of the products analysed. An important stage that can radically change the result of our analysis is the one establishing product costs out of a wide variety of offers by considering only the acquisition cost or the lifecycle cost for the type of product analysed. This study does not only present a software which makes it possible to perform such analyses and to automatically hierarchize offers by modifying the weights given to cost and benefit respectively, but also offers the possibility to perform a sensitivity analysis.

Article Title: Research on the Performance Evaluation Index System of Finance Supporting Agricultural Development
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: agriculture development; finance support; performance evaluation; innovation
Abstract: Relatively weak and low benefits of agriculture decide that its development need more financial support. But in recent years, commercial finance institutions have contracted substantial business departments in rural areas, policy-oriented finance support for agriculture tend to weak and the outflows of rural capital have restricted the development of agriculture and rural economic. In this paper, the performance evaluation indicators of finance support for agricultural development was designed, the performance of financial support for agricultural development in our country was evaluated by means of Analytic Hierarchy Process and Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation Method.

Article Title: Research on the Management System of the High-level Basketball Team in Chinese Universities
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: management system; high-level basketball team; Chinese universities
Abstract: The scientific management system is particularly important for basketball sports, which decides whether the basketball team can make success or not. This paper focuses on the main management factors of the high-level basketball team of Chinese universities, which can improve the level of basketball team, using the methods including literature analysis, questionnaire investigation and interview with experts etc. The results show that it is necessary to building management system for basketball team. At last, put forward corresponding countermeasure aimed the existing problems in the management system, in order to offer the theoretical foundation for perfecting the management system of the high-level basketball team of Chinese universities.

Authors: Al-Zayyat, AN; Al-Khaldi, F; Tadros, I; al-Edwan, G
Author Full Names: Al-Zayyat, Abdel Naser; Al-Khaldi, Firas; Tadros, Ibrahem; al-Edwan, Ghassan
Article Title: The Effect of Knowledge Management Processes on project Management
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: 3-4 keywords that highlight the topic in the paper
Abstract: Knowledge management and project management are recognized to be of supreme importance to the competitive advantage of organizations as well as a major agent of change in the new era of the knowledge economy. This study empirically examines the relationship between knowledge management processes and project management in the context of the information technology industry in Jordan. Very frequently projects, mostly information technology (IT) projects, fail or are challenged due to their incapability to get the right knowledge to the right people at the right time, and help people on the project share and put information into action in ways, which improve project performance. Knowledge management may be able to address this. Previous studies have not clearly identified nor demonstrated the relationship between the management of projects and the use of knowledge management processes. The purpose of this research is to identify if a positive relationship exists between the two? If a relationship does exist, which knowledge management processes in use by practitioners of project management are significant in terms of improving project management, and what is their impact? Hundred and fourteen project practitioners (project managers, managers, team leaders, team members, supervisors, etc) some affiliated with the Project Management Institute (PM!), and mostly from organizations in the IT industry both governmental and private had participated in the research to answer these questions. A positivistic approach was adapted using quantitative data. A survey aimed at project practitioners of information technology industry population was conducted in an effort to investigate the knowledge management activities and to examine the relationship of knowledge management processes and the improvement of project management.

Article Title: Research of Fashion Conceptual Design Methodology Based on Fashion Design Elements
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: conceptual design; fashion design; design elements; fashion design methodology; design theory
Abstract: The process of fashion concept design normally is directed by the fashion designers. It is a work of art and creativity, but lack of objectiveness and efficiency, which is now behind the huge demand of fast fashion and quick-response fashion supply chain. The paper proposes a prototype of the fashion conceptual design methodology based on the fashion design elements. The process is composed of definition of elements, optimization of elements, and integration of elements, which can be carried out both by human and computer intelligence. The new method of fashion conceptual design can help the fashion design procedure to be more objective, scientific and efficient.

Article Title: Developing and Validating a Multidimensional Scale for Nonprofit Market Orientation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: market orientation; nonprofit organizations; scale development; performance; factor analysis
Abstract: This paper intends to develop a scale for market orientation of nonprofit organizations (NPOs). Scale items are generated by field interviews and pilot test. Statistical software packages like SPSS13.0 and LISREL8.7 are used to conduct exploratory factor analysis and confirmatory factor analysis on the questionnaires finished by top managers from NPOs. The final nonprofit market orientation (NMO) scale includes 5 dimensions, 17 measurement indicators with good reliability and validity. Meanwhile, the results of Structural Equation Modeling validate the long-held belief that market orientation is a critical success factor for performance in a new context of China's NPOs. Market orientation is a strategic choice for China's NPOs to improve their customer performance and financial performance. The proposed NMO scale in this study can be used as a diagnostic tool for NPOs to identity areas where specific improvements are needed. The antecedents and consequences of NMO, and the complex influencing mechanisms among them need to be explored further.

Article Title: Service Innovation in Online Recruiting
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: online recruiting; service innovation; lead user study
Keywords Plus: LEAD USER METHOD; TECHNOLOGY; APPLICANT; INVOLVEMENT; EXPERIENCES; CUSTOMERS; COMMUNITY; SELECTION
Abstract: Since most existing online recruiting services are simple job boards serving to replace traditional newspaper ads, we study how to innovate such services. Specifically, we apply the lead user tnethod as a driver of breakthrough innovations. We compare new service ideas emerging from interviews with 60 registered applicants with the ideas derived from two lead user studies. From both types of data we learn that applicants desire the integration of community and social network features for specified user segments. Interestingly, while most of the interviewed applicants suggested social network features they already knew from other online platforms, lead users came up with more innovative service solutions. Our findings indicate that online career services should not contain only useful information regarding careers and continuing education, but can also encourage friendships and social activities, as well provide access to virtual experiences that may enhance users' self esteem.

Authors: Hu, SH; Wang, WD; Sun, SY
Author Full Names: Hu Shuhua; Wang Weidong; Sun Siyuan
Article Title: Revelation of the Sino-Japanese War to Modern Manufacturing Industry of China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: sino-japanese war; manufacturing industry; revelation
Abstract: The outbreak of the Sino-Japanese War in 1894 is one of the most important events in Chinese modem history. In the following one hundred years, China struggled herself in fighting with a series of invasions of the western superpowers, failing into a long-term darkness and humiliation. Yet, the difficulties faced by modem manufacturing industry of China are alarmingly similar in comparison with those faced by the Qing Dynasty before the Sino-Japanese War. This paper, from the perspective of the history and politics, focuses on an analysis of the background of the Chinese manufacturing industry during the Sino-Japanese War, pointing out that the failure of Chinese manufacturing industry has actually led to the failure of the Sino-Japanese War and then suggesting the revelation of Sino-Japanese War to modem manufacturing industry of China.

Article Title: Urban Cycle Economic Development Research Based on Dynamics Systems Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: system dynamics; urban circle; industrial structure
Abstract: This article aims to evaluate and predict the development of the economy in city circle. Based on System Dynamics Principle, the article draws a presumed Evaluation and Prediction Conclusion by establishing System Dynamic Model from the branch systems of city circle. Firstly, the current situation and the existing problems in china's city circle are elucidated in details. Then System Dynamics Evaluation Model on city circle is built up from the final result of evaluation and prediction based on System Dynamics. Eventually, the article testifies the new model's feasibility by analyzing cases of current development of certain city circle.

Article Title: Empirical Study on Technology Seeking FDI of Chinese Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technology-seeking FDI; Chinese enterprises; economic fluctuation; independent innovation
Abstract: Using the statistics data, this paper carries out an empirical study on the relationship between reverse investment of Chinese enterprises in developed countries and independent innovation capability, and explores how American economic fluctuation affects technology-seeking FDI of Chinese enterprises in the United States by the methods of Granger causality test and cointegration analysis. The result shows that Chinese enterprises may gain international scientific and technological resources and facilitate independent innovation through direct investment in developed countries, and there is a negative relationship between technology-seeking FDI (foreign direct investment) of Chinese enterprises in the United States and American economic growth.

Article Title: E-Business, Globalization, and Human Resource Management: An Examination of Trends, Definitions and Directions
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: E-business has brought in its wake a basic and dramatic transformation in the workplace characterized by legal, technological, socio-cultural, political, and organizational upheaval of the old order. The workplace of the new millennium has been the subject of study by futurists, academics, scholars, and practitioners alike. Two of the major, inter-related, and defining trends of the new millennium in the context of Human Resource Management are E-business and Global Employee Markets. Among the many fundamental changes predicted for the workplace of the future on account of these trends are: (a) Flexibility (b) Virtual Reality (c) Multi-dimensional diversity (d) Strategization of HR (e) Internationalization (f) Declining role of work in People's emotional lives and (g) Continuous Learning. This paper attempts to examine: (a) how these changes have brought forth new challenges, directions, and changes of course to the field of Human Resource Management, (b) how certain conflicts need to be recognized, and (c) how changes in direction and definitions need to be implemented in order to make HRM more relevant to the new workplace. The paper is organized around seven central themes.

Abstract: In this study we present some results obtained after a training program that was basically instrumental enrichment program developed by Reuven Feuerstein. This program requires a methodology for targeted intervention in particular to improve cognitive abilities: memory, reasoning, attention, etc. And especially to develop the capacity to coordinate these mental functions autonomously and actively. R. Feuerstein's theory falls between metacognitive research aimed to achieve the level of individual awareness and monitoring skills and cognitive behavioral own, improving cognitive functions that allow to define more clearly the problems, establish connections, observing the relationship, optimization for motivation learning.

Article Title: GROUND RULES AND BENCHMARKS FOR ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION INTEGRATION IN UNIVERSITY EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Abstract: The magnitude of ecological problems and social activities aimed at the protection and quality of the environment both at national level and at international level impose the need for rapid and different changes in the educational systems of many countries Modem educational theory, practice and recommendations of the international organizations are leading to the ecological system at the high education level. In order to understand the need and the importance of ecological factors and laws in the occupational-field, the connection between ecological and professional aspects of student's future professional activities, it is necessary to understand the environment protection as the necessary content and principle of educational work at the university. The paper has as goal to synthesize the educational needs of the academic population and to highlight the educational program orientation in the environment protection field for different segments of the high level education system

Article Title: EVALUATION AND MONITORING MILK-RAW MATERIAL QUALITY IN MARAMURES COUNTY IN TERMS OF CONTENT OF AFLATOXINS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education

Abstract: It was pursued the control of raw materials especially milk which was collected from 5 farms in the county of Maramures for a period of 12 months (January-December 2007) and examined in terms of aflatoxin M1 (AFM1) and M2 (AFM2) content. Samples were analyzed by high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) using UV and fluorescence detectors, the analytical results of this parameter were recorded in special registers were have been pursued on possible deviations content To fulfil quality control requirements to the level of farm management was developed a plan for self-control and work instruction on monitoring the content of aflatoxins as a result of rigorous research on this period with the purpose to produce a superior product in terms of quality. Depending on the quality management requirements to processors, the milk producers from farms, taking count by this monitoring have organized their productive activity so that the obtained product has satisfied the processors exactingness and during 2008 were no more nonconformity.

Abstract: In the recent years the website has become a necessity for organizations everywhere. Web applications have started being used more and more and this is only normal since their role is to provide the functionality from a server to client machines while using the Internet. In this paper we present the on-line store of the Publishing House from the Petroleum Gas University of Ploiesti, which in this way has increased its numbers of customers a great deal and is now also being used as a mean of publicity for the researchers work. Article Title: Mining Student Evolution Using Associative Classification and Clustering
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Associative Classification; Classification; Itemset; Clustering
Abstract: Associative classification (AC) is a branch in data mining that utilises association rule discovery methods in classification problems. This paper idea aims to discuss and evaluate a modeling approach for student evolution. It is developed as a component of an adaptive achievement system. At the beginning of the process, associations of student achievement results are found based on each student's factors that affect learning process, which finds the relationship between student evolution during years of study and understanding the modular scheme, that finds the main effect of enrolling on the correct modules i.e. getting the right advice and student support regarding choosing modules, meeting all the necessary prerequisites, having summer courses, and taking in consideration the student's high school grades, as well as finding the relationship between modules type and student gender. Clustering [10], or unsupervised classification, method is employed to model this task. The goal of clustering is [7] to objectively partition data into homogeneous groups such that the within group object similarity and the between group object dissimilarity are determined. Clustering here is used to model student achievement according to predefined criterion functions that measure similarity among students who grant certain goal having the same conditions using data collected from University Database. A clustering method is developed far this step. We evaluated the student progress according to associations between different factors using data collected. We concluded the performance of those groups using these two approaches. Now, the need for solid information about student evolution and how to improve it has only grown in importance for state policy. The compelling metaphor of increasing flow through the educational pipeline is now common in state policy discussions, fueled by more vocal recognition by business and civic leaders of the importance of the critical supply chain of educational capital in their states.

Article Title: WHO ARE THEY AND WHAT DO OUR CANDIDATES WANT? - PART II
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: While the faculties may know a great deal about students that walk through their doors, little is known about the decision-making process undertaken by applicants when selecting an area of study or a faculty of interest Given the expansion of bachelor degree offerings now available on the local market, the Department of Economic Engineering from Hermann Oberth Faculty of Engineering of Sibiu conducted a marketing research study among the 2008 applicants. The paper presents the results of this survey and the information is useful for faculties' recruiters in order to guide recruitment and enrolment strategies. The paper is a continuation of the work results presented in the Who are they and what do our candidates want? - part I.

Article Title: Research of Grey Forecasting Model in Logistics Requirements-XiaMen City as an Example
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: logistics; requirements; Xiamen; gery forecasting
Abstract: The forecast of logistics requirements is the precondition of logistics planning. In this paper, grey system theoretics is used to build the grey forecasting model of logistics requirements-GM(1,1) model. This model is applied to forecast the logistics requirements between 2009 and 2014 in XiaMen city, and then error test is produced. Finally, the logistics requirements in Xiamen city in the future years are discussed.

Authors: Wang, WJ; Tang, XW; Ni, DB
Author Full Names: Wang Weijun; Tang Xiaowo; Ni Debin
Article Title: Retailer's Decision on a Demand-curve's Shape with AR(1) Shocks and the Bullwhip Effect
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: supply chain; pricing decision; inventory decision; Bullwhip Effect; demand-curve
Abstract: This paper discusses impacts of retailer's decision on the bullwhip effect for the different demand-curves with first-order autoregression process(AR(1)) shocks in a simple two-stage supply chain system consisting of a single retailer and a single supplier. First, combined decision (pricing and inventory decision) models are made for the retailer with demand-curves with random shocks. Then, impacts of decisions on the bullwhip effect are analyzed. The result shows that when the market demand is a linear curve with AR(I) shocks, the retailer's optimal decision cannot make the bullwhip effect occur and its measure has no concerns with its demand elasticity and scaling factor; however, when the market demand is an iso-elastic demand function with AR(1) shocks, the bullwhip effect measure will decrease with the increase of the demand elasticity and its scaling factor, but the bullwhip effect will always occur. Moreover, for the above two curves, the bullwhip effects change differently with autoregression coefficient of shocks. Therefore, retailers must consider the pattern of the demand curve and its fine structure to reduce the bullwhip effect.

Authors: Wei, S; Lu, Y; Wang, YL
Author Full Names: Wei, Shen; Lu, Yin; Wang Yongli
Article Title: A Short-term Prediction Method of Shanghai Composite Index Based on Back Propagation Neural Network and Inheritance Algorithm
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: BPNN; Inheritance Algorithm; Shanghai Composite Index; stock index prediction; prediction method
Abstract: The forecast of the stock index fluctuation is a difficult job as it is influenced by many factors. In recent years, Back Propagation Neural Network (BPNN) has been applied in stock index prediction. However, in practical application, BPNN has some disadvantages. The widely used BP learning algorithm has slow convergent speed and low learning efficiency, and it is easy to get in local minimum. The inheritance algorithm is a sort of self-adaptive optimized search algorithm based on natural selection and natural inheritance. It can be implemented in different areas of parameter space in the colony generation subrogation toward the optimal direction which the search could more possibly find and couldn't get in local minimization. So, we can adopt the inheritance algorithm to train the BP neural network to overcome the above disadvantages. We optimized the network through adding inheritance algorithm and established the stock index prediction model to predict Shanghai composite index. The empirical analysis indicated that the above model optimized with inheritance algorithm possessed better function approximating ability, and achieved ideal effect for the short-term prediction of stock index.

Abstract: Aiming at the problems existing in the current performance evaluation system of enterprises' technological innovation, this paper combined the characteristics of technological innovation and the innovation practice in China's enterprises, innovatively developed the Balanced Scorecards and the new field of their applications, proposed the Enhanced Balanced Scorecards - Technological Innovation(EBSC-TI)regarding society environment and future development, and fully established the performance measurement indexes system for evaluating technological innovation performance synthetically from five aspects such as finance, customer, flow, development and society and explained every index. Article Title: FDI, Financial Development of Host Countries and Technological Progress
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: FDI; financial development; technological progress; economic growth
Abstract: Many policy makers and scholars believe that the foreign direct investment can promote host countries' technological progress and economic growth, but the results of empirical research have shown that the effects of technological progress and economic growth in many developing countries are not clear. The main reason is that the effects depend on host countries' absorptive capacity. In recent years, the financial development becomes a new perspective about the host countries' FDI absorptive capacity. This article summarizes and analyzes the results of domestic and foreign scholars' research so as to provide reference for domestic related research.

Authors: Zhang, W; Liao, HZ; Zhao, N
Author Full Names: Zhang, Wei; Liao, Hongzhi; Zhao, Na
Article Title: Research on the FP Growth Algorithm about Association Rule Mining
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Data mining; Association rule mining; FP growth method
Abstract: For large databases, the research on improving the mining performance and precision is necessary, so many focuses of today on association rule mining are about new mining theories, algorithms and improvement to old methods. Association rules mining is a function of data mining research domain and arise many researchers interest to design a high efficient algorithm to mine association rules from transaction database. Generally all the frequent item sets discovery from the database in the process of association rule mining shares of larger, the price is also spending more. This paper introduces an improved aprior algorithm so called FP-growth algorithm that will help resolve two neck-bottle problems of traditional apriori algorithm and has more efficiency than original one. In theoretic research, An anatomy of two representative arithmetics of the Apriori and the FP Growth explains the mining process of frequent patterns item set. The constructing method of FP tree structure is provided and how it affects association rule mining is discussed. Experimental results show that the algorithm has higher mining efficiency in execution time, memory usage and CPU utilization than most current ones like Apriori.

Article Title: The Flow of Information Through People's Network and Its Effect on Japanese Public Pension System
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Agent based simulation; Network structure; Public pension system; Policy impact
Abstract: In this article, we would like to verify a positive or negative policy impact that comes from decreasing or increasing people's distrust in Japanese public pension system. For the sake of tackling these issues, firstly, we pick up some network models that fit well in real people's network. Secondly, we put the information, which is concerning about Japanese public pension system, on agent-to-agent network. Finally, we ascertain the effect of releasing the information and its expansion on Japanese public pension system. Consequently, it is revealed that releasing information over again have a profound effect on reducing distrust in public pension system and on pension premium fund. With releasing information to a limited extent and to a limited number of agents, there is limited effect on reducing agent's distrust.

Author Full Names: Bojnord, Nahid Hashemian; Menhaj, Mohammad Bagher
Article Title: What is knowledge and how it can be valuated?
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; knowledge value
Abstract: In this paper, we present a conceptual model for knowledge valuation. After a literature review, over various definitions on knowledge, we first extracted the main plausible features of knowledge both its nature and meaning. The main features are amount of information, verification of information and retrieval ability of information. We then developed a three dimensional model to valuate knowledge. The surrounded volume amount these components can represent the knowledge value. To see how powerful our model is, we have considered a case study. It has been shown that the model can valuate customer knowledge. We extracted different aspects of knowledge value from the literature and showed that they can be also acknowledged by the proposed model. The model provides a general framework for knowledge valuation and can be used to valuate human and artificial knowledge.

Article Title: ASPECTS CONCERNING ORGANIZATIONAL CLIMATE AND CULTURE AND THEIR IMPACT ON EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The aim of the paper is to discuss aspects concerning the organizational climate at the level of the working staff and at the level of the management of an organization, with special emphasise on educational organisations. The discussion will be based on learning style, task-oriented attitude and personal management style. The assessment of the organizational climate is made usually with the help of a set of three standardized questionnaires conceived by Adizes. The first questionnaire that will be described is called the learning style, with its four types described by Adizes, the second questionnaire will make reference to the task requirements, which aims at the managerial development styles and the third questionnaire, Adizes' personal test, aiming at the assessment of the respondents' profile regarding the managerial development. Other questionnaires developed to assess learning styles will be presented, due to the importance for an academic institution. The assessment of the organizational climate at the level of the top management is based, besides the above-mentioned questionnaires, on McGregor's XY-theory and on the LEADSELF questionnaire. Such a complex analysis of the organizational climate is important for an educational organization as it helps to design the best ways to deliver knowledge to the students, taking into account their learning styles and behavioural profiles. A study of the correlation of different assessments of learning styles and the consequences for educational management is also presented.

Authors: Cheng, Z; Zhang, ZH; Zhang, PL
Author Full Names: Cheng, Zhou; Zhang, Zhuhong; Zhang, Peilin
Article Title: Research on blending optimized algorithm of WSICO industrial port Based on logistics equilibrium
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: blending; logistics; equilibrium; optimized algorithm; WISCO
Abstract: The steel and iron industry is the key industry of national development. The massive ore are needed in the steel-making process of the Iron and steel enterprise. Blending of the ore material is an important step in WISCO industrial port's production, but the current research is lack of theoretical achievements about blending optimization. The deficiencies of research on blending the ore material are analyzed in this article, that is many experts regarded ore blending as a independent production step and has not consider that blending is belong to the internal logistics chain of Iron and steel enterprise's material supply. In view of these questions, the Logistics equilibrium conceptual model is proposed. And a new thought is put forward to solve the blending model, which gives a new way for raw ore blending optimization problems. Then, the author uses the computer program to realize this mentality. And the computed result is proved effective and correct.

Article Title: Performances of B2B e-Marketplace for SMEs: The Research Methods and Survey Results
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: B2B e-Marketplaces; SMEs; Research Methods; Survey Results
Abstract: The concept of B2B (Business-To-Business) e-Marketplace provides a new dimension in facilitating the marketers to work more effectively in particular when making critical marketing decision. Benefiting from the Internet technologies, the range of advantages that can be gained from the B2B e-Marketplace is extensive. This paper is intended to provide a clear understanding of the wide range of research approaches, strategies and methods that will contribute to the study of B2B e-Marketplace's performances for Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs). A two stage research design combining qualitative and quantitative research methodologies are used to generate relevant data for this study. Focusing on SMEs the paper will also explore the ability of the SMEs to capitalise from the opportunities provided by B2B e-marketplace. Based on the research results, B2B e-Marketplace is reported to reshape the business processes and enhances the business exposure in the market

Authors: Du, M; Zhao, Y; Le, JJ
Author Full Names: Du, Ming; Zhao, Yan; Le, Jiajin
Article Title: A Dynamic logging Approach on Flash-Based DBMS
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Dynamic logging; Flash-Based DBMS; NAND Flash; Non-volatile storage; Records merge
Abstract: Flash memory, especially NAND flash memory, is being rapidly deployed as data storage for mobile devices such as mobile phones, digital cameras and PDA's. With its capacity increasing and price dropping, Flash memory has been installed in many portable computers instead of magnetic disk for its light weight, small size, physical stability and low power consumption. We may expect that Flash memory will finally take the place of magnetic disk in the next few years. Therefore, it is possible for us to consider running a full database on the flash computing platforms. However, disk-based database technology can not be used on flash memory directly because of different characteristics between flash memory and magnetic disk. Some researches are being done currently on flash-based database technology. In this paper, we propose a new approach called Dynamic logging. This new approach makes use of the characteristics of flash memory effectively to acquire more benefits from using traditional database technology on flash memory.

Article Title: A Study on a New Pattern of Enterprise-Intelligent Enterprise
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: enterprise; intelligent enterprise; evolution; artificial intelligence
Abstract: Today's enterprises deploy IT to do their business, which introduces significant complexity. This technical complexity combined with organizational complexity can and does create internal islands of inefficiency that are difficult to deal with. The notion of the IE is characterized by the ability of businesses to morph into new forms/entities with some surprising results. We envision that in the future IEs will wittingly transform themselves into better forms by becoming more intelligent. Intelligent enterprises (IEs) have broad horizons with long-term perspectives. They will derive efficiencies through the automation of their core business processes, and the exploitation of knowledge. Agility will be improved by one or two orders of magnitude, intelligence density within the enterprise will grow sharply and problem-solving capacities will be dramatically enhanced. They will form dynamic partnerships with other enterprises to create dynamic business ecosystems, which will be self-managed, self configured and self-optimized. Consequently, they will exploit new forms of business value creation, adjusting their behaviors to the markets.

Article Title: Study on Integrated Innovation Interface for Product Development
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product development; integrated innovation; interface
Abstract: With increasing study on integrated innovation system as the new mode of product development, interface has been a hotspot of integrated innovation theory, and has been the key question of influencing the result of product innovation. In the paper, the essentials of integrated innovation interface are analyzed base on internal and external theory on interface. The model of integrated innovation is illustrated and designed in the three levels of micromechanics, Mesoscopic and macrostructure in detail.

Article Title: APPLYING OF INNOVATIVE TEACHING METHODS IN THE MARITIME ACADEMIC
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Training process in maritime field has two major components designed for the development of theoretical and practical knowledge and skills, offering graduates a double qualification at the end of studies as maritime officers and engineer in transportation. This option of having double qualification and also the possibility to activate in many connected fields involves a complex teaching and training process that uses new and advanced technology as simulators, computerized programs and interconnections with economical sectors. Present paper describes the way of using these new teaching methods in maritime educational system in order to provide better specialists at an international required level for maritime transportation field and connective business sector. The results obtained at Maritime University in Constanta have shown, in accordance to international statistics, a decreasing of collisions in simulated environment with over 60 percents that will considerably improve safety on sea extrapolated in real conditions.

Authors: Harris, MSG; Chisholm, CU; Allan, M
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Harris, Margaret S. G.; Chisholm, Colin U.; Allan, Malcolm
Article Title: HOW THE LIFELEARN CONCEPT RELATES TO THE EUROPEAN QUALIFICATIONS FRAMEWORK
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The Lifelearn project which tested the accreditation of learning done through life in a variety of contexts has been tested both in Scotland and in a number of other European contexts; primarily Germany, Estonia, and Finland. The results of the project indicated high levels of interest in this type of learning from both students and tutors alike, providing high quality and motivational learning situations. The Lifelearn project examined the new concept of Lifeplace Learning (not to be confused with lifelong learning) and the Scottish model (the original model), utilised the Scottish Credit and Qualifications Framework as a major part of the design. In line with this Scottish framework, the European concept of a qualifications framework is now progressing well and many European countries are on their way to establishing how their own national frameworks relate to the EQF. This paper will discuss the framework development but importantly will suggest how the Lifeplace Learning concept enables the framework to be utilised fully to achieve goals of including more people in education and allowing for flexible and apposite learning

Article Title: The Innovation Study of Chinese Ceramic Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Ceramic industry; ceramic predicament; innovation; ceramic education; ceramic producing
Abstract: Chinese ceramic industry has carried out a series of work on recovery and developing with the lead and help of Chinese government since 1949. However, Chinese ceramic is not strong enough in the world till now, based on which, the main research of this paper will be the predicament that Chinese ceramic is facing. The focuses are education on ceramic, the staff, traditional ceramic producing habit and present. industry management, which might help us to find the main reason to the present predicament. It is necessary to know that the first three aspects are most easily ignored by the researchers, especially education on ceramic. Therefore, education part will be the focus of the paper. The predicament and solutions to Chinese ceramic industry are presented in the paper, which might be helpful for the innovation and development of it.

Article Title: Research on Innovation of Regional Development Pattern Based on Marketing Orientation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: regional development; marketing orientation; co-marketing
Abstract: Regional development is a process of increasing regional welfare, along with output increase, structure change, system transformation, space evolvement, income distribution, knowledge advancement, and conception evolvement. With the deepening of marketization, globalization, informatization and the change of regional developmental environment, the regional development pattern has shifted from traditional supply aspect to demands aspect, which needs the region build marketing orientation. The marketing-oriented regional development pattern promotes the regional incessant development mainly by the processes of accumulation of regional brand capital, material capital and economic space. From the whole view of regional development, the innovative pattern of co-marketing may be utilized into regional development, which emphasizes both the cooperation and appropriate competition among regional enterprises so as to make sure that each enterprise can obtain benefits from the cooperation marketing.

Article Title: MATHEMATICAL MODELS AND SIMULATION SOFTWARE FOR THE GREAT POWER BLOCKS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The intelligent engineering system for the great power blocks consists of a set of mathematical models for stationary and dynamic processes specific to operation of the 330 MW power blocks, the simulation software and their implementation on a 3 workstations system to simulate in real time the processes. The application is destined to: desk training, attestation and periodically training of the exploitation personnel from thermal power stations equipped with 330 MW blocks, in higher education to accomplish laboratory studies and research, in thermoenergetics and automation, in research papers on thermo-electric installations in faculties with energetics profile and also in preparation of some papers. The accomplishment of the project involved collaboration of four partners.
