Article Title: Study on Business Model Innovation Related to Search Engine from the Perspective of Intellectual Property Protection
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: search engine; business model; IPR; innovation
Abstract: The combinations of E-commerce and search engine are changing old business models in the world. After introducing the traditional search business model, this thesis analyzes new challenges for search engine model from the perspective of intellectual property right (IPR) including patent, trademark and copyright. Accepting data analysis method and retrieval method, the thesis puts forward a series of new challenges stemming from patent infringements, trademark infringements as well as copyright infringements. Finally a new business model framework has been designed, where Google-related several classic business search models are given based on the successful experience of search companies under the protection of IPR laws and other regulations.

Article Title: Analysis of Industrial Clusters' Trust Mechanism: A Game Visual Angle
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industry clusters; trust; game; mechanism
Abstract: Industrial cluster, as a special economy organizing form, have exhibited its huge compete advantage, but the trust mechanism is the important side of its competitive advantage. The paper set up game models to analyze how trust mechanism of industrial cluster formed automatically through prisoner's dilemma game and repeated game. Based on this, establish the game modes of enterprise between government and enterprise between enterprises with government Intervention, and explain the government Intervention influence to the formation of industrial clusters' trust mechanism. Based on the above analysis, this paper put forward the countermeasures of how to set up industrial clusters' trust mechanism in the conclusion.

Article Title: Research on Fair Value Measurement Model for Forest Ecological Assets
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: forest ecological assets; accounting measurement model; fair value
Abstract: Financial accounting does not include the accounting of forest ecological assets, which has been a urgent task on the choice and the determining of accounting measurement model of forest ecological assets. With the more attentions that people pay to today's forest ecological problems and the need for accounting information disclosure, value measurement has become a forefront issue and hot topic in the accounting profession. Based on analyzing the features of forest ecological assets, air value model is suggested for initial and further measurement of forest ecological assets. As a public good, it is hard to get market value to measure. The techniques for the fair value measurement should be considered more with non-market value. And the value appraisal methods should take from those applied in current mature economics and ecology as reference.

Authors: Liu, XB; Cui, FJ; Meng, QN; Pan, RL
Author Full Names: Liu, Xiaobing; Cui, Fajing; Meng, Qiunan; Pan, Ruilin
Article Title: Research on the Model of Quality Cost in CIMS Environment
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: COQ; ABC mothed; allocation; CIMS; application
Abstract: One of the most important tools necessary for the successful implementation of a quality program such as ISO9000 or TQM is the cost of quality(COQ). This paper proposes a new model for the COQ, which captures the value of continuous process improvement in achieving economic operation. The model is given based on Activity-based Costing (ABC) Method in this paper. As the application of computer is widely in many companies, firstly, COQ system structure is built in Computer Integrated Manufacturing Systems (CIMS) environment. Secondly, the function structure of the COQ accounting system is suggested. In the function structure the input and output relationship of information is shown between many sub-systems. Thirdly, the allocation method which uses two-stage procedure to assign quality resource costs is adopted when calculating COQ. Five important rules are described in this method. Finally, the new model of COQ was demonstrated through an application in a steel enterprise.

Article Title: Application of EF Model to Quantitative Assessment of Sustainable Development in Hubei Province
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Abstract: The quantitative measurement of Sustainable Development has become one of the frontiers of the present sustainable development research, whose core is to determine whether mankind survives within the bearing capacity of the ecological system. The article deals in some details with the quantitative measure method (the ecological footprint method) for Sustainable Development established by M. Wackernagel and others since 1996. The research applies the method to calculate and analyze the ecological footprint of Hubei Province in 2004. The result indicates that the ecological deficit per capita of Hubei province was 1.269 82hm2 in 2004. The ecological footprint deficit shows that the human load has already stayed beyond the regional ecological capacity and the regional natural ecosystem is under great pressure of human activities.

Authors: Mariana, J; Ioan, L; Alexandru, VD; Bogdan, CI
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Mariana, Jurian; Ioan, Lita; Alexandru, Daniel Visan; Bogdan, Ion Cioc
Article Title: WIRELESS TECHNOLOGIES FOR IMPROVED E-LEARNING PLATFORMS USED IN HIGHER EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: E-learning is a rapidly evolving domain implying new applications and services based on information and communication technologies. In this context the current paper approaches the problematic of using the broadband wireless technologies (WiFi 802.11n, WiMax etc.) and Internet network in order to realize a platform for e-learning activities between distant locations of the universities. Besides of the description of the platform structure, in the first pan of the paper it is made also a comparative analysis of the existing wireless technologies that allows live data communications. The e-learning system presented in this paper is based on client/server architecture. The client applications can be run on cell phones, PDAs, or laptops and the server application can be installed on desktops or laptops. The trainer operates on the server side. To enter the e-learning system, students first need to run the client side application. The students can use various portable devices to communicate with the trainer. For wireless connection to the wired network it is Cisco Aironet 1121 802.11 g access point - AIR-AP1121G-A-K9 from the Cisco Aironet 1100 Series Access Point and the interaction between trainer and students it based on wireless video cameras.

Article Title: CONFLICT MANAGEMENT IN MODERN ORGANIZATIONS. DIFFICULTIES AND PRECAUTIONS IN DESIGNING AND CARRYING OUT RESEARCH INITIATIVES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: differences of opinion; conflicts; experiment; conflict management
Abstract: The difficulties underlying any experimental approach to conflicts can hardly be denied. Whatever precautions researchers may take, there is always a risk of failure involved. One can compensate for this risk by performing rigorous research, based on thorough documentation, and starting from a realistic view of research. The methods used in the research of conflicts within organizations must be designed with due precaution Given that the topic of research includes social actors placed in tensed, stressful situations, they are bound to become increasingly susceptible. Therefore, any unsuitable word or expression, any unprofessional conduct on the part of the researcher will trigger attitudes of reluctance and hostility. This may lead to the occurrence of undesirable phenomena, such as distorting with the data collected, inauthentic involvement of social actors in experimental tasks and a potential shifting of the latter's hostility towards the researchers.

Article Title: TOWARDS A NEW CURRICULAR DESIGN FOR FOREIGN LANGUAGE TEACHING IN ROMANIAN TECHNICAL UNIVERSITIES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The present research aims at defining specific criteria underlying curricular design customized for foreign language teaching to engineering students in Romanian technical universities, in accordance with the recommendations of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages: Learning, Teaching, Assessment (CEFR), enforced regulations in the field of national educational policies, European quality standards, the needs of the technically-oriented labour market, idiosyncrasies of the Romanian technical higher education. The authors regard such research as filly justifiable within an academic context lacking some specific curriculum-elaborating criteria adapted to engineering students' specific needs, since the CERF stipulates general criteria applicable only to overall users. The authors conclude that defining a set of specific criteria is essential to establish a common framework of reference for curricular design customized for language teaching to engineering students, viewed as a successful complement to engineering education.

Authors: Nicolae, D; Pau, V; Ardelean, D; Briciu, S; Zarnescu, N
Author Full Names: Nicolae, Dan; Pau, Valentin; Ardelean, Daniel; Briciu, Sorin; Zarnescu, Narcis
Article Title: Using Fuzzy Sets To Define the Information's Quantity
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: mathematical modeling; grade of membership; decipher the message; a measure of change; subtle sets; fuzzy information; fuzzy sets; a fuzzy definition of communication
Abstract: Information is considered as a change of a fuzzy set expressing a state. In this case, a mange of state is equivalent to a change in the grade of membership Delta mu(A) (x) of an element x belonging to a fuzzy set A. The quantity of information can be computed using certain functions, called informational functions. Four axioms are presented, which must be satisfied by any informational function. In the case of information accumulation, they will organize themselves in a pattern. The intensity of the relation between two elements x is an element of A and y is an element of A at time t(0) is measured by a grade of membership. In this case, the information gain is expressed by the change of the grade of membership Delta mu(A) (x) Some examples are given from the field of figures of speech used by writers. In the case of metaphor, the concept of author-reader communication is defined as the possibility an educated reader has of guessing the author's intentions. In the algorithm used by the reader to decipher the message, the grade of membership to the author's message should increase at every step, ideally converging to one.

Article Title: Semantic data integration: overall architecture
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Semantic Data Integration; Information Systems; Ontology; Data interchange
Abstract: The information has always been a valuable patrimony for the information systems that every company tries to capitalize as much as possible. With the web, the amount of information is increased and several problems arise for instance for the safety of the exchanged data but also to the semantic heterogeneity: the same information is very often represented in different ways in different information systems. In this paper we present an architecture of interchange of data both within the sate information system and among different information systems founded on the ontologies in order to overcome the problem list of the heterogeneity. Ontologies, today, they seem to be the best tool useful to resolve the problem of heterogeneity, but that has not now been exploited fully.

Authors: Salim, J; Rashid, NRM; Yahya, Y; Hamdan, AR; Deraman, A; Othman, MS; Amin, HM; Aris, A
Author Full Names: Salim, Juhana; Rashid, Nurul Rafidza Muhamad; Yahya, Yazrina; Hamdan, Abdul Razak; Deraman, Aziz; Othman, Mohd Shahizan; Amin, Hazilah Mohd.; Aris, Akmal
Article Title: HiKMas: Cultural Behavioural and ontology based approach towards a Holistic Knowledge Management System Design
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Knowledge Management System; Cultural behavioural perspectives; Ontology
Abstract: This paper discusses the Holistic Knowledge Management System design which is based on culture, behavioural and ontology approach that addresses the need to support a better management of the tacit and explicit knowledge, learning processes, knowledge creation, sharing and transfer; and continuous learning. The Cultural Behaviour concept models some characteristics of users interacting with a knowledge management system and acknowledges the behaviour of users in the system that can be associated with incentives so that users are willing to share their knowledge and be active in the system. The framework designed focuses on three features, i.e. the cultural behaviour of people in the organization, incentives system and technical system. Detailed analysis was conducted on the cultural behavioural perspectives of users based on existing cultural practiced in the organization and factors that can motivate staff to share knowledge through the KM system was also looked at. Based on the analysis performed, it was discovered that the behaviour of KM users may be influenced by the technical system. From the technical system, the behaviour of users can be identified and the system rewards a form of incentive to staff that share knowledge. The methodology in developing this system involves identifying KM initiatives towards developing methodologies to convert tacit knowledge into explicit knowledge that can be codified, captured, stored, transmitted, used and be acted on by others. The knowledge system architecture proposed gives emphasis on the three main components namely the people, process and technology. The architecture designed had focused on the interaction between employees in the organisation through the use of the platform provided in the Internal Generated Repository (IGR), and the User Profile Editor; knowledge warehouse (External Knowledge Acquisition and Environmental Scanning) that enables access to internal and external repositories, infrastructure provided and the enabling environment (Knowledge Maintenance subsystem and Knowledge Manipulation)

Author Keywords: outdoor advertisement; management; innovation
Abstract: The present paper analyzed the relationship between outdoor advertisement and urban environment, and explored the management principles of urban outdoor advertising in China. On the basis of market research, the ways to improve the quality of the outdoor advertisement in China were proposed. The concept of district identity system should be followed and the urban outdoor advertising in china needs to be under reasonable control. It can be concluded that urban outdoor advertising in China should achieve the goals, truthfulness, kindness and beauty, and develop harmoniously with the urban environment.

Author Full Names: Soomro, Tariq Rahim; Al-Qaimari, Ghassan; Wahba, Hassan
Article Title: Using GIS to Overcome Non-Traditional Security (NTS) Threats and Challenges
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: GIS; NTS; NTS Threats; NTS Challenges
Abstract: Non-traditional security, often abbreviated as NTS, is a popular but rather ambiguous concept within and outside academic circles. The NTS threats and challenges are always referred to in the context of human security to focus on the security of individuals, societies and groups, which includes criminality, environmental degradation - energy, natural disasters, infectious disease and illegal migration etc. These threats and challenges are not within the scope of more traditional military concerns: these can be facilitated by non-traditional security measures; such as applying technological tools to overcome them. This paper explores the role of Geographical Information Systems (GIS) as a tool to facilitate non-traditional security threats and challenges.

Article Title: E-health Business Models: From pilot project to successful deployment
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Business models; Business model dynamics; Innovation; Adoption; Diffusion; E-health
Abstract: Innovation in healthcare through information systems can he seen as the land of opportunities. E-health promises both quality improvements and higher efficiency but many of these systems end up as successful pilots. Although end users are satisfied and initial objectives are reached in terms of product quality and testing results, most of the innovations never reach the real world. In this study the main question is how to break through the impasse of e-health diffusion? With five cases empirical proof of the impasse is found and with business model theory these cases are analyzed. The practical contributions of this study show an emphasis on the financial business model and show that most of the innovations are technology driven. The case studies add dynamism and context to the model and change the perspective from ex post research to ex ante research. This result facilitates further research in business modeling by delivering a dynamic business model research framework.

Article Title: Research on Multi-Gear Pump Based on CFD
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: multi-gear pump; reverse design; fluent; dynamic grid
Abstract: The multi-gear pump is the new hydraulic pump which is researched and developed on the ordinary gear pump's foundation. Without the influence of load on the flow, it can afford equal amounts of oil to each lubricant point. The volume is relatively small, but it can reach the effect of several pumps. In order to catch the variation of flow field inside of multi-gear pump, the Dynamic grid technology in fluent software is used to numerically simulate the flow in multi-gear pump, and then the flow variation inside of multi-gear pump with gear rotating is analyzed. Thus lays the foundation for reverse design and the structure optimization of multi-gear pump.

Abstract: This paper carries on the analysis of Wuhan city circle from the industrial angle, analyzes the main problems which exist in the economic development process, obtains the conclusion that the industrial level of Wuhan city circle is still at low stage, needing to develop towards the more reasonable direction to form the characteristic superior industrial groups. Article Title: Excellence Design for Manufacturability of Electric Product
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: electric product; DFX; DFM; PCB
Abstract: Design For Manufacturability of electric product is introduced in this paper, by analyzing the technical background of using DIM technology in electric product development. DFM technology's positive roles in electronic product development, costs, quality, processing efficiency and product time to market are discussed. The main content of electric product DFM and the main concerns of different topics are summed up. The implementation of electronic product DFM process, method and platform is analyzed. Finally, two DFM cases confirm the importance of DFM in the electronic product development, among which one case study is an optimized utilization of PCB and the other is a troubleshooting of process defect through DFM.

Article Title: The Moderating Effect of Switching Costs on the Customer Satisfaction-retention Link: Retail Internet Banking Service in Hong Kong
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Customer retention; Customer satisfaction; Switching costs; Moderating effect
Keywords Plus: SELF-SERVICE; TRUST; CONSEQUENCES; ANTECEDENTS; INTENTIONS; COMMITMENT; QUALITY; MODEL
Abstract: The objective of this research was to develop a model that examines the direct effects of customer satisfaction and switching costs on customer retention as well as the moderating effect of switching costs on the relationship between customer satisfaction and customer retention in the segments of basic and advanced Internet banking users. This empirical research was conducted within the context of the retail Internet banking industry in Hong Kong. An online questionnaire was employed as the means of data collection. This research confirms the significant positive effects of customer satisfaction and switching costs on customer retention in both segments of basic and advanced Internet banking users. It is interesting that switching costs play a significant moderating effect on the customer satisfaction-retention link only for the segment of basic Internet banking users. For the segment of advanced Internet banking users, the moderating effect of switching costs does not significantly affect satisfaction-retention link.

Author Full Names: Xue Minggao; Liu Linlin; Zhong Cui
Article Title: Optimal Licensing Strategy of Patent holding Firm
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: paten; asymmetric cost; fixed fee; royalty rate; optimal licensing strategy
Abstract: In this paper we study the optimal patent licensing strategy where an inside (incumbent) patent holder and the potential entrant are different in marginal cost. We find that patent licensing strategy depend not only on the market demand but also on the marginal cost of licensee. Under asymmetric costs in production, we show that the royalty rate does not always dominate the fixed fee licensing for an inside patentee. We also discuss how to charge the optimal licensing fee which includes fixed fee and royalty rate, and present the value of patent licensing.

Article Title: The mechanism design of Multi-attribute auctions
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: multi-attribute auctions; incentive compatibility; mechanism design; optimal mechaism; revenue equivalence theory
Abstract: In this paper we consider an extension of the traditional auction mechanism, the multi-attribute auction, which enables negotiation on several attributes in addition to the price of the item. In particular, we consider a procurement auction in which the buyer is the auctioneer and the sellers are the bidders. We set up the model of multi-attribute auctions where sellers bid on price and the other attributes, and bids are evaluated by a scoring rule designed by the buyer. We educe the optimal auction mechanism by analyzing the incentive compatibility. In addition, we find that the optimal attributes are chosen independently of the price and the seller's beliefs about the other participants, so we get the optimal score rule and an extension of the equivalence theory of the single attribute for the case of multi-attribute auctions. Finally, we implement the optimal mechanism by three auctions: the first-score-sealed-bid auction, the second-score sealed-bid auction and the English auction.

Authors: Ying, WP; Luo, CS; Zhao, Y
Author Full Names: Ying Wei-ping; Luo Chao-Sheng; Zhao Yun
Article Title: The Design of the Integrated E-Business System based on CPC
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: E-Business; design; the integrated E-Business; CPC; platform, system framework
Abstract: E-Business is an advanced commerce pattern, which is centered on electronic trade, and takes actualizing buddy benefit and information share together such as customers, suppliers, sellers, and logistic distribution enterprises as the target. The integrated E-Business is an advanced E-Business, which is based upon collaboration and effective approaches to solve the problems in the enterprise such as Information Island and Resource Island. CPC is a kind of advanced business management idea and a kind of advanced commerce solution based on the Web, which conforms to the requirement of the Mass Customization. It locates customers and services at the center, and realizes cooperation and intercommunication between the related people in the whole lifecycle. According to the actual development of the CPC theory and the domestic E-Business, the integrated E-Business and some relative problems based on CPC are researched in this paper. The workflow and the system framework of the integrated E-Business system based on CPC are proposed. Finally, the characteristics of the integrated E-Business system based on CPC are summarized briefly.

Abstract: It is significant to solve the financing problem as it has been a bottleneck which constrains creative enterprises' development, especially in current financial crisis situation. With the improvement of policy and incentive mechanism of intellectual property financing of creative industry, its method as a new approach to creative enterprises, still turns out many problems. The author, first analyzes the impact of intellectual property financing in current financial crisis situation, then expounds the purpose and significance of developing and perfecting it in China based on its developing realities, finally puts forward a programming and content of the intellectual property financing of creative industry.

Article Title: THE INFLUENCE OF NEW VISUAL INTERFACE DESIGN ON EDUCATION DYNAMICS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: This paper means to explore visual culture in the universal digital media machines' both hard and soft interfaces designs with respect to the latent, fundamental desire of humans across history to practice magic. Despite the lack of stylistic influence factors, magic contributes to the nature of a culture by its magnitude and frequency; it participates in building a culture exclusively as a substance, along with other creations. Without converting mysteries, it helps organize the unknown serving as provisional explanation, on the possibility of communication at a distance without prior knowledge regarding the mechanism inside the means of communication. Discussing the design trend started by Apple with their iPods, iPhones and Macs, moving to the simple yet astounding Google and then to slick, transparent, visually rich, yet simple to use operating systems took and feel: from Mac OSX to Windows Vista, this article will try to encompass modem visual culture in digital media migrating towards magic in order to better fulfil the consumer's need to be empowered. This paper will conclude that new interface design influences the way users manipulate data within the digital world thus changing traditional educational dynamics.

Article Title: Assessing Electronic Government Readiness of Public Organizations
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Government; eGovernment; eGovernment Readiness; eReadiness; Information and Communication Technology; Public sector
Abstract: Electronic Government (eGovernment) has rapidly become a political imperative at local, national and international level. Based on the perceived success realized by the private sector through information and communication technology (ICT) introduction, diffusion and adoption, governments around the world are becoming more and more interested in embracing ICT, and respectively have made a remarkable progress over the last few years. Once only regarded as a means for modernizing the public sector and increasing government productivity and efficiency, eGovernment is presently recognized as a driver and a key enabler of citizen-centric, cooperative, and seamless modern governance. This implies not only a profound transformation in the way government interacts with the governed but also the reinvention of its internal processes and how organizations carry their business both internally as well as externally with other segments of the community. Based on the literature, it is frequently claimed that the availability of an effective eGovernment assessment framework is a necessary condition for advancing eGovernment proper implementation. This paper aims to review some of the existing electronic readiness (eReadiness) and eGovernment readiness (EGR) frameworks, to identify the different aspects covered by both types, and to discuss to what extent they can really fulfill their intention in acting as guiding tools in the successful introduction and implementation of eGovernment. Based on this discussion, the paper concludes that such assessment tools are not suitable in assessing EGR over a micro level (i.e., a public organization). At the end, the paper presents the building blocks of an EGR assessment framework. These building blocks - categorized into four Main dimensions: strategy, processes, technology, and people - cover all internal factors that should be addressed when setting an appraisal framework of eGovernment success on a public organization scale.

Article Title: IMPLEMENTING E-CONTENT IN THE FIELD OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING - A LESSON LEARNED
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Abstract: E-learning solutions in the mechanical engineering field can be spectacular as design but very hard to implement. This paper provides relevant aspects on designing and implementing the e-plasticity asynchronous e-learning solution within Land Forces Academy, Romania. The obtained results led to the increasing of the e-learning capabilities achieved by the Land Forces Academy. The paper concludes with several recommendations for using e-plasticity educational module and provides future research issues within the plasticity domain.

Article Title: Endogenous Money Supply: Evidence from China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: endogenous money supply; china; causality test; Johansen cointegration test
Abstract: The essay describes the performances of endogenous money supply under different periods in China and argues that the endogenous money supply leads to the difficult situation of China's monetary policy. Using Granger Causality Test, the paper finds that the change in economic output may lead to changes in the money supply. Using Johansen Cointegration Test, the paper verifies the relationship between Position for Forex Purchase and Claims on Other Depository Corporations with Money Base. The finding suggests that economic growth may lead to the increase of money supply, and the money supply may lead to the increase of money base. It also implies the Position for Forex Purchase is a key determinant of money supply.

Authors: Colin, C; Margaret, H; Malcolm, A
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Colin U, Chisholm; Margaret S G, Harris; Malcolm, Allan
Article Title: ENTREPRENEURSHIP: A SUSTAINABLE AND TRANSFERABLE ATTRIBUTE OF ESSENTIAL VALUE TO PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS GRADUATES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Entrepreneurship is reviewed in terms of its evolution, growth and meaning. Arguments are detailed and advanced for the establishment of entrepreneurship as a sustainable attribute within the curriculum of engineering and business programmes Consideration is given to emerging trends in relation to the interpretation of the meaning of entrepreneurship within the context of current 21st century thinking where entrepreneurship is considered in the context of social responsibility and social justice Established models are reviewed and it is proposed that for engineering and business graduates that existing models should be rejected in favour of models which address entrepreneurial thinking in terms of personal mindset for life and within a framework of ethical practice Consideration is then given to the development of entrepreneurship as a global competence particularly considering how best this competence can be established and taught A range of learning environments are considered in relation to the most effective way to teach entrepreneurship in the context of social mission and ethical practice. It is concluded that the teaching of entrepreneurship within a global context needs to be based on evolving thinking around personal entrepreneurial mindset, ethical values and social mission using appropriate learning environments which involve the close integration of the on-campus environment with appropriate life based off-campus environments. It is also concluded that full development of competence in entrepreneurship can be best achieved at postgraduate level with sustainability realised through lifelong learning practice.

Authors: Elminaam, DSA; Kader, HMA; Hadhoud, MM
Author Full Names: Elminaam, D. S. Abdul; Kader, H. M. Abdul; Hadhoud, M. M.
Article Title: Performance Evaluation of Symmetric Encryption Algorithms
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Encryption techniques; Computer security; AES; DES; RC2; 3DES; Blowfish; RC6
Abstract: Internet and networks applications are growing very fast, so the needs to protect such applications are increased. Encryption algorithms play a main role in information security systems. On the other side, those algorithms consume a significant amount of computing resources such as CPU time, memory, and battery power. This paper provides evaluation of six of the most common encryption algorithms namely: AES (Rijndael), DES, 3DES, RC2, Blowfish, and RC6. A comparison has been conducted for those encryption algorithms at different settings for each algorithm such as different sizes of data blocks, different data types,battery power consumption, different key size and finally encryption/decryption speed. Simulation results are given to demonstrate the effectiveness of each algorithm.

Article Title: Drawing out the Essential Business of Ports
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Abstract: Process modelling is used to reveal the structure of business processes in a port. The method of process modelling used is Quid's Riva method and the port it is applied to is Alexandria Port in Egypt. The main advantages of this method are that an overall picture of the business of a complex organisation such as a port can be drawn, and that essential elements of the business can be distinguished from secondary elements. An initial process architecture of the business of Alexandria Port is developed from the essential elements, the most important of which are ship and shipment. The architecture makes visible ways in which processes connect with and may affect one another. An architecture derived from essential elements- can serve as the basis for a comparison of Alexandria Port with other ports, or for a redesign of some of the processes in order to streamline the business or to introduce new technological support.

Article Title: Motivation for Product Innovation-the Case of Manufacturing Companies in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product innovation; manufacturing and motivation
Abstract: This paper aims at identifying what actually motivates Chinese Manufacturing companies for product innovation and what they expect to motivate them in the future. Using a questionnaire-based approach, a survey was conducted from five manufacturing companies namely; Haier, C- Bons Group, Midea, Wuhan Economy Technique Development Area Dongjiang Commerce cl. Ltd and Dongfeng Peugeot Citroen Automobile Company Ltd. The outcome of the analysis of 352 respondents revealed that, Financial Rewards index had the highest point for both the actual and expectations. However, majority think that, Job security is the least motivation factor for product innovation.

Article Title: Corporate Governance and Quality of Accounting Information
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: management; governance; information; quality
Abstract: According to some authors, the degradation of the quality of accounting information and the financial scandals that followed are actually the consequence of three factors: poor company management, a less rigorous attitude in relation to the monitoring of the enforcement of the accounting and auditing norms and the sometimes perverse effects of the remuneration system of the managers. In this context, the past years witnessed the national regulatory factors of the financial markets as well as international organisms become more and more preoccupied with the adoption of professional conduct codes and standards in order to consecrate the best practices meant to ensure the transparence of the financial and accounting information for investors and good company management.

Article Title: WISMAR- ENTREPRENEURIAL UNIVERSITY
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The Wismar University runs a successful project from 2000 till 2008 called INFEX The project INFEX (abbreviation for information for entrepreneurs) was a project of the Educational Institute of Economy (BdW gGmbH) in cooperation with the Wismar University of applied sciences Technology, Business and Design and the Agency for Technology Transfer and Furtherance of Innovations West Mecklenburg GmbH (ATI). INFEX offered a basic- and advanced seminar for entrepreneurs as well as individual educational modules for each participant. The seminars were built upon a semester and step by step the students were led through the process of setting up a business and the necessary entrepreneurial competence. The contents were good and reached about 10% of all students After eight years of a good project the Wismar University thought over again and decided to develop a system, which will reach nearly 100% of students. Entrepreneurship has to become a mainstream at the University system. The responsibility has to be at the University management, at Wismar University the rector (Prof Grunwald) is in charge of the new developments.

Article Title: Dynamic Relationship between International Oil Price and China's Financial Variables
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: exchange rate; international oil price; interest rate; real estate price; stock price
Abstract: There are certain relations between oil price and financial variables. With the methods of VEC test, Granger Causality Test and State Space Model, this paper empirically tests the relationship between international oil price and China's financial variables. It draws four conclusions: international oil price's shocks is the reason of China's policy interest adjustment whether in short or long term; fluctuation of international oil price may lead to the adjustment of RMB's exchange rate in long run, while there are bidirectional causality between them in short term; fluctuation of international oil price is the reason of the change of China's real estate price in short term while no relation between them in the long run; there is no causality between international oil price and China's stock price regardless of long or short-term.

Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3

Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: KM processes; Organizational readiness; UTAUT; KM infrastructure
Abstract: The main purpose of this paper is to propose a conceptual model that can be used to assess the organizational readiness and its contributing factors for KM process adoption. The authors propose that the organizational readiness should be assessed considering both organizational and individual factors. The model has been developed by integrating KM infrastructure and Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTA UT). This model will enrich the KM literature, especially on KM readiness, while being the basis for other researchers and authors to develop further.

Author Keywords: collaborative plan; distributed supply chain; collaborative optimization
Abstract: This article systematically states how to use the collaborative plan to optimize the distributed supply chain(DSC) system. Firstly, the article analyzes the necessity of using the collaborative plan to optimize the distributed supply chain system, then proposes the goal of using the coordination plan to coordinated optimize the distributed supply chain system, finally suggests the method of using the collaborative plan to optimize the distributed supply chain system.

Authors: Kilany, RM; Ammar, R; Rajasekaran, S; Sheta, W
Author Full Names: Kilany, Rania M.; Ammar, Reda.; Rajasekaran, S.; Sheta, Wala.
Article Title: A New Framework for High Performance Processing of Voluminous Multisource Datasets
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: High Performance processing; Data Mining; Data Reduction
Abstract: In this paper we present a new framework to process high-volumes of data generated from heterogeneous sources with different formats (text, image's features ...etc.). The framework consists of three phases. The first phase selects appropriate data reduction technique that closely preserves all of the relevant information in the original data set. The second phase determines the suitable algorithm to apply the selected data reduction technique. The third phase integrates the reduced datasets and makes it ready to fit into different models (Visualization, Reports, Decision making, and predictions). This framework is ideal for knowledge management of data-intensive applications.

Article Title: Crises in Supply Chain Management from the Calculus Milk Powder Event
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: supply chain management; crisis of SCM; adverse selection; moral crises; the calculus milk powder event; Sanlu
Abstract: In August, 2008, the outbreak of the calculus milk powder event gives rise to reflection on supply chain management, especially the crisis factors in supply chain management. Calculus milk powder event has not only brought out enormous tangible and intangible economic losses to Santa, but also arisen negative influence to the whole consumption and socio-economic development. Meanwhile, it also reveals the enterprise's deficiency in SCM and the significance of strengthening SCM. When every link in the supply chain confronts crises, the linkage effect of crises is formed immediately, and endangers all enterprises in the supply chain. This paper studies the internal and external crises factors in supply chain management, as well as the adverse selection and morality crises under the principal-agent relationship. Meanwhile, take the Sanlu as an example to empirically analyze the reasons why crises happen in supply chain management of Santa. So, it's time for Sanlu and all other enterprises to study and strengthen crisis management of SC

Article Title: Think on the Network-based Protection Management of Historical Cities in China
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: network; protection management; historical city; public participation; transportation system
Abstract: The paper is to explore protection management method for Chinese historical cities nowadays. By using investigation of the status quo of protection, the authors found out problems exist in protection management of present Chinese historical cities, and carefully analyzed its technical priority in protection for historical cities according to characteristic of network technology. Network technology that has quickly developed in China is brought forward to solve those problems that could not be solved in traditional way, such as public participation and transportation. On the other hand, combining actuality of Chinese historical cities, the paper also points out shortage of network technology application. Most retained historical cities in China are middle and small cities, whereas the development of network technology there are slow generally. In the long run, applying network technology to protect historical cities in China is a very good method, and it needs further research for finding an appropriate development road for the situation of middle and small cities.

Author Keywords: enterprise expansion; range investment; industry decision-making
Abstract: During the course of range expansion, the industry decision-making is related to the efficiency and the growth even the existence of enterprise. This articles put forward the industry attractiveness enterprise capability and reciprocity - enterprise investment risk systematic analysis framework based on enterprise capability diversification investment and investment risk theory, and build up the evaluation system of the targeted industry, which based on a balance and evaluation of the above 3 factors. At last, this article established an industry decision-making model founded on the Analytic Hierarchy Process.

Article Title: Study of Evaluation and Selection on Third Party Reverse Logistics providers
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: third party reverse logistics(3PRL); fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; outsourcing; study; evaluation
Abstract: Two of the most significant problems of our era are the depletion of the natural energy and resources and the pollution caused from the disposal of waste end-of-life products. An effective reverse logistics (RL) operation can help organizations make good use of nature energy and resources and take healthy balance between economy and environment Thereby R-L has emerged as one of the most rapidly evolving research fields in the past few years. Reverse logistics is actually very involved and can be extremely complex. Many companies with limited resources outsource their reverse logistics operation needs to third-party providers [1]. This paper firstly present a decision model for enterprises performing RL activities. After that, the paper creates an evaluation index system for selecting a 3PRL provider, and the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) is applied to calculate the objective weights. On the basis of this, an evaluation model is built to evaluate 3PRL providers by using the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation methodology, and an example demonstrates the model's efficiency.

Article Title: Research study concerning social impact of Complex Environmental Project
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: local community; impact; social study; access control; integrated price systems; alternative transport modes
Abstract: The partnership between La Rochelle, Preston and Ploiesti, made possible the development of a project called SUCCESS (Smaller Urban Communities in Civitas for Environmentally Sustainable Solutions). The local demonstrations include the implementation of different projects for vehicles with biodiesel engine, having as base a variety of initiatives which include access control areas, integrated price systems. alternative transport modes, real time informational systems and new concepts regarding freight transport at city level. Implementation of such project supposes use of new technologies and restrictions in car use for both inhabitants and economic agents. Studies were made in order to determine the social impact of project; these studies determine the acceptance and awareness of measures implemented.

Article Title: A Strategy For Knowledge Management In E-Government
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: E-government (EG); knowledge; knowledge management (KM); strategy; strategic approaches
Abstract: Knowledge management has become increasingly critical for the success of governments in this emerging era of e-government. As government activities increasingly shift to the web, the challenge facing government administration is providing quality services by responding observantly to the needs of the public. A good knowledge management strategy can help achieve this goal. Therefore, it is important to understand how governments can successfully implement knowledge management programs that will help them to gain citizenry satisfaction and expectations. This paper identifies knowledge management strategies in e-government. It will demonstrate how governments can benefit by adopting strategies that harness the potential of knowledge management technologies to transform their e-business activities and provide an overview of the driving and impeding forces that help and hinder proper deployment of knowledge management strategies in e-government. At the same time approaches and implementation issues which are integrating knowledge management into e-government activities are described.

Article Title: CONNECTING ENGINEERING EDUCATION TO THE BUSINESS COMMUNITY REQUIREMENTS BASED ON THE ACTUAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE MANAGERIAL COMPETENCES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS

Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paper is addressing the complex challenges of academic environment in the framework of technological education. A sine qua non condition for creating an appropriate teaching environment that allows technical students to acquire useful business and managerial competencies to deeply understand the business community needs Thus, the authors have conducted a comparative study aimed to bridge the gap between the offer and the demand with respect to business and managerial competencies ensued by engineering education Based on the research results, the authors share their views regarding how both academic environment and business community could take advantage of building innovation networks. This network aspect of the innovation processes fosters cluster of innovation and cooperation between teams of students, educators and entrepreneurs. In this way all parties involved will benefit from networking opportunities with respect to initiate collaborative projects and share information, knowledge, and experience.

Abstract: This paper discusses the suitability of an e-procurement system in increasing logistic performance, given the growth in fast Internet availability,. In consequence, a model is derived and submitted for analysis. The scope of the research is limited at the intermediary goods importing sector for a better and easier quantification of the results. Article Title: Research on Monitoring Index System of Labour Market
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: labour; labour market; monitoring index system
Abstract: With the continuous development of China's labour market, labour market fluctuation has become more frequent and increasingly intensive, contradiction between supply and demand has been conspicuous and employment situation has become serious. However, labour statistical indexes in China at present cannot reflect the conditions of labour market in a comprehensive, accurate and timely manner, so it is extremely urgent to establish and improve a monitoring index system of labour market. This paper makes a meaningful exploration on building a monitoring index system of China labour market by drawing lessons from International Labour Organization's experiences and adopting statistical indicator theories and approaches.

Article Title: Examining IT Outsourcing Decisions and Practices of Small and Medium Enterprises in Malaysia
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Outsourcing decisions; outsourcing practices; small-and-medium enterprises; Malaysia
Abstract: IT outsourcing business tends to be the domain of large companies. However, with increase saturation of outsourcing market among large companies, the under-exploited SME market emerges as a potentially lucrative playground for vendors. SMEs, confined by limited resources, can benefit from having external services. Literature review shows a lack of outsourcing research among SMEs in Malaysia. This paper thus aims at examining IT outsourcing decisions and practices of Malaysia SMEs. Data was collected from SMEs in the manufacturing and service sectors in Malaysia. The findings show that the lack of internal competency is the primary reason that drives IT outsourcing and that SMEs prefer shorter-term contractual agreements. To attract SMEs, vendors have to establish trust prior to contract signing. This trust is critical for long-term outsourcing engagement. If resources permit, SMEs would revert to in-house IT services to minimize dependency on vendors.

Article Title: Study on the Effect of Minimum Wages in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: minimum wages; employment; labor costs
Abstract: This paper presents new evidences on the effects of the minimum wage, and evaluates the efficacy of the minimum wage according to Chinese monthly household and firm panel data between 1995 and 2006. By examining the effects on wages, employment and prices together we are able to provide an explanation for the small employment effects prevalent in the literature. Our principal finding is that increasing the minimum wage raises wages and prices with small adverse employment effects. This suggests a general wage-price inflationary spiral, where persistent inflation offsets some of the wage gains. This has potentially important policy implications and researched area.

Article Title: Comparative Study on Decentralized and Centralized Management of Spare Parts Inventory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: spare inventory; centralized management; decentralized management; shortage risk
Abstract: Building the decentralized and centralized management models of spare parts under the control of the risk out of stock, this paper makes a comparison of safety inventory quantity and inventory cost between the two models. The findings of the study, which are verified by numerical examples in this paper, indicate that, with the same probability of stock shortage, the centralized management model can reduce inventory holdings of enterprises so as to lower down their inventory cost and reduce capital occupation.

Authors: Zhao, HJ; He, CZ; Ye, Z
Author Full Names: Zhao, Hengjun; He, Changzheng; Ye, Zhen
Article Title: Fuzzy Clustering-based GMDH Model to Feature Selection in Customer Analysis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: fuzzy rule; FRI algorithm; feature selection; fuzzy clusterin; customer relationship management
Abstract: Feature selection has recently been the subject of intensive research in data mining, especially for datasets with a large number of descriptive attributes such as feature selection in customer relationship management (CRM). In this paper, FRI algorithm which has some deficiencies in feature selection of market segments groups is improved. A new FC-based GMDH model is built. It has the advantage of combining both qualitative and quantitative information in the decision analysis, which is extremely important for CRM. To derive the decision rules from different customer group for identifying features that contribute to CRM, both fuzzy clustering and heuristic algorithm are developed in this paper. It has been demonstrated in the empirical research that the proposed algorithm is able to derive the rules and identify the most significant features more accuracy than FRI when feature difference between customer segments is not obvious, which is unique and useful in solving CRM problems. The results showed the practical viability of the proposed approach for customer feature selection.

Authors: Zhao, Y; Du, M; Le, JJ; Guo, YM
Author Full Names: Zhao, Yan; Du, Ming; Le, Jiajin; Guo, Yongming
Article Title: Research on the Intelligent Online Trading Platform Based on J2EE
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Soft Platform; J2EE; Mobile Agent; Webwork; Spring; Ibatis; Aglets
Abstract: Nowadays, most online trading platforms are based on J2EE technology. However, the online trading platform only supports the typical B2B online trading among enterprises which cannot exchange information with the online trading platform based on agent mobile and hasn't intelligent feature. In this paper, we propose a new online trading platform model based on J2EE which meets the requirements of typical B2B online trading and supports mobile agent technology. It not only maintains the steady Web technology but also increases the distinctive merit of mobile agent technology which will bring new vital force for the online trading of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises. Next, based on this model, then we structure a technology model of the online trading platform by integrating the three open source frameworks - Webwork, Spring and iBATIS and mobile agent technology, which makes the platform have intelligent feature by realizing the function of negotiating and arriving at a transaction price with buyer enterprise according to pre-set strategy. Finally, we design and implement the business pattern based on mobile agent technology in the model.

Book Editors: Chen, SH; Terano, T; Yamamoto, R
Article Title: Boundary Organizations: An Evaluation of Their Impact Through a Multi-Agent System
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Boundary organization; Opinion diffusion; Decision-making; Agent-based model
Abstract: Modern environmental issues imply that decision-makers consider simultaneously various dimensions, such as science and economics. To take into account opinions from experts of different fields, they can rely on boundary organizations, institutions able to cross the gap between different domains and act beyond the boundaries. By encouraging a flow of useful information, they provide a better understanding of a situation characterized by uncertainty, increasing the efficiency of the decision-making process. Though never formally proved, this hypothesis is widely accepted based on the observation of existing institutions. In this paper, we observe the impact of boundary organizations through an agent-based model of continuous opinion dynamics over two dimensions where heterogeneous experts distinguished by credibility and uncertainty interact. We conclude that boundary organizations significantly reduce the diversity of opinions expressed and increase the number of experts agreeing to emerging positions, which confirms their positive impact on the efficiency of decision-making.

Article Title: Optimization of the Teaching in Electronic Commerce
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Electronic Commerce; talent cultivation; curriculum system
Abstract: Nowadays,the society makes great demand on E-commerce talents, companys urgently lack the E-commerce professionals who is able to be responsible for the decision-maker, the talents who know both the techonology and the E-commerce is quite rare. With the development of Electronic-commerce and the informationization of enterprises management, the content and the method of Electronic-commerce education have changed deeply. So as to do well in talents educating, this paper will make researches on optimizing the E-commerce curriculum system and develops a E-commerce curriculum system based on static & dynamic training mode. This curriculum system centers on the principles of information management,takes computer science and remote telecommunication technology as due instruments and tools in management of information system of the course, and considers knowledge of management science and economics as thinking and methods in designing information management system of the course, the three of which should complement each other. At the same time, in order to improve teaching achievement, this article points out some optimizing measures which should be taken during the teaching process of the compulsory profession course.

Article Title: Applications of Finite Mixture Weibull-Gamma Model for New Automobiles Trial Calibration and Forecasting in Chinese Market
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: finite mixture Weibull-Gamma model; new product penetration; calibrating and forecasting
Abstract: Although Chinese automobile market grew very fast during the last twenty years, few new automobiles succeed in this high competitive market. Consequently, how to calibrate and forecast the new automobile penetration process becomes a key issue in pursuit of success in Chinese automobile market. This article extends the weibull model to finite mixture weibull-gamma model (FWG) by considering difference between individuals and difference between customer groups. Then an empirical analysis was carried out to analyze the accuracy of calibrating and forecasting of FWG model by employing BASS model as a benchmark. Results show that FWG model is more accurate in calibrating and forecasting for Chinese new automobiles trial than Bass model.

Article Title: SVG Plus AJAX Based Linked-Entity Visualization for Product Semantic Annotation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: virtual organization; OWL; Semantic Annoationt; Linked-Entity Visualization; SVG
Abstract: In order to discover the potential semantic association on the heterogeneous product information among the virtual enterprise units over the Internet, a Linked-Entity Visualization (LEV) base on the XOEM+OWL is put forward that uses AJAX/SVG to realize the visualization in the display space of the browser. It is driven by the semantic data and its data on the relationships between individual entities on the semantic data and the properties of these entities based on the XOEM+OWL semantic model. Lev semantic description is put forward at first, and then the correspondent data schemas are designed and build, the example is shown at last.

Article Title: A Statistical Study on the Defects of Scientific Research Projects Selection System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: scientific research projects; selection system; defects
Abstract: This paper probes into the defects of scientific research projects selection system by statistical analysis. The study has shown that although the scientific research projects selection system played a very important role in subsidizing the scientific research, this system really isn't flawless. This study indicates that there are three serious defects in the scientific research projects selection system: the peer reviews lack consistency; there are stochastic in the selection outcome; the social relationship has influenced the peer review.

Article Title: Ain't no Sunshine when the Boom is Gone: Questioning the Roots of Current Global Financial Crisis
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Monetary Austrian School; Financial Crises; Political Economy; Boom-Bust Cycles
Abstract: In autumn 2008 the unrivalled stars of Wall Street and international financial markets have been struggling to understand why the boom was gone, after enjoying years of bright sunshine in financial markets. In this short note, we put forth a new line of political-economy reasoning in explaining the root causes of the global financial turmoil, which turned Wall Street into a house which ain't no home as long as the boom is gone. In this regard, we argue that the recent financial crisis is rather a political failure, which comes at the price of recession.

Author Keywords: farm machinery; statistics; design; management information system
Abstract: The farm machinery statistics is an important task of the farm machinery management, agricultural machinery statistics will provide the main basis for decision-making. With the development of computer technology, the use of advanced software technology and network technology can change the traditional agricultural machinery statistical methods. So, three tasks has done in this paper. First, the present situation of the farm machinery statistics management informationization was analyzed. Subsequently, the system solutions, based on the Microsoft (IIS) structure, was designed and the functional structures was planned. At last, the key technologies were analyzed and explained.

Article Title: Study on Information Engineering Surveillance Risk Assessment Based on VaR Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: risk assessment approaches and methodologies; quantitative and qualitative risk assessment; VaR model; Bayes model
Abstract: Firstly, this paper introduces VaR theory to information security risk estimation for the first time. The paper tries to apply VaR model to information engineering risk assessment and to estimate risk value based on VaR model adopted the method of Bayes. An information engineering risk management model based on Bayes Model and VaR Model is presented. According to the new data obtained from the information system, it can continually predict risks, identify sources of risks, and take proper measure to reduce risk occurrence probability. Finally, an example is introduced to come to the conclusion whether the project is feasible.

Article Title: Method of Product Family Design Based on Shape Grammar
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product family; shape grammar; innovation strategy; industrial design
Abstract: The method of product family design based on shape grammar is proposed aiming at enhancing market competitiveness. This method uses shape grammar to extract basic form elements and transform them according to given rules in order to generate new product family constructed on product platform with homogeneous characters, reduce cost and shorten product development cycle. Meanwhile, value and connotation of brand are transmitted by this method. Taking Motorola as an example, this paper explores the history of product family and product shape grammar.
