Article Title: EVALUATION OF GRADUATE ACADEMIC QUALIFICATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Three fundamental areas of quality assurance in education must be taken into consideration for an organization which aims to become or already operates as a higher education institution: institutional capacity, educational effectiveness and quality management. To address the issue regarding the educational effectiveness in Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu (LBUS), we designed a survey to assess RAQAHE performance indicators like as: employability within the field of the academic qualification, access to the next level of academic studies and level of students' satisfaction with regard to their professional and personal development ensured by our institution. The results of the survey suggest that knowledge, competences and skills acquired by LBUS graduates are sufficient for them to integrate in the tabour market, to develop their own business, to access to the next study cycle and to continually team and develop. In this article we present the methodology after which the survey was conducted and preliminary results of the investigation.

Abstract: The paper analyses the main cargo type and its typical routes of river-to-sea transport on Yangtze River and multi-object comprehensive calculation model system for transportation organizing mode of Yangtze-fiver bulk cargo is established. Multi-criteria evaluation method is adopted in the paper and taking into account uncertainties of transport. AHP-Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation based on random simulation method is proposed in this paper to multi-objective optimization and evaluation for bulk cargo transport on the Yangtze-river. And obtain the best ship type with main dry bulk river-to-sea transport.

Author Full Names: Sun Peihong; Yu Xuejie; Gao Xiaoqiu
Article Title: An empirical study of the Retail format development in Inner Mongolia
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: retail format; empirical; inner mongolia; development; IRS
Abstract: The retail industry in Inner Mongolia is in the transition period. On one hand, it is in a rapid development, on the other, it is facing many problems. To manage and plan the retail industry in Inner Mongolia in accordance with the Retail Trade evolution of the law can avoid the vicious competition brought by redundant construction and blind development and improve the industrial competitiveness of the entire retail industry. Since the evolution of the Retail Trade is limited to theoretical research, the paper analysizes three Retailing evolution of the dynamic factors through the test of the level of economic development, consumer behavior and industry competition, and shows the empirical data and conclusion of the status quo and development trend of the retail industry in Inner Mongolia on the basis of getting first-hand information through research. Due to the rapid economic development of Inner Mongolia, many new retail formats have been provided with favorable conditions to survive. The interaction between the difference of consumption behaviors and retail type of operation is increasing.On one hand, different levels of consumption call various types of operation to match them; on the other, the introduction and creation of retail formats promote the diversification of consumers' shopping behavior. Traditional types of operation have appeared a trend as transitional type in competition. Meanwhile, some new retail formats are rapidly developing. The Inner Mongolian retailing in the future will be an industry with the coexistence of plenty of retail formats.

Abstract: In order to deal with current financial crisis attending private economy today, companies should first adopt survival strategies, and then plan long-term development on condition of global competition. This paper outlines how an open innovation initiative applies in development strategy to undergo ordeals and seek future growth. Three aspects used in conjunction suggest new thinking: firstly, the ignorance in technological innovation in private sector; secondly, highlights of the application of open innovation; and thirdly, the methods that help execute open innovation.

Article Title: The Knowledge Based Accounting: Next step in Total Quality Accounting
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Information; Accounting; Knowledge; TQM; TQA
Abstract: The evolution of society is dominated by some benchmarks, two of them, that is, information and quality, being of peculiar interest for the topic of our discussion. Regarding accounting, we agree that, in time, it underwent the following stages: data-based accounting (d-accounting), information-based accounting (i-accounting) and knowledge-based accounting (kb-accounting). In the specialty literature ([1], [1] [12], [13]) the overall quality of the accounting information represents a challenge both for practitioners, as well as for theorists in the field, a thing which led to the emergence of an accounting concept that has become more and more used: Total Quality Accounting (TQA). In our opinion, accounting based on meaningful information will represent a new step in reaching total quality accounting. This study catches the premises that determine the evolution of accounting towards this stage and the implications the TQA concept has in the above-mentioned process.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial cluster; network integrated manufacturing; B/S architecture; enterprise alliance
Abstract: Industrial cluster has become an important mode for development of the enterprises and the regions. The construction of the network integrated manufacturing architecture and the realization process of an industrial cluster are discussed and analyzed in this paper. The study shows that adopting three-layer B/S architecture can realize the link of heterogeneous networks and make the enterprise alliance respond quickly to the market, lower the cost of the product's life cycle and share the data. Four steps should be included in the process of network integrated manufacturing of a regional industrial cluster: looking for partners in or outside the regional industrial cluster, forming the regional alliance of network integrated manufacturing, realizing the network integrated manufacture and disbanding the regional alliance of network integrated manufacturing.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: real estate industry; the listed companies; capital structure; company performance
Abstract: This paper selects 50 listed real estate companies from 2006 to 2008 as the object of study, and applies ROA as an indicator to evaluate the company performance, exploring the relationship between the capital structure and the company performance from the facts of the assets liabilities ratio, the proportion of state-owned shares and ownership concentration, company size and company growth. The positive results show that the assets liabilities ratio and the proportion of state-owned shares are inversely proportional to the company performance, and company size is positively correlated with the company performance. And the correlation between the remaining three variables and the company performance is not obvious.

Abstract: According to the International Study on Entrepreneunal Activity - GEM Annual Report 2007, a gender difference in business exists throughout all regions. The gender distribution shows similar patterns in middle- and low-income countries as in high-income countries, although females are less underrepresented among entrepreneurs in middle- and low-income countries as in high-income countries.' Still 73% of innovation-driven countries had significantly higher levels of training among men than women. Though, women are also successful in setting up companies'. These facts indicate some clear differences in factors, which affect the attitudes and motivations of women - and therefore clear implications for the type of support, which women need to get started.

Abstract: With the aggravation and spread of the USA financial crisis, the whole world economy has got into a recession, this brought about grave impingement not only to world automobile industry, China automobile industry also received deep effect. This paper proposes an objective and comprehensive analysis about both the challenges and opportunities for China automobile industry in the global financial crisis as well as the essential countermeasures for governments and corporations to cope with the crisis.

Article Title: Innovative Mechanism Research on Management System of the Project of Nanyang Eco-industrial Park
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: large-scale construction project; management innovation; independent evaluation; investment benefit; post-evaluation
Abstract: In the projects construction of Nanyang eco-industrial park, not only construction period is very short, but also the engineering quantity is very great. Moreover, requirements of quality are very high, and construction organization is very difficult. By the innovation on the management system of the projects construction of Nanyang eco-industrial park, the project management office of the industrial park is set up during project is constructed. A tripartite mechanism of construction, management and use is composed. It has greatly improved the management level of the project construction. Meanwhile, it restricts the corruption problem. When the management system characterized by general supervision coordination representative, it ensures the project construction to be carried out smoothly. At the same time, projects management realizes marketization, socialization and specialization. It achieves a better. social and economic benefit. Supplying management method characterized by collective bidding procurement bulk materials,guarantee the procedure to be justice, public and transparent. It also guarantees the material quality and put an end to corrupt. When the incentive mechanism of labor emulation, characterized by independent evaluation, not only the quality of the projects is guarantee, but also the enthusiasms of construction enterprises are aroused. Similarly, when a post-evaluation mechanism of the industrial park investment projects is established, experience and lesson are summarized. Meanwhile, evaluation results and suggestion are feedback to decision departments in time, so as to guide second phase project construction. By the innovation on management system of the projects construction in many aspects, the projects of industrial park are constructed well and rapidly. The maximum investment benefits, good social-benefits and economic benefits can be achieved finally. At the same time, it has some guiding significance for the similar engineering construction.

Author Keywords: deliberate learning; conceptualizing; framework
Abstract: Learning has become the inherent nature of a market-oriented organization. This logic shift calls on organizations for widening learning responsibility. In this paper, the importance of frontline deliberate learning is introduced and then it analyzes the conceptualizing process of deliberate learning. Unique features in the frontlines are studied. Finally, a conceptual framework is developed for understanding the process of the deliberate learning in frontline unit.

Abstract: The propose of this work is to set a concept of E-business experiment education system based on the theory of knowledge management. For this sake a framework of education call centre is explored to support the knowledge flow in E-business. The structures facilitate the education of communication and sharing of knowledge associated with E-business.

Article Title: DIFFERENTIATION STRATEGIES FOR BUSINESS SCHOOLS IN EMERGING MARKETS: THE CASE OF ROMANIA
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Business schools operate nowadays in a competitive and tumultuous market, driven by several forces: non-traditional competition, the emergence of corporate universities, increasing students' expectations, the continuous rise of distance learning programs, and rising program costs. Today, the business schools market in Romania sees a variety of institutions offering different types of business training, as it is perceived to be open and training providers still comfortably assume a constant demand for their products. Our paper aims at addressing the issue of postgraduate business education in emerging countries, with a focus on the Romanian market, through an investigation and critical evaluation of market differentiation strategies employed so far by programs offered by business schools in Romania, accompanied by an analysis of these programs' prospects in the years to come, under the pressure of a more competitive business environment and in the wider context of trends in business schools around the world.

Article Title: Study on Improving Service-oriented Product Design Efficiency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: efficiency; product design; quality function deployment (QFD); service
Abstract: This paper provides insight in efficient methods for designing new service product. The economic globalization and the fierce competition are placing an ever-increasing emphasis on the rapid development and introduction of new products. Central to this aim is improving the efficiency of product design. In this article, we proposed the goal of creating a service product is to meet the customers' requirements and using quality function deployment (QFD) to develop new products. On the basis of illustrating the merits of QFD, the research suggested that using QFD is better focus on adequate describing requirements, handing relations between requirements and the technology, which contributes to the product innovation performance. Finally, the results from the application and testing of this method within a case study are summarized and used to help derive conclusions regarding the validity of the research.

Author Full Names: Ling, Tan Nya; San, Lim Ying; Hock, Ng Tuan
Article Title: Trust: Facilitator of Knowledge-sharing Culture
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Trust; knowledge-sharing culture; knowledge; knowledge management (KM)
Abstract: The culture of trust in the workplace has been shown to have a strong and robust influence that act as an important force behind the sharing of knowledge. In this study, using literature review, we had clearly identified trust as one of the key facilitator that influences the development and establishment of a knowledge-sharing culture. It is hope that the contributions from this study will support and encourage organisations in making decisions on taking a step forward in inculcating a knowledge-sharing culture that shares not only valuable knowledge but also new knowledge. This is partly due to the fact that organisations nowadays are still unaware of the potential benefit and impact of knowledge in making continuous organisational development and improvement.

Article Title: PATENTS, ACADEMIC GLOBALIZATION AND THE LIFE CYCLE OF INNOVATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: R&D (research and development); innovation; patent; academic globalization
Abstract: The analysis of the life cycle of innovation depends on the expansion of intellectual property (IP) rights. Innovation is view as a dynamic step by step process in which innovation generated in a stage of development represents the basic input for the next step. This dynamics depends on the openness, expansion and the upstream fragmentation of the patent rights. Dissemination encourages the formation of new R&D clusters and increases the diversity of advanced researchers. Openness give a new freedom for all the actors in R&D and this mechanism add a better engagement in the experiments that broaden the diversity of research lines because of the subsequent impact across a wide range of research lines An increase of the level of openness of the innovational R&D reduces the costs associated with the explanation of the new instrument along a vertical research line. Based on the life cycle of innovation concept, an economical analysis of the forces and trade-offs at work in a competitive environment with both proprietary and open firms is presented.

Article Title: Improve Quality of Internship for Civil Engineering Students with a Circled Management System
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technical-vocational education and training; post-internship; management system; civil engineering; employability skills
Abstract: The quality of post-internship of higher vocational education has always been a concern for educators and administrators. To effectively manage the post-internship and improve the quality of vocational training, we proposed a management system, including quality objectives, conduct system, driving system, constraint system and feedback system. This paper, taking Zhejiang College of construction as example, illustrated its application. A questionnaire survey was also conducted to explore the validation of the system. Investigation shows that after the implementation of this circled management system the employability of students were markedly improved: more than 90% students were formally employed; nearly 80% graduates were employed by the top enterprises; students having achieved two or more than two professional qualification certificates were up to 99%, and more than 95% parents were satisfied with the training.

Authors: Santos, DSS; Pereira, AMJ; Gonçalves, RMRM
Author Full Names: Santos, Diana S. S.; Pereira, Antonio M. J.; Goncalves, Ramiro M. R. M.
Article Title: IntelligentCart: Architecture of an Innovative System for the Acquisition of Products in Grocery Stores
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Automatic Product Identification; Grocery Stores; Electronic Services
Abstract: Large grocery stores are nowadays used by millions of people for the acquisition of an enlarging number of products. Product acquisition represents a complex process that comprises lime spent in corridors, product location and checkout queues. On the other hand, it is becoming increasingly difficult for retailers to keep their clients loyal and to predict their needs due to the influence of competition and the lack of tools that discriminate consumption patterns. In this article it is presented the proposal of an architecture and solution of an innovative system for the acquisition of products in grocery stores (IntelligentCart). The IntelligentCart explores enlarging mobile technologies and automatic identification technologies (such as RFID) as a way to improve the quality of services provided by retailers and to augment the consumer value thus allowing to save time and money.

Article Title: A Case Study on ABC Implementation in Chinese Cigarette Company
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: activity-based costing; conventional costing; tobacco industry; allocation
Abstract: This paper deals with the case study of implementation of activity-based costing in a Chinese medium-sized cigarette company. It aims to develop an ABC system for the company in order to calculate the product costs more accurately and make correct managerial and strategic decisions. Firstly it introduces current developing status and cost calculation system applied in Chinese tobacco industry. Secondly it designs the ABC system in this cigarette company, mainly includes the identified activities, cost pools and cost drivers. It also compares data information between conventional cost system and ABC system and gets conclusions: conventional cost system has distorted the cost information. Thirdly it discusses the applications of ABC in this cigarette company. Also some suggestions such as resetting products' prices and reorganizing products lines are offered to improve the company's decision making by using ABC system.

Authors: Vrazalic, L; MacGregor, R; Behl, D; Fitzgerald, J
Author Full Names: Vrazalic, Lejla; MacGregor, Robert; Behl, Donna; Fitzgerald, Jean
Article Title: E-learning Barriers in the United Arab Emirates: Preliminary Results from an Empirical Investigation
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-learning; barriers; UAE
Abstract: E-learning is relatively new to the United Arab Emirates. Most tertiary institutions have allocated ICT resources to provide alternatives to the previously used teacher-centred chalk and talk approach to learning and teaching. However we have not yet developed a comprehensive understanding of the application of e-learning methods and resources in the tertiary education sector in the UAE. This paper describes a collaborative research project which empirically investigated the perceived barriers to e-learning for students studying at tertiary institutions in the UAE using an online questionnaire. The paper analyses the associations between e-learning barriers and students' age and gender. The ease of use, usefulness and satisfaction with e-learning are also examined in relation to e-learning barriers. The preliminary research findings presented here will inform faculty who are integrating technology in their teaching and the tertiary institutions encouraging the use of e-learning as an integral part of the learning environment.

Article Title: The Impact of Psychological Rehabilitation on the Patients with Work-related Brain Trauma
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: psychological rehabilitation; work-related injury; brain trauma
Abstract: Objective:This paper aims at exploring the impact of psychological rehabilitation on the recovery of patients with work-related trauma. Methods: The trial group receive both physical and psychological rehabilitation treatment, and the control group only receive physical rehabilitation treatment, Hamilton depression scale (HAMD), Fugal-Meyer motion function scale, and the activities of daily living scale are employed in measuring the impact of psychological rehabilitation on the patients with work-related Brain Trauma in terms of recovery and the ability to reintegrate into the society. Results: The results are as follows: I measured by HAMD, patients in two groups show no evident difference after one-month treatment, and very significant difference (P<0.05) after three-month treatment and significant difference after six-month treatment (p<0.01). 2. Measured by Fugl-Meyer FMA, the patients show relatively significant difference after being treated for one month and after being treated for three months (P<0.05). After six-month treatment the trial group and the control group show very significant difference (P<0.01). 3. Measured by Activity of Daily Living Scale (ADL), the trial group shows great difference from the control group after 1-month, 3-month and six-month treatment in terms of MBI (P<0.05). Conclusion: Based on the analysis, this paper comes to the conclusion that psychological rehabilitation plays an important role in helping the patients to get rid of psychological problems, to relieve emotional disorders and to build self-confidence. In turn the patients will be encouraged to coordinate with the doctors in the treatment and to have better ability in reintegrating into the society.

Article Title: Research on the Product Design Process
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product design process; communication; system integration
Abstract: Along with the status of design in people's life, the product design process is also highlighted gradually. In the past, people pursued the characteristics of the complex product, abandoned the elegant concise designs that users' experience has become the least important in the link of the design. Now, what we pursue is the priority to design, user-orientated design philosophy, which need us compact the entire design process together. This article describes the value of the design process and introduces the specific implementation of the design process. Facilitate the designers from different angles and at all levels to understand the design process, making the design of product in a planned, step-by-step and effective long line method.

Article Title: A Study on the Relationship between Organizational Characteristics, Internal Organizational Integration and New Product Development Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: corporate culture; organizational flexibility; executive support; internal organizational integration; new product development
Keywords Plus: INNOVATION; SUCCESS; MODEL; MANAGEMENT; INDUSTRY; FIRMS
Abstract: This paper discusses the relationship between organizational characteristics, internal organizational integration and new product development performance, and conducts empirical research based on the investigation of domestic manufacturing enterprises. The results show that cooperative and sharing culture, executive support, and enterprise informatization have positive impact on internal organizational integration, and the impact of organizational flexibility on internal organizational integration is not significant, internal organizational integration has positive impact on new product development performance. These results can provide useful references for enterprises to enhance the performance of new product development through internal organizational integration.

Author Full Names: Xi Wei; Pan Feng; Yan Jingdong
Article Title: Countermeasure for Industry-Academia-Research Cooperation of Small and Medium-sized Enterprise in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industry-academia-research cooperation; small and medium-sized enterprise; technological innovation
Abstract: IAR cooperation is an important solution for technological innovation and level development of SMEs. This paper makes use of correlation theory such as IAR cooperation and technology innovation, and makes research of IAR cooperation in SMEs. IAR cooperation can provide intelligence security and financial support for development of SMEs, and can also improve enterprise resource allocation, which has important significance for development of SMEs in china. However, many problems existing hold back the development of SMEs in China. Considering the domestic condition, it gives some countermeasures and suggestions to promote the IAR cooperation of SMEs in china.

Article Title: Turning Crisis into an Opportunity-On the Development of Private Enterprises under the Global Financial Crisis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: financial crisis; private enterprises; impacts and opportunities
Abstract: The private enterprises have become a new economic growth channel for every region in China. The financial crisis which swept across the whole world brings about both impacts on and opportunities for Chinese private enterprises. From an external point of view, the government has to boost the investment incentives, strengthen financial innovation, and effectively optimize the environment for the development of private enterprises. From an internal perspective, private enterprises should ensure cash flow,control cost, contract business, and restructure and upgrade the enterprises. Through these joint efforts Chinese private enterprises may avoid the impacts of financial crisis and turn crisis into rare opportunities.

Article Title: Research on Technological Innovation of Applying Energy Conservation and Emission Reduction in Electrolytic Aluminum Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technological innovation; energy conservation and emission reduction; electrolytic aluminum; the measure and way
Abstract: With the change of Chinese economic increasing mode and according to the energy conservation and emission reduction policy during the national 11(th) five-year, stepping up to save energy and reduce consumption in electrolytic aluminum industry will be the key work in future. Based on the comprehensive analysis of the difference of main technological indexes in electrolytic aluminum industry at home and abroad, this paper expounds the importance which accelerates technological innovation and promotes the energy conservation and emission reduction mean to the national aluminum industry, and points out the measure and way of applying technological innovation to accelerate the energy conservation and emission reduction in Chinese electrolytic aluminum industry.

Article Title: Fractal Theory and Its Application in Product Configuration Design
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: configuration design; fractal theory; product series; reasonning
Abstract: By analyzing the relationship between fractal theory and product configuration design, the idea of applying fractal theory in product configuration design is proposed. One kind of product configuraiton element model based on the concept of fractal is constructed; and a configurable basic product structure is designed. In response to the configurable model and structure, an approach to recursive configuration reasoning based on fractal theory and knowledge engineering is presented. This new approach has the characteristics of logical description, efficient configuration of product and easy integration with other application systems.

Authors: Zhu, XY; Li, YP; Korkeakoski, M
Author Full Names: Zhu Xiaoyan; Li Yanping; Korkeakoski, Marko
Article Title: Effects of Organizational Political behavior on Individual Promotion
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: organizational political behavior; six dimensions; promotion
Abstract: This article analyzes six dimensions of political behavior in Chinese companies, including: ingratiation, create good individual image, self-promotion, allies, bargaining, blame or downplay others profile. We hypothesize that every dimension of political behavior has positive relationship to individual's promotion. Data are collected from a matched sample of 600 white-collar employees and their supervisors. Results indicate that different dimension of political behaviors have different effects on individual's promotion. Among six dimensions there are 4 play positive roles to individual promotion in career with ingratiation ranked no. 1. These findings demonstrate that the extent to which an individual engages in political behavior may have been a key component to receiving promotion. Finally, main conclusions and areas of future research are provided.

Author Full Names: Alhawari, Samer; Nehari, Amine; Mansour, Ebrahim; Alryalat, Haroun; Hadi, Wa'el Musa
Article Title: The effects of Knowledge Process for Customer on the achievement of Customer Knowledge Retention
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Knowledge Management (KM); Customer Knowledge; Process for Knowledge; Customer Knowledge Retention
Abstract: It is evident that there is a strong competition among organizations and a sort of rapid change in the business environment is taking place. Therefore; organizations start thinking of how to improve their processes to slay competent. Knowledge has become a strategic resource and a basis of competitive advantage in the organization. However, many organizations lost sight of managing Knowledge to grow and compete with domestic and global competitors. Customer Knowledge has been increasingly recognized within process as a significant resource that can be managed to support customer retention. This paper reviews process for knowledge and present suggestions for what a general process to improve customer knowledge retention should include based on analysis of various processes in the literature. The main emphasis is laid upon the concepts of Rationalize Customer Knowledge, Validation Customer Knowledge, and Scrutinize Customer Knowledge. Therefore, this paper contributes to the process of developing customer knowledge retention process. The paper will describe a more valid process in how to achieve customer knowledge retention.

Authors: Amberg, M; Reinhardt, M; Kittler, M
Author Full Names: Amberg, Michael; Reinhardt, Michael; Kittler, Matthias
Article Title: From Virtual Teams to Online Communities: Fostering Group Based Collaboration for Innovation and Knowledge Management
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Collaboration; Open Innovation Communities; Open Innovation Management; Virtual Teams
Abstract: This paper contrasts the characteristics of Virtual Teams and Online Communities with regard to their potentials for fostering Open Innovation Management. We develop scenarios to illustrate the potentially most effective usage for Virtual Teams and Open Innovation Communities in an enterprise and analyze how discontinuous innovations are developed in an open company environment. Core values, which should be taken into account when creating and operating a community effectively, will be identified and classified. To enhance and transfer our findings, we used semi-structured explorative interviews with practitioners engaged in the field of Innovation Management.

Article Title: The Importance of Entrepreneurship in Economic Development
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: economic development; human capital; knowledge accumulation; entrepreneurship
Abstract: Over recent years policy makers have shown increasing interest in the role of entrepreneurship to generate economic growth and development. Entrepreneurship could have a positive contribution to economic development in: creating jobs, easing fiscal burden, and providing competition. But entrepreneurship may undermine economic development, too. The positive role of entrepreneurship that we discuss here is focusing on structural economic change and growth acceleration.

Article Title: Application of Activity-Based Costing in Customer Profitability Analysis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: customer profitability; the classification of customers; customer profitability analysis; activity-based costing; marketing strategy
Abstract: With the rapid development of information technology, the competition of market is increasingly severe. The demand of customers tends to individuation, and different customers bring different profitability for corporations, so it is important to analyze the precise customer profitability, to distinguish between different types of customers and to carry out the right management to control costs of marketing and customer support. This paper focuses on the customer profitability analysis, points out the importance of analyzing the customer profitability and classifies the customers into four kinds according to the difference of the customer profitability. Besides, this paper analyses the customer profitability by introducing the activity-based costing, and illustrates the application of activity-based costing in customer profitability analysis by specific cases. It suggests some key factors which influence the customer profitability. And according to various customers, the corporation takes different marketing strategies, ultimately to achieve optimizing the value chains, lowering the costs of products and improving the customer profitability.

Article Title: Implications of Marketing Orientation for Service Innovations at Chinese University Libraries
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: service innovation; university library; marketing orientation; liaison librarian
Abstract: There is a common misunderstanding among both practitioners and academics that only commercial activities should and could be marketed, and only few Chinese university librarians have achieved a proper understanding of marketing orientation. This paper argues for the necessity of bringing formal marketing into Chinese university libraries existing in a turbulent environment, explains the implications of marketing orientation, internal marketing, marketing process and marketing mix for libraries, and brings forward proposals for liaison librarians to innovate their services delivery.

Article Title: RE-ENGINEERING OF A GRADUATE LEVEL EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMME
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Successful delivery of competences to the socio-economical environment, by means of labour market oriented educational programmes, is one of the key missions of a university in general, and of a technical university in particular. Building on existing knowledge and experience with graduate level programmes, the authors propose an integrated approach to re-engineering of a graduate study programme into a Bologna type master programme in Quality Management and Engineering that meets the requirements of present stakeholders. The methodology developed by the authors advances a two phase approach to curriculum design, facilitating this way the transition to the new master programme. Each of these phases employs the use of structured instruments to ensure consistency and accuracy throughout the entire process Including the key actors throughout the stages of curriculum development, along with their specific requirements, assures that the type of disciplines, their distribution and allocation in time during each semester will allow graduates to face the challenges of today's economic environment

Author Full Names: Elghazaly, Tarek A.; Fahmy, Aly A.
Article Title: English/Arabic Cross Language Information Retrieval (CLIR) for Arabic OCR-Degraded Text
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Cross Language Information Retrieval; CLIR; Arabic OCR-Degraded Text; Arabic Corpus
Abstract: In this paper, a novel for Query Translation and Expansion for enabling English/Arabic CLIR for both normal and OCR-Degraded Arabic Text model has been proposed, implemented, and tested. First, an English/Arabic Word Collocations Dictionary has been established plus reproducing three English/Arabic Single Words Dictionaries. Second, a modern Arabic Corpus has been built. Third, a model for simulating the Arabic OCR errors has been proposed. Forth, a comprehensive model for Query Translation and expansion is proposed. The model translates the Query from English to Arabic detecting and translating collocations, translating single words and transliterating names. It solves the replacement ambiguity then it expands the Arabic Query to handle the expected Arabic OCR errors. The proposed model gives high accuracy in translating the Queries from English to Arabic solving the translation and transliteration ambiguities and with orthographic query expansion, it gave high degree of accuracy in handling OCR errors.

Article Title: SOME RESULTS OF THE PRACTICAL EXPERIMENTS USING NEW METHODS OF WORKING WITH IMAGES IN DIRECT RELATION TO THEIR TEXTURE ANALYSIS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In this paper the authors try different methods of working with images in direct relation to their texture. To find a better solution, the authors have treated the subject simultaneously as engineering and as business education's problem. Finally, the adequate approach was a statistical one. in many natural surfaces, the texture is always exposed and a successful visual system must be able to work with the environmental textured world. The methods of texture examination proposed in this paper could be and are indeed used in a wide range of domains such as: medical picture processing, automatic inspection of surfaces, documents processing, distance viewing etc. The texture's analysis was intensively used also in classifying and finding distance images (satellites etc). In this kind of images there are also a lot of homogeneous regions with different type of textures that must be identified (for instance a texture analysis could identify different types of fields: water portions, earth, cities, grass, etc.) and different methods are more or less adequate to a proper texture analysis. For the experiments the authors have used soil, water and grass samples. The final remark details the inferences from the samples' experiment to the world of engineering and business education, through images and Computer's performance. [COLLABORATION IN ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION]

Article Title: CYBER-WARFARE AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Web 2.0; Security; Business; Social issues
Abstract: It is clear that computers and especially the global connectivity of the Internet have been one of the most far-reaching inventions in human history. High technology has changed the way business is done and the way humans personally connect and interact. 2008 has seen an increasingly public acknowledgement both by governments and business community of the cyberwarfare threat. Our research looks into the ways cyberwarfare transfer into the business world, becoming a specific risk of the global world, offering both a timeline of cyberattacks and also discussing the main solutions offered.

Article Title: The Impact of Supplier Development on Supplier Capability and Performance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: supplier development; supplier development activities; supplier capability; supplier performance
Abstract: Based on the literature analysis of supplier development, 200 companies in China are used as the research object for study the relationship among supplier development, supplier capability and supplier performance. Seven activities belong to three kinds of development activities are proved by factor analysis in this paper. The three kinds of development activities are advanced supplier development, moderate supplier development and basic supplier development. The empirical results showed that the three kinds of supplier development activities are significantly positive correlation to supplier capability and performance; supplier development has indirectly effect on supplier performance through supplier capability. The results of this paper may establish a theoretical foundation for domestic supplier development research, and also may give some theory guidance to the supplier development activities of domestic corporations.

Abstract: Against actual movement characteristic of Shipping company and occurrence mechanism of sea accident, with the combination between information technology and security theory, this paper proposes design process and the characteristic of the ships safety management information system, which argues that it is necessary for enhancing the shipping enterprise's security that does the effective record, memory, and the continuous additional record and the memory for the person - ship environment and the management information. Article Title: The Study on the Characteristics of China's Auto Industry Cluster and its Policy Orientation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industry cluster; policy orientation; independent innovation
Abstract: The China's automobile industry is primarily composed of the six clusters. Through the analysis of the current situation of the six clusters, the paper forecasts the developing trend of six industrial clusters. The paper also exposes the problems in the development of the China's auto industry, and further proposes some principles that should be followed when the policies about the development of auto industry are determined as well as some suggestions about how to strengthen the government's role as the policy guide.

Authors: Kifor, CV; Oprean, C; Georgescu, N; Negulescu, SC
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Kifor, Claudiu V.; Oprean, Constantin; Georgescu, Nicolaic; Negulescu, Sorin C.
Article Title: ENGINEERING EDUCATION: DENSE TEACHING FOR LIFE-LONG LEARNING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The paper starts from the conclusions of a paper on innovating engineering education, but it is only partially its extension, since moving from targets (what needs innovating) to methods (how should be innovated) entails a triple shift of focus. the perspective is rather academic than managerial, the echelon is rather tactical than strategic, the granularity is rather fine than coarse (however, specific - mainly debatable but crucial - Information Technology issues are dealt with in line with new paradigms in a paper to be presented in a section). After reviewing contextually the chief (but well-known) challenges (e g., risk taking vs. continuity, technological innovation vs. academic inertia, exploration vs. exploitation) the paper investigates a less studied paradox of andragogy: how organise institutional teaching, clearly limited in both time (in line with the Bologna framework) and objectives (in line with the curricula) to meet expectations in a free, dynamic, and indistinct environment, as involved by life-long learning. The proposed solution is based on the concept of e-maieutics. Among the conclusions a) Teaching focus must move from knowledge to skills. b) Educator profiles must move from teacher, to trainer, to tutor, to moderator, to catalyst.

Article Title: Cyberterrorism: The Next Arena of Confrontation
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: cyberterrorism; information assurance; internet security; malware; scada; botnet; nimda
Abstract: This paper presents a research conducted over the increasing dangers of cyberterrorism. It discusses the cyberterrorism parameters - the cyberterrorists, the attacks, and the countermeasures as well as the Internet's physical security. The paper sounds an alarm over the current accessibility of critical intranets via the Internet, and points out that the risks in this practice outweigh any possible benefits. Concern is also raised over the security of Internet's physical infrastructure, suggesting increased redundancy and that countries have more physical entry points into cyberspace. The paper concludes with two recommendations. One is the physical isolation of the Internet from critical intranets, and the other is the development of an Internet SCADA to oversee the Internet's performance in the U.S. cyberspace.

Article Title: Study on Evaluation of Technological Innovation Risk Based on Gray Fuzzy Synthetic Method
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technological innovation; risk evaluation; fuzzy gray synthetic method
Abstract: The risk evaluation of enterprise technological innovation is necessary for promotion innovation project success. This article introduces some evaluation methods in the process of technological innovation risk analysis and points out the own merits and shortcomings. The fuzzy gray synthetic evaluation method is proposed. The principle of this method is expatiated in detail. The model of fuzzy gray synthetic evaluation is established on the basis of construction of index on echnological innovation risk. Finally, an example is illustrated. and the result prove that this evaluation method is feasibile and the valid.

Article Title: The Path of Humanistic Design Innovation Based on Technical Rational Criticism
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: humanistic design; industrial design; technical rational criticism; products; innovation path
Abstract: In this paper, the ideas and ways of humanistic design innovation digesting the negative effects of technology rationality were proposed, using the methods of qualitative analysis and theory with practice. Based on the criticism of technology rationality clamping down on people and the thinking of solutions, this paper holds that humanities innovation of industrial design is the necessary means of digesting the negative effects of technology rationality and promoting the humanization of technology products; builds the relationship between industrial design co-ordinating factors(technology, market, and cultural, et al.)and physico-chemical technology creating humane products; and comes to the conclusions of filtering and recycling the process of technology commercialization, enriching and enhancing the humanistic connotation of technology products by using new forms of industrial design, namely experience design, interactive design, eco-design and non-material design.

Article Title: RISK MANAGEMENT IN GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEERING MASTER PROGRAM
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Basic courses of geotechnical and foundation engineering are intended to provide the principles of soil mechanics. The graduate of the 1st cycle should be competent in constructing a geotechnical model appropriate for a well defined situation. The master program in geotechnical engineering intends to continue the education on advanced subjects of soil mechanics, to enhance the training in appropriate use of standards and norms, and also to develop research applied competence in laboratory and field testing. Geo-engineering sciences have a low visibility during education but a significant social impact due to losses induced by failures of construction projects. Risk management can be approached as one course intended to provide investigation of failure modes and corresponding effect analyses, risk assessment and solutions for reducing risks of ground-related uncertainty. It can also be included as one chapter in each course of the master program in Geotechnical Engineering. The paper intends to present these two approaches in risk management and to comment on the acquired competences of the graduate.

Article Title: INQUIRY-BASED APPROACH TO ENHANCE STUDENT LEARNING. CASE STUDY IN FOOD ENGINEERING EDUCATION
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In this paper, an application in the food engineering higher education of an inquiry based method, named Learning-By-Design method (LBD), is presented. The students are asked to develop individually new sugar-based products following some steps distributed on four levels. The first level has as main direction to establish the basis knowledge and rules in working at the obtaining of a new sugar-based product. At the second level, after a preliminary training with the teacher (when all the steps arc presented, discusses and simulated), team of students work alone at the production of their own new product by concept development, product and technology design, product obtaining and analysis, labelling and packaging. During the third level, each team presents the final products to the colleagues who analyse and discuss the concept, the product itself and the marketing approach. The assessment is realised at the four levels and is focused on the analysis of the behaviour in the context of the group, the use of prior knowledge and of science terms The results show that the LBD approach is suitable for teaching the students to solve of a complex problem, the obtaining of a new sugar-based product, with improvement of the behaviour in the context of the group, of the use of prior knowledge and of self-checking and control. The use of science terms is not stimulated by this approach.

Author Full Names: Noor, Ahmad Shukri S. Mohd; Saman, Md Yazid Md
Article Title: Distributed Java Based Medical Imaging Informatics Model
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Java; CORBA; DICOM; Medical Imagine; Medical Informatics; Distributed Object Computing
Abstract: Digital medical informatics and images are commonly used in hospitals today,. Because of the interrelatedness of the radiology department and other departments, especially the intensive care unit and emergency department, the transmission and sharing of medical images has become a critical issue. Our research group has developed a Java-based distributed medical informatics(DMI) framework to facilitate the rapid development and deployment of medical imaging applications in a distributed environment that can be shared and used by related departments and mobile physicians. Java Based Distributed medical informatics is a unique suite of multimedia telemedicine applications developed for the use by medical related organizations. The applications support real-time patients' data, image files, audio and video diagnosis annotation exchanges. The DMI enables joint collaboration between radiologists and physicians while they are at distant geographical locations. The DMI environment consists of heterogeneous, autonomous, and legacy resources. The Common Object Request Broker Architecture (CORBA), Java Database Connectivity (JDBC), and Java language provide the capability to combine the DMI resources into an integrated, interoperable, and scalable system. The underneath technology, including IDL ORB, Event Service, HOP JDBC/ODBC, legacy system wrapping and Java implementation are explored. This paper explores a distributed collaborative CORBA/JDBC based framework that will enhance medical information management requirements and development. It highlights the capability of DMI both in hardware and software as technologically independent. It encompasses a new paradigm for the delivery of health services that requires process reengineering, cultural changes, as well as organizational changes

Abstract: In our study that it is in progress the terms internet banking and is used to refer and describe the types of transactions that are investigated. The term e-banking is not used because e banking also includes the hank transactions made by ATM, Telephone banking and all the other electronic bank transactions that do not need the use of the Internet the factors that influence customer's intentions to use internet banking services are studies in order to increase Internet banking usage in the future. It focuses on user's perceptions on ease of use and usefulness of Internet banking and relies on previous researches that were made by using the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) in order to study the use and acceptance of services provided through the Internet.

Article Title: ACTUAL METHODS FOR CONSOLIDATION OF ROMANIAN NUCLEAR EDUCATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Author Keywords: nuclear education; nuclear knowledge management; networking; education providers
Abstract: Establishment and development of nuclear education networks at national and international level consolidate the existing expertise, enable the harmonization and mutual recognition of curricula, and provide a better use of existing expensive research infrastructure. Romanian Network of Excellence in Nuclear Physics and Engineering (REFIN) develops an efficient, flexible and modem training system in the nuclear education area, which answers the requirements of nuclear industry and redundant with the requirements of National Nuclear Strategy as well as with perspectives of the European Research Area (FP6, FP7, EURATOM). At national level, UPB coordinated the project Romanian Network of Excellence in Nuclear Physics and Engineering-REFIN (2005-2008) which gathered as partners University of Bucharest, University of Pitesti, Institute of Nuclear Research in Pitesti and University Babes-Bolyai in Cluj. REFIN developed a data base, proposed a global strategy in order to harmonize the curricula, implemented pilot modern training courses, delivered handbooks and multimedia support for these courses in order to strengthen and better use the existing research infrastructure for R&D among the network partners. It also introduced advanced learning technologies (recommendations for Systematic Approach to Training, e-learning and distance-learning platforms). All nuclear courses delivered by project partners are available on the REFIN web-site, based on a MOODLE e-learning platform. Both current and specific educational and training activities of network partners are oriented towards the nuclear knowledge management requirements.

Authors: Richard, G; Alsaedy, H; Farmer, M
Author Full Names: Richard, Gilles; Alsaedy, Hasan; Farmer, Muhammad
Article Title: Predicting By Analogy: A New Way to Enhance Business
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: data mining; analogy; global business; analogical reasoning
Abstract: In a global world, where e-business is rapidly growing, everyone tries to improve his income. Among all the available strategies. trying to predict the customer Is behavior and to anticipate his expectations is a solution. To achieve this goal, one has to design a model of customer Is behavior. usually by mining the tremendous amount of data stored on the company's computer. Inflict. the data mining process implicitly assumes the homogeneity of the context where data are collected But the cultural background is different when an Egyptian citizen buys with Amazon or when it is a Chinese citizen. We cannot suggest a Chinese citizen to buy a spoon after buying a bowl: stick would be more appropriate. In that context, the classical techniques of machine learning or data mining can he challenged. This is why we suggest investigating the use of analogical learning, which allows highlighting hidden correspondences between diverse contexts. Analogical learning is not new but we provide a set theoretic approach, very suitable for practical implementation. This way to model customer behavior could enhance the customer experience in a business environment.

Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: loss distributions; expectation maximization (EM) algorithm; motor third part liability insurance
Abstract: The motor insurance is an important branch of non-life insurance in many countries; in some of them, coming first in total premium income category (in Romania, for example). In this paper we present the Gaussian mixture method to model the loss distribution of data from motor compulsory third part liability insurance. The parameters of the mixture are estimated using the Expectation Maximization (EM) algorithm.

Article Title: Evolution of Business Contracts and Corporate Social Responsibility
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: corporate social responsibility; social contract; corporate governance; governance environment
Abstract: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is increasingly a core component of corporate strategy in the economy, and its importance has become even greater in recent years. Although corporations are busy adopting and enhancing CSR practices, there is (beyond very few notable exceptions) no established empirical research on CSR's impact and relevance in the capital market. Author holds a point of view that the meaning of CSR is changing in various corporate governance structures and contractual relations. Different governance structures under social contractual relationship determine the main content of corporate social responsibility. This paper investigates this issue by tracing the impact factors to CSR from the aspect of corporate governance. More importantly, based on the degree of overlap between social expectations and Community responding, companies will improve the response process and policies through the study of social responsibility.

Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product identity symbols; category attributes; brand strategy; consumer cognition; integrated construction
Abstract: Product identity (PI) is the brand recognition which is formed through the overall construction of the personalized visual image, and the performance of feature symbols is one of the keys. This article aims at the construction of the feature symbols. It is necessary to attach importance to the property and the timing of product group, but also the corporate culture and brand strategy. The status and location of the strong brands, medium potential brands and the disadvantaged directly influence the identification and development of the feature symbols. The consumers also awareness of the diachronic and synchronic of the consumers is proposed, which showed the accessibility and identification of feature symbols. The article puts forward specific process and methods which integrated construct the prototype of feature symbols.

Abstract: Agricultural production means market is the life line of circulation system of rural market. Whether the agricultural production means market is orderly or not, has direct bearing on vital interests of farmers. Nowadays, under the conditions of plurism of subjects of agricultural production means market, diversification of circulating modes and low degree of circulating level, whether the market circulation of agricultural production means in China, which is still positioned in primitive state of market, can stand the test of transitional period upon acceding into the WTO, is still an issue worthy of high concern.

Article Title: Landscape Analysis of Possible Outcomes
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Scenario analysis; Agent-based social simulation; Decision support technique; Visualization technique
Abstract: The behavior of a complex social system is unpredictable because both the uncertainties and the complex interactions in the system affect its future behavior. Existing scenario analysis methods focus on the effects of complex interactions of the system upon the system's behavior, rather than the uncertainties in the system. The purpose of this paper is to develop a novel scenario analysis method that mainly focuses on evaluating a range of possible outcomes in a system based on selected uncertainties. We validate this method by applying it to a case example in which the configuration of an evaluation system for a sales division is examined.

Article Title: Examining the Effects of Traders' Overconfidence on Market Behavior
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Rationality; Behavioral finance; Overconfidence; Artificial stock market; Agent-based modeling; Genetic programming
Abstract: Much attention has been paid in the past decade to how traders' psychological factors affect market properties. Overconfidence is one of most important characteristics of traders. Under an agent-based modeling framework, this paper examines how traders' overconfidence affects market properties. The preliminary results have shown that overconfidence increases market volatility, price distortion, and trading volume. Some stylized facts such as the fat-tail of the return distribution and volatility clustering would be more evident.

Article Title: QUALITY IN E-LEARNING
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The quality developing in higher education institutions is imposed by the management requirements, staff responsibility, performance orientation of the university activities and developing a quality culture not only for the staff but also for the students. Assurance of educational quality is a fundamental requirement for distance learning development. Factors that influence educational quality include instructional design, teaching styles, learning styles, learning objectives, content, and instructional media. The question of how e-learning can be successful becomes more urgent as we move from an early adopter stage to a more general offering. In a European educational market, it is critically important to gain an understanding of quality in e-learning. Many different concepts and approaches have been developed so far for many different contexts and purposes

Authors: An, YH; Roan, JS; Liou, JC; Zhang, YX
Author Full Names: An Yuhong; Roan Jinshyang; Liou Ji-Chyuan; Zhang Yaxu
Article Title: Joint Determination of Process Mean, Production Run Size and Material Order Quantity with Rework Process
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: process mean; production run size; order quantity
Abstract: Selection of the process mean for a container-filling process is important in quality control especially when material cost is a significant portion of production cost. But there are few researches considering the process mean problem using an integrated model with rework option. In this paper, we incorporate the issues associated with rework cost, production setup and raw material procurement into the classical process mean problem for a single-product production process. It is assumed that filled cans are weighed and underfilled cans will be reworked at the expense of rework cost. A two-echelon model is formulated, and an efficient algorithm is put forward to find the optimal solution.

Author Keywords: Fuzzy Logic; Usability; NBR
Abstract: In order for the initial result of this research to be obtained scientifically, a decision was made on setting the limits of the universe of users to be studied. For this end, the research was centered on the users of a Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, college and the EXCEL and MATLAB software were used. The Fuzzy Logic was employed to assess IPod usability. The methodology presented hereby is unprecedented and was developed by a 25-student study group of the above-mentioned college in their research.
