Author Full Names: Cao, Zhao; Zhou, Shibin; Li, Kan; Liu, Yushu
Article Title: Flashsearch: Document Searching in Small Mobile Device
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Searching; Inverted Index; Flash; Mobile; Document
Abstract: Desktop searching engines are used frequently in our modern operating system, but their techniques cannot be used in small mobile devices because of the limited memory, limited processing speed and the characteristics of flash. In this paper, we proposed an adaptive inverted index that can be used in small mobile devices based on the memory constraint and storage characteristics according to the size of memory can be used in searching. As demonstrated by our simulation results on real data set, our algorithm can achieve major performance gains in terms of the search speed and energy consumption.

Article Title: The Impact of Human Resource Management on Service Innovation in Travel Agencies
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Service Innovation; Human Resource Management; Travel Agencies
Abstract: The success of service innovation is largely associated with human resource management. This study conducted an empirical research on the relationship among HRM, service innovation and performance of travel agencies, with 28 travel agencies in China as samples. The result demonstrates that human resource management significantly impacts service innovation and the performance of travel agencies, and service innovation partially mediates the relationship between HRM and the performance of travel agencies.

Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: investments; economic growth; function; savings; income; investor; profit
Abstract: Nevertheless, one of the most important engine of the economy all over the world is represented by the investments, particularly by the direct investments. There is no economic growth, no prosperity, no high standard of living without direct investments. In this paper we will make on overview of the direct investment determinants, variables, and its relation to the level of income, consuming from the mathematical and statistical point of view. We'll also study the Keynesian model, which is considered the most important models in determining investment and consuming, and we'll show the viewpoint of Keynesian School in consuming and saving.

Article Title: The Analysis of Performance Improvement of E-government Based on Institution Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: E-government performance; institution; formal institution; informal institution
Abstract: The E-government performance is hotspot problem in study of the E-government. Institutional economics studies the realistic problems and activities of human. The E-govemment is practical problem with humanism philosophy. It is feasible to analyze the E-government on the basis of institutional economics. The paper points out that the E-government is especial institution. The information system is dominant E-government, while the management idea is recessive E-government. Furthermore, the electronic governance is advanced dominant E-government. In the form, the transformation between recessive character and dominant character makes the E-government performance improvement. With the development, the E-government becomes the institution, and converts the formal to the informal institution, which is essential reason to optimize performance of E-government. It presents that as the informal institution, the E-government has optimization performance.

Article Title: Structure of Interpersonal Communication Competence based on Factor Analysis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: interpersonal communication competence; communication skill; communication cognition; communication tendency; factor analysis
Abstract: In this paper, the structure of the interpersonal communication competence (ICC) is constructed from the perspective of the function of psychological activities. The ICC is sorted into three dimensions' which are communication skill (CS), communication cognition (CC) and communication tendency (CT). Taking the instrument made by the domestic scholar, with the exploratory factor analysis, five factors of ICC are selected including verbal expression, nonverbal expression, attentively listening, CC and CT, which may explain 74.23% of the population variance. Besides, the three-dimension structure of the ICC is confirmed in this thesis via the questionnaire survey.

Abstract: This paper from the perspective of knowledge flows in the new sort of economic growth and innovation in theory, on the establishment of new enterprises to enter the market and the relevance of the theory that the mobility of knowledge as a key feature of knowledge for economic growth within the framework of Health and the new enterprises to enter the performance and economic development research of great significance. These enterprises through the stock of knowledge for the enterprise to private flows, and then from the parent companies spun off into a new market entrants.

Article Title: Investigation into Theory Frame and Appraisal System of Strategic Management Audit
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: strategic management audit; theory frame; appraisal system
Abstract: Strategic management audit is an upfront and novel field in audit which attracts numerous scholars' attention from the very beginning of its development. It is one of the ten major tendencies of internal audit to convert from operational management audit to strategic management audit. This paper reviewed the development and revolution of the theory of strategic management audit, analyzed the differences between strategic management audit and traditional internal management audit, and proposed constructive ideas for enhancing the theory frame and appraisal system.

Article Title: Toward a Measure of Innovation in Nonprofit Organizations: Scale Development and Nomological Validation
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: organizational innovation; nonprofit organizations; factor analysis; structural equation modeling
Abstract: Although innovation plays an important role in attaining competitive advantage for any organization, no currently available scale is adequate for the measurement of organizational innovation in nonprofit organizations (NPOs). Through a concise review of the literature, three dimensions of nonprofit organizational innovation (NOI) were identified. A cross-sectional survey methodology was used to collect the data. Based on exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis, we constructed the NOI scale, with three factors and 12 items. Reliability and validity assessments provided evidence of the scale's psychometric property. Organizational innovation was found to be a significant predictor of organizational performance in NPOs. This study used a convenience sampling method which may limit its generalizability to other respondents. Future research should investigate other different industries and cultures outside of the industrial associations and community medical institutions examined in the current study. Furthermore, the antecedents and consequences of NOI need to be investigated in future studies.

Article Title: Effect of Social Network Type and Intensity on The Knowledge Performance of Groups

Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference

Author Keywords: social network; constructive capacity; knowledge management
Abstract: These study aims to analyze whether an external network tie density and a constructive controversy would have relation with the knowledge management performance in accordance with the internal tie density. Several previous studies related to knowledge management and social network, provide us with theoretical support for research model and hypotheses. A type and intensity of social network would become critical variable as key factor for knowledge management performance caused by internal friendship density. Such reasoning will provide managers seeking practically effective strategies to improve knowledge management performance with simple guideline by forming social network strategy.

Article Title: Coordinated Policy in Multi-suppliers and One-manufacturer System under Partially Symmetric Information
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: partially symmetric information; multi-suppliers and one-manufacturer system; coordinated policy; penalty; bonus
Abstract: Coordinated policy was proposed in multi-Suppliers and one-manufacturer system under partially symmetric information. The model of suppliers, manufacturer and supply chain was constructed, which testified that the mismatch of supply quantity would lead to supply chain profit lessening. Necessity of coordinated policy was analyzed by comparing supply chain decision under partially symmetric information with supply chain decision under symmetric information. Then an incentive function based on penalty and bonus was introduced and a coordination policy was set up by the combined use of order quantity, bonus and penalty cost. The policies can make suppliers deliver more under the limited production capacity and reach the order quantity of manufacturer. Therefore the supply chain can be coordinated by this policy under partially symmetric information. The case proved that the coordinated policy was feasible and effective.

Article Title: The Application of Free Cash Flow in Financial Analysis
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: FCF; FCF valuation model; financial analysis
Abstract: With the opening and growth of China's capital market, investors are increasingly concerned about the risks and true value of companies, while income, cash flow from operations (CFO) and other traditional indicators used to analyze share prices are far from flawless. This paper provides a definition of free cash flow (FCF), and compares FCF with earning and CFO. Then it describes the advantages of FCF, and proposes a set of FCF-centric financial indicators based on the FCF valuation module. A case study is then made on a listed company to verify the reasonability of FCF. At last a conclusion is reached that FCF is a better indicator for the company to verify its value.

Author Full Names: Li Xiangdong; Shen Yang; Shen Xiangxing
Article Title: Study on Management Mode of Chinese Internet Academic Journals
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: management mode; internet academic journals; repeated construction; standard construction; illegal journals
Abstract: This paper takes three typical internet academic journals (IAJ), which are China National Knowledge Infrastructure (CNKI), Chongqing VIP Information Co., Ltd. (VIP) and Beijing Wanfang Data Co., Ltd. (WFD), as subjects to discuss the problem of mechanism innovation based on digital publishing in China's science information communication system. After introducing main Internet environment, comparing and explaining the basic characteristics and typical publishing and operation mode of the above IAJs, this paper analyzes problems in repeated contents, paper selling and buying and illegal journals, standard. construction, copyright and benefits distribution. By learning from the achievements of research and practices on open access, a new benefit distribution and copyright management mode based on the third-party agency (TPA) is proposed, and the future operation mode of IAJs is discussed from the view of innovative scientific research service and innovative issue platform construction.

Article Title: Research of Second-mover Advantage in Technology Adoption Competition
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: dynamic game; technology adoption; second-mover advantage
Abstract: This paper probes into the second-mover advantages of dynamic technology adoption competition in a duopoly market. The time of product adoption in market and the costs of research and development (R&D) have direct effects on the existence and magnitude of a second-mover advantage. If R&D costs are low, the duopoly competition is mainly a preemption game, for there is no second-mover advantage. If technology adoption competition is mainly based on R&D effort, the game of technology adoption changes its nature form preemption to a waiting game with second-mover advantage.

Article Title: An Approach to Discriminating Cut-off Point of Product Life Cycle Based on Polynomial Regression Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: cut-off point; life cycle theory; polynomial regression model; product life cycle
Abstract: Identifying cut-off points over stages of product life cycle is an important content of accounting for enterprise life cycle. The common method used in practice for recognizing cut-off points is analogy, that is, to qualitatively discriminate product life cycle according to the changes of sales or sales volumes over time. This method, however, could not give a quantitative description on the ambiguity of the divisions on product life cycle. Based on literature study and analysis, this paper proposes a new method of polynomial regression model. By fitting profit changes with product life cycle curve, it is possible-to accurately discriminate cut-off points over stages of product life cycle. We wish this method could help enterprises to know well about which stage their product locate in the market timely, hence enable them to select agreeable marketing strategy to the product life cycle, facilitate their products renovation and guarantee enterprises' development stable and sustainable.

Author Keywords: DEA; technological innovation performance; index system; measurement
Abstract: Based on an improved composite DEA model, we present a method to evaluate the performance of technological innovation in enterprises. It helps find the gap between the target enterprise and the advanced peer enterprises, as well as the reasons causing such a gap. It enables the enterprise to survey its technological innovation activities and identify possible problems with their causes from the view of the perspective of organizational behavior. The proposed method provides an effective theoretical foundation for the enterprises to evaluate, track, and monitor their technological innovation activities.

Article Title: Research on Tax Planning Model of Loss Carry Forward in Modern Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: tax planning; loss carry forward; nonlinear programming
Abstract: To modem enterprises, tax planning of loss carry forward is of great importance. This paper applies mathematical programming method of operational research to corporate tax planning of loss carry forward, and sets up two nonlinear programming models for tax planning of loss carry forward in the case of continuous loss and discontinuous loss. The two mathematical models have general applicability for tax planning practice in modem enterprises, and the application of the two models can minimize the blindness in the process of tax planning and improve greatly the accuracy of tax planning decisions.

Article Title: FUNCTIONAL DIMENSION AND TECHNOLOGICAL DIMENSION - SELF-DIRECTED E-LEARNING MODULE
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The main concept of this paper is: the critical mass. In this case, by critical volume, we understand the precursory knowledge someone should have in order to have the capacity to understand and assimilate a new concept. The actual paper is approaching this general concept from a particular perspective, the educational one. So, this general concept is used to find another approach for the study of a particular technical issue and is used to find a way to verify if the necessary notions are assimilate, an important instrument for those who want to remember a specific issue is represented by a module which implies a guided individual study and e-learning. To reach this we have to respond to some important questions. which is the critical mass in our case, what can we do if we have it and what is not possible if we do not have it.

Article Title: Study on Financial Governance Mechanisms of Parent-Subsidiary Relationship in Enterprise Groups
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: incomplete contract; enterprise groups; financial governance
Abstract: The logical starting point of financial governance of enterprise groups is the incomplete financial contract and the parent company is the subject of financial governance. Enterprise groups mainly aim to solve agency problems between parent and subsidiary companies and control the agency cost. This paper reveals financial governance mechanisms of parent-subsidiary relationship in enterprise groups by constructing a game model. It means that financial governance is an institutional arrangement which should have the function of realizing internalization of external financial activities of subsidiary companies so as to maintain the consistency of overall interests of enterprise groups represented by parent and subsidiary companies.

Article Title: FREE TO CHOOSE YOUR EDUCATION. A COUNTERFACTUAL PERSPECTIVE
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In the last decades, an enormous economic literature has been developed in the field of education and schools' reform. It is generally accepted the idea that Romanian education system, despite the attempts of institutional reform according to European standards, has various functioning problems The weak capacity of education to stimulate creativity and human capital accumulation is the natural consequence of lack of incentives among state-run-schools What could be wrong if the education system will be managed according to the market rules? This paper looks to examine the main arguments favoring pro-market reform in education, and to offer a counterfactual approach in education field. We believe that educational entrepreneurship and competition are the only way to succeed in order to have better education for our children.

Article Title: Naive Bayesian Based on Chi Square to Categorize Arabic Data
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Text Categorization; Naive Bayesian; Arabic Text Data; Chi Square
Abstract: Text classification is a supervised technique that uses labelled training data to learn the classification system and then automatically classifies the remaining text using the learned system. This paper investigates Naive Bayesian algorithm based on Chi Square features selection method. The base of our comparisons are macro F1, macro recall and macro precision evaluation measures. The experimental results compared against different Arabic text categorization data sets provided evidence that feature selection often increases classification accuracy by removing rare terms.

Author Keywords: value chain; service enterprises; service innovation; knowledge; innovation system
Abstract: Developed service industry is a symbol of economic prosperity in a region, while innovation is a necessary means to enhance services competitiveness. Based on the value chain theory, service profit chain theory and knowledge value chain theory, this paper explains the concept and features of service innovation, according to service enterprise resources constitutes service innovation system of service enterprise, then analyzes and puts forward proposals the specific measures for the service innovation strategy, and finally takes a performance evaluation of service innovation.

Article Title: Analysis of the Dynamic Effects of Total Factor Productivity on Three Industries -a Case Study
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: TFP; decomposition; three industries
Abstract: This paper presents a case study about dynamic effects of total factor productivity (TFP) growth on three industries in China's west region using a vector auto-regression (VAR) approach. The results show that the long run effects of total factor productivity, capital investment and labor input growths positive on three industries growth. Total factor productivity growth has the least effect. So,west region, as the largest developing area in China, its economy is still a physical forces pushed economy and total factor productivity growth only plays a small role in its long run economy growth.

Article Title: ZheShang Innovation: From Both Individual and Popular to Stakeholder
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; both individual and popular; stakeholder
Abstract: ZheShang is the largest commercial group and they create a marvelous economic myth in the world by persistent innovations, which is a tough process. Their management model of innovation is an evolutive and developmental process. This article discusses the management model of innovation about the relevant in the innovation process from the perspective of Both Individual and Popular to stakeholder. Firstly, we identify the concept of Both Individual and Popular and Both Individual and Popular innovation, then analyze its advantages and weaknesses. Secondly, we introduce the concept of stakeholder and stakeholder innovation. In the end, we analyze the process of transformation from Both Individual and Popular innovation to stakeholder innovation.

Article Title: Application of RFID and Internet of Things in Monitoring and Anti-counterfeiting for Products
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Radio Frequency Identification (RFID); internet of things; EPC; monitor; anti-counterfeit
Abstract: Monitoring and anti-counterfeiting for products are important contents of supply chain management, the enterprises which want to open the markets fully, should offer consumers a real-time information inquiry platforms on commodity, and to allow people have a clear understanding of the whole life cycle of the products they consumed and to give the customers a convenient channel to identify the authenticity of the products, but fewer enterprises can monitor whole cycle of products at present. In order to solve this problems this paper proposes a product life cycle monitoring information system based on RFID and internet of things. This system fully integrates the technical advantages of RFID and internet of things, designs products monitoring function modules and products anti-counterfeiting flow chart, and taking mobile with RFID-enabled for example, demonstrates the process of mobile phone anti-counterfeiting. This system gives effective technical references for enterprises to monitor whole life cycle of products with internet of things.

Article Title: Empirical Analysis of Forest Rights Mortgage Loan:A Case Study of Suichang City
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: forest rights; mortgage loan; guarantee; credit assessments
Abstract: The reform of China's rural economy needs financial innovations. Forest Rights Mortgage Loans (FRML), which allows the forest farmer to apply for a loan by mortgaging his forest fights, as a latest rural finance instrument, was trialed in Suichang City. Three main patterns in FRML were comparatively illustrated and analyzed. Addressing the low income of most forest farmers, a new kind of FRML-MCMML, combining the characters of a guarantee loan and a micro-revolving loan, was selected as a practical finance tool in the mountain area's economic development. Some suggestions were proposed in the end for FRML's further development and improvement.

Article Title: The Innovative Study on the Accounting Supervision of Business Merger
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: business merger; economic agent; financial merger; accounting supervision
Abstract: The business merger is generally divided into the expansive merger, the financial merger and the mixed merger according to the economic agent. The economic agent decides the substance and form of the business merger, directly affecting the quality of the accounting information and leading to different economic consequences. If enterprises are merged mainly for financial reasons, it is easier to create the bad consequences of glossing over the financial statements and false accounting information. The accounting norm should implement the principle of taking the substance rather than the form into consideration, moreover adapt the requirements of the overall accounting environment and be mainly responsible for the regulation and supervision of the accounting treatment in the financial merger of enterprises. From a long term this will become a basic direction for the development of the accounting norms in the future merger of enterprises. Therefore, in order to improve the accounting norm of the merger of our country's enterprises, our attention should be focused on judging the economic agent and substance of the merger according to the related accounting information disclosed by the enterprises and setting the proper accounting treatment methods; in order to perfect the government's accounting supervision system, our attention should be focused on implementing strictly the system of the examination and approval of the financial merger information.

Article Title: Study on Balanced Scorecard-based Performance Evaluation of Human Resources Management
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: balanced scorecard; human resources management; performance evaluation
Abstract: Human resources management performance evaluation is a challenge to many organizations, and is an important factor of enterprise performance assessment. In this paper, we introduce the Balanced Scorecard to assess performance of human resources management and construct the indicator system of human resources management performance evaluation. Though analyzing of examples, we verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the method and get some effective advice on human resources management performance evaluation.

Article Title: Technology and Innovation Management Learning in the Knowledge Economy: A Techno-Managerial Approach
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; knowledge management; curriculum development
Abstract: Technology and innovation management education is now regarded as a critical area of study in most business schools. This growing importance is partly a strategic response to managing knowledge-driven industry development. In a changing business climate, traditional management education needs to combine with pragmatic technology management education that provides rich ground for developing managerial theories that are less fuzzy and practically more relevant to industry needs. Management studies are not just about theoretical constructs, but must, instead, address practical resolutions and problem solving in the real business world. This paper investigates the epistemological, pedagogical and organizational factors impacting on the design, development, and implementation of technology management learning programs. In doing so, it brings theory in line with practice. It draws on the authors' personal experiences, case examples, and student reflections during a project over three years to design, develop and implement a masters-level Web-based online technology program in three countries - Australia, Hong Kong and Singapore. Effective management learning, we argue, needs a techno-managerial approach that combines general management theories with technology management practice to link business and technology communities.

Author Full Names: Zhang, Shuai; Sun, Jianling; Yin, Keting; Xu, Bin
Article Title: Petri Net based Web Service Interactive Behavior Compatibility Analysis
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: web service; service composition; behavior compatibility; virification; Petri Nets; reachable tree
Abstract: Verification of services compatibility is an important issue in Web Services composition. With the growing of grain size, services will become more complicated with internal business processes and will have interactions with other services while composition. This paper proposed a Petri Net based approach to analyze the Web Services interactive behaviors compatibility. First, the interacting services are merging and reducing into a composite service. Based on the introduction of an analysis method called the reachability tree, the behavior of composite service can be then verified. At last, two case studies are used to show how the compatibility issue can be detected quantitatively using this approach.

Article Title: Analysis of Innovation Design of Inbound Tourism Product in Heilongjiang Province
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: inbound tourism; product innovation; tourism production
Abstract: In Heilongjiang province, inbound tourism plays a very important role in economic development and social network construction. Product innovation is the breakthrough to promote the competitive power of inbound tourism. Based on the analysis of the problem existing in current innovation situation of Heilongjiang inbound tourism product, ideas about innovation design of inbound tourism product have been studied in this paper. According to the study results, the precondition of innovation is the survey on what customers want, the necessary condition for innovation process is institutional innovation, and innovation based on the autologous advantage and feature with culture and technology is the effective innovating means.

Authors: Zhou, YJ; Tong, XL; Kong, J; Zheng, Y
Author Full Names: Zhou Yanjun; Tong Xianliang; Kong Jun; Zheng Ying
Article Title: An Adaptive Shadow Removal Method Based on Weighted Gaussian Model
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Gaussian Model; Distance Weighted; Shadow Detection; Shadow Removing
Abstract: The method of the shadow detection and remove which has application value is proposed based on analyzing visual surveillance purposes. The method proposed is essentially based on linear ratio and shadow direction angle threshold to locate the rough shadow regions, considering the relationship of the probability whether it is a shadow pixels and distances which between the shadow pixels and the centroids of the foreground objects. So this paper use the distances to weight the probability regions, and then exact remove the shadow using the threshold method to locate It e exact shadow regions. The experimental result indicates that the algorithm of removing shadow is fast and exact, improves the accuracy of the moving vehicle detection.

Authors: Chen, R; Liu, PD; Tang, SK
Author Full Names: Chen, Rong; Liu, Peide; Tang, Shukun
Article Title: An Evaluation Method for Enterprise Knowledge Management Performance Based on Linguistic Variable
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; performance evaluation; fuzzy evaluation; Linguistic Variable; Evaluation Method
Abstract: Knowledge management performance evaluation is an important approach for organization to acquaint and understand its knowledge management performance level of itself. The paper analyzes knowledge management performance evaluation research actuality both in home and abroad based on relative literature, considering fuzzy index, and puts forward an enterprise knowledge management performance evaluation method based on linguistic variable. First, establish enterprise knowledge management performance evaluation index system; then, transform linguistic variable into triangle fuzzy number, use aberrance coefficient method and get evaluation index weight, use projection of each solution on positive-ideal and negative-ideal solution, calculate projection relative approach degree, use relative approach degree to rank each solution; finally, explain the method validity of evaluation process and evaluation index and method according to example. The paper according to character of enterprise knowledge management performance evaluation index put forward a method based on linguistic variable for enterprise knowledge management performance evaluation. Application case indicates that the method can obtain favorable evaluation effect offering a new method for enterprise to implement knowledge management evaluation.

Article Title: The Impact of New Consumerism on Romanian Economy
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: new consumerism; consumer's behaviour; post communist economy
Abstract: This paper aims to focus on the conditions that Romanian people faced after December 1989, as determinants of getting the affluence society in Romania. The purpose of this paper is firstly to discuss on three periods of time which have had a strong impact on the over arising and then raising the consumption society. Secondly, the paper aims to discuss the social and psychosocial context where the consumer decided to communicate his feelings, or frustrations, or to express his needs, as a result of increasing the new technology influence in his life.

Article Title: Corporate governance and e-vote practice
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: e-vote; corporate governance; e-governance right to vote; general meeting; shareholders; Euronext
Abstract: The communication is questioned if the e-vote introduced recently into the companies listed on Euronext100 is the required result of a policy of corporate governance in favour of a better transparency of information and a stronger participation of the shareholders in the decisions. The results of the investigation carried out are first of all presented. It is found that these companies are rather of more important size but of performance generally worse. Then, we carried out comparative tests of some explanatory data, in term of corporate governance, with the quality of the practice of the e-vote. It is observed that these are companies whose capital is more diffuse and which there is not statistical differences in term of presence at the Annual General Meetings. The e-vote thus exceeds the simple stage of the improvement of the administrative process of the management of these meetings. Lastly, the discussion relates to the impact of new rules of transparency for the corporate governorship.

Article Title: Demographic Factors and Knowledge Sharing Quality among Malaysian Government Officers
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; knowledge sharing; government; demographic factors; Malaysia
Abstract: Knowledge sharing is one of the important elements in knowledge management. Previous works indicate that employees are reluctant to share knowledge among themselves. Many factors impede knowledge sharing among employees in organizations. One of those factors is demography. The purpose of this study is to find out the differences among government officers' knowledge sharing quality in terms of demographic factors. A survey of 48 respondents using questionnaire as data collection method was conducted. The results show that demographic variables are not significant predictors to government officers' knowledge sharing quality.

Article Title: PROPOSAL OF A FRAMEWORK TO ASSESS INTERNATIONAL AID PROJECTS IMPLEMENTATION READNESS : IMPORTANT FACTORS TO CONSIDER DURING THE ANALYSIS
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Aid projects; development; developing nations; success; sub-Saharan Africa; assess; readness
Abstract: Project management is used as the main tool for administering aid in developing nations. Unfortunately, the success rate of development aid projects is relatively low. Several explanations have been given for these failures. Clarke (1999) emphasizes the necessity of using instruments and techniques to increase a project's chance of success. As current techniques do not always meet the specific needs of development aid projects, particularly in the African context, we identify some important factors that should be taken into account to assess the likelihood of success of these projects before they are implemented.

Author Full Names: Klcova, Hana; Sulova, Dagmar; Sodomka, Petr
Article Title: Planning and Scheduling Methods and their Applications in ERP Systems on the Czech Market
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP); Manufacturing Resource Planning (MRP II); Just in Time (JIT); Advanced Planning and Scheduling (APS); Supply Chain Management (SCM); Theory of Constraints (TOC)
Abstract: Production and logistical processes are some of the most critical processes in every industrial enterprise. Mastering these processes has a direct influence not only upon the entrepreneurial activities of individual firms, but also on the whole of the supplier-customer chain and on industrial branches as It whole. For this very reason, these processes have always been, are and will continue to be the centre of interest in the exploitation and use of modern information systems and technologies. ERP systems represent a key software infrastructure for production and logistics management. Their effective application in everyday working practice should however not take place without the use of the corresponding methods for the planning and management of production and logistics processes. This paper summarises the main observations of the Center for inVestigations into Information Systems (CVIS) in these fields, it provides an overview of the main results and outcomes of research study investigations into the Czech ERP market with an orientation on the planning and management methods integrated into the applications logic of ERP systems.

Article Title: Empirical Study on Dynamic Sources of Innovation inside Enterprise
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: sources of innovation; corporate culture; core competence; entrepreneurship; innovation synergy
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to find the sources of enterprise innovation. First, some research results of management theory are used to analyze the influential factors of innovation motive force inside enterprise, then proposed related hypothesis; second, based on the survey data, the validity of the hypothesis was tested; at the end, the final results were discussed. The empirical results show that there is a positive relation among innovative corporate cultures, shared vision, core competence, entrepreneurship, innovation synergy and innovation motive force; but the hypothesis that bureaucratic culture has a negative impact on innovation synergy is not supported.

Abstract: By analyzing the concrete carbonization, the support vector machine (SVM) method was put forward to forecast concrete carbonization. The testing results show that prediction precision of SVM is much higher than that of BP network. The research is valuable and can provide a useful reference for application of similar engineering.

Article Title: Software projects' most important activities of quality management: A Delphi study
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Quality management; Project management; Project success
Abstract: Quality management is a very important contributor for the success of software project management. In quality management area we can find multiple activities to carry out, however organizations cannot always execute all those tasks and many times it is indispensable to make choices about what can and should be made. In order to help the organizations to identify the most important activities in quality management, we carried out a Delphi study with the participation of several senior project managers. The result is the identification of several groups of activities, ordered by importance for the project success.

Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: In the European countries more then 95% of the companies are small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and majority of the European Union employees work in these companies. As a result of a new product development paradigm, there is a greater need for software tools to risk estimation In this paper we describe the professional risk assessment (PRA) as part of risk management process (RMP) and how can be establish the risk level depending on probability and seventy of consequences. In addition, the paper presents a didactical method to knowledge bases (KBs) built and used for PRA at the SMEs level.

Author Keywords: self-adaptive algorithm; team forming; member selection
Abstract: A knowledge team member selection optimization model and algorithms based on self-adaptive algorithms (SA) is proposed in this paper. The complexity of member selection during forming team is discussed and the member selection process is described in detail. In this algorithm, Self-adaptive probabilities of cross over and mutation are designed in this algorithm, and they can be selected automatically according to fitness. Thus, each individual of the group owns the ability of self-adaptation according to the variation of the environment.

Authors: Tian, F; Qin, YL; Zhang, JX
Author Full Names: Tian Fei; Qin Yaolin; Zhang Jinxin
Article Title: Motivation Research of Earning Management in Chinese Listed Companies with Controlling Rights Transferred
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: motivation; earning management; controlling right; accrued profit; majority shareholder; information asymmetry
Abstract: The phenomenon of dominant majority shareholders is widespread among China's listed companies, despite it could reduce the agent cost between shareholders and managers, but major interest conflict often occur between majority shareholder and exterior minority shareholders. Due to the information asymmetty between them, majority shareholder could obtain private interest through managing the earning information, which is a low cost manner, so they have the motivation on earning management. This paper explains through the motivation model of earning management that under the governance structure of Chinese listed companies' large shareholder, majority shareholders tend to manage the reported earnings one year before transfer to maximize their own interest. While empirical research results in this paper indicate that under the estimation of controlling rights transfer, majority shareholders in positive earning companies have the motivation to uplift earnings so as to increase transfer revenue; however, companies with negative earnings may substantially decrease earnings so as to create a high quality shell company.

Article Title: Application Study on Signal Analysis of Multiplier-accelerator Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: marco economy; system; signals model
Abstract: As it is difficult to solve the system of difference equation of multiplier-accelerator model, it is difficult to thoroughly and comprehensively analyze the effect of typical macro economic model on economic parameter, and the accuracy of model is diminished. In this paper macro economic typical model proposed by Keynes is analyzed by signals and system theory, model is analyzed from a systemic perspective, so effect of system parameter and input signals on macro economic operation can be clearly analyzed. Through analysis of system structure and system response characteristic, effect of system parameter on economic operation can be determined. Calculation result shows that series drawbacks which occur while model is directly analyzed by matrix theory in traditional way is conquered by this new method, and accuracy of the model is improved. Deciders can refer to the study result.

Article Title: Management Innovation in Chinese Private Firms: The Effects of Resource-Based Advantage and Family Governance
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: management innovation; actual financial position; financial slack resource; family governance; Chinese private firm
Keywords Plus: TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION; CORPORATE GOVERNANCE; ORGANIZATIONAL SLACK; EMERGING ECONOMY; PERFORMANCE; CAPABILITIES; INTERNATIONALIZATION; PERSPECTIVE; BUSINESSES; OWNERSHIP
Abstract: Over the past several decades innovation research has been a conversation across the academia and management field. This paper joins this conversation by focusing on the antecedents of organizational innovation. Drawing on institutional theory, the resource-based view (RBV), transaction cost theory and agency theory, this paper discusses about several particular innovation antecedents that are of extreme importance for a special group of firms (i.e., private firm) in an emerging economy (i.e., China). Specifically, we probe into the effects of actual financial position, financial slack resource and family governance on management innovation in Chinese private firms. We propose that firms with higher actual financial position, more financial slack resources and lower family governance will be more likely to innovate on their management system and to take higher risk level when conducting management innovation. This paper contributes to the innovation literature through three ways. First, concerning the research content, it focuses on management innovation instead of the well-discussed technological innovation. Second, in terms of the research context, it explores innovation phenomenon in an emerging economy and transition market - China, instead of western developed countries. Third, with respect to the research object, this paper examines the innovation behaviors of small private firms instead of big state-owned enterprises or multinational firms that have been investigated a lot. In addition to the theoretical contribution, this paper may also shed light on the management practice.

Article Title: Implementation of the Computer Aided Business Process Reengineering System Based on UML and J2EE Technology
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: UML; J2EE; Business Process Reengineering; benchmarking
Abstract: Business Process Reengineering (BPR) is a hotspot both in academic field and in modern enterprises. Aimed to explore a process reengineering model for manufacturing enterprises in China, this paper studied BPR and its development, analyzed the problems existed in manufacturing enterprises as well as the deficiency in implementing BPR, and proposed an integrated process reengineering system-Computer Aided Business Process Reengineering System (abbreviated to CABPR), which was an intelligent system based on benchmarking. Finally, this paper expounded the process of the system's designing and implementing based on UML and J2EE technology.

Article Title: Branch Establishment Efficiency of State-owned Commercial Banks in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: state-owned commercial bank; branch establishment; principal-agent model; DEA method
Abstract: After share-reform, the issue how branches of state-owned commercial banks (SOBs) in China will be reconstructed based on market institution deserves academic concerns. However, existing literature lacks thorough model-based analysis and empirical study. Especially, there is little research on the relation between branch establishment and bank efficiency. The purpose of this paper is to provide model-based analysis and empirical evidence concerning branch establishment of SOBs in China. Explorative research on the optimal branch layer and span for SOBs under framework of principal-agent theory was conducted. In addition, DEA method was adopted to empirically test bank efficiency relating branch establishment in 2006-2008. It is found that efficiency of SOBs is significantly lower than that of other domestic joint-stock commercial banks. Moreover, the decreasing returns to scale mainly account for the low efficiency of these state-owned banks. Based on the analysis and test results above, the paper finally puts forward some suggestions about branch establishment of SOBs.

Abstract: Research on the cluster supply chains is development trend of the cluster theory at present This paper analyzes the theory of cluster supply chain, puts forward integrating the supply chain collaborative management to cultivate industry cluster. The use of collaborative management of cluster supply chain strengthens enterprises' collaborative ability in industrial clusters, optimizes the allocation of resources, and enhances the whole competitiveness of industrial clusters.

Article Title: The Demand for Education and Training for Irregularly-employed Labor Based on Manpower Capital Investment Efficiency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: irregularly-employed labor; education and training; demand
Abstract: Based on theoretical and practical analysis, the article holds that irregularly-employed labor force has different classes of desires for education and training and substitutions among the classes, and then comes up with a correspondent demand function. It also says that we should start with the characteristics of the demands for the education and training of irregularly-employed labor, and design specifically different training models for groups of different demand classes so as to improve manpower capital investment efficiency.

Article Title: Study on Knowledge Sharing in University Town
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge sharing; University Town; activity effectively; study
Abstract: The construction of University Town aims at realizing innovation of higher education system and improving its overall strength. The implement of knowledge sharing in University Town facilitates to aggregate education resource and enhance core competitiveness of University Town. In this article, knowledge sharing in University Town is studied from the external and internal activity effectively. According to the effect of knowledge sharing in University Town, the knowledge sharing model of University Town is designed. How to improve the sharing level of University Town, is discussed from mechanism designing, trust and communication, knowledge sharing platform, and knowledge sharing culture in University Town.

Article Title: Environmental Cost and Countermeasure of the evelopment of Photovoltaic Industry in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: photovoltaic industry; environmental cost; countermeasure
Abstract: In the use of research methods such as the information-gathering and interviews, this paper points out that there are serious pollution problems of green energy industry in China and makes an analysis of pollution sources of photovoltaic industry: the pollution in the process of producing polysilicon energy, waste pollution of photovoltaic power generation system, light pollution. To ensure orderly development of solar energy industry, this paper makes some conclusions of protecting measures such as constructing the new idea of protecting ecological environment, raising public awareness of environmental protection, guiding enterprises to self-innovation, e-waste recycling and other measures.

Article Title: Identification of Voting with Individual's Feet Through Agent-Based Modeling
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Agent-based modeling; Voting with the feet; Social systems; Multi-layer modeling
Abstract: This paper describes an agent-based simulation model to analyze migration behaviors of individual in several political regions. The model was originally discussed by Tiebout in 1956 as Voting with Feet, however, the validity of the model has not been examined very carefully. In the proposed agent simulation model, plural political decisions in each region are made by the corresponding regional government, and the inhabitants will vote the decisions based on their preferences. Both governments and individuals are modeled as decision making agents. The intensive simulation studies have revealed the emergence of decision groups and how the decisions have been made.

Article Title: Empirical Electricity Demand Curve Modeling: Case Dominican Republic's Power Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: electricity demand modeling; electricity price elasticity; power industry
Abstract: Dominican Republic's power sector is one of the major restrictions of the country's economy growth. Although that this is a major problem, the published literature about studies about this country's electricity demand curve is scarce. This papers aims to close this gap by determining an empirical electricity demand curve for this country. A linear model and a log-linear model were selected to describe the demand curve. The models coefficients are estimated using linear regression method with 15 years of historical data. After estimating the coefficients, the models are compared using its determination coefficient and the confidence level for each of theirs coefficients.

Article Title: An Algorithm for Mining Large Sequences in Databases
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Sequential Patterns; Data Mining; Large Sequence Mining
Abstract: Frequent sequence mining is a fundamental and essential operation in the process of discovering the sequential rules. Most of the sequence mining algorithms use apriori methodology or build the larger sequences from smaller patterns, a bottom-up approach. In this paper, we present an algorithm that uses top-down approach for mining long sequences. Our algorithm defines dominancy of the sequences and uses it for minimizing the scanning of the data set.

Article Title: Intuitive Sales Force Behavior: Theoretical Background and Empirical investigation
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: intuition; behavior; marketing; seller and buyer
Abstract: In this paper, we focused on the contribution of intuition in the marketing area, espessially in the selling one. We present the definition of intuition, it's dimensions and how can we measure it. We showed that intuition is mainly an unconscious process which can be created, developed and measured. However we don't found studies in the marketing area. This establishment leads us to make a qualitative study which were based on free interviews with seller in a market place. Our results show that intuition is widely used, but sometimes sellers use also objective informations. Our results supported findings in the litterature as well as for use of intuition and the importance of experience ans practics in intuition, understanding customers and selling. But the most important contribution of our research is the recourse for observation in ordre to act better intuition in the selling efforts.

Article Title: Study on the Benefit Driving Forces for the Staffs in the Small and Medium-sized Enterprises
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: the small and medium-sized enterprises; benefit driving; DNA
Abstract: Due to the relative deprivation of talent, overall insufficient quality of talent, over-flow of talent, inadequate of personnel training and so forth in the small and medium-sized enterprises, how to establish an effective interest incentive mechanism become an pressing topic faced by enterprises. This thesis considers that the essence of benefit driving is encouragement, and the sources of benefit driving force are not only the extrinsic objectives and the intrinsic absence, but also closely related with the encouragement of behavior correction and expectations. Meanwhile, the thesis put forth a DNA model of the employees' benefit driving in the small and medium-sized enterprises.

Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management

Author Keywords: industry agglomeration; swarm intelligence; evolution model
Abstract: After discussion of defects of linear and circular models on industry agglomeration, the conclusion that the improper prerequisite of the models is the ultimate cause has been reached. With careful modification on the parameters, a dynamic model of particle swarm intelligence aiming at the simulation on industry agglomeration has been set up in the paper, followed with relevant computer simulation, leading to the finding that the accumulation and diffusion of knowledge is the prime motivation of industry agglomeration.

Article Title: Research on Salary Incentive of Small-Medium Accounting Firms
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: small-medium accounting firms; salary incentive mode; material drive; spiritual drive
Abstract: For a long time, most of the small and medium accounting firms are on the use of extensive human resources management, which result in lack of incentive mechanisms. This article is aimed at small and medium-sized accounting firms of our existing pay system, points out that its deficiencies lies in the four conflictions, including the confliction between service charge system and business-related bonus system, the confliction between business-related bonus and job-related bonus, the confliction between the contradiction of the residual claim between partner and non-partner, the contradiction between pure material drive and long-term development of the firm. Based on this, this paper designs a new comprehensive incentive mode including material incentive and spiritual incentive to find the ways that help small and medium accounting firms stimulate the enthusiasm of staff.

Article Title: Evaluation Weights Distribution and Modification for Technological Innovation Capability Based on BP Neural Network

Author Keywords: BP algorithm; neural network; weight distribution; technological innovation capability
Abstract: In this paper, based on the index system for the technological innovation capability of enterprises evaluation, and the analytic hierarchy process (AHP) relying on expert experiences is used to obtain a comprehensive evaluation index weight distribution as the desired output of BP neural network. Finally, through the BP neural network algorithm, by accessing to training the neural network, the weight modification for the evaluation index has been achieved. And a case study has been done to prove its feasibility, and demonstrate the role of combination of subjective and objective methods in promoting the development of scientific evaluation.

Abstract: Technological resource, dominated in production factors, is the most important in forming of social wealth in the age of the knowledge-based economy. Its status and efficiency are not only the mirror of the regional science level, but also the measurement of regional general strength and development potential. This article analyzes the allocation status of regional technological resource in the northeast old industrial base by statistical data analysis and indicates the problems. In the end how to optimize the allocation of technological resources is introduced.

Article Title: Knowledge Management and Performance among Top Emerging Market Companies
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: knowledge management; research and development; performance; innovation; patent; research and development
Keywords Plus: RESOURCE-BASED VIEW; COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE; FIRM PERFORMANCE; ECONOMIC-PERFORMANCE; STRATEGY; INNOVATION; IMPACT; ENTRY; DIVERSIFICATION; CAPABILITIES
Abstract: This study examines knowledge management trend of top Fortune Global multinational enterprises from, emerging markets and it's relation to business performance. Drawing on the resource-based and its extension, knowledge-based strategic management theories, it is argued that companies that best manage their intangible resources such as knowledge and patent are more likely to have a competitive advantage. Data of top thirty Fortune Global multinational enterprises from emerging markets show a trend toward spending more on research and development, registering more new patents, and better usage of assets from 2002 to 2007. A positive correlation was identified between changes in new patent registration and return on assets. Implication for managers is that they can achieve better business performance through efficient and effective management of assets, intangible assets in particular, and investment in research and development.

Authors: Malcolm, A; Colin, UC; Margaret, SGH
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Malcolm, Allan; Colin, U. Chisholm; Margaret, S. G. Harris
Article Title: EFFECT OF GLOBALISATION ON GENERIC COMPETENCIES FOR ENGINEERS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Recent research relating to the need to consider generic competencies for engineering education in the context of global workplaces is reviewed and further developed within the context of a requirement for such competencies to be developed and practiced with due consideration given to a global social responsibility. A portfolio of generic competencies is developed and considered against factors such as ethnicity, culture, language, religion and ethics and detailed consideration is given to how best such competencies can be developed. It is concluded that the use of a range of novel learning environments can provide considerable advantage over the traditional on-campus education environment particularly in relation to delivering of the competencies within the context of a rapidly developing global information society. Particular difficulties relating to the achievement of such competencies are analysed and solutions suggested based on the use of a range of global based environments where aspects such as culture, ethics, and ethnicity can be effectively related to the evolution of generic competencies within a global context It is concluded that a range of life-place environments are essential to the effective realisation of generic competencies within a global context for engineers at undergraduate, postgraduate and post-experience levels. It is further shown that globalisation of competencies provides for more effective career development with the establishment of a social responsibility mindset being considered as fundamental and mandatory.

Article Title: How Does Knowledge Management Matter in Enterprise Strategic Flexibility? Multiple Case Study Approach Based on SMEs in Malaysia
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Strategic Flexibility; Knowledge Management; SME; Competitiveness
Keywords Plus: INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY; CAPABILITIES; OPPORTUNITIES; PERFORMANCE; SYSTEMS; MODEL; FIRM
Abstract: SMEs domestically and globally are encountering tough competition. Globalization, liberalization, information revolution and ICT phenomena have brought about many challenges for all organizations more seriously for SMEs. The only way to cope with these impediments is to be strategically flexible and adaptable to environmental changes and emergent circumstances. Strategic Flexibility requires a comprehensive set of abilities to acquire, interpret, share and utilize knowledge by scanning internal and external environments carefully and profoundly in order to take immediate and proper actions. Therefore managing knowledge is an inseparable component of strategic flexibility. An integrated system has to be executed to strategize all enterprise activities based on knowledge toward becoming flexible strategically. But in enterprise's management literature a dearth of an intensive study in the context of SMEs is vividly felt. Therefore, addressing this gap seems worthwhile for SME's competitiveness; hence, the main objective of this study is to fill the gap empirically based on case-study of some service provider and manufacturing SMEs in Malaysia. Research is concluded with discussion and expressing limitations.
