Article Title: An Exploration of Individual Student Perceptions of Mastery of Knowledge in an Online Collaborative Context
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: mastery of knowledge; knowledge management; discussion forum; collaboration
Abstract: Technology-supported learning environments no longer need to conform to the traditional classroom environment where information is uniformly disseminated. Instead, the application of technologies means that learners can participate actively in their own knowledge acquisition process. Over the years teaching and learning practices have moved from instructor-centric to student-centric: As the focus moves from instructor-centric to student-centric, the knowledge to be collected has grown hyper exponentially. Individual mastery of knowledge has been shown to be effective in a variety of learning situations, particularly in face-to-face collaborative learning environments. This qualitative study explores individual perceptions of mastery of knowledge acquired in a technology-supported online collaboration context. Results from the study indicate individual student mastery of knowledge was strongly supported in online collaboration via engagement in online discussion forums. By using mastery of knowledge to enhance the learning process, there would be a commensurate enhancement of the likelihood of the transfer of knowledge. The enhancement of this learning process can assist Web course designers and educators to create online learning programs that best utilize the students' capacity for knowledge management, processing of information and information sharing.

Article Title: Creativity Tendency of Chinese Science-Technology Talents: The Individual and Regional Influencing Factors and Their Interaction Effect
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: science-technology talents; technological innovation; creative tendency; individual factor; regional factor
Abstract: The study theorized and examined the individual and regional factors influencing the creative tendency of Chinese Science-Technology talents including gender, age, education, technical title and region, and the interaction effect of individual and regional factors. Based on a sample of 5180 Science-Technology talents from 31 provinces and seven national institutes, we used One-way ANOVA and MANOVA to test our hypothesis and found the infusing pattern of individual and regional factors and their interaction effect on creative tendency of Science-Technology talents. Theoretical and practical implications for innovation management were provided finally.

Article Title: How Can We Build A Good Project Configured Supply Chains
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Project configured supply chains; industry quality
Abstract: Project configured supply chains, or networks are becoming increasingly prevalent in a number of industries. Construction is one of them. Supplies and products in construction consists of material and immaterial, knowledge, elements. The paper argues however that in a knowledge economy, those two elements are increasingly intertwined and competition and markets will increasingly be constituted by the knowledge element. Creating value for the customers and the enterprises becomes dependent of the ability to organise and coordinate in the supply networks. This includes the issue of quality. The approach taken here is study the emergence of failures occurring in the supply chain, and thereby understanding its quality aspects better. The paper presents case study work done in Chinese construction. The method was to observe work at the construction site and interviewing actors following backwards upstream the supply chain to the origin of the failure. The building project followed generated 160 failures over a three month observation period. These were compiled and analysed. The economic consequences are calculated to be 8% of the production costs. The analysis of relations in the supply chain both shows relations to materials and knowledge aspect of the supply network and these to aspects' interaction. Most of the failures was generated in relation to knowledge processes and then occasionally transform into the material process. The paper proposes initiatives to strengthen partnerships in supply chains and especially at engineer to order production. The contradiction between the permanent enterprise organisation potentially capable of handling purchasing and the role of the project manager is discussed as a contradiction to overcome.

Article Title: Comparative Analysis of Technology Innovation Activity of Large and Medium-Sized Enterprises in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: technological innovation; large and medium-sized enterprises (LMEs); research and development; china
Abstract: In this paper, we study the technology innovation activity of large and medium-sized enterprises (LMEs) in China from the comparison of three perspectives: the industry the enterprises belonging to, registered type and region of the enterprises located. Based on a panel database of more than 20 thousand LMEs in China from 2004 to 2006, the percentage of research and development expenditure in total sales revenue has been compared to identify the characteristics, of the technology innovation activity of LMEs. The finds are concluded as follows: first, the technology innovations activities of LMEs in China remain relatively stagnant or even slow down slightly from 2002 to 2006; second, LMEs demonstrate different characteristics in technology innovation from different observation perspectives; third, LMEs exposes particular problems in technology innovation activity. Policy recommendation suggest that government should attach great attention to the industries which are lack of technology innovation activity, encourage the indigenous innovation activity through policy inclination and financial supporting, protecting intellectual property right and propagating technical education..

Authors: Xu, PP; Wang, HB; Wu, HH
Author Full Names: Xu Pingping; Wang Haobai; Wu Haihua
Article Title: The Effect of C2C E-commerce Website Locked-in Stratagem on Custom Trust during Online Production Purchase Procedure
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: C2C; locked-in stratagem; customer trust; online purchase
Abstract: In China, C2C e-commerce is becoming more and more promising. While problems like safety still exist in online purchase. Past research indicate that customer trust is one of the most important factors influencing the online deal. This paper mainly tries to figure out the effect of different locked-in stratagems on customer trust. First, 3 dimensions of trust and 5 types of locked-in stratagem are determined based on past research. Then this paper use statistical analysis to find out the different effects of locked-in stratagem and mechanism on online trust. Finally, this research draw 2 conclusions: virtually community is the most effective locked-in stratagem in increasing online trust; emotional locked-in mechanism is far more effective than material locked-in stratagem.

Article Title: Trust Evaluation Model of E-Commerce Based on WOT
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: web of trust; electronic commerce; trust evaluation; model; friend of a friend
Abstract: Trust has been one of the main factors affecting electronic commerce. Web of Trust (WOT) is a Certification system that allows your identity to be validated for use in your Personal Certificate. On the basis of introducing the concept of WOT, a trust evaluation model is proposed to assist the individuals to establish Web of Trust in online trust domain. This model uses FOAF and can be used as a blueprint to develop e-commerce application.

Authors: Ye, G; Wu, CL; Yue, J; Cheng, S; Cheng, W; Wu, CL
Author Full Names: Ye, Gang; Wu, Chanle; Yue, Jun; Cheng, Shi; Cheng, Wei; Wu, Chanle
Article Title: Research on Design of Structured Application Layer Multicast Prototype about Self-Similar Structured Multicast (S3M)
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Application Layer Multicast; Self-Similar Structured Multicast; Nodes Group; NICE; Stretch; Stress
Abstract: Topology model is regarded as the key factor of quality in a multicast system. High quality of a multicast system can be defined to high efficiency, robustness and scalability. Self-Similar Structured Multicast (S3M) is a new application layer multicast model of high quality. After prior researches on a special class of directed graphs, we defined nodes group as the basic object of study in S3M, as well as data streams on it. They can be descriptions of structure and data transmission on the overlay network based on SM. Nodes group which supports unitary substitution and multi-tree structure are the main specialties of S3M according to other current theories. Therefore, various existing overlay prototypes cannot afford precise modeling and evaluation of the multicast system. The paper proposes a design scheme of structured Application Layer Multicast model. It sets up an appropriate evaluation context for S3M based on the sampling scheme of that multicast model. The prototype can substantiate the validity of the S3M protocol in contrast with NICE.

Article Title: Research on Situation and Suggestions of R&D Institutions' Establishment in Industrial Enterprises of Dalian
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: industrial enterprises; R&D institution; countermeasure; suggestion
Abstract: With the worldwide R&D process of the internationalization accelerating, how to. make better use of the internationalization of R&D resources, to enhance the capability of independent innovation has been attached great importance by business, academics and government departments. In this paper, we focus on the current situation of R&D institutions' establishment in industrial enterprises of Dalian. The analysis in this paper is composed of five parts: composition of corporate R&D activities, R&D investment and expenditure, economic benefit of corporate R&D activities, business environment and human resources for R&D activities. According to the above analysis, we give some corresponding countermeasures and suggestions to the main problems during the development of R&D institutions.

Author Keywords: digital library; semantic grid; knowledge management
Abstract: In accordance with the issues of semantic interconnection and distribution heterogeneity of knowledge at digital libraries, this paper analyzes the current situation of knowledge organization at digital libraries, namely, the application of web and network techniques in knowledge organization. In the meanwhile,the paper also discusses semantics grid knowledge management applied to the digital library of the technology, and from a macro to create a semantic grid-based digital library platform for knowledge management-level model. Through four levels of knowledge in different activities, for a variety of digital library resources to provide efficient use of tools.

Article Title: Study on the Evaluation of Internal Control
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: internal control; evaluation; flexible rules; professional judgment
Abstract: The evaluation of internal control is an important step in business management for managers and the study and evaluation of internal control have become a key part in audit practice. This thesis starts from the examples of the evaluation of internal control of a company, puts forward its flexible rules, holds that the efficiency of internal control lies in the profession judgment of evaluators (usually auditors or other supervisors), which, however, is developed not from internal control but from subjective cultivation, constructs several examples of internal control and finally comes to the conclusion that the efficiency of internal control is a process revealed by evaluator's professional abilities based on the flexible rules.

Article Title: Study on Innovation under Cooperative Circumstances
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; cooperative circumstances; knowledge
Abstract: This paper analyzes the conventional contradiction between standardization and innovation. However, as the market circumstances change with the time, there have also been influences along with the changes on the relationship between standardization and innovation. The most significant facets of these influences are also discussed in this paper, in order to adapt to the changes better. This paper constructs three models from different perspectives to realize this purpose. Based on the study above, this paper draws the conclusion that innovation through a fore-and-aft production process, innovation through complementary products and sustainable innovation through an organizational process provide approaches to better adaptation ability under cooperative circumstances.

Article Title: Large Scale Crowd Simulation of Terminal Station Area When Tokai Earthquake Advisory Information Is Announced Officially
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: Spatial-spot type agent-based simulation; Tokai earthquake advisory information; Terminal station; Large area; Crowd management
Abstract: On the assumption of advisory information concerning an imminent Tokai earthquake being officially announced, as a case example we developed a LSCS (Large Scale Crowd Simulator) for the Nagoya Station area, where several terminal stations are concentrated; in the model, agents played people on their way home, and such factors as the routes selected by agents and the spatial restrictions, e.g. passages, were taken into consideration. Basic on SOARS (Spot Oriented Agent Role Simulator) platform, we conducted a large-scale crowd simulation with 160,000 agents and analysis the change of space density in 1 h to compare to the estimates given by Nagoya City, we analysis the result and also refer to LSCSver1.0 for implementing much higher functions.

Article Title: Communities, Anti-Communities, Pan-Community as Social Order
Source Title: AGENT-BASED APPROACHES IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COMPLEX SYSTEMS VI
Book Series Title: Springer Series on Agent Based Social Systems
Conference Title: 6th International Workshop on Agent-Based Approaches in Economic and Social Complex Systems
Conference Sponsor: Natl Chengchi Univ, Dept Econom,NCCU Top Univ Program,Natl Sci Council
Author Keywords: A friend and an enemy; Community; Reputation; In-group morality; Evolutionary simulation
Abstract: A society of agents who can freely attack others or not inevitably evolves into a battling society (a war of all against all). We investigated whether the Friend Selection Strategies based on Attribute and Reputation in Group (FSS-ARG) lead to the emergence of social order. FSS-ARG require an agent to evaluate whether others are his friends or enemies, based on whether others were peaceful or hostile to his group and whether others have the same attribute as his group or not. We carried out evolutionary simulations with FSS-ARG. As a result, we found that four types of social states, what we call battling society, communities, anti-communities and pan-community, have emerged. For example, the communities consist of two mutually hostile communities, in each of which all members have the sane attribute and are friendly to all other members. So, the communities can remind us of Max Weber's in-group/out-group morality.

Article Title: TEACHING ENTREPRENEURSHIP TO ENGINEERING STUDENTS
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to analyse the challenges posed by teaching entrepreneurship to engineering students. We will start by outlining some theoretical background to teaching entrepreneurship to engineering students, focusing on the peculiarities of the educational system in Romania Secondly, we will present the results of a survey we carried out among 208 students of Applied Electronics, Cadastre and Environmental Engineering, aged 19-46. The questionnaires applied aimed at revealing students' both theoretical/practical knowledge, as well as skills and personality traits pertaining to entrepreneurial education The interpretation provided was both qualitative and quantitative Last but not least, we will present pedagogical implications of the results found, by providing suggestions for curriculum design, implementation and evaluation The approach that we will suggest is student-centred, great emphasis being placed on the autonomous learning dimension and on self-discovery techniques, as well as on the development of critical thinking.

Authors: Alawneh, AA; Abuali, A; Almarabeh, TY
Author Full Names: Alawneh, Ali. A.; Abuali, Amer; Almarabeh, Tamara Y.
Article Title: The Role of Knowledge Management in Enhancing the Competitiveness of Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SMEs)
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs); knowledge (K); knowledge management (KM); organizational memory (OM)
Abstract: Knowledge is one of the enterprise's most important assets that influence its competitiveness. One way to capture an enterprise's knowledge and make it available to all its members is through the use of knowledge management practices. This paper discusses the importance of knowledge management (KM) in Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and presents a framework to deal with knowledge management in order to enhance their competitiveness. Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are known for too much implicit knowledge, limited resources, insufficiently shared between managers and other employees. So, in the context of SMEs, KM can he used to capture knowledge and experience generated during their operations, activities, and processes. This research paper addresses a new way of thinking about the role of KM in SMEs through developing a framework that combines five phases of the KM lifecycle (capture, creation, codification, communication, and capitalization). This framework is called A Five C's Knowledge Management Framework. The application of this framework will improve the success rate and competitiveness of SMEs.

Article Title: Facilitating Inter-organizational Knowledge Flows to Support SMEs' Innovation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: inter-organizational knowledge flow; SMEs; innovation
Abstract: How to support Chinese SMEs to be innovative to survive through financial crisis is a problem for Chinese government. Based on policy literatures to support SMEs' innovation, this article argues that the policies should focus on the systemic problems of SMEs' innovation. The systemic problems of SMEs' innovation are that the barriers that hinder inter-organizational knowledge flows. Policies should. pay more attention to facilitating inter-organizational knowledge flow to support SMEs' innovation

Article Title: A Study on the Definition of Industrial International Competitiveness
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: constitutive element; definition; development strategy; industrial international competitiveness
Abstract: Industrial international competitiveness is an important branch in the research field of international competitiveness. This paper first reviews the origin of international competitiveness through listing the different points of view of different scholars and analyzing their similarities and differences. Then this paper makes a study of the definition of industrial international competitiveness from six aspects, such as the background elements, the resources elements, the market elements, the process elements, the advantages elements, and the results elements, which lay the foundation for the further study.

Authors: Cosma, D; Bogdan, O; Ratiu, G; Rizescu, A; Patesan, M
Book Editors: Oprean, C; Grunwald, N; Kifor, CV
Author Full Names: Cosma, Daniela; Bogdan, Octavian; Ratiu, Gheorghe; Rizescu, Alexandru; Patesan, Marioara
Article Title: THE SIMULATION METHOD AND THE INFORMATION SYSTEMS WORKING FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: Simulation contributes to ensuring holistic educational development, coherence in the development of subsectors, and a better understanding of the implications of particular policies and strategies, by facilitating the projection of pedagogical and institutional inputs, and the financial resources which these imply. It is used to test the viability of an education policy and strategy, and to propose alternatives that can help cope with dynamic and changing environments. This article encourages our colleagues to take ownership of this tool that will help link our educational community of practice. Examples of the some most important educational data and indicators, policy options and development scenarios are explained and discussed by the authors, part from familiarization with key concepts and skills for strategic planning and simulation modelling. This research focuses on developing the necessary means to implement in the Land Forces Academy simulation methods, training-specific data structures and communication methods between a simulation, Shareable Content Object Reference Model (SCORM)-based instructional content, and a Learning Management System (LMS), to facilitate the use of simulation as an environment where an individual Or a team can practice a skill (instruction) or demonstrate their level of performing the skill (performance assessment). A benefit is that the outcome of instruction can be assessed as a combination of knowledge, measured by objective testing, and performance, achieved by simulation.

Article Title: A Game Theory Model of Firm's Product Quality Selection under Asymmetric Information
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product quality; asymmetric information; separating equilibrium
Abstract: Asymmetric information between consumers and firms on product quality not only affect the consumers' decision-making process, but also the quality decision-making of firms. In this paper, game theory and information economics tools are used to deal with the firms' and consumers' product quality selection under asymmetric information. The research indicates that high-quality firms can transmit quality information through multi-signal transmission, and there is always a separating equilibrium. Based on the consumers' utility function on product quality, if consumers are more inclined to search for information about product quality, more firms will strive to improve the quality of products, consumers' choice will affect firms' product quality decision-making action.

Authors: Huang, C; Sun, JL; Wang, XY; Si, YJ
Author Full Names: Huang, Chao; Sun, Jianling; Wang, Xinyu; Si, Yuanjie
Article Title: Separation of Duty Constraint for Permission Based Delegation Model
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: PBDM; RBAC; SOD; constraint; security; safe delegation
Abstract: In large enterprise software systems, users often need to delegate their authority to others. Permission base delegation model (PBDM) based on RBAC96 currently is the most attractive model to fulfill the delegation requirement since it supports partly delegation and multiple steps delegation. However in PBDM there is no explicit specification of the separation of duty (SOD) constraint, which is one of the most important constraints and is essential to the security of the system. In this paper, we analyze the SOD constraint in PBDM delegation model and give the formal definition for the constraint. We prove that the constraint violation will not happen at the stage of the delegation role definition whereas it can only happen at the stage of role assignment. We then propose a protective mechanism to prevent the illegal role delegation utilizing the prerequisite conditions which are a set of Boolean expressions. We also give the algorithm to check the prerequisite conditions to help

Article Title: Product Innovation Performance and Major Knowledge-related Contributors: A Conceptual Framework
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: product innovation performance; knowledge management; competitive advantage
Abstract: Based on both product innovation and knowledge management literature, this paper proposes a conceptual framework of product innovation performance, which indicates that a firm's product innovation performance is associated with the use of different knowledge flows, its product development strategy, various market conditions, its knowledge adsorptive capacity as well as assorted knowledge support structure. It concludes that better product innovation performance results from managing the knowledge-flow system which consists of complex interrelationships between knowledge flows and other major knowledge-related factors.

Article Title: Innovative and Applied Research of Project Financing on BT Mode about Municipal Transportation Projects
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: municipal transportation project; BT mode; financing mode; project management; innovation and application
Abstract: Project financing on BT mode can solve the problem of insufficient funds, thus it is an effective approach to increase construction efficiency. On the basis of analyzing the meaning and characteristics of BT mode, the application of project financing on BT mode is studied in the construction of Nanyang Bridge. In the paper, BT mode is innovated, and the role of guarantee bank is emphasized. Supervision enterprise, as the third party, participates in the projects. Owners participate in the bidding works to choose design and construction enterprise. By such innovations, BT financing mode has a more powerful ability to resist risks. Some good suggestions are proposed to the construction on BT mode. Innovative research of project financing on BT mode also has guiding significance to other similar projects.

Author Keywords: fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; weapon development; termination decision
Abstract: Weapon equipment development is a groping and risky complex system engineering, terminate bad-behavior weapon development project will enhance the efficiency of weapon acquirement management, and save limited military resource. Aimed at reduce supplemental loss for lack of timely termination, this paper establish termination decision index system, and put forward weapon development project termination decision method based on fuzzy comprehensive evaluation. At last, the example proves the correctness and feasibility of this method.

Article Title: Research of Collaborative Fashion Product Design System Based on Knowledge Management
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: fashion design; fashion trend knowledge; collaborative design; knowledge management; product design system
Abstract: In traditional fashion product design system, the design director's personal taste and experience are usually the orientation for design team, and the different departments in the fashion enterprise are working separately, so the whole product design process tend to be subjective, inefficient, and waste lots of design resource. With the development of globalization of fashion market and mass customization manufacturing, the notion of Collaborative Design has risen up in fashion industry. The collaborative design demands the multi-knowledge from communication and sharing of knowledge in trend, marketing, scheme, design, material, technique, etc. The paper supposes a prototype that enables different departments in fashion enterprise to obtain, share and use the knowledge collaboratively with Knowledge Management, and collaboratively optimize the fashion product design process.

Abstract: In this thesis, the authors point out the necessity for the small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) to carry on the marketing channel innovation, introduce the research status of the theory of marketing channel, expound the organization model of marketing channel elaborate the contents of wireless marketing, put forward the marketing channel innovation based on wireless marketing model, finally carry on the forecast on this kind of new channel model innovation's prospect.

Article Title: TRAINING FOR RESEARCH IN ENGINEERING STUDY PROGRAMMES
Source Title: BALKAN REGIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENGINEERING AND BUSINESS EDUCATION & ICEBE, VOLS I AND II, CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS
Conference Title: 5th Balkan Region Conference on Engineering and Business Education/2nd International Conference on Engineering and Business Education
Conference Sponsor: Hochschule Wismar, Univ Technol, Business & Design
Abstract: This article is intended to draw attention to some problematic aspects related to the research training component in engineering study programmes, aspects that are reflected in students' research skills and in the quality and quantity of their scientific products The subject has significant relevance nowadays, when a major purpose of higher educational system is to enhance the employability of graduates, when students are primarily interested in acquiring knowledge and skills necessary to be successful practitioners and when engineering professional career increasingly requires certain generic research-related attributes and a rapid and efficient use of complex scientific methods in engineering applications. Taking into consideration these conditions, it is obvious that we need to find solutions for ensuring a solid research training component in engineering study programmes.

Article Title: Evolutionary Game Analysis on the phenomenon of National student loan default
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: National Student Loan; Evolutionary Game; Duplicative Dynamic; Evolutionary Stable Strategy; Bank Loan
Abstract: In order to reveal the national student loan game dynamic evolution path and discuss how to guard against national student loan risk, this paper adopts the dynamic evolution game replication method to analyze the choice behavior between the bank groups and the student groups. The result shows that the staple reason causing the failure of cooperation between the bank groups and student groups is that the reward and penalties of relevant law are inadequate to the loan students or the interest to the banks from the loan is less than their opportunity cost. Government should improve the risk compensation mechanism of the banks and increase the reward and penalties to the students, which will make a win-win situation between banks and students and solve the phenomenon of the national student loan default effectively.

Article Title: Attitudes towards the use of E-banking: Result of a Pilot Survey
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Electronic Banking; Internet banking; Telephone Banking; Electronic Commerce
Abstract: Electronic Banking (EB) is the use of banking services, conducted via electronic media and Internet technology. With the rapid increase in the development and availability of information and communications technologies, EB has become a reality. People are beginning to sell and purchase goods via the Internet. They are beginning to transact and transfer funds via the use of EB without feeling the need to visit banks. Although, the use of EB is becoming popular, there are a number of inherent issues. In this paper, EB is discussed and results of a survey are reported. The aim is to report on the opinions of the general public towards the use of EB.

Article Title: Issues in Software Development Practices A South African Software Practitioners' Viewpoint
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Grounded Theory Method; mechanistic system; software development; actor network theory
Abstract: Software development is a process tasked with the development of artefacts that are used to implement organizational information systems. Depending on the social, economical and environmental setting, different software practices are used. These, however, have an effect on the resultant software product. In this paper, the authors investigate some of the software development practices that are used in South Africa. Through the use of interview techniques, the study highlighted a plethora of methods, techniques and tools that are used during the software development process. This paper advocates for a paradigm shift in the way information systems are developed. It motivates for developers to consider the social context of organizational information systems when developing software products. In a social context, capturing the organizational culture, context and human aspect contributes to the system's responsiveness and its adaptiveness to the ever changing organizational environment.

Authors: Morais, EP; Pires, JA; Gonçalves, RM
Author Full Names: Morais, Elisabete Paulo; Pires, Jose Adriano; Goncalves, Ramiro Moreira
Article Title: Exploring the Constraints to the Evolution of Electronic Business: The Portuguese Reality
Source Title: INNOVATION AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT IN TWIN TRACK ECONOMIES: CHALLENGES & SOLUTIONS, VOLS 1-3
Conference Title: 11th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Conference Sponsor: Int Business Informat Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Stages of growth; e-business progression; constraints
Abstract: It is imperative for an organization to identify potential constraints to e-business in order to minimize the risk derived from its c-business initiative. Hence, in this paper, we have used a maturity stage model (Stages Of Growth Model for c-business SOGe) to identify the maturity stage of the biggest Portuguese enterprises and to report the findings of a study that sought to explore a range of constraints that the literature suggests influences c-business evolution, so that organizations could be better equipped in anticipating any difficulties while in progress through their. e-business initiatives. Questionnaires were applied to investigate the research problem. It was administered to 1000 managing directors of the biggest (according to the amount of business) Portuguese enterprises. Results suggest that Portuguese enterprises had a positive evolution between 2005 and 2007, and that, in lower maturity stages, the constraints are more significant.

Article Title: Research on Phase of Evolution and Innovation Mode of Silicon Valley
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: high-tech industry park; innovation mode; silicon valley
Abstract: After Semiconductor material was found, semiconductor products was invented which make Semiconductor industry grows up gradually. With the formalization development and the extending the industry chains of semiconductor industry, the Silicon Valley becomes more and more successful as a typical mode of high-tech Industry Park. Many countries want to imitate the developmental mode to build own high-tech industry park, but, strictly speaking, there is not any park that make so success like Silicon Valley. This paper analyzes the reasons why cannot be imitated and the characteristics of its developmental stage. Through an extensive research we have concluded that, even by combining different innovation factors, the characteristics of the evolution pattern of the Silicon Valley cannot be imitated without having a significant innovative product because there is no conditions to come into being significant innovational products or technology in a short time, however, we can draw many useful lessons from this case for seeking different developmental ways to guide other high-tech industrial park.

Article Title: The Choice Model of Marketing Innovative Patterns Based on Capabilities and Environment
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: marketing innovation; innovative capabilities; choice of patterns; cobweb model
Abstract: Marketing innovation is not only the inevitable result of market competition, but also the essential instrumentality to survive in competition. Appropriate marketing innovative patterns can contribute to the success of innovative activities. Therefore, this article introduces the signification and process of marketing innovation and defines marketing capabilities by dividing it into marketing innovative and marketing executive capabilities. Then the article analyzes the four key factors that exert influence on the choice of marketing innovative patterns: marketing innovative capabilities, marketing executive capabilities, environment of marketing competition and linkage breadth with others. At last, the article chooses marketing innovative patterns by using cobweb model diagram to integrate these four factors.

Article Title: Analysis of Determinants of Inter-Regional Equalization of Basic Medical Care in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: basic medical care; equalization; determinants
Abstract: The paper employs Panel Data Analysis to study the determinants of inter-regional equalization of basic medical care in China. Results show that the basic medical care equalization level is positively correlated with the inter-provincial economic development, local authority bias, degree of financial decentralization, marketization and urbanization level; while negatively correlated with the local government's fiscal capacity, central government transference payment variations, and the degree of opening to the outside world.

Article Title: Research on the Income Disparity of Urban and Rural Residents Based on Curve Regression in Heilongjiang Province
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: curve regression; farmers' income increase; income disparity of urban and rural residents; partial correlation analysis
Abstract: The difficulty of farmers' income increase and the expanding disparity of urban and rural income have become the most prominent problems in the current agriculture and rural economic development, which has greatly affected the establishment of well-off and harmonious society. This article makes a quite detailed analysis of the present situation of the disparity of urban and rural residents in Heilongjiang Province. By means of using SPSS software, this paper makes the curve regression to estimate and carries on the forecast to its development tendency. Through the partial correlation analysis of urban and rural residents' income disparity index, it proposes the countermeasures of reducing city and countryside income disparity-promoting farmers' income.

Article Title: Home Network Using Complementary Communication System
Source Title: ISBIM: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SEMINAR ON BUSINESS AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, VOL 1
Conference Title: International Seminar on Business and Information Management (ISBIM 2008)
Conference Sponsor: Engn Technol Press,Intelligent Informat Technol Applicat Assoc,CPS,IEEE Comp Soc
Author Keywords: Zigbee; PLC; Home Network; Complementary Communication System
Abstract: The transmission property of power line channel has been analyzed, and power fine spread spectrum communication has been expounded in the paper. We study a complementary network system which works simultaneously two communication systems, wireless (IEEE 802.15.4Zigbee) and wired (Power line carrier communication; PLC) communication. Our analyze results show that the communication result of the Table Creation (TC) communication method is much better than that of the Broadcast (BC) method and Relay Confirmation (RC) method. The concrete scheme of home network based on Complementary System and the program of control unit are gave in the paper.

Article Title: Study on the Use of Artificial Intelligence in Products Based on Analysis of AIBO Robot Dog
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: AIBO; artificial intelligence; smart products
Abstract: The Artificial Intelligence is one of the three most advanced technologies in the twenty-first century, which has been developing rapidly around the world in the past few decades. Based on analysis of AIBO robot dog-the SONY presented in 1999, this article explained the five characteristics: the smart products should have, the ability of self-learning, the ability of self-reasoning, the ability of problem solving, the ability of environment perceiving and the ability of language recognition. And then in view of the market reaction of AIBO, this issue concludes the people's need to the smart products and the direction of smart products' development.

Article Title: Empirical Study on Technological Innovation and Market Performance in Domestic Circulation Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: China's circulation industry; market performance; human capital; technological innovation; econometric model
Abstract: Based on the data of 1994-2007, this article establishes the evaluation index system about market performance in domestic circulation industry and obtains the market performance factor of circulation industry by means of factor analysis. Then the article sets up the state space model and multivariate regression model for empirical study, where the market performance is a dependent variable and the level of human capital and technological innovation are independent variables. It is found that technical innovation has improved the market performance in domestic circulation industry, and human capital and R&D funding have a greater positive effect on the improvement of circulation industrial market performance, of which the level of human capital is more important. Regarding this, corresponding proposals are put forward.

Article Title: Research on Evaluation of Wuhan City Circle's Resource Conservation and Environment Friendly
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: Wuhan city circle; evaluation research; indicators system
Abstract: This paper applied Analytic Hierarchy Process and Evaluation Goals Method to set up a judge matrix, and constructed Wuhan city circle's Resource Conservation and Environment Friendly evaluation indicators system. Making use of the evaluation indicators system this paper measured Wuhan city circle's Resource Conservation and Environment Friendly condition in 2006. In this way, we found that Wuhan is the best city in these nine cities, but still has some problem which are not good such as Resident's house acreage per capita, Industrial waste gas emissions per capita and Unit GDP power consumption. Other cities' development is unbalanced. In conclusion, if Wuhan city circle want to develop rapidly should it be driven in Wuhan as the center of nine cities and come into balanced and stable development.

Authors: Zheng, HY; Xu, M; Liu, ZG
Author Full Names: Zheng Haiyan; Xu Ming; Liu Zhonggang
Article Title: The Relationship between Manager Ownership, Government Subsidies and Investment Incomes Based on the Ownership Structure of Manufacture Industry
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: investment income; ownership structure; check-and-balance share
Abstract: This paper classifies companies into two categories (from distress to normal, from distress to worse) according to the change trend of financial distress. By comparing these two kinds of companies, this paper explores the relationship among manager ownership, government subsidies and the investment income. The evidence suggests that under the circumstance of different degree of checks and balances of the ownership structure, the financial subsidies and the management shares play different roles. Companies with lower degree of checks and balances, their investment income is significant negative to government subsidies, the management' shares and the largest shareholder' shares, and the investment income is significant positive to the tradable shares of top five shareholders. However, Companies with higher degree of checks and balances, their investment income is positive to government subsidies, the proportion of management shares and the second-largest shares, and this kind of company easily get out of financial distress.

Authors: Zhu, LB; Yu, Z; Fang, ZZ
Author Full Names: Zhu Linbin; Yu Zhou; Fang Zhengzheng
Article Title: From Anti-piracy to Harmonious Symbiosis: Development Tendency of Digital Copyrighted Works' Profit Mode
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PRODUCT INNOVATION MANAGEMENT, VOLS I AND II
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Product Innovation Management
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol, Profess Comm Prod Innovat Management,Prod Dev & Management Assoc,Natl Nat Sci Fdn China,Ctr Prod Innomat Management Hubei Prov,China Affiliate Prod Dev & Management Assoc
Author Keywords: black-out screen; digital right management; profit mode
Abstract: On Oct21st 2008, Microsoft released an update version of its Windows XP Professional (Win XP) called Windows Genuine Advantage (WGA) in China, whose function was to detect whether or not the users' Win XP was genuine. The pirate version of Win XP could not pass the verification of WGA, and the desktop of this system would be enforced to turn into black once an hour as a result. In China, people from all social circles, especially a large number of netizens responded to the so called Microsoft Black-out screen event. Most of them argued that MS WGA had violated various laws and regulations; however, through an analysis of such event with some relative theories and cases, this article believes that MS WGA is a due action of Digital Right Management (DRM). From the angel of Intellectual Property Law, DRM is a kind of legitimate technical measure. Therefore, this article would Re to illustrate the legitimacy of MS WGA by comparing it with the cases of Jiangmin corporation logical lock and SONY BMG. Though MS WGA is not an illegal action, most people in China evaluate such action negatively. This is similar to what has happened to the recording industry in the past few years, the recording industry had employed a variety of DRM in Internet music downloading in order to limit such usage. Unfortunately, these measures didn't succeed, but stirred heavy criticism. Recently, many record companies such as iTunes Store and Napster music store have begun to provide DRM free music for downloading, which shows a reform of operation and profit mode of digital copyrighted works. This article then summarizes the transformation of profit mode in the software industry. Some digital copyrighted works, such as antivirus software and office software, gain money through service and advertisement, which not only ensures the popularization and application of the digital copyrighted software, but also protects the profit of the software designers. Thus, this article concludes that a new commercial mode characterized by collaborative development is taking shape and will have a promising future.

Authors: Luttighuis, PO; Stap, R; Quartel, D
Author Full Names: Luttighuis, Paul Oude; Stap, Roel; Quartel, Dick
Article Title: Contexts for Concepts: Information Modeling for Semantic Interoperability
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: enterprise interoperability; semantic interoperability; conceptual modeling; context-awareness; enterprise integration; information modeling
Abstract: Conceptual information modeling is a well-established practice, aimed at preparing the implementation of information systems, the specification of electronic message formats, and the design of information processes. Today's ever more connected world however poses new challenges for conceptual information models, as different models should enable mutual connection and reconciliation, even when developed in totally different situations. This paper argues that the 'vertical' bias of today's conceptual information modeling practice diverts models from meeting this new, 'horizontal' need. As an alternative, a conceptual information modeling approach is described that is simultaneously unconventional as well as interoperable with existing approaches. The key to this approach is conceptual context-awareness. It is based on ideas from the Metapattern work [31].

Authors: Usman, Z; Young, RIM; Chungoora, N; Palmer, C; Case, K; Harding, J
Author Full Names: Usman, Zahid; Young, Robert Ian Marr; Chungoora, Nitishal; Palmer, Claire; Case, Keith; Harding, Jenny
Article Title: A Manufacturing Core Concepts Ontology for Product Lifecycle Interoperability
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: semantics; core concepts; interoperability; manufacturing ontology; knowledge sharing; product lifecycle; design and production
Abstract: This paper proposes a manufacturing core concepts ontology (MCCO) aimed at providing support for product life cycle interoperability. The potential focus of the work is interoperability across the production and design domains of product lifecycle. A core set of manufacturing concepts and their key relationships are identified in MCCO. Semantics are captured formally through heavyweight logic using rigorous rules and axioms. Three different levels of specialization have been identified according to the degree of specialization required. Each level provides an immediate route to interoperability for the concepts specialized from that level. MCCO enable knowledge sharing across design and production domains through core concepts. A successful initial experimental implementation has been done to demonstrate the working of MCCO.

Article Title: A Trust Model for Services in Federated Platforms
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: trust; model; security; web services
Abstract: Web services are a powerful tool for executing functionalities using third party applications and they are widely used in business processes. For this reason, it is necessary to complement traditional security solutions by adding soft security mechanisms, which take care of trust, in order to determine whether a web service and its provider are performing as they should. An extensible model for a trust evaluation system is presented for this purpose. It determines some parameters important in enterprise and Future Internet environments and it defines how to calculate the perceived trust by applying a three round algorithm with fuzzy logic. It exploits services semantics and it takes into account last updates about the service, consistency rules based on the semantic relationships between aspects and other specific calculations for each parameter. Semantics are used as well for sharing information with other platforms and federations for improving interoperability in distributed environments.

Authors: Mallck, S; Daclin, N; Chapurlat, V
Author Full Names: Mallck, Sihem; Daclin, Nicolas; Chapurlat, Vincent
Article Title: An Approach for Interoperability Requirements Specification and Verification
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: interoperability; interoperability requirements; compatibility; interoperation; verification; model checker; conceptual graphs; collaborative process
Abstract: Enterprises are today involved in collaborative processes with other partners sharing common economical interests in confidence. This allows these enterprises to focus on their core business, to optimize, and to be effective to respond to customers' needs. Implicitly, a partner that wishes to become involved in a partnership must demonstrate numerous qualities and enable to gain the confidence of other partners. Among other ones, demonstrate its ability to be interoperable is a major issue. This research work aims to define, to formalize and to analyze a set of interoperability requirements that each partner of a collaborative process have to satisfy prior to any collaboration. This paper focuses and illustrates how interoperability requirements related to the static and dynamic aspects of the collaboration may be formalized and verified by the use of a formal verification technique.

Author Full Names: Asuncion, Camlon H.; van Sinderen, Marten
Article Title: Towards Pragmatic Interoperability in the New Enterprise - A Survey of Approaches
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: enterprise interoperability; pragmatic interoperability; survey of approaches
Abstract: Pragmatic interoperability (PI) is the compatibility between the intended versus the actual effect of message exchange. This paper advances PI as a new research agenda within the gamut of enterprise interoperability research. PI is timely in today's new enterprises as it is increasingly important that organizations are able to collectively add value to their products and services through effective collaboration. When enterprise systems exchange information, PI goes beyond the compatibility between the structure and the meaning of shared information. It also considers the use of information in a given context as an equally important aspect. As PI is a relatively new domain, this paper attempts to elucidate its notion by identifying and relating its key concepts from proposed definitions, and by reviewing extant approaches to identify critical knowledge gaps in PI research.

Authors: Liu, CL; Yang, CW; Liu, SJ; Wu, L; Meng, XX
Author Full Names: Liu, Cuiling; Yang, Chengwei; Liu, Shijun; Wu, Lei; Meng, Xiangxu
Article Title: A Process Interoperability Method for SMEs
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Enterprise interoperability; SMEs; process interoperability
Abstract: This paper starting with the present status of enterprise interoperability, focuses on enterprise interoperability of SMEs (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises), and based on a SMEs oriented framework of enterprise interoperability proposes an approach of process level interoperability. The approach appropriate for SMEs mainly solves two types of interoperability involving processes' interior in the process level. Life cycle of process level interoperability is redesigned and reorganized. In each phase of the life cycle a comprehensive solution is given. In final, this paper gives a case study to describe and enhance the approach.

Article Title: On Challenges in Enterprise Systems Management and Engineering for the Networked Enterprise of the Future
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: enterprise systems management; enterprise systems engineering; networked enterprise
Abstract: Since 20 years, many traditional firms transform their orientation from products to services, among them also many potential SAP partners, competitors and customers. Powered by globalization, competition, and the Internet, that process happens globally and at accelerating speed. It breaks existing product supply chains and transforms them into a volatile network of collaborating businesses the business value network. The network forms around service value propositions of the participants that lead to joint value creation. While SAP and other players have developed quite a sophisticated understanding of on premise software solutions and accompanying services, the field of on-demand software services is relatively new to the industry, and the underlying principles of value creation in many successful new service businesses are often a miracle. Business value networks will become increasingly important in the world's economy in the future. Their appropriate IT support must efficiently realize business collaborations and interactions between globally spread organizations. In the past, Enterprise Interoperability has been often seen as a synonym for Enterprise Application Integration at intra- or inter-organizational level. In the future, the ability to adapt to changing market and business requirements together with the ability to reflect the business adaptations on the level of the connected ICT systems will constitute key challenges for the support of business network formations. Enterprise Interoperability will have to address business value networks not only from ICT viewpoint but also as socio-technical systems from the business and operational perspective. Over the past years, SAP Research was involved into intense research that has taken place to explore the Internet of Services. New ways of developing, hosting, aggregating, mediating and finally consuming services have been described and tested. The developed Service Delivery Framework will be presented as a foundation for a Future Internet platform for business value networks demonstrating the key roles and relationships involved in the formation and value creation of business value networks from the business, operational and technical perspective.

Authors: Huberi, S; Carrez, C; Suttner, H
Author Full Names: Huberi, Stefan; Carrez, Cyril; Suttner, Hannes
Article Title: Development of Innovative Services Enhancing Interoperability in Cross-Organizational Business Processes
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Cross-organizational business processes; process interoperability; private-to-public transformation; interoperability gap detection; BPMN; SBVR
Abstract: This paper presents the vision and ongoing results of the COIN (FP7-216256) European project for the development of collaborative and cross-organizational business process interoperability. Services for selectively publishing parts of private business processes are developed which enable the creation of a cross-organizational business process (CBP). Gap detection services provide analysis of the CBP with regards to interoperability gaps like potential deadlocks.

Authors: Khadka, R; Sapkota, B; Pires, LF; Van Sinderen, M; Jansen, S
Author Full Names: Khadka, Ravi; Sapkota, Brahmananda; Pires, Luis Ferreira; Van Sinderen, Marten; Jansen, Slinger
Article Title: Model-Driven Development of Service Compositions for Enterprise Interoperability
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: SOA; MDA; Metamodel Transformation; Enterprise Interoperability; Choreography; Orchestration; Service Composition; Service Interoperability
Abstract: Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) has emerged as an architectural style to foster enterprise interoperability, as it claims to facilitate the flexible composition of loosely coupled enterprise applications and thus alleviates the heterogeneity problem among enterprises. Meanwhile, Model-Driven Architecture (MDA) aims at facilitating the development of distributed application functionality, independent from its implementation using a specific technology platform and thus contributes to deployment in different platforms. In this paper we propose an MDA-based transformation technique for service composition. The contribution of the paper is two-fold. First, our approach shows how enterprise interoperability is supported by service composition at two different technical levels, namely at choreography and orchestration level. Second, the approach contributes to the management of changes that affect enterprise interoperability, by defining a (semi-)automated transformation from choreography to orchestrations in which the interoperability constraints specified at the choreography level are preserved.

Author Full Names: Silva, Patricio de Alencar; Weigand, Hans
Article Title: On the Move to Business-Driven Alignment of Service Monitoring Requirements
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Early Requirements Analysis; Monitoring as a Service; Value Models
Abstract: Current service monitoring capabilities have been not designed in alignment with business needs. We argue that service monitoring should be primarily thought of as an economic concern, with proper needs being elicited on the business strategy level and further drilled down to process and IT services management layers. Monitoring needs and capabilities should be designed independently from each other and exposed as abstract monitoring interfaces for matchmaking. This allows for treating monitoring as a service, with more flexibility and adaptability to fulfill specific business needs.

Article Title: Third Party User Interaction Control in SIP Networks
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Open Service Access; Media services; Interface to protocol mapping; Formal testing of functional behavior
Abstract: A lot of attractive applications in addition to manipulation of session related signaling involve specific processing at media level such as playing media, prompting and collecting media from the user, mixing media streams etc. One of the ways of provisioning applications in managed all IP-based multimedia networks, is based on Open Service Access (OSA) service platform. The paper investigates the capabilities for OSA third party control on user interactions in multimedia networks where the session management is based on Session Initiation Protocol (SIP). The focus is on the interoperability between OSA application control on session-related user interactions and media services in SIP networks. OSA user interaction interfaces are mapped onto SIP signaling. The behavior of the OSA gateway is modeled by synchronization of application view on user interaction call and SIP session involving media resources. A formal approach to functional verification of OSA gateway is proposed.

Authors: Zinnikus, I; Cao, XQ; Fischer, K
Author Full Names: Zinnikus, Ingo; Cao, Xiaoqi; Fischer, Klaus
Article Title: Agent-Supported Collaboration and Interoperability for Networked Enterprises
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Abstract: The paper presents an agent-supported framework for improving solutions for enterprise interoperability and enterprise collaboration. We present the context of COIN in the European research area and explain the basic approach and system architecture COIN is aiming at. Special emphasis is put on how agents can support enterprise interoperability as well as enterprise collaboration services. The framework adopts a modeling approach for the description and execution of business processes. With this a system engineer can describe the interaction protocols that should be used at an intuitive level and transform the model down to executable code. Private partner processes can be integrated using a mapping approach to bridge technical interoperability gaps.

Authors: Li, J; Zhan, DC; Nie, LS; Xu, XF
Author Full Names: Li, Jin; Zhan, Dechen; Nie, Lanshun; Xu, Xiaofei
Article Title: A Construction Approach of Model Transformation Rules Based on Rough Set Theory
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Model transformation; Model transformation rules; Rough set theory
Abstract: Model transformation rules are the central part of model transformation. Many model transformation approaches provide some mechanisms to construct transformation rules in industrial and academic research. However, transformation rules are typically created manually in these approaches. As far as we know, there are no complete solutions that construct transformation rules automatically. In this paper, we propose a rough set based approach to construct transformation rules semi-automatically. Construction approach of rough set is improved in order to support the transformations between different meta-models, then the corresponding algorithm to construct transformation rules is presented. We also provide the measurement indicators of transformation rules to support selecting proper rules from many rules which meet transformation requirement. Three kinds of experiments for problems with distinct complexity and size are given for the validation of the proposed method.

Article Title: Anatomy of the Unified Enterprise Modelling Ontology
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: Ontology; ontological analysis and evaluation; Unified Enterprise Modelling Language (UEML); Unified Enterprise Modelling Ontology (UEMO); OWL2; description logic
Abstract: The Unified Enterprise Modelling Language (UEML) aims to become a hub for integrated use of enterprise and information systems (IS) models expressed using different languages. A central part of this hub is an extendible ontology into which modelling languages and their constructs can be mapped, so that precise semantic relations between the languages and constructs can be established by comparing their ontology mappings. The paper presents and discusses ongoing work on reformulating the UEML ontology as an OWL2 DL ontology, the Unified Enterprise Modelling Ontology (UEMO).

Article Title: A Data-Centric Approach for Privacy-Aware Business Process Enablement
Source Title: ENTERPRISE INTEROPERABILITY
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
Conference Title: 3rd International IFIP Working Conference on Enterprise Interoperability
Conference Sponsor: IFIP TC5 WG5 8,INTEROP VLab,KTH, Royal Inst Technol,Ctr Telemat & Informat Technol
Author Keywords: privacy; policy; BPM; SOA; web services
Abstract: In a SOA context, enterprises can use workflow technologies to orchestrate available business processes and their corresponding services and apply business rules or policies to control how they can be used and who can use them. This approach becomes a bit more complex when a set of business processes includes services that derive outside the company's domain and therefore can be difficult to align with existing rules/policies. In the privacy and security domain, access control and policy languages are used to define what actions can he performed on resources, by whom, for what purpose and in what context. In this paper we propose an approach for dealing with the inclusion of internal and/or external services in a business process that contains data handling policies.
